source: अथाश्रमस्थो विनयात् कदाचित् तं महामुनिम्॥ उपासीनः स काकुत्स्थः सुतीक्ष्णमिदमब्रवीत्।
target: Once upon a time, as Kākutstha dwelling in that asylum was seated, he humbly observed to that great ascetic.

source: आवामपि च धर्मस्य गृहे जातौ द्विजोत्तम। रम्यां विशालामाश्रित्य तप उग्रं समास्थितौ॥
target: We two, O foremost to twice-born ones, have taken birth in the house of Dharma. Living in this charming and spacious herinitage, we are practising the austerest penances.

source: शरणं च प्रपन्नानां शिष्टाः कुर्वन्ति पालनाम्। शरणं त्वां प्रपन्नाः स्मस्तस्मात् त्वं क्षन्तुमर्हसि॥
target: The good man always protects those that seek protection at his hands. We solicit your protection; you should therefore pardon us."

source: तामस्वस्थां तदाकारां सख्यस्ता जजुरिङ्गितः। ततो विदर्भपतये दमयन्त्याः सखीजनः॥ न्यवेदयत् तामस्वस्थां दमयन्ती नरेश्वरे। तच्छ्रुत्वा नृपतिर्भीमो दमयन्ती सखीगणात्॥ चिन्तयामास तत् कार्यं सुमहत् स्वां सुतां प्रति। किमर्थं दुहिता मेऽद्य नातिस्वस्थेव लक्ष्यते॥
target: O King, the hand-maids, of Damayanti beholding her that condition and features, represented them to the ruler of Vidharbha. The king Bhima hearing all from the handmaids was set to serious thinking regarding the affair of his daughter; the thought within, himself why was it that his daughter scemed to be so uncasy at present.

source: संजय उवाच वर्तमाने महाराज संग्रामे लोमहर्षणे। व्याकुलेषु च सर्वेषु पीड्यमानेषु सर्वशः॥
target: Sanjaya said When that hair-stirring battle continued to be fought and when all the warriors were filled with anxiety and were greatly afflicted.

source: काम्बोजविषये जातैर्बाहीकैश्च हयोत्तमैः। वनायुजैनदीजैश्च पूर्णा हरिहयोत्तमैः॥
target: And the city abounded with excellent horses sprung in Kamboja, and Vahlika, and Vanayu, and the banks of the Sindhu, and like to that best of horses, Hari's charger.

source: तस्य शब्दो महानासीद् धम्यमानस्य जिष्णुना। तथा वीर्यवता संख्ये पर्वतस्येव दीर्यतः॥
target: Blown on the battle-field by the powerful Vishnu the sound of that conch appeared like that of the clapping of a mountain.

source: शीतं वातं समासाद्य श्रान्तो मदविमोहितः। विषेण च परीताङ्गो निश्चेष्टः पाण्डुनन्दनः॥
target: He was fatigued and he was under the influence of the poison. The cool air spread the poison all over his body and the son of Pandu (Bhima) became senseless.

source: पूर्वं कृच्छ्रे चरिष्येऽहं पश्चाच्छुभमिति प्रभो। धर्मराजं ब्रुवन्नेवं पतितोऽस्मि महीतले॥
target: I answered, saying-I shall first suffer the distress of punishment, and when that is over, I shall enjoy the happiness that is in store for me, O lord! After I had said these words to the king of the dead, I dropped down on the Earth.

source: तत् करिष्यन्ति कौन्तेया वासुदेवस्य सम्मतम्। न हि ते जातु शाम्येरवृते राज्येन कौरव॥
target: The sons of Kunti will do that with the approval of Vasudeva and they will not be pacified without the kingdom, O son of Kuru.

source: अक्षरं परमं ब्रह्म बलवच्छक एव च। नीतिमुनीतिः शुद्धात्मा शुद्धो मान्यो गतागतः॥
target: You are free from decay; you are the highest form of happiness; you are a deity proud of his power; you are Shakra; you are the punishment described in treatises on Politics and inflicted on offenders; you are the tyranny which prevails over the world; you are of pure Soul; you are stainless, you are worthy of adoration; you are the world that appears and disappear ceaselessly.

source: एवमुक्तसतु संक्रुद्धः शरवर्षेण पाण्डवम्। अभ्यवर्षत् सगोविन्दं धनुरादाय भास्वरम्॥
target: Thus spoken to, king Bhagadatta, inflamed with rage, took up a lustrous bow and showers of arrow on Pandu's son and Govinda.

source: महारथौ च पाञ्चाल्यौ युधामन्यूत्तमौजसौ। वीर्यवन्तौ महात्मानौ न गदाकार्मुकधारिणौ॥
target: And the two Maharathas, the ruler of Panchala, Yudhamanyu and Uttamaujas, who were high-souled (warriors) of great prowess holding clubs and bows.

source: पाण्डवानां बलौघस्तु शल्यमासाद्य मारिष। व्यतिष्ठत तदा युद्धे सिन्धोर्वेग इवाचलम्॥
target: The huge army of the Pandavas, coming against Shalya, O sire, stood still in that battle, like the rushing deep upon being obstructed by a mountain.

source: नदीः पुण्यवहाश्चैव पुष्पितांश्च नगोत्तमान्। सत्यवानाह पश्येति सावित्री मधुरं वचः॥
target: And Satyavana said these sweet words to Savitri "behold these streams of sacred waters and these excellent blossoming trees.”

source: तौ युध्यमानौ संरब्धौ मृत्युपाशवशानुगौ। उपसृत्यापरिज्ञातो जग्राह मृगहा तदा॥
target: The slayer of animals then approaching those two fighting with each other, subject to the trap of death, without their knowledge caught hold of them.

source: तदा मनस्ते त्रिदिवादिवाशुचे निवर्तिना पार्थमहीप्रशासनात्। प्रशाम्य राज्यं हि सुदुर्लभ त्वया बुभूषितः स्वर्ग इवातपस्विना॥
target: O Partha! As the mind of an impious man retires from heaven, you will retire from your ruling power. Keep quite, it is very difficult to gain the kingdom for you like a man wants heaven without any penance.

source: स सौष्ठवोपेतमदीनवादिनः कपेनिशम्याप्रतिमोऽप्रियं वचं। दशाननः कोपविवृत्तलोचनः समादिशत् तस्य वधं महाकपेः॥
target: Hearing the distasteful yet excellent speech of the bold and matchless monkey, the ten-necked one, with his eyes whirling in wrath, ordered the destruction of that mighty monkey.

source: कथं च बालस्य सत: सूक्ष्मजाने गता मतिः। यथा नान्यस्य लोकेऽस्मिन् द्वितीयस्येह कस्यचित्॥
target: How was it that, when he was a mere boy, his mind became bent to the knowledge of the subtile? Indeed, in this world no second person can be seen in whom such marks could be seen at so early an age.

source: व्यूढेनासुरयुद्धेन हत्वा दैतेयदानवान्। व्यभजत् पृथिवीं कृत्स्नां ययातिनहुषात्मजः॥
target: Having killed many Daityas and Danavas duly in battle, Nahusha's son Yayati divided the whole Earth (among his children).

source: विराटः सह पुत्रेण धृष्टद्युम्नश्च पार्षतः। भीमश्च केकयाचैव सात्यकिश्च विशाम्पते।॥
target: O king, these were Virata and his son, the descendant of Prishata, Dhrishtadyumna, Bhima, the five Kaikeya brothers, and Satyaki.

source: न व्याहरति चैवेनं जैगीषव्यः कथंचन॥ काष्ठभूतोऽऽश्रमपदे वसति स्म महातपाः।
target: The great ascetic Jaigishavya never spoke a word to Devala but lived in the latter's hermitage like a log of wood.

source: द्विस्तीर्थानि मया पूर्वं दृष्टानि कुरुनन्दन। इदं तृतीयं द्रक्ष्यामि तान्येव भवता सह॥
target: O descendant of Kuru, I have seen the Tirthas twice before. I shall for the third time see them with you.

source: संनियच्छति मे क्रोधं त्वयि कामः समुत्थितः। द्रवतो मार्गमासाद्य हयानिव सुसारथिः॥
target: Truly dose my love for you keep in control the wrath like to a good charioteer restraining the swerving steed.

source: सोऽहं श्रुत्वा ब्राह्मणानां सकाशाद् ब्रह्माद्वैत कथयितुमागतोऽस्मि। क्वासौ बन्दी यावदेनं समेत्य नक्षत्राणीव सविता नाशयामि॥
target: Having heard this from the Brahmanas, I have come to expound the doctrine of the Supreme Being. Where is that Bandi? Tell me, so that I may destroy him, as the sun destroys the stars.

source: पारिजातेन राजेन्द्र पर्वतेन च धीमता। सुमुखेन च सौम्येन देवर्षिरमितद्युतिः॥
target: O king, the celestial Rishi of immeasurable effulgence was accompanied by Parijata, the intelligent Raivatga, Saumya and Sumukha.

source: तेजसा वर्चसा चैव युक्तं भार्गवनन्दनम्। स वर्धमानस्तेजस्वी वेदस्याध्यनेन च॥ बहूनृषीन् महातेजाः पाण्डवेयात्यवर्तत।
target: This descendant of Bhrigu was endued with both splendour and grace. He grew in years as well as in strength; and he excelled all in the Vedas.

source: विभित्सता रथानीकं सौभद्रेणामितौजसा। विक्रीडितं यथा संख्ये तन्ममाचक्ष्व संजय॥
target: Tell me, O Sanjaya, how in battle did the dauntless son of Subhadra, endued with immeasurable might sport, having penetrated into our car-division.

source: प्राजापत्यं विश्वकृतं प्रस्वापं नाम भारत। न हीदं वेद रामोऽपि पृथिव्यां वा पुमान् क्वचित्।।१२
target: It appertains to the lord of all creatures (Brahma) and was manufactured by the divine architect; it is named Prasvapa, O Bharata. It is not known even to Rama nor to any body else on the earth.

source: सत्यसेनस्त्रिभिर्बाणैर्विव्याध युधि पाण्डवम्। मित्रदेवस्त्रिषष्ट्या तु चन्द्रदेनस्तु सप्तभिः॥
target: In the battle, Satyasena penetrated the son of Pandu with three arrows; and Mitradeva pierced him with sixty-three; while indeed, Chandradeva pierced him with seven arrows.

source: रमणीयं हि भर्तारं विनष्टमधिगम्य सा। नैराश्यात्स्त्रीलघुत्वाच्च त्वद्वशं प्रतिपत्स्यते ॥
target: Losing her charming husband, she from despair and female railty, shall come under your away.

source: स तु देशो विसूर्योऽपि तस्य भासा प्रकाशते। सूर्यलक्ष्म्याभिविज्ञेयस्तपतेव विवस्वता ॥
target: Albeit without the sun, yet through the brightness of the Soma mountain, the land shines forth with all the loveliness and reality of one warmed by the sun.

source: तिस्रः क्षत्रियसम्बन्धाद् द्वयोरात्मास्य जायते। हीनवर्णास्तृतीयायां शूद्रा उग्रा इति स्मृतिः॥
target: A Kshatriya may take three wives. In two of them, he takes birth himself. His third wife being of the Shudra caste, is considered as very inferior. The son that he begets upon her is called an Ugra.

source: स्तस्मान्मन्त्रो मन्त्रपूर्वं हि कर्म। विधिविधेयं मनसोपपत्तिः फलस्य भोक्ता तु तथा शरीरी॥
target: Acts have the three Gunas (of Satva Rajas, and Tamas) for their soul. The Vedas say this. The Mantras, therefore, have the same three qualities, since it is with Mantras that acts are performed. The ritual also is possessed by the same three qualities. The fruits of action depend upon the mind. It is the embodied creature who enjoys those fruits.

source: कथं हि भिन्नकरटं पद्मिनं वनगोचरम्। उपस्थाय महानागं करेणुः सूकरं स्पृशेत्॥
target: Is it possible for a she-elephant who has enjoyed the company of the mighty ranger of forest with rent temples, to live with a (miserable) hog?

source: भीष्मस्य समरे राजन् यशो मानं च वर्धयन्। सौभद्रो राजपुत्रं तु बृहद्बलमयोधयत्॥
target: Then in that conflict for Bhishma 0 king, Subhadra's son, acquiring great fame and honour fought with prince Brihadbala,

source: न तत्र विषयस्त्वासीन्मम सैन्यस्य भारत। खे विषक्तं हि तत् सौभं क्रोशमात्र इवाभवत्॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, as that (car) Saubha made of precious metals was in the sky full two miles off, it could not be seen by my troops.

source: शो नेत्रे करौ पादौ गुल्फावूरू समौ चितौ। अनुवृत्तनखाः स्निग्धाः समाश्चाङ्गुलयो मम॥
target: My temples, and eyes hands, feet, ankles, and thighs are equal. And my fingers are furnished with round nails, and are plump and even in the middle.

source: गिरिं य इच्छेत् तु तलेन भेत्तुं शिलोच्चयं श्वेतमतिप्रमाणम्। न चापि किंचित् स गिरेस्तु कुर्यात्॥
target: He, who desires to pierce by the palm of his hand the high white mountain of huge dimensions, has his hand with his nails only wasted away; and absolutely no harm is done to the mountain.

source: मनुरुवाच यथा व्यक्तमिदं शेते स्वप्ने चरति चेतनम्। ज्ञानमिन्द्रियसंयुक्तं तद्वत् प्रेत्य भवाभवौ॥
target: As in a dream this body (inactive) and the enlivening spirit in its subtile form, separating itself from the former, walks forth, so, in the state called deep sleep (or death), the subtile forin with all the senses becomes inactive, and the Understanding, separated from it, remains awake. The same is the case with Existence and Non-Existence.

source: अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि सत्त्वक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्यथा। संयोगो विप्रयोगश्च तन्निबोधत सत्तमाः॥ विषयो विषयित्वं च सम्बन्धोऽयमिहोच्यते।
target: I shall, after this. describe how the association and the disassociation takes place of Soul and Nature. You best of men, listen. The relation here is said to be that betwcen the object and the subject.

source: ततस्तामेव चोत्कृष्य शक्तिं शक्तिधरप्रियः। माल्यवन्तं समुद्दिश्य चिक्षेपाम्बुरुहेक्षणः॥
target: Thereat drawing out the same dart, that one dear to the Wielder of the Dart,* having eyes resembling red lotuses, aiming at Mālyāvan, hurled it at him. *A name of Kārtikeya, the celestial generallissimo.

source: पाण्डुपुत्रेण वै तस्य केतुं छिन्नं महात्मना॥ निपतन्तमपश्याम गिरिशृङ्गमिवाहतम्।
target: We saw the standard of Shalya, which was thus cut off by the son of Pandu in that great battle, drop down like a mountain summit.

source: सम्प्रावेपन्त कुरवो गावः शीतार्दिता इव। विस्मयोच्चोत्तरीयाणि व्याविध्यन् सर्वतो नृपाः॥
target: The Kurus began to shiver like kine afflicted with the chill of winter. Out of amazement the kings then began to waive their garments;

source: यस्मिन् यथा वर्तते यो मनुर्घ्य स्तस्मिंस्तथा वर्तितव्यं स धर्मः। मायाचारो मायया बाधितव्यः साध्वाचारः साधुना प्रत्युपेयः॥
target: One should treat another as the latter does him. A deceitful person should be thwarted with deceit, while an honest man should be treated with honesty.

source: निष्कम्पपत्रास्तरवो नद्यश्च स्तिमितोदकाः। भवन्ति यत्र तत्राहं तिष्ठामि च चरामि च॥
target: What shall I say more? Wherever I live, even the leaves of the trees do not flutter and the currents of the rivers are stopped.

source: आर्जवेनापरे युक्ता निहतानार्जवर्जनैः। ऋजवो नाकपृष्ठे वै शुद्धात्मानः प्रतिष्ठिताः॥
target: Others, marked by simplicity and truth, have been killed by wicked men. Gifted with pure souls, such men to truth and simplicity, have become respected inhabitants of heaven.

source: निक्षिप्य देहौ काकुत्स्थ कथं तौ द्विजपार्थिवौ। पुनर्देहेन संयोग जग्मतुर्देवसंमतौ॥
target: Having thus cast off their bodies how did that Brāhmaṇa worshipped of the celestial and the king regain them?

source: अप्सरोभिस्ततस्ताभिर्मुनिर्दृष्टपरावरः। नीतो मदनवश्यत्वं देवानां कार्यसिद्धये॥
target: And for compassing the end of the celestials, that ascetic conversant with the morality and otherwise as well of this life as that to come, was brought by those Apsaras (nymphs) under the sway of Madana.

source: श्रान्तं भीतं भ्रष्टशस्त्रं रुदन्तं पराङ्मुखं पारिबहश्च हीनम्। अनुद्यन्तं रोगिणं याचमानं न वै हिंस्याद् बालवृद्धौ च राजन्॥
target: A Kshatriya should not, O king, strike one who is fatigued, or one who is terrified, or one who has been disarmed, or one who is weeping, or one who is reluctant to fight, or one who is unequipped with mail and cars and horse and infantry, or one who has ceased to exert in the fight, or one who is ill, or one who cries for quarter. Or one who is of tender years, or one who is old.

source: नयश्च विनयश्चोभौ निग्रहानुग्रहावपि। राजवृत्तिरसंकीर्णा न नृपाः कामवृत्तयः॥
target: The royal virtue consists in humbly and freely administering discipline, favour and punishment. Kings by no means, should follow their whims.

source: शरणं ये प्रपन्नानां भवन्ति शरणार्थिनाम्। चरन्ति लोके प्रच्छन्नाः क्व नु तेऽद्य महारथाः॥
target: Alas where do those mighty warriors ramble in disguise today who grant refuge to those that come to solicit it.

source: महतः परमव्यक्तमव्यक्तात् परतोऽमृतम्। अमृतान्न परं किंचित् सा काष्ठा सा परा गतिः॥
target: Superior to Mahat is the Prakriti. Superior to the Prakriti is Brahma. There is nothing superior to Brahma. That is the highest limit of goodness and the highest end.

source: न च मे प्रतिभा काचिदस्ति किंचित् प्रभाषितुम्। पीड्यमानस्य गोविन्द विषानलसमैः शरैः॥
target: I am so afflicted, O Govinda, by these arrows resembling poison or fire that I have not the power to speak anything.

source: सव्यं चक्रं महीग्रस्तं दृष्ट्वा देवादिदं मम। पार्थ कापुरुषतीर्णमभिसंधिं विसर्जय॥
target: Seeing my wheel thus accidentally sunken you should give up your idea which is cherished by a coward only.

source: तथैव देवता राजन् नात्र कार्या विचारणा। तथैव तेऽपि प्रीयन्ते येषां भवति तद्धविः॥
target: The deities also become pleased when the Brahmanas are pleased. There is no doubt in this. They who give away the sacrificial Havi to the Brahmanas become themselves pleased.

source: तांस्तथाङ्गेषु संसक्तानङ्गदो रजनीचरान्। आदायैव खमुत्पत्य प्रासादतलमाविशत्॥
target: And along with those wanderers of the night who held him fast by his limbs Angada took a leap upwards and alighted on the roof of the palace.

source: स तांस्तु प्रियकान् प्राप्य शीघ्रानास्थाय वाजिनः। अनुज्ञाप्याथ भरतो वाहिनीं त्वरितो ययौ॥
target: Coming to the Priyakas, Bharata speedily yoking the horses, set out without delay, issuing his orders to the forces.

source: दण्डपाणिर्यथा गोषु पालो नित्यं हि रक्षयेत्। ब्राह्मणा ब्रह्म च तथा क्षत्रियः परिपालयेत्॥
target: As the herdsman, stick in hand, protects the herd, so should the Kshatriya always protect the Vedas and the Brahmanas.

source: रक्षसा तं गृहीतं तु विदित्वा मुनिसत्तमः। विश्वामित्रोऽप्यपाक्रामत् तस्माद् देशादरिंदम॥
target: O chastiser of foes, knowing that the Rakshasas had entered the body of the king, that best of Rishis, Vishvamitra, left the place and went away.

source: आर्यक उवाच न मे नमैतद् बहुमतं महर्षे वचनं तव। सखा शक्रस्य संयुक्तः कस्यायं नेप्सितो भवेत्॥
target: These words of yours, O great Rishi, are not approved of by me. The cause is not want of respect for you; foe who would not desire a connection with the friend of Shaka?

source: तस्मात् संजनयेत् कोशं सत्कृत्य परिपालयेत्। परिपाल्यानुतनुयादेष धर्मः सनातनः॥
target: For these reasons the treasury must be replenished; and when filled, it should be carefully kept, and even sought to be increased. This is the eternal practice.

source: मनसा क्लिश्यमानस्तु समाधानं च कारयेत्। न निर्वेदं मुनिर्गच्छेत् कुर्यादेवात्मनो हितम्॥
target: He should, though disturbed by the fickleness of his mind, fix it in meditation. The Yogin should never despair, but seek own his well-being.

source: शौण्डिकाः कुकुराश्चैव शकाश्चैव विशाम्पते। अङ्गा वङ्गाश्च पुण्ड्राश्च शाणवत्या गयास्तथा॥
target: O king, the Paundrayas, the Kukkuras, the Shakas, the Angas, the Vangas, the Pundras, the Shanavatyas and the Gayas,

source: तदन्तरममेयात्मा कौन्तेयः शत्रुतापनः। अभ्यद्रवद् रणे क्रुद्धो द्रोणं प्रति महारथः॥
target: At this crisis, that afflicter of foes that mighty car-warrior the son of Kunti, (Arjuna) waxing worth, rushed against Drona.

source: असुरास्तु निजघ्नुर्यान् सुरान् समरमूर्धनि। न तान् संजीवयामास बृहस्पतिरुदारधीः॥
target: The Asuras also killed many Devas, but the greatly learned Brihaspati could not revive them.

source: अक्षयूते च भगवन्धनं राज्यं च मे हृतम्। आहूय निकृतिप्रज्ञैः कितवैरक्षकोविदैः॥
target: "O almighty one, summoned by those evilminded and mischievous but skillful gamblers at dice. I have been deprived of my wealth and kingdom (through gambling).

source: तमेव शास्त्रकर्तारः प्रवदन्ति मनीषिणः। निष्ठां नारायणमृर्षि नान्योऽस्तीति वचो मम॥
target: Those wise persons who are the authors of the scriptures say that Narayana, who is a Rishi, is the one object of respectful adoration in the universe, I say that there is no other being like Him.

source: प्रनृत्ताप्सरसं दिव्यं देवर्षिगणसेवितम्। दृष्टिकान्तमनिर्देश्यं दिव्यमद्भुतदर्शनम्॥
target: It was the resort of the celestial Rishis, the Apsaras danced there in joy. The place was exceedingly beautiful to look at. It was exceedingly beautiful, resembling Heaven itself. Its view was wonderful, and indeed, its beauty and sweetness was beyond description.

source: सप्तविंशेऽथ दिवसे यः कुर्यादेकभोजनम्॥ सदा द्वादशमासांस्तु जुह्वानो जातवेदसम्। फलं प्राप्नोति विपुलं देवलोके च पूज्यते॥ अमृताशी वसंस्तत्र स वितृष्णः प्रमोदते।
target: That man who having fasted for twentysix days eats a single meal on the twentyseventh day, and acts thus for a full year, pouring libations every day on his sacred fire, acquires great merit and proceeding to the celestial region, receives honours from the deities, Living there he subsists on nectar freed from thirst of every kind, and enjoying every happiness.

source: यस्मिन् हरिसहस्राणि शतानि नियुतानि च। वर्तयन्ति कृताशानि सोऽयं दिष्टान्तमागतः॥
target: He even, who (while living) was surrounded by thousands of monkeys cherishing hopes, has met his destined end.

source: अथ राक्षससिंहस्य कृष्णान्कनकभूषणान्। शरैश्चतुर्भिः सौमित्रिर्विव्याध चतुरो हयान्॥
target: Then Sumitrā's son pierced the four black steeds of the leonine Räksasa, caparisoned in gold.

source: दुहिता जनकस्यापि वैदेही यदि ते श्रुता। पतिमन्वचरत् सीता महारण्यनिवासिनम्॥
target: You may have heard that Janaka's daughter Sita, the princess of Videha, went in the wake of her lord while he was dwelling in a great dreary forest.

source: यदि नोत्सहसे गन्तुं सरुजं त्वां हि लक्षये। न च ज्ञास्यसि पन्थानं तमसा संवृते वने॥
target: If you do not venture to go. (I will do all this). I see you are unwell. You will not be able to discern the paths as a dense darkness is hanging over these woods.

source: सा तु तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा कन्यका पितृगौरवात्। तत्र गत्वा च सा तस्थौ विश्रवा यत्र तप्यते॥
target: Hearing that speech of his, the daughter for the sake of dignity of her sire, going to where Viśravā was practising penances, stood there.

source: ततो धर्मसुतो राजन् प्रगृह्यान्यन्महद् धनुः॥ द्रौणिं विव्याधं सप्तत्या बाह्वोरुरसि चार्पयत्।
target: Upon that, О king, the son of Dharma took up a very big bow and darted, one after another, seventy shafts, piercing the arms and breast of the son of Drona.

source: तौ गजाविव चासाद्य विषाणाप्रैः परस्परम्। शरैः पूर्णायतोत्सृष्टैरन्योन्यमभिजघ्नतुः॥
target: They wounded each other with arrows shot from bows drawn to the highest stretch like two elephants assailing each other with their tusks.

source: यथा च भीमो व्रजति तन्मे निगदतः शृणु। बाह्वोर्बले नास्ति समो ममेति भरतर्षभ।॥
target: Hear, I tell you, why Bhima goes in this way. O best of the Bharata race, thinking “There is none equal to me in strength of arms."

source: ततस्तामापगां दिव्यां प्रसन्नसलिलाशयाम्॥ तत्र द्रक्ष्यथ कावेरी विहतामप्सरोगणैः।
target: At the foot of the Malaya mountain endued with exceeding energy, you will behold the noble stream Kāveri, of pleasant waters, where sport troops of Apsarās.

source: सामान्यं जनकं ज्ञात्वा धर्मज्ञो ज्ञानमुत्तमम्। उपेत्य शतमाचार्यान् मोहयामास हेतुभिः॥
target: Knowing fully all the forms of duty, Panchashikha, after having himself gained high knowledge, (came to Janaka) and knowing that that king had equal reverence for all his preceptors, began to startle those hundred preceptors (by a very sensible exposition of his doctrine).

source: विद्यया ह्यनया राजन् वयं नृभ्यो विशेषिताः। अविशिष्टाश्च देवानामनुभावप्रदर्शिनः॥
target: O king, (only) on account of this science, we have a superiority over men. Because we are capable of seeing everything (by our spiritual eyes), we are equal to the celestials.

source: अभ्यन्तरा च सर्वस्वे द्रौपदी भरतर्षभ। एवं धर्मजितां कृष्णां मन्यसे न जितां कथम्॥
target: O best of the Bharata race, Draupadi is (surely) included in his possessions. Why do you consider that Krishna (Draupadi) who has been righteously won as not won?

source: एतत्सुबहुवृत्तांतमुत्तमं चानुशासनम्। भीष्यस्यात्रैव संप्राप्तिः स्वर्गस्य परिकीर्तिता॥
target: All these excellent matters have been treated in this Anushasana Parva containing variety of incidents. It also describes ascension of Bhishma to heaven.

source: कथंरूपा च सा शान्ता राजपुत्री यतव्रता। लोभयामास या चेतो मृगभूतस्य तस्य वै॥ लोमपादश्च राजर्षिर्यदाश्रूयतधार्मिकः। कथं वै विषये तस्य नावर्षत् पाकशासनः॥
target: What sort of a princess that vow-observing Shanta was, who tempted his heart by becoming at nd? Why did not the chastiser of . foes (Indra) pour rain in the kingdom of the royal sage Lomapada when it is heard that he was very virtuous.

source: तमुवाचाथ राजा स सान्त्वपूर्वमिदं वचः। राजा प्रभञ्जनो नाम कुलेऽस्मिन् सम्बभूव ह॥
target: The king then spoke thus in sweet accents, "There was born a king in our race named Prabhanjana.

source: यक्षराक्षससाणां दैत्यदानवयोरपि। वपुर्धारयते देवो भूयश्च विलवासिनाम्॥
target: He assumes the forms of also Yakshas and Rakshasas and Snakes, of Daityas and Danavas. The illustrious god assumes the forms of all creatures too which live in holes.

source: काम्बोजैः शबलैरश्वैरभ्यवर्तत दुर्जयः। बृक्षत्रं तु कैकेयं सुकुमारं हयोत्तमाः॥ पलालधूमसंकाशाः सैन्धवाः शीघ्रमावहन्। मल्लिकाक्षाः पद्मवर्णा बाह्निजाता: स्वलंकृताः॥
target: And invincible in battle, was carried by horses of Kamboja breed and of variegated hue. Excellent steeds of thc Sindhu breed, of beautiful limbs and of the colour of the smoke emitted by burning straws, quickly bore the prince of the Kekayas, namely, Vrihatkshastra. Possessed of eyes of the hue of jasmine, of lotus hue, of Valhika breed and decked with gold trappings, such steeds.

source: निकृतेस्तस्य पापस्य ते पारं गमनेप्सवः। चारान् सम्प्रेषयामासुः समन्तात् तद्रणाजिरे॥
target: Desirous of putting an end to that sinful man's evil policy, they had sent spies in all directions on the field of battle.

source: ब्रुवन्त्यामेवमार्तायां जनन्यां भरताग्रजः। पादावासाद्य जग्राह वसिष्ठस्य च राघवः॥
target: As his wretched mother was thus speaking, Bharata's elder brother, Räghava, approaching, took the feet of Vasiştha.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच निदेशाद् भवतः पूर्वं वने विचरता मया। तीर्थयात्राप्रसङ्गेन सम्प्राप्तोऽयमनुग्रहः॥
target: Yudhishthira said While at your behest I wandered in the foremost, I obtained this boon at the time of sojourning to the sacred places!

source: तया हि देव्या च कृतप्रदक्षिणो निपीड्य मातुश्चरणौ पुनः पुनः। जगाम सीतानिलयं महायशाः स राघवः प्रज्वलितस्तया श्रिया॥
target: Being gone round by his mother thus, Rāghava, of great lame, and resplendent with the splendour of beauty, proceeded towards the abode of Sītā, after bowing down to the feet of his mother repeatedly.

source: आरुरोह रथं राजंश्चित्रसेनस्य भारत॥ स्थितावेकरथे तौ तु भ्रातरौ कुलवर्धनौ।
target: Ascended, O king, the resplendent car of Chitrasena; them thus seated on the same chariot, namely those two brothers the perpetuator of Kuru's race.

source: बलवर्णप्रभावा हि प्रहीयन्त्युद्भवन्ति च। तदलं वत तद् रूपं द्रष्टुं कुरुकुलोद्वह। युगं समनुवामि कालो हि दुरतिक्रमः॥
target: O perpetuator of the Kuru race, therefore do not desire to see my former form. I am following the tendency of this (present) age. Time is irresistible.

source: स्कन्धमारोपयामास दशव्यामं परंतपः॥ स तं वृक्षं दशव्यामं सस्कन्धविटपं बली। प्रगृह्याभ्यद्रवत् सूतान् दण्डपाणिरिवान्तकः॥ ऊरुवेगेन तस्याथ न्यग्रोधाश्वत्यकिंशुकाः। भूमौ निपतिता वृक्षाः सङ्घशस्तत्र शेरते॥ तं सिंहमिव संक्रुद्ध दृष्ट्वा गन्धर्वमागतम्। वित्रेसुः सर्वशः सूता विषादभयकम्पिताः॥
target: Measuring ten Vyamas and placed it on his shoulders. Then taking that tree up with its trunk and branches, measuring ten Vyamas that slayer of foes rushed towards the Sutas like Yama with mace in his hand. By the velocity of his movement, the banian, Nyagrodha, Kinshukh and other trees fell down on earth an lay in a heap. Beholding that Gandharva approach enraged like a lion, all those Sutas were afraid and trembled in sorrow and fear, Then beholding the Gandharva approach like death, the Kichaka's cremated their cldest brother and spoke amongst themselves trembling in fear and sorrow.

source: पृथिव्यां तु रणे पार्थ न योद्धा त्वत्समः पुमान्। धनुग्रार्हा हि ये केचित् क्षत्रिया युद्धदुर्मदाः॥ आ देवात् त्वत्समं तेषां न पश्यामि शृणोमि च।
target: There is no mortal warrior on earth who can be your rival in battle. There cannot be found any skilled archer like you, either among the invincible Kshatriyas or the gods.

source: कर्तव्यं यद् वयस्येन स्निग्धेन च हितेन च। अनुरूपं च युक्तं च कृतं सुग्रीव तत् त्वया॥
target: O Sugriva, that which, pleasing and profitable, proper and fit, ought to be done by a friend, has been done by you.

source: अधीत्य वेदानखिलान् साङ्गोपनिषदस्तथा। अन्विच्छन्नैष्ठिकं कर्म धर्मनैपुणदर्शनात्॥ कृष्णद्वैपायनं व्यासं पुत्रो वैयासकिः शुकः। पप्रच्छ संदेहमिमं छिन्नधर्मार्थसंशयम्॥
target: Having studied the measureless Vedas with all their branches and the Upanishads, and desirous of leading a life of celibacy on account of his having acquired excellence of religious merit, Shuka put these very questions, about which his doubts had not been removed, to his father Dvipayana, who had removed (by study and contemplation) all doubt regarding true duties.

source: किरात उवाच मयैषधन्वनिर्मुक्तैस्ताडितः पूर्वमेव हि। बाणैरभिहतः शेते नीतश्च यमसादनम्॥
target: The Kirata said: This one (the Rakshasas) was first struck with the arrow shot from my bow. He was killed and sent to the abode of Yama by me.

source: तेषां त्रयाणां चापानिचिच्छेद विशिखैस्त्रिभिः। ते निकृत्तायुधाः शूरा निर्विषा भुजगा इव॥
target: Then with their bows severed, those warriors with three darts appeared like serpents without venom. Then from their respctive cars, hurling lances at the foe, they uttered loud warcries.

source: मुदितैर्मुनिशार्दूलैः प्रशस्त: कुशिकात्मजः। निद्रामुपागमच्छीमानस्तंगत इवांशुमान्॥
target: And the auspicious son of Kuśika having been extolled by those delighted ascetic, the foremost of their order-slept, like to the sun, when setting

target: And the graceful Bharata, Having installed the sandals of the noble one, always carried on the government in subordinations to them.

source: समेतं पार्थिवं क्षत्रं कालपक्कमसंशयम्। विमर्दश्च महान् भावी मांसशोणितकर्दमः॥
target: All these Kshatriyas, these rulers of the earth have their hour come and there will be a great massacre which will make the earth one mass of clay of flesh and blood.

source: सामात्यपरिषत्क्रीडन् पानमेवोपसेवते। शोकदीनेषु नास्मासु सुग्रीवः कुरुते दयाम्॥
target: Does not Sugrīva feel pity for us, who are racked with sorrow, being addicted to drinking with friends and counsellors?

source: ततो द्रोणो महाराज मागधश्च महारथः। दुर्योधनसमादिष्टौ तं देशमुपजग्मतुः॥
target: Then, O monarch, Drona and the king of the Magadhas, both being commanded by Duryodhana, hide to that spot,

source: विसंजं वानरं दृष्ट्वा दशग्रीवो रणोत्सुकः। रथेनाम्बुदनादेन सौमित्रिमभिदुद्रुवे॥
target: Seeing the monkey deprived of his senses, the Ten-necked one, eager for encounter, riding a car emitting a rattle resembling the rumbling of clouds, darted against Sumitra's son.

source: सेनयोरुभयोश्चापि समन्ताच्छूयते महान्। पाञ्चजन्यस्य निर्घोषो गाण्डीवस्य च निःस्वनः॥
target: A loud uproar set up by the two armies is heard, as also the blare of the conch Panchajanya, and the twang of bow Gandiva.

source: कृतस्वस्त्ययनं मात्रा पित्रा दशरथेन च। पुरोधसा वसिष्ठेन मङ्गलैरभिमन्त्रितम्॥ स पुत्रं मू[पाघ्राय राजा दशरथस्तदा॥
target: And when the auspicious rites had been performed by both Rāma's father and mother, and when the priest Vasiştha had uttered mantras, king Dasaratha, smelling his son's crown, with a glad heart, made him over to the descendant of Kusika.

source: तमहं रथं प्राशंसमथ राजाब्रवीद् भगवता रथः प्रशस्तः। एष भगवतो रथ इति॥
target: I praised that car and then the king spoke to me thus, "O exalted one, this car has been praised by you, let this car therefore by yours.”

source: अथ चिन्तां समापेदे पुनः कौरवन्दन। अम्भस्यस्या निमज्जेयमिति दुःखसमन्वितः॥
target: O descendant of Kuru, seeing this, the sorrowful Rishi began to ponder and thought that he would certainly be killed if he fell into its waters.

source: अवश्यं तु मया सर्व विज्ञाप्यस्त्वं नराधिपा वासुदेवस्य यद् वाक्यं फाल्गुनस्य च धीमतः॥
target: But, O foremost of men, I think it a duty to remind you of the words which were spoken to me by Vasudeva and the highly intelligent Phalguna.

source: पश्य देवस्य माहात्म्यं महिमानं च नारद। शुभाशुभैः कर्मभिर्यो न लिप्यति कदाचन॥
target: See, O Narada, the greatness and power of that God! He is never affected by good or bad deeds.

source: ततः पश्यति धर्मात्मा तत् सर्वं योगमास्थितः। पुरा यत् तत्र निर्वृत्तं पाणावामलकं यथा॥
target: And like an embolic myrobalan on his palm, that righteous-souled sage by virtue of his yoga, perceived all that had happened as well as all that would happen in the past.

source: शिखण्डिन्युवाच प्रतिदास्यामि भगवन् पुंल्लिङ्गं तव सुव्रत। किञ्चित्कालान्तरं स्त्रीत्वं धारयस्व निशाचर॥
target: Shikhandin said O you of good vows, I will return to you your manhood, O God. Only for a certain period bear by womanhood, O night ranger.

source: एवमुक्तो नृपतिनां रामो धर्मभृतां वरः। प्रत्युवाचाञ्जलिं कृत्वा पितरं वाक्यकोविदः॥
target: Thus addressed by the monarch, Rāma, the best of the righteous, well versed in speech, with joined hands addressed his father thus.

source: स ते वक्ष्यति धर्मज्ञः सूक्ष्मधर्मार्थतत्त्ववित्। तमभ्येहि पुरा प्राणान् स विमुञ्चति धर्मवित्॥
target: Conversant with all duties and the subtile truths of morality, he wili describe to you the duty and morality. See him before he dies.

source: न हि कश्चित् क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत्। कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः॥
target: None ever remains for a moment without performing some action. All perform actions impelled by the qualities (laws) of Nature.

source: बद्धौ तु शरबन्धेन तावुभौ रणमूर्धनि। निमेषान्तरमात्रेण न शेकतुरवेक्षितुम्॥
target: And fast bound by the shackles of shafts on the edge of battle, they* could not attain respite for a moment, *i.e. Rama and Laksmana.

source: सहितान् हि कुरून् सर्वानभियातो धनंजयः। प्रमथ्य चाच्छिनद् वासः किमयं प्रोषितस्तदा॥
target: When Dhananjaya rushing against all the Kurus and smashing them dispossessed them of their clothes, what did he then do.

source: संजय उवाच अथोत्तरेण पाण्डूनां सेनायां ध्वनिरुत्थितः। रथनागाश्वपत्तीनां दण्डधारेण वध्यताम्॥
target: Sanjaya said Then there had arisen a great uproar, towards the northern part of the Pandava army, amongst the cars, the elephants, the horses and the infantry, as they were being slaughtered by Dandadhara.

source: ततो मैन्दस्तु संप्रेक्ष्य नयापनयकोविदः। वाक्यं वचनसंपन्नो बभाषे हेतुमुत्तरम्॥
target: There upon followed Mainda, conversant with what is right and wrong, after due deliberation, with words pregnant with words pregnant with reason.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच एके लोकाः सुकृतिनः सर्वे त्वाहो पितामह। तत्र तत्रापि भिन्नास्ते तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह॥
target: Yudhishthira said O grandfather, it has been said that all righteous men attain to the same region after death. It is true, O Bharata, that there is difference of position among them?

source: स चास्य गतभी राजन् प्रतिजग्राह शासनम्। ततः शाकलमभ्येत्य मद्राणां पुटभेदनम्॥
target: He (Krishna) with all the Yadavas accepted the sway (of the Pandavas). He then went to Shakala, the city of the Madras.

source: पत्रिणः पुष्पितानेतान् संपतन्नि महाद्दुमान्। रक्तपीतारुणाः पार्थ पादपाग्रगताः खगाः॥ परस्परमुदीक्षन्ते बहवो जीवजीवकाः। हरितारुणवर्णानां शाद्वलानां समीपतः॥
target: Birds alighting these great blossoming trees. O Partha, seated on the boughs these myriad of Yivajevaka birds of scarlet, yellow and red colour are looking at one another. And near the green and red grass plots,

source: ध्वजमेकेन विव्याध सारथिं चास्य पञ्चभिः। धनुरेकेषुणाविध्यत् तत्राक्रुध्यद् द्विजर्षभः॥
target: His standard with one, and his charioteer with five. Virata also pierced the bow of Drona with one shaft. Thereupon the foremost of the regenerates, Drona, waxed irascible.

source: परस्परेण धावन्तः पतिताः पुनरुत्थिताः॥ उत्थाय च प्रधावन्तो द्वन्द्वयुद्धमवाप्नुवन्।
target: Rushing upon one another, falling down and rising up again, and rushing again having risen up the combatants fought hand to hand.

source: फेनपानामृषीणां यो धर्मो धर्मविदां सताम्। तन्मे शृणु महाभागे धर्मज्ञे धर्ममादितः॥
target: O highly blessed one, do you hear, from the beginning, what are the duties of those pious Rishis who know every duty and who are known by the name of Phenapas.

source: लोकानामिह सर्वेषां त्वं कर्ता चान्त एव च। त्वं धारयसि लोकांस्त्रीन् क्रियाणां च प्रवर्तकः॥
target: "You are the creater of all creatures, you are their destroyer, you preserve the three words, you are also the promoter of all sacrifices and ceremonies,

source: प्रतिज्ञां दुष्करां कृत्वा पितुरर्थं कुलस्य च। अराजा चोर्ध्वरेताश्च यथा सुविदितं तव। प्रतीतो निवसाम्येष प्रतिज्ञामनुपालयन्॥
target: My hard determination, for the sake of my father and for the sake of my race, of never being a king and of never throw in down vital fluid by the regular passage, is well known to you; observing these vows I am now living in joy.

source: मयाभिपन्नं त्रायेरन् बलमास्थाय न त्रयः। युद्धार्हान् क्षत्रियान् सर्वान् पाण्डवेष्वाततायिनः॥
target: These three together cannot by their joint strength rescue a man in my power. All the Kshatriyas, who are fit for battle and who oppose the Pandavas.

source: विदुर उवाच अत्रैवोदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। आत्रेयस्य च संवाद साध्यानां चेति नः श्रुतम्॥
target: Vidura said In this connection is quoted the old story of the conversation between the son of Atri and Saddhyas as heard by us.

source: देवदेव उवाच नरसवं पूर्वदेहे वै नारायणसहायवान्। बदाँ तप्तवानुचं तपो वर्षायुतान् बहून्॥
target: Shiva said: You were in your former life Nara, the friend of Narayana, You passed many thousands of years in fearful and austere asceticism.

source: स तस्य मनुजेन्द्रस्य पश्यतो भगवानृषिः। अर्ध्वमाचक्रमे द्रष्टुं भास्करं भास्करद्युतिः॥
target: In the very sight of the king, the illustrious Rishi ascended the sky in order to see Surya, he himself being as effulgent as that luminary.

source: तमब्रवीत्ततः कर्णो व्यर्थं व्याहृतवानसि। वदेदानीं पुनर्हष्टो वध्यमानः पुनः पुनः॥ मा योत्सीः कुरुभिः सार्धे बलवद्भिश्च पाण्डव। सदृशैस्तात युध्यस्व व्रीडां मा कुरु पाण्डव॥ गृहं वा गच्छ माद्रेय यत्र वा कृष्णफाल्गुनौ। एवमुक्त्वा महाराज व्यसर्जयत् तं तदा॥
target: Then Karna addressed him thus-'whatever you speak is of no avail. Being delighted, do you utter those words once more, as you are struck over and over again. O son of Pandu, do you not fight with the mightiest of Kurus; O son, fight with those, that are your cquals. O son of Pandu, do not be ashamed of it. O son of Madri, go home, where are Krishna and Falguna.' O most powerful monarch, he then, having addressed him thus, dismissed him at that time.

source: रथा रथवरैरेव समाजग्मुर्मुदा युताः। तस्मिन् रात्रिमुखे घोरे तव पुत्रस्य शासनात्॥
target: and car-warriors joyfully engaged with one another, during the dreadful night at the command of your son.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच धृतराष्ट्राभ्यनुज्ञाता: कृष्णया सह पाण्डवाः। रेमिरे खाण्डवप्रस्थे प्राप्तराज्या: परंतपाः॥
target: Vaishampayana said : Having obtained their kingdom at the command of Dhritarashtra, those chastisers of foes, the Pandavas, sported with Krishna at Indraprastha.

source: न शोचन् मृतमन्वेति न शोचन म्रियते नरः। एवं सांसिद्धिके लोके किमर्थमनुशोचसि॥
target: By grieving one cannot get back the dead. By indulging in grief, one cannot die himself. When such is the course of the world, why do you grieve?

source: यस्मा मम सपुत्रायास्त्वं नाथो मधुसूदन। रामश्च बलिनां श्रेष्ठः प्रद्युम्नश्च महारथः॥ साऽहमेवंविधं दुःखं सहेऽद्य पुरुषोत्तम। भीमे जीवति दुर्धर्षे विजये चापलायिनि॥
target: Having yourself, O slayer of Madhu, as the protector of myself with my sons and as also that foremost of powerful men, Rama and that great car-warrior Pradyumna; and having the invincible Bhima and Vijaya who never turn back from the field alive, that I should suffer this sort of grief, O best among men!

source: सर्वलोकस्य धर्मात्मा शरण्यः शरणं पुरा। गुरुर्मे राघवः सोऽयं सुग्रीवं शरणं गतः॥
target: That spiritual guide, who ere now was worthy of being the shelter (of all) and who (actually) was the refuge (of all creatures) Rāghava, has saught the shelter of Sugrīva.

source: तस्य क्रुद्धस्य रोषेण गदां तां बहुकण्टकाम्। पातयामास धूम्राक्षो मस्तकेऽथ हनूमतः॥
target: Then Dhūmrākṣa enraged, brought down that mace studded with innumerable pricks, on the head of Hanumān fired with wrath.

source: धनुश्च्युतै रुक्मपुङ्खैः शरैः संनतपर्वभिः। द्विषतां भिन्ध्यनीकानि गजानामिव युथपः॥
target: Crush down the enemics' life, with straight shafts feathered in gold discharged off your bow like an elephant chief rushing at a herd.

source: त्वया विगण्य वातापे परिभूताश्च तेजसा। जीवलोके द्विज श्रेष्ठास्तस्मादसि जरां गतः॥
target: Being blinded with your prowess O Vātāpi, you have destroyed many eminent twice-born ones on this earth and for this that I do digest you.

source: भीष्म उवाच त्रयोदशैतेऽतिबलाः शत्रवः प्राणिनां स्मृताः। उपासन्ते महाराज समन्तात् पुरुषानिह॥
target: Bhishma said These thirteen vices are known as very powerful enemies of all creatures. These, O king, approach men and tempt them from all sides.

source: निहतो रावणो राम प्रहृष्टो दिवमाक्रम। अमोघं देव वीर्य ते न ते मोघाः पराक्रमाः॥
target: O Rāma, Răvaşa has been slain. Do you go up to heaven delighted. Sure is your godly energy and never goes for nothing your prowess.

source: सौमराजमुपेत्याहमवोचं दुर्वचं वचः। न च मां प्रत्यगृह्णात् स चारित्र्यपरिशङ्कितः॥
target: Approaching then the king of Saubha I addressed him in improper words, but he did not accept me being suspicious of my character.

source: अनेन वनवासेन मम प्राप्तं फलद्वयम्। पितुश्चानृण्यता धर्मे भरतस्य प्रियं तथा॥
target: By this banishment of mine, I have gained two things, my father has maintained his truth in religion, and Bharata has obtained his dear interest.

source: य एनं संश्रयन्तीह भक्ता नारायणं हरिम्। ते तरन्तीह दुर्गाणि न चात्रास्ति विचारणा॥
target: Those, who devotedly seek the refuge of this Narayana, called also Hari, succeed in getting all difficulties.

source: शाखामृगांस्तान् मृगराजदोन्। प्रष्टुं कृतार्थान्सह राघवाभ्यां श्रोतुं च सीताधिगमे प्रयत्नम्॥
target: Along with these two descendants of Raghu, I long to know soon from these monkeys headed by Hanumān, and proud like lions, what they have settled for the regaining of Sītā.

source: ततो दुमशिलाहस्ताः कोपसंरक्तलोचनाः। रिरक्षिषन्तोऽभ्यपतनङ्गदं वानरर्षभाः॥
target: Those powerful monkeys, with their eyes crimsoned with choler and bearing rocks and trees in their hands, were engaged in defending Angada.

source: तदस्य हत्वा विरराज कर्णो मुक्त्वा शरान् मेघ इवाम्बुधाराः। समीक्ष्य कर्णेन किरीटिनस्तु तथाऽऽजिमध्ये निहतं तदस्त्रम्॥ ततोऽमर्षी बलवान् क्रोधदीप्तो भीमोऽब्रवीदर्जुनं सत्यसंधम्।
target: But thwarting that weapon Karna looked handsome like the raining clouds and went on sending showers of shafts. In that fight seeing that weapon of Kiritin waisted by Karna the powerful and wrathful Bhimasena, firing up with anger, thus addressed Arjuna of never failing aimननु त्वाहुर्वेदितारं महास्त्रं

source: मद्रराजं तु समरे दृष्ट्वा युद्धाय धिष्ठितम्। कुरवः संन्यवर्तन्त मृत्युं कृत्वा निवर्तनम्॥
target: Beholding the king of the Madras standing for battle on the field, the Kouravas returned, making death their goal.

source: ततः कर्णस्य दुर्घषं स्यन्दनप्रवरं महत्॥ आरुरोह महातेजाः शल्यः सिंह इवाचलम्।
target: Then like a lion ascending a hill the highly energetic Shalya got upon the strong built car of Karna.

source: रुद्रस्याक्रीडसदृशः संहारः सर्वदेहिनाम्॥ ततः शब्दो महानासीत् पुनर्येन धनंजयः।
target: The carnage was terrible like that when Rudra slays in sport all creatures at the end of a Yuga. Then arose a loud uproar the place where Dhananjaya was.

source: भीमेसेनस्तु तं षष्ट्या सात्यकिर्दशभिः शरैः। मद्रराजमभिद्रुत्य जघ्नतुः कङ्कपत्रिभिः॥
target: Rushing at the ruler of the Madras Bhimasena and Satyaki both struck him with Kanka-feathered arrows, the former with sixty and the latter with ten.

source: आस्तीक उवाच न संतापस्त्वया कार्यः कथंचित्पन्नगोत्तम। प्रदीप्ताग्नेः समुत्पन्नं नाशयिष्यामि ते भयम्॥
target: Astika said: O best of snakes, you should not grieve any longer. I shall dispel your fear of the blazing fire.

source: मय उवाच युक्तमेतत् त्वयि विभो यथाऽऽत्था पुरुषर्षभ। प्रीतिपूर्वमहं किंचित् कर्तुमिच्छामि भारत॥
target: Maya said O lord, O best of men, what you have said fully deserves you. O descendant of Bharata, I gladly desire to do something (for you).

source: सर्वेषां चैव सैन्यानां प्रमोहः समजायत॥ अवहारं ततश्चकेनं पिता देवव्रतस्तव। संध्याकाले महाराज सैन्यानां श्रान्तवाहनः॥ पाण्डवानां कुरूणां च परस्परसमागमे।
target: All the warriors were over whelmed with confusion. Then your Sire Devavrata whose steeds were completely exhausted, O mighty sovereign, caused the withdrawal of the force, After that (fierce) encounter between the Kurus and the Pandavas.

source: ततस्तु तौ पितापुत्रौ भारद्वाजं रथे स्थितौ। महता शरवर्षेण वारयामासतुर्बलात्॥
target: Then, the father and the son (Virata and Sankha) riding on the same car, putting forth all their energies, endeavored to check the son of Bharadvaja with a mighty shower of arrows.

source: आवर्तयति भूयिष्ठं तदेव ह्यनुपालितम्॥ कुलीना देशजाः प्राज्ञा रूपवन्तो बहुश्रुताः।
target: Those who are of high descent, who. are born in your kingdom, who have wisdom, beauty, great learning, and dignity of conduct, and who are, besides, devoted to you, should be employed as officers of your army.

source: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच कथं त्वं माधवं वेत्थ सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम्। कथमेनं न वेदाहं तन्ममाचक्ष्व संजय॥
target: Dhritarashtra said How have you come to know, Madhava, the great lord of all the worlds; and how is it that I do not know him? Tell me that, O Sanjaya.

source: वसव ऊचुः तुरीयार्धं प्रदास्यामो वीर्यस्यैकैकशो वयम्। तेन वीर्येण पुत्रस्ते भविता तस्य चेप्सितः॥
target: The Vasus said : We shall each give one eighth part of our respective energies and from it a son will be born to you who will live according to your and his wishes.

source: शूद्रोऽहं नाधिकारो मे चातुराश्रम्यसेवने। इति विज्ञानमपरे नात्मन्युपदधत्युत॥
target: Even the righteous among the Shudras never betake themselves to such hypocrisy under the pretext that persons of the Shudra order are not permitted to live according to any of the four prescribed modes.

source: ततो गच्छद्धृषीकेशं द्वारवत्यां कदाचन। लब्धवांस्तत्र बीभत्सुर्भार्यां राजीवलोचनाम्॥
target: Thus roving about in many places, on one occasion, he went to Krishna in Dwarka and he obtained there for his wife the lotus-eyed,

source: शोच्येयं भारती सेना राज्यं चैव सुयोधनः। यस्य त्व कर्कशो भ्राता पलायनपरायणः॥
target: Both this army of the Bharatas and king Suyodhana are to be pitied, in asmuch as the latter own you who are now flying away as his brave brother.

source: भीष्म उवाच नहुषस्तु ततः श्रुत्वा च्यवनं तं तथागतम्। वरितः प्रययौ तत्र सहामात्यपुरोहितः॥
target: Bhishma said Hearing the strait into which Chyavana was reduced, King Nahusha speedily went there, accompanied by his ministers and priest.

source: अथ कुम्भहनुस्तत्र तारेणासाद्य वीर्यवान्। वृक्षेण महता सद्यः प्राणान्संत्याजयद्रणे॥
target: There speedily assailed by Tārā, with a mighty tree, the powerful Kumbhahanu gave up the ghost in the conflict.

source: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच एवं व्यूढेष्वनीकेषु मामकेष्वितरेषु च। कथं प्रहरतां श्रेष्ठाः सम्प्रहारं प्रचक्रिरे॥श।
target: Dhritarashtra said When my troops and the troops of our foe were thus placed in battle array, how did then the foremost of warriors Bhishma begin to strike?

source: तं तथा पतितं शूरं तावकाः पर्यवारयन्। दावं दग्ध्वा यथा शान्तं पावकं शिशिरात्यये॥ विमृद्य नागशृङ्गाणि संनिवृत्तमिवानिलम्। अस्तंगतमिवादित्यं तप्त्वा भारतवाहिनीम्॥ उपप्लुतं यथा सोमं संशुष्कमिव सागरम्। पूर्णचन्द्राभवदनं काकपक्षवृताक्षिकम्॥ तं भूमौ पतितं दृष्टवा तावकास्ते महारथाः। मुदा परमया युक्ताश्चक्रुशुः सिंहवन्मुहुः॥
target: Then your troops surrounded the fallen hero, who then looked like an extinguished fire that had consumed a whole forest during the summer season; or like a tempest with its fury subsided after it has broken down numerous tree-tops; or like the setting sun that had scorched the Bharata army with its rays; or like the moon devoured up by the Rahu; or like the ocean with its waters dried up. Then the mighty car-warriors of your army beholding Abhimanyu whose countenance wore the splendour of the full moon and whose eyes were black like the wings of the raven, lie prostrate on the naked earth, uttered repeated lion-like roars being filled with great delight.

source: सौमदत्तेः पुन पो यज्ञशीलस्य धीमतः॥ ध्वजः सूर्य इवाभाति सोमश्चात्र प्रदृश्यते।
target: The standard of Somadatta's son, ever devoted to the performance of sacrifices was decked with the device of a sacrificial stake. It shone like the sun or the moon.

source: हर्यश्वस्य मरुः पुत्रो मरोः पुत्रः प्रतीन्धकः। प्रतीन्धकस्य धर्मात्मा राजा कीर्तिरथः सुतः॥
target: Haryaśva's son was Maru; and Maru's son was Pratīndhaka. And Pratīndhaka's son was the righteous king Kirtiratha.

source: परिष्वज्य च बाहुभ्यां प्रीतात्मा भगवान् हरः। पुनः पार्थं सान्त्वपूर्वमुवाच वृषभध्वजः॥
target: The exalted Hara, whose sign was the bull, (Shiva), cheerfully embracing Arjuna with his arins, again consoled him and thus spoke to him.

source: चारेण तु सुयुक्तेन शत्रोः शक्तिमवेक्षता। गूढेन चरता तावदवेक्षितमिदं मया॥ राक्षसानां विशेषश्च पुरी चेयं निरीक्षिता। राक्षसाधिपतेरस्य प्रभावो रावणस्य च॥
target: Truly have I seen her today, engaged as I have been as a spy to estimate the strength of the enemy and am ranging secretly everywhere. I have seen minutely the city of the Rākşasas, and the strength of Rāvana the lord of Rākşasas.

source: न मे वचः पथ्यमिदं त्वया कृतं न चास्मि शक्ता हि निवारणे तव। हता सपुत्रास्मि हतेन संयुगे सह त्वया श्रीजिहाति मामपि॥
target: You didst not act by my wholesome words, nor could I prevent you. And I am now destroyed with my son, along with you in the battle. Truly has Sree (goddess of wealth) renounced me.

source: क्षिप्रं संनद्धकवचौ सखड्गावात्तकार्मुकौ। मामास्थाय प्रतीक्षेतां रथवौ परंतपौ॥ इत्युक्त्वा रथमास्थाय प्रायदभिमुखः परान्। तपन्वगात् कृपो राजन् कृतवर्मा च सात्वतः॥
target: Put on your coats of mail soon and take your bows and swords, and wait for me here, O foremost of car-warriors.'—Having said so, Ashvatthaman got upon his car started towards the enemy. The Kripa, O king, and Kritavarman of the Satwata race, both followed him.

source: भोजनाच्छादने चैषां नित्यं मे श्वशुराः स्थितः। रामप्रभृतयः सर्वे भजन्त्यन्धकवृष्णयः॥
target: My mother-in-law is ever attentive in feeding and clothing them. All the Anddhakas and Vrishnis with Rama and others love them very much.

source: तौ प्रविश्य महात्मानौ तद् गृहं परमार्चितम्। धर्मराजं ददृशतुर्देवराजमिवाश्विनौ॥
target: The two great ones, entering that welladorned chamber, saw king Yudhishthira the just like the two Ashvins seeing the chief of the celestials.

source: एष विग्रहवान् धर्म एष वीर्यवतां वरः। एष बुद्ध्याधिको लोके तपसां च परायणम्॥
target: He is in fact the embodiment of Virtue and the foremost of the powerful. He is of superior intelligence in this world and intent on the performance of ascetic rites.

source: त्वया तु नृपशार्दूल रोषमेवानुवर्तता। लघुनेव मनुष्येण स्त्रीत्वमेव पुरस्कृतम्॥
target: O foremost of kings, being subject to ire-you did not perceive anything but womanhood in me, like an ordinary man.

source: गुरुमभ्यर्च्य वर्धन्ते आयुषा यशसा श्रिया॥ वृद्धान् नाभिभवेज्जातु न चैतान् प्रेषयेदिति।
target: By adoring his preceptor, one increases the period of his life as also his fame and prosperity. One should never censure the old, •nor send them on any business.

source: एवमुक्त्वा तु तं राम दशग्रीवं पितामहः॥ विभीषणमथोवाच वाक्यं लोकपितामहः।
target: Having said this to the Ten-necked one, the. great sire of all creatures addressed Vibhīşana, saying.

source: कीचकानां वधः पर्व पर्वं गोग्रहणं ततः। अभिमन्योश्च वैराट्याः पर्व वैवाहिकं स्मृतम्॥
target: Then the Kichaka-vadha, then Gograhana, then the marriage of Abhimanyu with the daughter of the king of Virata.

source: ननु नाम महाबाहो तव वैश्रवणानुज। क्रुद्धस्य प्रमुखे स्थातुं त्रस्यत्यपि पुरंदरः॥
target: O you of huge arms! O younger brother of Baishravana! Even Purandara feared to stand before you when enraged.

source: किरन् बाणगणान् राजशतशोऽर्जुनमूर्धनि। अतितीवं महद् युद्धं नरराक्षसयोस्तदा॥
target: By incessant discharges of arrows, O king, on the head of Arjuna. The battle that commenced between the man (i.e. Arjuna) and the Rakshasa was exceedingly hot and furious.

source: च्यवन उवाच नाहं शतसहस्रेण निमेयः पार्थिवर्षभ। दीयतां सदृशं मूल्यममात्यैः सह चिन्तय॥
target: Chyavana said I should not be bought with a hundred thousand coins, O best of kings! Let a proper price be given to these! Do you consult with your ministers.

source: पञ्चालानां महेष्वासाः सर्वे युद्धिविशारदाः। द्रोणेन सह संगम्य गता वैवस्वतक्षयम्॥
target: All the mighty bowmen among the Pandavas, who were expert in battle, departed to the region of Death, after having fought with Drona.

source: स भवान् सर्वधर्मज्ञो धर्मात्मा भरतर्षभ। राजा मनीषी निपुणो लोके दृष्टपरावरः॥ त्यक्त्वा संतापजं शोकं दंशितो भव कर्मणि। क्षत्रियस्य विशेषेण हृदयं वज्रसंनिभम्॥
target: You know full well all duties, and you are of righteous soul, O foremost of Bharata's race. You are a wise king, of skilful deeds, You can discriminate what is right in this world from what is wrong. Shaking off this cheerlessness begotten by repentance engage in action vigorously. The heart of a Kshatriya is hard as adamant.

source: यत्र ज्ञानवतां प्राप्तिरलिङ्गग्रहणा स्मृता। तस्मादलिधर्मज्ञो धर्मतत्त्वमुपाचरेत्॥
target: The attainment to it by those who are endued with knowledge is said to be without comprehension of symbol. Hence the man who knows the properties of that which is shorn of symbols, should practise the truths of piety.

source: गौरं श्यामं च कृष्णं च वर्णं विकुरुते पुनः॥ विरूपो रूपवांश्चैव युवा वृद्धस्तथैव च।
target: Sometimes he becomes fair, sometimes darkish, sometimes dark of complexion. Sometimes he becomes ugly and sometimes beautiful. Sometimes he appears as young and sometimes as old.

source: तमिन्द्रः प्राह सुप्रीतो न तवास्तीह तक्षक। भयं नागेन्द्र तस्माद्वै सर्पसत्रात्कदाचन॥
target: Indra, being much pleased, told him, “0 i Takshaka, o king of the snakes, you have nothing to fear here from the snake-sacrifice.

source: स तु दृष्टैव तं राजा क्रुद्ध उत्थाय भारत। आविष्टो रक्षसोग्रेण इयेषात्तुं तदा मुनिम्॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, on seeing him the king at once rose in anger and as he was possessed with the Rakshasas, he desired to devour the Rishi.

source: स जानन्नपि चाकार्यमर्थार्यं सेवते नरः। बालस्नेहपरीतात्मा तत्क्षयाच्चानुतप्यते॥
target: Filled with affection for children, such a person then commits, for the sake of acquiring riches, evil deeds, and yields to grief if his wealth belost.

source: स्त्रीलिङ्गं धारयिष्यामि तदेवं पार्थिवात्मजे। सत्यं मे प्रतिजानीहि करिष्यामि प्रियं तव॥
target: I will take on myself this your maidenhood, O daughter of a king. Pledge yourself to me (as to the condition) and I will do what is dear to you.

source: गतिमन्तश्च तेनेष्टा नान्ये नित्या भवन्त्युत। नित्येऽस्मिन् पञ्चके वर्गे नित्ये चात्मनि पूरुषः॥
target: Therefore, the eternal ones (viz., Jivas), by adoring the deities in sacrifices, succeed in attaining to excellent ends. When the five primal elements are eternal, when he soul also is eternal, he called Purusha is equally so.

source: भयात्पापात्तथा बाधाद् दारियाद् व्याधिधर्षणात्। यत्कृते प्रतिमुच्यन्ते ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥
target: Those men who save people from fear and sin and who remove the obstacles lying in the way of what they wish to accomplish and poverty and the sufferings of disease, succeed in ascending to heaven.

source: अमूढत्वमसंगित्वं कामक्रोधविवर्जनम्। अदैन्यमनुदीर्णत्वमनुद्वेगो व्यवस्थितिः॥ एष मार्गो हि मोक्षस्य प्रसन्नो विमलः शुचिः। तथा वाक्कायमनसां नियमः कामतोऽन्यथा॥
target: The avoidance of ignorance, the absence of attachment, freedom from desire and anger, the power that is acquired by Yoga, the absence of pride and haughtiness, freedom from anxiety, absence of attachment to anything like home and family,—these forin the path of Liberation. That path is delightful, stainless, and pure. Likewise, the control of speech, of body, and of mind, when practised from the absence of desire, forms also the path of Liberation.

source: चिच्छेद तांस्तु खड्ड्रेन शिक्षया च बलेन च। दर्शयँल्लाघवं युद्धे तार्क्ष्यतुल्यपराक्रमः॥
target: That warrior (Sutasoma), who resembled Garuda in strength, after having exhibited the lightness of his arms in the battle, severed those arrows by his sword with the assistance of both his learning and strength.

source: न च पश्यामि सदृशं पृथिव्यां तव किंचन। सदृशं यत्प्रियाख्याने तव दत्त्वा भवेत्सुखम्॥
target: I do see any such thing on this earth which can match your pleasant tidings and bestowing which upon you I may be happy.

source: नारद उवाच न त्वामविषये भद्रे नियोक्ष्यामि कथंचन। स्त्रीणां स्वभावमिच्छामि त्वत्तः श्रोतुं वरानने॥
target: Narada said O amiable one, I shall not certainly ask you for any task that is beyond your power. O you of beautiful face, I wish to hear from you of the disposition of women.

source: कच्चित् स्वनुष्ठिता तात वार्ता ते साधुभिर्जनैः। वार्तायां संश्रितस्तात लोकोऽयं सुखमेधते॥
target: O child, do the four kings of Bharata (agriculture, trade, cattle rearing and lending in interest) are carried on (in your kingdom) by honest men? O child, upon these depend the happiness of your subjects.

source: सुशीघ्रमपि धावन्तं विधानमनुधावति। शेते सह शयानेन येन येन यथा कृतम्॥
target: The acts that one does, follow him even when he runs fast. Whatever act one does, lie down with the doer when the doer lays himself down.

source: शिखण्डिनं समासाद्य भरतानां पितामहः। अवर्जयत संग्रामं स्त्रीत्वं तस्यानुसंस्मरन्।॥
target: But the grandsire of the Bharatas, meeting with Shikhandin in the battle avoided him, remembering the femininity of his sex.

source: सीतामदृष्ट्वा ह्यनवाप्य पौरुषं विहृत्य कालं सह वानरैश्चिरम्। न मेऽस्ति सुग्रीवसमीपगा गतिः सुतीक्ष्णदण्डो बलवांश्च वानरः ॥
target: Failing to see Sītā, and (thereby) annulling my prowess, and having long spent the appointed space in company with the monkeys, way have I none to present myself before Sugrīva, that monkey being puissant and given to meting out sharp chastisement.

source: दैत्या ऊचुः वयं पुराणि त्रीण्येव समास्थाय महीमिमाम्। विचरिष्याम लोकेऽस्मिस्त्वत्प्रसाद पुरुस्कृताः॥
target: Asuras said 'In this world having kept your grace always in the front we will, living in three different cities, wonder over this entire earth.

source: तत् सर्वमेवं प्रह्लाद उवाच न श्रेयः सततं तेजो न नित्यं श्रेयसी क्षमा। इति तात विजानीहि द्वयमेतदसंशयम्॥
target: Prahlada said: Do you learn, my son, these two truths without any doubt neither does prowess always lead to well-being nor does forgiveness.

source: धर्मं चरत माधर्ममिति तस्य वचः किल। पक्षिणः शुश्रुवुर्भीष्म सततं सत्यवादिनः॥
target: O Bhishma, “Practice virtue and forego sin", these were the words that the truthful (birds) heard him say.

source: मौात्पूर्वं कृतो रोषस्तद् भवान् क्षन्तुमर्हति । यथैव हि पिता तेऽभूत् पूर्वं हरिगणेश्वरः॥ तथा त्वमपि सुग्रीवो नान्यस्तु हरिसत्तम।
target: It behove you to forgive us for our wrath arising out of ignorance. Like to your sire before, yourself and Sugrīva are the lords of these monkey hosts, O you foremost of them and none else.

source: राक्षसैः सा परित्यक्ता पुरा विष्णुभयार्दितैः॥ शून्या रक्षोगणैः सर्वै रसातलतलं गतः। शून्या संप्रति लङ्का सा प्रभुस्तस्या न विद्यते॥ स त्वं तत्र निवासाय गच्छ पुत्र यथासुखम्। निर्दोषस्तत्र ते वासो न बाधस्तत्र कस्यचित् ॥
target: Formerly she was renounced by the Raksasas afflicted with the fear of Vişnu; and was empty of swarms of Rākşasa, who had gone to the nethermost regions. Now Lanka is vacant, and there is no one that lords it over her. Do you, my child, for abode, at your ease repair thither. Your stay there shall meet with no rub, and no manner of disturbance shall occur there.

source: सोऽहं नारायणस्रेण महता शत्रुतापनः। शत्रून् विध्वंसयिष्यामि कदर्थी कृत्य पाण्डवान्॥
target: An afflicter of foes as I am, with the aid of that Narayana weapon, I shall destroy the foes, completely crushing the Pandavas.

source: तु तदस्य कर्मातिमनुष्यकर्मणः समीक्ष्य हृष्टाः कुरवोऽभ्यपूजयन्। पराक्रमज्ञास्तु धनंजयस्य ये हुतोऽयमग्नाविति ते मेनिरे॥
target: All Kauravas filled with ecstasy to see this phenomenal valour of Vrishasena and they started appreciating him again and again. However, the people known of Arjuna's valour, understood it definitely that this Vrishasena will become morsel of fire.

source: उद्यम्य त भुजानन्ये निक्षिप्य च महीतले॥ पदा चोरः समाक्रम्य स्फुरतोऽपाहरच्छिरः।
target: Some other combatants, having stretched their arms, hurled down their antagonists upon the ground, placed their feet upon their breasts and with great pleasure severed their heads.

source: यो ब्राह्ममस्त्रं वेदांश्च वेद वेदविदां वरः। स त्वां दाशरथी रामो देवि कौशलमब्रवीत्॥
target: O worshipful dame, Rāma, the son of Dasaratha, the master of the Vedas, and the foremost of those conversant with Vedas has enquired of your welfare.

source: तस्य संकल्पमाज्ञाय भीमं प्रत्यशुभं हरिः। भीममाक्षिप्य पाणिभ्यां प्रददौ भीममायसम्॥
target: Understanding the wicked intentions towards Bhima, Krishna, dragging away the real Bhima, prusented an iron statue of the second son of Pandu to the old king.

source: अथाब्रवीदर्जुनं भीमसेनः स्ववीर्यमासाद्य कुरुप्रवीर। संशप्तकान् प्रतियोत्स्यामि संख्ये सर्वानहं याहि धनंजय त्वम्॥
target: Bhima replied then to Arjuna-"O foremost of Kurus, with the aid of my own power, I will encounter the Samsaptakas in battle, you better go yourself, O Dhananjaya.

source: प्रधानाः सर्वलोकस्य यास्वायत्तमिदं जगत्। ता गाव: प्रस्तुता वत्सैः शोणितं प्रक्षरन्त्युत॥
target: Those animals that are the best of all creatures in the world and upon whom depends the preservation of the whole universe, namely kine, when milked after the calves have sucked them give only blood.

source: सदानृणमिमं रामं वयमिच्छामहे पितुः। अनृणत्वाच्च कैकेय्याः स्वर्गं दशरथो गतः॥
target: We wish that Rāma may always act truthfully in respect of his father. By virtue of this truth connected with Kaikeyi, Dasaratha has gone to heaven.

source: भूमिः सस्यवती चैव फलवन्तश्च पादपः।७२।। गन्धवन्ति च पुष्पाणि बभूवू राघवोत्सवे।
target: The earth was filled with crops, the trees with fruits and the flowers were fragrant on the occassion of Rāghava's installation.

source: अस्य चामीकराभस्य तप्तकाञ्चनसप्रभा। आस्याद् विनिः सृता जिह्वा भक्ष्यते कृष्ण पक्षिभिः॥५
target: There, the tongue of that king, beautiful like molten gold, looting out of his mouth, is, O। Krishna, being devoured by carnivorous birds.

source: भये न मुह्याम्यष्टकाहं कदाचित् संतापो मे मानसो नास्ति कश्चित्। धाता यथा मां विदधीत लोके ध्रुवं तथाहं भवितेति मत्वा॥
target: O Ashtaka, I never feel terrified with fear, nor do I ever feel grief, for I know that I shall be on earth exactly what the great Ordainer has made me.

source: प्रयत्नज्ञो हि कौन्तेयो नखमांसान्तरेषुभिः। स वेदनाभिराविग्नः पलायनपरायणः॥
target: Then your warriors, beholding Duryodhana that foremost of bowmen, involved in great danger and afflicted with the arrows of Dhananjaya, rushed to his rescue.

source: नास्यामित्रैर्गतं गच्छेर्मा शत्रुभिररिंदम। भर्तुरर्थपरो दान्तः सुग्रीववशगो भव॥
target: O slayer of foes, do you never mix with Sugrīva's enemies, and place yourself always under Sugrīva's control, having subdued your senses and being intent upon your master's (Sugriva's) welfare.

source: यदा तु तद्वनं श्वेत अगस्त्यः स महानृषिः। आगमिष्यति दुर्धर्षस्तदा कृच्छ्राद्विमोक्ष्यते॥
target: O Sveta, you shall be relived from this affliction when the irrepressible, great Saint Agastya shall reach that forest.

source: कर्णार्जुनाभ्यां सम्प्राप्ते द्वैरथे राजसत्तम। कर्णस्य भवता कार्यं सारथ्यं नात्र संशयः॥
target: O you best among kings, when the two, Karna and Arjuna meet in two chariots (in battle) I have no doubt that the office of charioteer of Karna will be filled by you.

source: भीष्मद्रोणौ कृपश्चैव सौबलश्च जयद्रथः। द्रौणिर्वाऽपि महेष्वासो विकर्णो वा महाबलः॥
target: Bhishma, Drona, Kripa and the son of Subala, and Jayadratha, and the mighty bowman the son of Drona, and the mighty Vikarna, what did all these warriors do?

source: मयैव यानि कर्माणि पूर्वदेहे तु मूढया। कृतानि नूनं पापानि तेषामेतत् फलं ध्रुवम्॥
target: The deeds that had been done by me in a previous life out of folly are certainly misdeeds and this is surely the result of that.

source: न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्यं पुरुषोऽस्तुते। न च संन्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति॥
target: Man does not attain freedom from action by not performing action. By asceticism also, he does not attain to final emancipation.

source: स खन्यमानः सहितैः सागरैर्वरुणालयः। अगच्छत् परमामार्ति दीर्यमाण: समन्ततः॥
target: That abode of Varuna (ocean), being thus dug by the united sons of Sagara and also rent and cut on all sides, found itself in the greatest possible distress.

source: श्रुत्वैव च वचो मह्यं क्षिप्रमेष्यति राघवः। चमूं प्रकर्षन् महतीं हर्यक्षगणसंकुलाम्॥
target: No sooner shall Rāghava hear from me than he shall speedily repair hither followed by a huge army of monkeys and bears.

source: वसिष्ठेनाभ्यनुज्ञातस्तस्मिन्नेव धराधरे। सोऽकामयत राजर्षिविहर्तुं सह भार्यया॥
target: The royal sage (Samvarana) with the permission of Vasishtha desired to sport with his wife on that mountain.

source: वैदर्भदुहिता राम केशिनी नाम नामतः। ज्येष्ठा सगरपत्नी सा धर्मिष्ठा सत्यवादिनी॥
target: O Räma, Vidarbha's daughter, named Kesinī, was the elder wife of Sagara. And she was virtuous and truthful.

source: ततस्त्रिगर्तराट् क्रुद्धस्तानुवाच महारथान्। अलं द्रुतेन वः शूरा न भयं कर्तुमर्हथ॥
target: Thereupon, excited with rage, the sovereign of the Trigarttas addressing those mighty carwarriors said, 'Fly not, you heroes, it behoves you not to be seized with panic.

source: ततः सत्यां प्रतिज्ञां ता पार्थेन प्रतिरक्षता। मच्छन्दादवमानोऽयं कृतस्तव महीपते॥ गुरूणामवमानो हि वध इत्यभिधीयते।
target: O lord of the Earth! that is why Partha simply to keep up that solemn vow, under my instructions, addressed you with those insulting words. Because it is said, that insults to superiors are tantamount to death.

source: स शैलमासाद्य किरीटमाली महेन्द्रवाहादवरुह्य तस्मात्। नजातशत्रोस्तदनन्तरं च॥
target: Arriving at the mountain and descending from the car of Mahendra, that intelligent, one wearing a coronet and garlands, saluted the feet of Dhaumya first and then those of Ajatshatru Yudhishthira.

source: अन्यत्र ब्राह्मणात् तात सर्वपापेष्ववस्थितात्। गुरुर्हि सर्ववर्णानां ब्राह्मणः प्रसृताग्रभुक्॥
target: An exception should be made, O Sire, in the case of a Brahmana, though he be addicted to all sorts of vices; for a Brahmana is the preceptor of all the other classes and he is allowed precedence in everything.

source: द्विरनुव्याहृते राज्ञः स शापो बलवानभूत्। रक्षोवलसमाविष्टो विसंज्ञश्चाभवन्नृपः॥
target: The Gandharva said : The curse on the king, thus repeated for the second time, became very strong. And the king being possessed of the Rakshasas disposition, soon lost all his senses.

source: उषित्वेह निशामेकां सुखं स्वभवने प्रभो। पुनरश्वानुगमनं कर्तासि जयतां वर॥
target: O lord, having lived for one night in your own palace in happiness, you may then follow the horse, O foremost of victorious warriors!

source: देवदेवो ह्यनन्तात्मा विष्णुः सुरगुरुः प्रभुः। प्रधानपुरुषोऽव्यक्तो विश्वात्मा विश्वमूर्तिमान्॥
target: The great god Vishnu, the Infinite Spirit, the Lord preceptor of the celestials, is the unmanifest, Pradhana Purusha, the soul of the universe and has His manifestation in the universe.

source: स्वान्यनीकानि मृद्गन्त आर्तनादाः प्रदुद्रुवुः॥ हयाच पतितारोहाः पत्तयश्च नराधिप।
target: Began to fly away uttering shrieks of pain and crushing their own ranks under heath their feat. Riderless steeds and foot soldiers also, O monarch.

source: विव्याध चैनं दशभिः सम्यगस्तैः शरोत्तमैः॥ वर्म चाशु समासाद्य ते भित्त्वा क्षितिमाविशन्।
target: He then pierced the latter with ten excellent shafts all well-directed. But striking against Duryodhana's armour they were shattered into pierces and fell down on the earth.

source: विन्दं तु निहतं दृष्ट्वा ह्यनुविन्दः प्रतापवान्। हताश्वं रथमुत्सृज्य गदां गृह्य महाबलः॥
target: The highly puissant Anuvinda, beholding Vinda thus slain, left the car of which the steeds were slain; and that mighty hero, taking up a mace.

source: प्रहरस्व च मे वीर पश्यामस्तव पौरुषम्। कर्म कृत्वा रणे शूर ततः कस्थितुमर्हसि॥
target: 'O brave warrior, strike me; we will behold your manliness. O hero, first having achieved some deed in the battle, then it behoves you to speak.

source: स गत्वा हिमवत्पार्वे किंनरोरगसेवितम्। महादेवप्रसादार्थं तपस्तेपे महातपाः।.१२ ।।
target: And repairing to the side of the Himavat inhabited by Kinnaras and Serpents that one of mighty asceticism began to perform austerities with the view of propitiating Mahādeva.

source: जनमेजय उवाच भगवन् केन विधिना श्रोतव्यं भारतं बुधैः। फलं किं के च देवाश्च पूज्या वै पारणेष्विह॥
target: Janamejaya said O holy one, according to what rites should the learned listen to the Bharata? What are the fruits? What deities are to be adored during the several Parnas?

source: न मूलघातः कर्तव्यो नैष धर्मः सनातनः। अपि स्वल्पवधेनैव प्रायश्चित्तं विधीयते॥ उद्वेजनेन बन्धेन विरूपकरणेन च। वधदण्डेन ते क्लिश्या न पुरोहितसंसदि॥ यदा पुरोहितं वा ते पर्येयुः शरणैषिणः। करिष्यामः पुनर्ब्रह्मन् न पापमिति वादिनः॥ तदा विसर्गमर्हाः स्युरितीदं धातृशासनम्। बिभ्रद् दण्डाजिनं मुण्डो ब्राह्मणोऽर्हति शासनम्॥
target: The wicked, therefore, should not be uprooted. The extermination of the wicked is not quite of a piece with eternal practice. By punishing them gently, by depriving them of all their riches, by chains and imprisonment, by disfiguring them they may be made to expiate their offences. Their relatives should not be punished by the infliction of capital sentences on them. If in the presence of the priest and others, they give themselves up to him from desire of protection, and swear, saying,-0 Brahmana, we shall never again commit any sin,-they would then be discharged without any punishment. This is command of the Creator himself. Even the Brahmana who puts on a deer-skin and the wand and has his head shaved, should be punished.

source: घोषवन्ति च यानानि युक्तान्यथ सहस्रशः॥ भक्ष्यभोज्यमयाः शैला वासांस्याभरणानि च।
target: Thousands of vehicles with horses and other animals harnessed thereto and with wheels whose caltter is always loud, are all there. Mountains of food and all enjoyable articles and heaps of cloths and ornaments are also there.

source: सत्ये कुरु स्थिरं भावं मा राजन्ननृतं कृथाः। कस्मात्त्वमनृतं वाक्यं देहीति कुरुषेऽशुभम्॥
target: Be firm in truth. Do not fact falsely, O king. Why do you falsify the falsify the words-Give (me)!-which you have said?

source: यस्य यज्ञो बभूवेह बह्वन्नो बहुदक्षिणः। यत्रानपर्वता राजशतशोऽथ सहस्रशः॥ घृतकुल्याश्च दध्नश्च नद्यो बहुशतास्तथा। व्यञ्जनानां प्रवाहाश्च महार्हाणां सहस्रशः॥
target: O king, here it was that he performed many sacrifices, in which food and gifts were in abundance and in which cooked rice was in hundreds and thousands of mountains. Ghee and curds were in hundreds of lakes and rivers and richly cooked curries in thousands of streams.

source: विसर्जयित्वा स हरीन् सहस्रान् कृतकर्मणः। मेने कृतार्थमात्मानं राघवं च महाबलम्॥
target: Having dismissed the thousands of apes, who had performed their task, he deemed himself as well as the mighty Rāghava as having secured success.

source: चिरमाशंसितो मात्रा चिरं गर्भेण धारितः। सफलं चिरकारित्वं कुरु त्वं चिरकारिक॥
target: Your mother had expected you coming for a long time. For a long time did she carry you in her womb. O Chirakarika, let your habit of reflecting long before acting yield beneficial results to-day!

source: तत्र देवो गिरितटे दिव्यधातुविभूषिते॥ पर्यङ्क इव विभ्राजन्नुपविष्टो महामनाः।
target: The great Mahadeva sat, beautifully on one of the peaks that was adorned with excellent minerals, as if it served the purposes of a fine bedstead.

source: ताभिः सहोत्थितं शीघ्रं विमानं प्रेक्ष्य राघवः॥ ऋष्यमूकसमीपे तु वैदेहीं पुनरब्रवीत्।
target: Beholding the car going up with them all, Rāghava again spoke to Sītā, near the mount Rishyamuka, saying.

source: आदिश्यतामभ्यधिको ममांशः पृथिवीपते। तमहं समरे जित्वा गमिष्यामि यथागतम्॥
target: O ruler of earth, let a much greater share be permitted to me in the battle. Having slaughtered him in the field, who has come to contend with me, I will repair to the place where from I came.

source: गन्धर्व उवाच ददानीत्येव तं तत्र राजानं प्रत्युवाच ह। वसिष्ठः परमेष्वासं सत्यसंधो द्विजोत्तमः॥
target: The Gandharva said : The best of the twice born, ever devoted to truth Vasishtha, replied to that great bowman, the king saying, “I will give."

source: न त्वं परस्यानुचरस्तात जीवितुमर्हसि। अहं हि क्षत्रहदयं वेद यत् परिशाश्वतम्॥
target: O my dear son, it is not proper that you should live on being the subject of another. I know what the eternal essence of the heart of a Kshatriya is?

source: सञ्जय उवाच दुर्योधनो वाचमिमां शृणोतु यदब्रवीदर्जुनो योत्स्यमानः। युधिष्ठिरस्यानुमते महात्मा धनंजयः शृण्वतः केशवस्य॥
target: Sanjaya said Let Duryodhana listen to this speech which was made by Arjuna, who was eager to fight, with the permission of Yudhishthira and in the hearing of Keshava.

source: स चन्ममार संजय चतुर्भद्रतरस्त्वया। पुत्रात् पुण्यतरश्चैव मा पुत्रमनुतप्यथाः॥
target: When even that king, O Srinjaya who was superior to you in religious merit, knowledge, renunciation, and wealth, and who was purer than your son, met with death, do not grieve for your son.

source: ततः प्रहृष्टा प्रतिपूर्णमानसा यशस्विनी भर्तुरवेक्ष्य भाषितम्। धनानि रत्नानि च दातुमङ्गना प्रचक्रमे धर्मभृतां मनस्विनी।।४७
target: Convinced that her going to the forest was desired by her husband, Sītā began to distribute them speedily with a delighted heart.

source: परिग्रहं परित्यज्य भव तात जितेन्द्रियः। अशोकं स्थानमातिष्ठ इह चामुत्र चाभयम्॥
target: Renouncing all attachments, O child, do you master all your senses, and thereby acquire happiness both in this world and in the next.

source: स च्छिन्नधन्वा तेजस्वी रथशक्त्या सुतं तव। बिभेदोरसि विक्रम्य स रथोपस्थ आविशत्॥
target: Gifted with great energy Bhima, who had been deprived of his bow, then displaying his prowess, struck on the chest of your son with a dart. Thereat your son sat down on the terrace of his car.

source: किं त्वद्य यदि ते श्रद्धा गमनं प्रति भार्गव। अनुज्ञा प्रतिगृह्य त्वं स्वगृहान् गच्छ मा चिरम्॥
target: If, however, O you of Bhrigu's race, you desire to leave this place, do you go without delay, with my permission.

source: जनमेजय उवाच कथं समभवद् द्रोणः कथं चास्त्राण्यवाप्तवान्। कथं चागात् कुरून् ब्रह्मन् कस्य पुत्रः स वीर्यवान्।
target: Janamejaya said : O Brahmana, how was Drona born? How and whence did he acquire his arms? How and why he came to the Kurus? Whose son was that powerful man?

source: तं वसिष्ठादयः सर्वे मुनयस्तत्र मेनिरे। तेजसा दीप्यमानं वै द्वितीयमिव भास्करम्॥
target: Then Vasishtha and the other Rishis regarded that Rishi, blazing with his own energy, as if he were a second sun.

source: यमस्य पुरुषैः क्लेशं यमस्य पुरुषैर्वधम्। दुःखं संसारचक्रं च नरः क्लेशं स विन्दति॥
target: After birth individual soul receives woe and death from the messengers of Yama. Indeed, he goes through misery and a painful round of rebirth.

source: मत्करोत्सृष्टवज्रेण हनुरस्य यथा हतः। नाम्ना वै कपिशार्दूलो भवित्त हनुमानिति॥
target: Since his chin got wounded by the thunderbolt released by me, so this tiger among Mongoloids will be known as Hanuniãn.

source: बलिषड्भागमुद्धत्य नृपस्यारक्षितुः प्रजाः। अधर्मो योऽस्य सोऽस्यास्तु यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः॥
target: May the person that had approved the exile of the noble one to the woods, reap the sin of his that having taken a sixth pare of their incomes, does not protect his subjects!

source: भ्राता चासि सखा चासि बीभत्सोर्मम च प्रियः। सौहृदेनाविशयोऽसि स्वस्ति प्राप्नुहि भूतये॥
target: You are my brother and you are my friend dear to me as Vibhatsa. Relying on your friendship we are not at all anxious. May all that is good attend you, who are going for our interests.

source: रात्रेः शेषे व्यतिक्रान्ते प्रयास्यामो रणाजिरम्। अधिवासितशस्त्राश्च कृतकौतुकमङ्गलाः॥
target: We shall at the end of this night march to the field of battle after having worshipped our weapons and duly performed all the auspicious ceremonies.

source: या तु त्यागेन शान्तिः स्यात् तदृते वध एव सः। संशयाच्च समुच्छेदाद् द्विषतामात्मनस्तथा॥
target: The peace that we can obtain by foregoing our claim to the kingdom is in effect the same thing as the total extinction of ourselves and the enemy or the uncertainly of victory.

source: तद् भीरुसंत्रासकर युद्धं समभवत्तदा। अन्योन्यस्पर्धिनोरुग्रं शक्रशम्बरयोरिव॥
target: Then began that fight which struck terror into the hearts of cowards and like Sakra and Samvara the warriors rushed fiercely against each other.

source: स यात्वा वाहिनीं तूर्णमब्रवीत् त्वरयन् युधि। युद्ध्यध्वमिति संहृष्टाः पुनः पुनररिंदमाः॥
target: Spcedily approaching his own soldiers and urging them to fight, he again and again said-"You chastisers of enemies, fight merrily.”

source: तस्य द्रोणः शरान् पञ्च चप्रेषयामास भारत। ते घोराः कवचं भित्त्वा पपुः शोणितमाहवे॥
target: At him then Drona sped, O Bharata, five shafts and those dreadful shaft penetrating through his armour drank his life-blood.

source: अथ भीष्मो महास्त्राणि दिव्यानि सुबहूनि च। प्रादुश्चक्रे महारौद्रे रणे तस्मिन् महाबलः॥
target: Then in that great battle, the mighty Bhimasena caused many powerful celestial weapons to app-ear.

source: शरीरगृहसंज्ञस्य शौचतीर्थस्य देहिनः। बुद्धिमार्गप्रयातस्य सुखं त्विह परत्र च॥
target: That embodied creature who considers his body as only a house and purity as its sacred water, and who walks along the road of the understanding, acquires happiness both in this world and the next.

source: पार्श्वतः पृष्ठतश्चास्य सर्वे वानरयूथपाः। अनुजग्मुर्महाशैलान्विविधांश्च वनस्पतीन् ॥
target: And followed him on all sides the leaders of the monkeys with huge crags and various trees.

source: मम राज्यं प्रणष्टं यन्नाहं तत् कृतवान् स्वयम्। कलिना तत् कृतं भीरु यच्च त्वामहमत्यजम्॥
target: "O timid one, the loss of my kingdom was not wrought by me. It was done by Kali, on whose account I had abandoned you in the woods.

source: सौतिरुवाच इत्युक्त्वा धृतराष्ट्रोऽथ विलप्य बहुदुःखितः। मूर्च्छितः पुनराश्वस्त: संजयं वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥
target: Sauti said: Bewailing his fate thus, Dhritarashtra was overcome with the greatest sorrow and lost his senses for a time. But being revived, he addressed Sanjaya in these words.

source: मूलपत्रफलैः सर्वा वर्तयिष्यथ नित्यदा। स्त्रियः किंपुरुषानाम भर्तृन्समुपलप्स्यथ ॥
target: I shall give you always fruits and roots. O you females, you shall have all Kimpuruşas as your husbands.

source: अभिधावतु मां कश्चित् पुरुषस्त्रातु चैव ह। पतिं च मे प्रदिशतु स्वयं वा पतिरस्तु मे॥
target: "May some one soon come to me. Let him point out to me a protector or become my protector himself.”

source: उभे दृष्ट्वा दुःखसुखे राज्यं प्राप्य यदृच्छया। राज्येनामात्यसंस्थेन कथं राजन् प्रमाद्यसि॥
target: You have obtained a kingdom without any hitch. Think of everything connected with its happiness and misery. You have ministers in your kingdom. But why, O king, should you be guilty of carelessness?

source: व्यवसायो व्यवस्थानः संस्थानः स्थानदो ध्रुवः। परधिः परमस्पष्टस्तुष्टः पुष्टः शुभेक्षणः॥
target: He who is understanding divested of all qualities. He on whom all things rest. He in whom all things live when the universal dissolution comes. He who assigns the foremost place to those who worship Himn. He who is durable. He who is gifted with the highest power. He who has been glorified in the Vedanta. He who is contented. He who is always full. He whose glance is auspicious. (384-393)

source: अथवा मूलघातेन द्विषतां मधुसूदन। फलनिवृत्तिरिद्धा स्यात् तन्नृशंसतरं भवेत्॥
target: By putting an end to the enemy to the roots, O slayer of Madhu, we can attain to our object; but it is most cruel.

source: इमे ते लोकधर्मार्थं त्रयः सृष्टाः स्वयम्भुवा। पृथिव्यां सर्जने नित्यं सृष्टांस्तानपि मे शृणु॥
target: For the sake of the virtue, three religions were created by the self-create. Whenever the world is created, those Religions are created by the Grand-father. Do you listen.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच ततस्ते प्रययुः सर्वे पाण्डवाधर्मचारिणः। ब्राह्मणैर्बहुभिः सार्धं पुण्यं द्वैतवनं सरः॥
target: Vaishampayana said : Thereupon the pious sons of Pandu, followed by numberless Brahmanas all repaired to the holy lake Dvyaitavana.

source: रेद् धर्मानकटुको मुञ्चेत् स्नेहं न चास्तिकः। अनृशंसश्चरेदर्थं चरेत् काममनुद्धतः॥
target: The king should follow his duties without any malice. He should not cast off mercy. He should have faith. He should earn wealth without persecution and cruelty. He should seek pleasure without attachment.

source: इति पार्थं प्रशस्याथ प्रगृह्यान्यन्महद् धनुः। मुमोच समरे वीरः शरान् पार्थरथं प्रति॥
target: Having thus praised Partha, and having taken up a large bow, that great hero hurled his arrows at Partha's car.

source: अनाधृष्यः परैयुद्धे शत्रुभिर्मघवानिव। युगान्ताग्निरिवार्चिष्मान् हिमवानिव निश्चलः॥
target: Incapable of being restrained by foes in battle like Indra himself who is invincible by enemies, Karna was like the all-destroying fire of dreadful flames at the end of a cycle, and immovable like Himavat himself.

source: भूतानां स्थावराणां च जङ्गमानां च दर्शनम्। यथास्ति न तथा धर्मस्तेन नास्तीति मे मतिः॥
target: Beings and the mobile as well as the immobile cannot have that direct perception of virtue which they have of happiness. Therefore, I ween, virtue is a non-entity.

source: महोदरं तं विनिपात्य भूमौ महागिरेः कीर्ममिवैकदेशम्। सूर्यात्मजस्तत्र रराज लक्ष्म्या सूर्यः स्वतेजोभिरिवाप्रधृष्यः॥
