target: Thus protected by Drona Abhimanyu is prizing his valour highly. Indeed he is a fool proud of himself. Crush him without delay."

source: साचं शतसहस्रं तु नागानां तव भारत। नागे नागे रथशतं शतमश्वा रथे रथे॥ अश्वेऽश्वे दश धानुष्का धानुष्के शतचर्मिणः। एवं व्यूढान्यनीकानि भीष्मेण तव भारत॥
target: O descendant of Bharata in your ariny, there were one hundred thousand elephants of the greatest fighting powers. To each elephant was assigned one hundred car-warriors, to each car was assigned one hundred horse men, to each horsemen, ten bowmen, to each bow-men, ten soldiers armed with shield. Thus, O descendant of Bharata, were your troops placed by Bhishma in battle array.

source: महाभूतानि सृष्ट्वैव तान् गुणान् निर्ममे पुनः। भूतेभ्यश्चैव निष्पन्ना मूर्तिमन्तश्च ताशृणु॥
target: Having created the Great Creatures he then created their qualities. Combining the Great Creatures, he then created various embodied Beings. Hear me as I describe them to you.

source: उपकारेण वीरस्तु प्रतिकारेण युज्यते। अकृतज्ञोऽप्रतिकृतो हन्ति सत्त्ववतां मनः॥ तदेव युक्तं प्रणिधाय लक्ष्मणः कृताञ्जलिस्तत् प्रतिपूज्य भाषितम्। उवाच रामं स्वभिरामदर्शनं प्रदर्शयन् दर्शनमात्मनः शुभम्॥
target: Heroes receiving favours always return them; the ungrateful lose the friendship of the welcoming them therefore, Laksmana, with folded hands, spoke to Rāma of graceful appearance, displaying his own intelligence,

source: तथेतरान् महेष्वासान् दशभिर्दशभिः शरैः। प्रत्यविध्यदसम्भ्रान्तस्तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्॥
target: Then Abhimanyu fearlessly pierced the rest of the mighty car-warriors in return, with ten shafts each; that feat of his seemed exceedingly wonderful.

source: तत्सखित्वं मया सौम्य रोचयस्व धनेश्वर। तपसा निर्जीतश्चैव सखा भव ममानघ ॥
target: Therefore, O mild one, O lord of riches, do you contract friendship with me. And you have conquered me by your penances. Therefore, O be you my friend.

source: शल्यस्य धृष्टकेतोश्च जयत्सेनस्य वा विभो। केकयानां च सर्वेषां दूता गच्छन्तु शीघ्रगाः॥
target: Let swift going messengers go to Shalya. Dhrishtakctu, Jayatsena and the ruler of the Kaikeyas.

source: यजुषा संस्कृतं मांसं निवृत्ता मांसभक्षणात्। न भक्षयेद् वृथामांसं पृष्ठमांस च वर्जयेत्॥
target: One who has abstained from meat, should not take meat even if it be sanctified with Mantras from the Yajurveda. One should also avoid the flesh of the vertebral column and the flesh of animals not killed in sacrifices.

source: एभिरेव घटैः सर्वैरभिषेचनसम्भृतैः। मम लक्ष्मण तापस्ये व्रतस्नानं भविष्यति ॥
target: The bathing ceremony, necessary before taking the vows of asceticism, shall be performed, Oh Laksmana, with all these jars full of water brought for my installation.

source: एष श्रियः समुदिताः सर्वराज्ञां ग्रहीष्यति। वर्षास्विवोदीर्णजला नदीनदनदीपतिः॥
target: He will seize the growing prosperity of all the kings, as the ocean receives the rivers swollen with the waters of the rainy season.

source: तवैव कर्म विहितं भूतं सर्वं चराचरम्। त्वयाऽऽपो विहिताः पूर्वं त्वयि सर्वमिदं जगत्॥
target: Water primarily depends upon you. Whole universe also depends upon you. All offerings of sacrificial ghee and all libations of food offered to the Pitris have also been established in you.

source: ततो वृषो बाणनिपातकोपितो महोरगो दण्डविघट्टितो यथा। तदाशुकारी व्यसृजच्छरोत्तमान् महाविष: सर्प इवोत्तमंन विषम्॥ नवैर्नवत्या च शैरस्तथार्जुनम्। शरेण घोरेण पुनश्च पाण्डवं विदार्य को व्यनदजहास च॥
target: Then Vrisha, angered at the stroke of arrow like a scotched snake, discharged most powerful and quick-coursing shafts like a serpent vomiting poison. He struck Janardana with twelve and Arjuna with ninty nine arrows. And striking the latter again with a dreadful arrow Karna laughed.

source: र्ये ते राजन् पूर्वमिन्द्रा बभूवुः। लक्ष्मीश्चैषां पूर्वमेवोपदिष्टा भार्या यैषा द्रौपदी दिव्यरूपा॥
target: O king, thus were born as the sons of Pandu those that were at one time Indras and the celestial Lakshmi herself who had appointed to be their wife is the exceedingly beautiful Draupadi.

source: सीतायाश्च विनाशोऽयं मम चामित्रसूदन । विस्तरेण जनन्या मे विनिवेद्यस्त्वया भवेत्॥
target: O destroyer of foes, do you relate at length to my mnother the story of Sītā's destruction.

source: कथं हि सर्वयज्ञेषु निश्चयः परमोऽभवत्। एतदर्हसि मे वक्तुं निखिलेन द्विजर्षभा॥
target: In what way, however, was the attainment held certain of the highest end in all sacrifices? O foremost of twice-born persons, you should fully expound all this to me.

source: ततः सवेदनः सद्यो जीवः प्रच्यवते क्षरात्। शरीरं त्यजते जन्तुश्छिद्यमानेषु मर्मसु॥ वेदनाभिः परीतात्मा तद् विद्धि द्विजसत्तम। जातीमरणसंविग्नाः सततं सर्वजन्तवः॥
target: On account of this, the Individual Soul, feeling great pain, quickly takes leave of the body. Know, O foremost of twice-born ones, that when the vital parts of the body become thus afflicted, Individual Soul passes away from he body, suffering from great pain. All living creatures repeatedly suffer from birth and death.

source: अद्य निर्वानरामुर्वी हत्वा रामं च लक्ष्मणम्। करिष्ये परमां प्रीतिमित्युक्त्वान्तरधीयत॥
target: Destroying Rāma and Lakşmaņa, and clearing the monkeys off the earth, shall I satisfy my sire greatly. Saying this, he disappeared from their view.

source: प्रकृतेर्गुणसम्मूढाः सज्जन्ते गुणकर्मसु। तानकृतस्नविदो मन्दान् कृत्स्नविन्न विचालयेत्॥
target: The man of perfect knowledge should not shake the belief of the men of imperfect knowledge, who being deluded by the qualities of Nature, from attachments to the actions done by the qualities (laws) of Nature.

source: स्वागतं ते नरश्रेष्ठ दिष्ट्या प्राप्तोऽसि राघव। विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य महर्षिमपराजितम्॥
target: Art you well come, O chief of men? It is by our luck that, O descendant of Raghu, you have come to us, headed by the respected Maharși Visvamitra.

source: एषोऽञ्जालमया बद्धः प्रणयात् त्वां प्रसादये। पौरुषं श्रय शोकस्य नान्तरं दातुमर्हसि ॥
target: I soothe you from the love I bear towards you. Do you have recourse to manliness. It does not behove you to let grief overcome you.

source: नैतादृशं भारत युद्धमासीद् यथा तु कर्णार्जुनयोर्बभूव। ग्रस्तौहि कर्णेन समेत्य कृष्णावन्ये च सर्वे तव शत्रवो ये॥
target: Never before, O descendant of Bharata, such a battle had been fought as that between Karna and Arjuna. Kama assailed the two Krishnas and your other enemies.

source: अभिमन्युस्ततः पश्चाद् विराटश्च महारथः। द्रौपदेयाश्च संहृष्टा राक्षसश्च घटोत्कचः॥
target: Abhimanyu and the mighty car-warrior Virata, the sons of Draupadi, and the Rakshasa Ghatotkacha were commanded to bring up the rear.

source: अशुभं वा शुभं वापि हितं वा यदि वाहितम्। प्रवर्ततां सुहृद्यूतं दिष्टमेतन्न संशयः॥
target: Auspicious or not auspicious, beneficial or not beneficial, let this friendly gambling match be held. This is certainly what Fate has ordained (for us).

source: आवार्य गगनं मेघो यथा प्रावृषि दृश्यते। तथा मायां विकुर्वाणौ राक्षसावभ्यधावताम्॥ मारीचश्च सुबाहुश्च तयोरनुचरास्तथा। आगम्य भीमसंकाशा रुधिरौघानवासृजन्॥
target: And as in the rains, masses of clouds appear enveloping the firmament, the Rākşasas, displaying illusions in that wise, began to rush onward. And Mārīca and Subāhu together with their followers coming in dreadful forms, began to shower down blood upon the altar.

source: प्रादुरासंस्ततो बाणा दीप्ताग्राः खे सहस्रशः। पाण्डवान् क्षपयिष्यन्तो दीप्तास्याः पन्नगा इव॥
target: Then thousands of arrows with blazing tips appeared in the welkin looking like snakes of fiery mouth, that continued to agitate the Pandavas.

source: इत्यनुस्मृत्य कृष्णं सा हरिं त्रिभुवनेश्वरम्। प्रारुदद् दुःखिता राजन् मुखमाच्छाद्य भामिनी॥
target: Vaishampayana said O king, thus being afflicted, the lady, covering her face, cried aloud thinking of Krishna (Hari), the lord of the three worlds.

source: ते गत्वा सर्वमाचख्युर्धातुस्तस्य चिकीर्षितम्। अनुज्ञाता ययुहृष्टा युद्धाय धनदेन ते॥
target: Going to him they in full related all about the doings of his brother. And on being permitted by the bestower of treasures, they went out for battle.

source: न तु तस्मै प्रदेयं स्यात् तथा कार्यगतिः प्रभो। विग्रहः समुपारब्धो न हि शाम्यत्यविग्रहात्॥
target: But circumstances are such, my lord, that nothing should be given him. War having been decided on will not turn into peace by delaying the former.

source: त्रासोद्विग्नं तथोद्भान्तं त्वदीयं तद् बलं नृप। युगान्तवातसंक्षुब्धं चलद्वीचितरङ्गितम्॥ प्रलीनमीनमकरं सागराम्भ इवाभवत्। सरणे व्यचरत् पार्थः प्रेक्षमाणो धनंजयः॥
target: Your troops, O monarch, agitated with fear and greatly confounded, became like the waters of the sea, with the fishes and Makaras within them, ruffled into huge waves and lashed to fury by the storm that blows at the end of a Yoga. Then the handsome son of Pritha, by name Dhananjaya began to career on the field of battle.

source: ते तं प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा पृष्ट्वा चापि निरामयम्। खनन्तः समुपाक्रान्ता दिशं सोमवतीं तदा॥
target: And having gone round him and asked him as to his welfare, they delving on, arrived at the Northern region.

source: कुले जातस्य वृद्धस्य परवित्तेषु गृद्ध्यतः। लोभ प्रज्ञानमाहन्ति प्रज्ञा हन्ति श्रियम्॥
target: The avarice of man born in a noble family yet desiring to possess himself the wealth of others nullifies his wisdom; and the wisdom being destroyed, the sense of shame dose nowhere exist.

source: यत्र त्रयं त्रयो लोकाः पवित्रं तत्समं भुवि। नान्यदस्ति शुभापाङ्गे तेनेदमभिराध्यते॥
target: In the worship of the parents are fulfilled the triple object of religious pursuit, and the adoration of the three regions, there is nothing equal to it, conducing to purity; so do I, O you of excellent-look , resort to it.

source: शैवालं शीर्णपर्णं वा तद्वती यो निषेवते। शीतयोगवहो नित्यं स गच्छेत् परमां गतिम्॥
target: That man who lives upon the moss he gathers and the fallen leaves of trees that he picks up, and puts up with all the severities of cold, acquires a very high place.

source: स त वैकर्तनः कर्णः सामात्यः सह बन्धुभिः। न्यासितः समरे शस्त्रं भीष्मेण भरतर्षभ॥
target: O best of the Bharata race, the son of Vikartana Karna, with his friends and relatives, however, laid aside his weapons of Bhishma.

source: चम्पकाशोकबकुलशालतालसमाकुला। तमालापनसच्छन्ना नागमालासमावृता॥ हिन्तालैरर्जुनैींपैः सप्तवर्णैः सुपुष्पितैः। तिलकैः कर्णिकारैश्च पाटलैश्च समन्ततः॥ शुशुभे पुष्पिताणैव लतापरिगतदुमैः। लङ्कां बहुविधैर्दृश्यैर्यथेन्द्रस्यामरावती॥
target: Abounding in champakas, asokas, vakulas, śālas, and palms; covered with tamālas and panišas, and environed all around with trees, and surrounded with Hintālas, Arjunas, blossoming Saptaparmas, Tilakas, Karmikāras, and Patalas, trees with flowering tops, entertwined with creepers, Larkā looked exceedingly lovely, with various sights, resembling the Amarāvatī herself of Indra.

source: सुखं च दुःखं च भवाभवौ च लाभालाभौ मरणं जीवितं च। पर्यायतः सर्वमवाप्नुवन्ति तस्माद्धीरो नैव हृष्येन शोचेत्॥
target: Happiness and misery, prosperity and adversity, gain and loss, death and life, in their turn, visit all creatures. There the wise man, endued with equanimity soul would neither be puffed up with joy nor be depressed with sorrow.

source: त्रिवलीमांस्त्र्यवनतश्चतुर्व्यङ्गस्त्रिशीर्षवान्। चतुष्कलश्चतुर्लेखश्चतुष्किष्कुश्चतु:समः॥ चतुर्दशसमद्वन्द्वश्चतुर्दष्ट्रश्चतुर्गतिः। महोष्ठहनुनासश्च पञ्चस्निग्धोऽष्टवंशवान् ॥ दशपद्मो दशबृहत्रिभिर्व्याप्तो द्विशुल्कवान्। षडुन्नतो नवतनुस्त्रिभिर्व्याप्नोति राघवः॥
target: His belly and throat have three folds of skin. The sole of the foot, the lines thereon and the nipples are equally bended. His neck, eyes and back are short. He has three locks of hair on his head. He has four lines on his thumb indicating his proficiency in the four Vedas. His body is four hands tall; arms, thighs and checks are plump; eye-brows, the hollows of the nose, eyes, ears, lips, nipples; wrists, knee-joints, scrotums, hips, hands feet are all equally proportioned. Four teeth by the side of each row, are gifted with auspicious marks of the Gästras. His gaits are like those of a lion, tiger, elephant or a bull. His lips and jaws are fleshy and elevated. His nose is long; words, countenance, nails, down and skin are all cool; his two arms, two little fingers, two thighs and two legs are long; his face, eyes, mouth tongue, lips; palate, nipples, nails and feet are like lotuses, his breast, forehead, neck, arms, navel feet, back and ears are spacious. He is gifted with grace, fame and effulgence. His paternal and maternal race are pure. His armpit, belly, breasts, nose, shoulders and forehead are high; his fingers, hairs, down, nails, skin, beard, eye-sight and intellect are thin and sharp. Rāghava, with a due division of his time is engaged in acquiring piety, wealth emancipation and desires,

source: उत्तङ्कस्य प्रियं कर्तुमात्मनश्च महत्प्रियम्। भवतां चैव सर्वेषां गच्छाम्यपचितिं पितुः॥
target: I must avenge myself on my father's enemy, to please myself, to please Uttanka and you all.

source: स तु शोकेन चाविष्टः कोपेन महता कपिः। हनूमानरावणिरथे महतीं पातयच्छिलाम्॥
target: Being overwhelmed with grief and wrought up with ire, that monkey Hanumān, threw a huge crag on the car of that son of Rāvana.

source: पश्यैतां द्रवती सेनां कर्णसायकपीडिताम्। कार्तिकेयेन विध्वस्तामासुरी पृतनामिव॥
target: Behold, the (enemy's) army, oppressed with the arrows of Karna, is, like the Asura force afflicted by Kartikeya, running away in all the directions).

source: अस्त्रयुद्धे समो वीर न ते कश्चिद् भविष्यति। अप्रमत्तः सदा दक्षः सत्यवादी जितेन्द्रियः॥
target: "No one shall be equal to you in fighting with weapons who are always vigilant, dexterous, truthful, self-controlled,

source: धारयिष्यति यश्चैनं महापुरुषसम्भवम्। शृणुयात् कथयेद् वा यः स श्रेयो लभते परम्॥
target: He who will remember that discourse when coming out from a foremost person, he who will listen to it, and he who will recite it, is sure to acquire what is highly beneficial.

source: इत्युक्त्वा राक्षसपति: कुम्भकर्णं तरस्विनम्। संदिदेशेतिकर्तव्यं वलावेगप्रमाथिनौ॥
target: Thus addressing the mighty Kumbhakarna, the lord of the Rakshasas pointed out to Vajravega and Pramathin what they should do.

source: चिन्तयामास जिष्णुस्तु भगवन्तं हुताशनम्। पुरस्तादक्षयौ दत्तौ तूणौ येनास्य खाण्डवे॥
target: Jishnu (Arjuna) then thought of the exalted Agni who had forinerly given him two inexhaustible quivers at the burning of the Khandava.

source: दीर्घकालसमासक्तं विषमाशीविषो यथा। स मोक्ष्यति रणे तेजः पुत्रेषु मम संजय॥
target: Like venomous snake having accumulated its poison for a long time, he (Bhima) will fling his strength on my sons in the field of battle, O Sanjaya.

source: यथाहं तस्य वीरस्य वनादुपधिना हृता। रक्षसा तद्भयादेव तथा नार्हति राघवः॥
target: It dose not behove the heroic Rāghava, to take me away by steal, like to Rāvaņa capturing me from the forest under a disguise.

source: अप्येव दहनं स्पृष्ट्वा वने तिष्ठन्ति पादपाः। राजदण्डपरामृष्टास्तिष्ठन्ते नापराधिनः॥
target: Even trees may exist in the forest, coming in contact with burning fire; but transgressors cannot exist, visited with the chastisement of the monarch.

source: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे चापि गरुडः काल आगते। विना मात्रा महातेजा विदार्याण्डमजायत॥
target: Meanwhile, when the time came, Garuda of great splendour came out bursting the egg without the help of his mother.

source: जलेन क्लेदयन्यन्ये विमुच्य कवचान्यपि। अवस्थां तादृशीं प्राप्य हते द्रोणे द्रुतं बलम्॥
target: After the slaughter of Drona, the enemy's host, falling into great distress, fled away in haste. Who hath rallied it now? Tell me if you know it.

source: विवेश नगरे राजन् निःशश्वास शनैः शनैः॥
target: Dutiful Vidura, with a sorrowful heart, entered the palace, sighing heavily.

source: तत्र सम्प्रेषितामेनां विजने निरवग्रह। सान्त्वयेथा यथाकामं सान्त्व्यमाना रमेद् यदि॥
target: Thus sent thereto you should, in uninterrupted solitude, humour her according to your will. Thus cajoled most likely she may be attached to you.

source: प्रत्यक्षं हि त्वया दृष्ट ऋषिर्गच्छन् महातपाः। मार्कण्डेयोऽप्रमेयात्माधर्मेण चिरजीविता॥
target: You have seen with your own eyes the great ascetic Markandeya of incomparable magnanimity come to us who has been rendered immortal by virtue.

source: अभुक्त्वातिथये चान्नं प्रयच्छेद् यः समाहितः। स वै ब्रह्मविदां लोकान् प्राप्नुयाद् भरतर्षभ॥
target: That man, who makes a gift of food to a hungry guest arrived at his house, acquires all those regions, O chief of Bharata's race, that are reserved for persons acquainted with Brahman.

source: इदममृतपदं निशम्य राजा स्वयमिह पञ्चशिखेन भाष्यमाणम्। निखिलमभिसमीक्ष्य निश्चितार्थः परमसुखी विजहार वीतशोकः॥
target: Having heard these words capable of giving imınortality and uttered by Panchashikha, and arriving at the truth after carefully reflecting upon everything that the latter had said King Janadeva cast off his sorrows and lived on in the enjoyment of great happiness.

source: तपन्तं च तपस्तीव्रमम्भोमध्ये दुरासदम्। यशस्करं कामकरं कारुण्ये पर्यवस्थितम्॥
target: Having compassion for all creatures Budha, at that time, was performing, hard, glorious and wished-for austerities within waters.

source: भ्रातुः शृणु समादेशं सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः। धर्मार्थसहितं वाक्यमिह चामुत्र च क्षमम्॥
target: Listen to the desire of your brother, the highsouled Sugrīva, and his words fraught with righteous sense and capable of working one's good here and hercafter.

source: क्रोधहन्तेति यस्तस्य बभूवावरजोऽसुरः। दण्ड इत्यभिविख्यातः स आसीनृपतिः क्षितौ॥
target: That Asura, who was the younger brother of Vritra and was known as Krodhahanta, became king Danda on earth.

source: ततः स वारुणास्त्रेण पूरयित्वा कमण्डलुम्। सममाचार्यपुत्रेण गुरुमभ्येति फाल्गुनः॥ आचार्यपुत्रात् तस्मात् तु विशेषोपचयेऽपृथका न व्यहीयत मेधावी पार्थोऽप्यस्त्रविदां वरः॥ अर्जुनः परमं यत्नमातिष्ठद् गुरुपूजने। अस्त्रे च परमं योगं प्रियो द्रोणस्य चाभवत्॥
target: Thereupon he filled his Kamandala with the Varuna weapon and came to his preceptor at the same time with his preceptor's son and thus the intelligent son of Pritha, that foremost of all the learned in arms, became in no way inferior to his preceptor's son. Arjuna took great deal of care in worshipping the preceptor; he had great devotion of his study of the science of arms, therefore, he became a great favourite of Drona.

source: सर्वाणि येषां गाङ्गेयैस्तोयैः कार्याणि देहिनाम्। गां त्यक्त्वा मानवा विप्र दिवि तिष्ठन्ति ते जनाः।।
target: Those men, O learned Brahmana, who use the waters of Bhagirathi in all their acts surely go to heaven after death.

source: न तु जात्या समा लोके ब्राह्मण्याः क्षत्रिया भवेत्। ब्राह्मण्याः प्रथमः पुत्रो भूयान् स्याद् राजसत्तम॥
target: The Kshatriya wife cannot be considered as equal to the Brahmana wife in point of Birth. Hence, O best of kings, the son born of the Brahinani wife must be considered as the first in rank and superior to the son born of the Kshatriya wife.

source: योनिष्वेतासु सर्वासु संकीर्णास्वितरासु च। यत्रात्मानं न जनयेद् बुधस्तां परिवर्जयेत्॥
target: For these reasons the wise should avoid those women among these various castes mixed, upon whom they should not beget children.

source: तस्मिन्ननिर्जिते युद्धे कामवस्थां गमिष्यसि। एतजित्वा महाराज कृतकृत्यो भविष्यसि॥
target: If you cannot win that battle what will be your condition? On the other hand, by acquiring victory in it, O monarch, you shall have attained the great end of life.

source: अथ चन्द्रपभां मुष्णन्नादित्यस्य पुरःसरः। अरुणोऽभ्युदयांचक्रे ताम्रीकुर्वन्निवाम्बरम्॥
target: Soon after Arjuna (the sun's charioteer) robbing the effulgence of the moon, appeared on the sky, spreading a coppery hue over it.

source: आत्मजान् क्षत्रधर्मेण श्रुत्वा शूरान् निपातितान्। उपप्लव्ये मया सार्धं दिष्ट्या त्वं न स्मरिष्यसि॥
target: By good luck, you do not like myself while living at Upaplavya, recollect your heroic sons killed while following Kshatriya duties.

source: द्वितीयः शलभस्तेषामसुराणां बभूव ह। प्रह्लादो नाम वाह्लीकः स बभूव नराधिपः॥
target: That Asura, who was known as Shalabha the second, became king Prahlada in the land of the Bahlikas on earth. was as

source: हताश्वात्तु तदा वेगादवप्लुत्य महारथात्। कोपमाहारयत्तीवं भ्रातरं प्रति रावणः॥
target: Thereat leaping down from his mighty car, whose horses had been slain, Råvana was fired with high wrath against his brother.

source: पुष्पवत्सु ध्रुवा श्रीश्च पुष्पवन्तस्ततो वयम्। क्षत्रियो बाहुवीर्यस्तु न तथा वाक्यवीर्यवान्। अप्रगल्भं वचस्तस्य तस्माद् बार्हद्रथेरितम्॥
target: Persons who adorn themselves with flowers always gain prosperity, therefore we have adorned ourselves with flowers. The Kshatriyas are powerful in their prowess of arms and in the prowess of speech. O son of Brihadratha it is therefore the speeches of the Kshatriyas are never audacious.

source: देवनिष्ठानभूतं तद्विमानं पुष्पकं मृधे। भज्यमानं तथैवासीदक्षयं ब्रह्मतेजसा ॥
target: In that conflict Pușpaka presided over by divine energy, incapable of being destroyed by virtue of Brahma power, being broken, resumed its former shape.

source: छत्राणि वालव्यजनानि खङ्गा दीप्ता महोल्काश्च तथैव राजन्। व्याघूर्णमानाश्च सुवर्णमाला व्यायच्छतां तत्र तदा विरेजुः॥
target: O king, umbrellas and yak-tails and scimitars and flaming brands and necklaces of gold as they were being whirled looked exceedingly brilliant.

source: न हि माहुगुप्तस्य प्रभवन्त्यमरा अपि। व्यूहयिष्यामि तं व्यूहं यं पार्थो न तरिष्यति॥
target: Even the very gods cannot obtain victory over him who is protected with the strength of my arms. I will (tomorrow) form such an array which Partha will never be able to reach the end of.

source: श्वः शिरः श्रोष्यसे तस्य सैन्धवस्य रणे हृतम्। समन्तपञ्चकाद् बाह्यं विशोका भव मा रुंदः॥
target: Tomorrow you shall hear that the head of the Sindhu ruler has been severed from his trunk in battle, to roll on the precincts of the Samantapanchaka. Dismiss your grief and do not weep.

source: ततस्तैबहुभिवीरैर्वानरैर्वानरर्षभाः। संरक्तनयनैः क्रोधाद्धरयः संप्रधर्षिताः॥
target: They were greatly assailed by those many thousand heroic monkeys, worked up with ire and having reddened eyes.

source: द्रोणदुर्योधनकृपाः कर्णमद्रेशबाह्निकाः। दुःशासनादयः शक्तास्त्रातुं मामन्तकार्दितम्॥ किमङ्ग पुनरेकेन फाल्गुनेन जिघांसता। न त्रायेयुभवन्तो मां समस्ताः पतयः क्षितेः॥
target: Drona, Duryodhana, Kripa, Karna, the rulers of the Madras and the Balhikas and Dushasana and others, these are competent to save even one who is seized by Death himself. Why then should not all these rulers of earth, united together, be able to protect me, when I are threatened by Phalguna who seeks to slay me?

source: तस्यां ह्याकृष्यमाणायां मन्थरायां ततस्ततः। चित्रं बहुविधं भाण्डं पृथिव्यां तद्व्यशीर्यत ॥
target: As Mantharā was pushed this way and that, her various ornaments were scattered over the floor.

source: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः। अवाक्शिरास्तथाभूतो वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह॥
target: Hearing the words of Räma of unwearied actions, the ascetic, with his face downwards, said.

source: दान्तानामपि यो दान्तो धीमतामपि या च धीः। देवानामपि यो देव ऋषीणामपि यस्त्वृषिः॥
target: To him, who is regarded as the most restrained of all creatures who are restrained, and him who is the intelligence of all creatures gifted with intelligence; to him who is regarded as the god of all gods, and the Rishi of all Rishis.

source: न हि केवलमस्माकं यावन्तोऽन्ये च पार्थिवाः। तथैव तेषामासीच्च बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतां वर॥
target: O foremost of all intelligent men, this was not only our opinion, but all the other kings were of the same opinion.

source: तं तोषय महाबाहो तपसा वरदं हरम्। स तु मां प्रच्युतां देवः शिरसाधारयिष्यति॥
target: O mighty-armed hero, therefore gratify that giver of boons Hara by asceticism. The god will sustain my fall upon his head.

source: न गृहाणि न वस्त्राणि न प्राकारस्तिरस्क्रिया। नेदृशा राजसत्कारा वृत्तमावरणं स्त्रियाः॥
target: Neither the houses, clothes, walls nor reception like these are the veils of women.

source: तस्यैतानि च कर्माणि तथान्यानि च कौरव। क्षत्रियस्येत्यतो जातमिदं कौतूहलं मम॥
target: These and many others are his feats. O descendant of Kuru, my curiosity has been kindled in this respect, because they were performed by a Kshstriya.

source: कथं हि धर्मराजस्य दोषमल्पमपि ब्रुवन्। लभते परिषन्मध्ये व्याहर्तुमकुतोभयः॥
target: How can one, who even in the slightest degree speaks ill of the virtuous king, dare continue in that stain without being checked, in this assembly.

source: एतेषां युयुधानेन युध्यतां युधि भारत। बभूव तुमुलः शब्दः प्रेतानां क्रन्दतामिव॥
target: Thus when they were being thus slaughtered by Yuyudhana in battle, O Bharata, a tumultuous uproar was heard there like the yell or bewailing of ghosts.

source: ततोऽब्रवीन्मुनिश्रेष्ठः श्रुत्वा रामस्य भाषितम्। ध्यात्वा मुहुर्तं धर्मात्मा ततोवाच वचः शुभम्॥
target: Hearing Rāma's words, that best of ascetics, reflecting for a while, spoke these excellent words.

source: जलां चोपजलां चैव यमुनामभितो नदीम्। उशीनरो वै यत्रेष्ट्वा वासवादत्यरिच्यत॥
target: (Behold) Jala and Upjala the rivers on both the sides of the Yamuna. Ushinara surpassed Vasava (Indra in greatness) by performing a sacrifice here.

source: पुनः पञ्चाशतेषूणां शितेन च समापयत्। लघुतां युयुधानस्य लाघवेन विशेषयन्॥
target: Then once more he pierced him with fifty and hundred shafts successively, thus surpassing with his own lightness of hands the lightness displayed by Yuyudhana.

source: पुत्रशोकसमाविष्टो निःश्वसन् ह्येष भूमिपः। न शेते वसतीः सर्वा धृतराष्ट्रो महामुने॥
target: Afflicted with grief on account of the destruction of his his children, this king Dhritarashtra, always breathes heavily, and never sleeps at night, O great Rishi.

source: कच्चिन्न परदारान् वा राजपुत्रोऽभिमन्यते। कस्मात् स दण्डकारण्ये भ्राता रामो विवासितः॥
target: Has the fancy of the prince gone after the wife of another? For what reason has brother Rāma been banished?

source: मम रूपं च सम्प्रेक्ष्य वने विचरतो महत्। राक्षस्यो भयवित्रस्ता भवेयुर्विकृतस्वराः॥
target: And espying my appearance while ranging in the forest, those Rākşasīs greatly terrified, shall fill the wood with their wild shouts.

source: अवध्यतां प्रेक्ष्य महासुरस्य तौ शितेन शस्त्रेण तदा नरर्षभौ। समर्थ्य चात्यर्थविशारदावुभौ बिले विराधस्य वधं प्रचक्रतुः॥
target: Having vanquished him in fight, Rāma and Lakşmana possessed of activity and steady in fight, being exceedingly delighted, raising up the dreadful Räksasa by main force, cast him howling (into the pit). Reflecting that he was incapable of being slain (by sharpened weapons), those foremost of men, exceedingly well versed (in arms), compassed the death of that mighty Asura, Virādha, in the pit, after they had dug it.

source: अग्निरापस्तथाऽऽकाशं पृथिवी वायुरेव च। विमुञ्चन्तु मम प्राणान् यदि पापं चराम्यहम्॥
target: And not only let air, but let fire, water, space and earth forsake my life if I have erred.

source: सिंहनादाश्च विविधा वाहनानां च निःस्वनाः। प्रादुरासन्ननभ्रे च वर्षं रुधिरकर्दमम्॥
target: There were also roars like those of lions and several other sorts of roars among the army; and though there were no clouds in the sky there was a down pour of blood which made the ground full of mire.

source: उत्तानाभ्यां च पाणिभ्यां पादावस्य मृदु स्पृशेत्। दक्षिणं दक्षिणेनैव सव्यं सव्येन पीडयेत्॥
target: He should gently touch his preceptor's feet with palms, the right foot with the right hand and the left foot with the left.

source: एवमुक्तस्तथा तेन वसिष्ठो जपतां वरः। आजुहाव ततः प्रीतः कल्माषीं धूतकल्मषाम्॥
target: This having been said by him, Vasistha, the best of those reciting mantras, joyfully called his sacrificial dappled cow, capable of purging away sins.

source: स तैरग्न्यर्कसंकाशैः शरैराशीविषोपमैः। शितैरभ्यर्दितो रामो मन्दचेता इवाभवत्॥
target: Rama, struck with those arrows which were like fire or the sun and like poisonous snakes, became like one senseless.

source: यदि ब्रह्मशृणोष्येतच्छ्रद्दधासि च मे वचः। वेदोक्तस्यैव धर्मस्य फलं मुख्यमवाप्स्यसि॥
target: If, O twice-born one, you listen to me and confide in my words, you will acquire the highest reward of the religion laid down in the Vedas.

source: जनकस्य वचः श्रुत्वा पाणीन्पाणिभिरस्पृशन्॥ चत्वारस्ते चतसृणां वसिष्ठस्य मते स्थिताः। अग्नि प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा वेदिं राजानमेव च॥ ऋषींश्चापि महात्मानः सहभार्या रघूद्वाहाः। यथोक्तेन ततश्चक्रुर्विवाहं विधिपूर्वकम्॥ पुष्पवृष्टिर्महत्यासीदन्तरिक्षात् सुभास्वरा।
target: Hearing Janaka's speech, those four perpetuators of Raghus's line, staying by Vasiştha's opinions, taking the hands of the four brides with their own, went round the sacrificial fire, and the dais, and the king, and the highsouled saints; and in company with their wives, agreeably to direction entered into matrimony in accordance with the ordinance.

source: कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः। स बुद्धिमान् मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत्॥
target: He, who sees inaction in action, and action in inaction, is a wise man, a Yogi and a doer of all actions.

source: नीलजीमूतसंकाशं न्यग्रोधं भीमदर्शनम्। तेजस्वी रावणभ्राता लक्ष्मणाय न्यवेदयत्॥
target: The energetic brother of Rāvana showed to Lakşmaņa the Nyagrodha, dreadful to behold and resembling a mass of sable clouds.

source: मम कायात् प्रसूतौ हि दुःखितौ भारपीडितौ। यौ दृष्ट्वा परितप्येऽहं नास्ति पुत्रसमः प्रियः॥
target: Seeing those that have been born of my body, cast down and in trouble, I grieve: there is none that is dear like to a son.

source: किमायासेन ते भीरु उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ शोभने। तत्त्वं मे ब्रूहि कैकेयि यतस्ते भयमागतम्। तत् ते व्यपनयिष्यामि नीहारमिव रश्मिवान्॥
target: What, O timid one, is the use of afflicting yourself thus? O beauteous damsel, arise, arise. Do you, O Kaikeyi, unfold to me the cause whence has proceeded your fear. On hearing the reason, I will dispel it, even as the sun dried up the due.

source: ततः प्रहृष्टाः कपयः ससुग्रीवविभीषणाः। साधुसाध्विति नेदुश्च दृष्ट्वा शत्रु पराजितम्॥
target: Seeing the enemy vanquished, all the .monkeys with Sugrīva and Vibhisana, experiencing high delight, exclaimed, "Excellent !" "Excellent!"

source: गृहस्नेहावबद्धानां नराणामल्पमेधसाम्। कुस्त्री खादति मांसानि माघमां सेगवा इव॥ गृहं क्षेत्राणि मित्राणि स्वदेश इति चापरे। इत्येवमवसीदन्ति नरा बुद्धिविपर्यये॥

source: प्रयातश्च महाबाहुः पाण्डवानुज्ञया हरिः। आश्वासयन् रथेनैव पाण्डुसैन्यानि सर्वशः॥
target: As urged by the son of Pandu the very driving of the car by the strong-armed Vasudeva gave assurance to the Pandava troops and cheered them up.

source: परिव्राजकानां पुनराचार:-तद् यथा विमुच्याग्निधनकलत्रपरिबर्हणं संगेष्वात्मनः स्नेहपाशानवधूय परिव्रजन्ति। समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनास्त्रिवर्गप्रवृत्तेष्वसक्तबुद्धयो ऽरिमित्रोदासीनानां तुल्यदर्शनाः स्थावरजरायुजाण्डजस्वेदजोद्भिज्जानां भूतानां वाङ्मनः कर्मभिरनभिद्रोहिणो ऽनिकेताः पर्वतपुलिनवृक्षमूल देवतायतनान्यनुचरन्तो वासार्थमुपेयुर्नगरं ग्रामं वा नगरे पञ्चरात्रिका ग्रामे चैकरात्रिकाः प्रविश्य च प्राणधारणार्थं द्विजातीनां भवनान्यसंकीर्णकर्मणामुपतिष्ठेयुः पात्रपतितायाचितभैक्ष्याः काम क्रोधदर्पलोभमोहकार्पण्यदम्भपरिवादाभिमानहिंसानिवृत्ता इति॥
target: I shall now describe the conduct of the Parivrajakas, which is as follows : alienating themselves from attachment to the sacred fire, wealth, wife and children, and robes, seats, beds, and such other objects of enjoyment, and snapping the fetters of affection, they walk about, regarding with an equal eye a clump of earth or rock and gold. They never think of acquiring or enjoying the threefold objects of life. They regard impartially foes and friends and neutrals or strangers. They never injure, in thought, word, or deed, immobile objects, or creatures that are viviparous, or oviparous, or born of fifth, or called vegetables. They have no homes. They road over hills and mountains, upon shores of rivers or oceans, under shades of trees, and among temples of gods, They may go to towns or villages for living. In one town, however, they should not live for more than five nights, while in the same village they should not live for more than one night. Entering a town or a village, they should , for maintaining their life, go to the houses of liberal Brahmanas only. They should never ask for any alms but accept what is put into the bowls they carry. They should free themselves from lust, anger, pride, cupidity, delusion, miserliness, deceit, slander, vanity, and injury to creatures.

source: कृत्रा तौ सुचिरं कालं धर्मिष्ठौ ताः कथास्तदा। मुदा परमया युक्तौ प्रीयेतां तौ परस्परम्॥
target: Having conversed for a long time, those virtuous ones, experiencing exceeding joy, ministered to each other's delight.

source: बलं तपश्च सत्यं च कर्म धर्मात्मकं तव। तेजोऽग्निः पवनः श्वास आपस्ते स्वेदसम्भवाः॥
target: Asceticism and truth born of acts of piety constitute your strength. Your energy is fire, your breath the wind. And waters have been created from your perspiration.

source: चोदितो राजसिंहेन मुनिर्वाक्यमभाषत। द्वन्द्वे ह्येतत्प्रवक्तव्यं हितं वै यद्यवेक्षसे॥
target: Being thus addressed by Rāma, a lion among kings, the ascetic said:-If do you wish to bring about the well-being of the celestials, my earnest desire is that we may talk over it in a solitary place.

source: ब्राह्मण उवाच गुणाज्ञानमविज्ञानं गुणज्ञानमभिज्ञता। परस्परं गुणानेते नाभिजानन्ति कर्हिचित्॥
target: Not knowing the qualities is ignorance; while knowledge of the qualities is knowledge. These seven never succeed in apprehending or knowing the qualitics of one another.

source: फाल्गुन याज्ञसेनी त्वयैव शोभिष्यति राजपुत्री। त्वया जिता प्रज्वाल्यतामग्निरमित्रसाह गृहाण पाणिं विधिवत् त्वमस्या:॥
target: "O Falguni, Yajnaseni has been won by you. It is proper therefore that you should marry this princess. O with stander of all foes, therefore kindle the sacred fire and marry her with all due rites."

source: कर्ण उवाच ब्रवीषि वाचा यत् पार्थ कर्मणा तत् समाचर। अतिशेते हि ते वाक्यं कर्मैतत् प्रथितं भुवि॥
target: Karna said Do you carry out your words into action, O Partha. That your words exceed your deeds is known in the world.

source: आसाद्य तु सभाद्वारमृषभः सर्वसात्वताम्। अवतीर्य रथाच्छौरिः कैलासशिखरोपमात्॥
target: Shauri, the best among the entire Satvata race, coming to the gate of the Assembly-Hall, got down from the car which was like the peak of the Kailasa mountain.

source: नेत्रैरनिमिषैर्दीनाः प्रत्यवेक्षन् परस्परम्। प्रतिलभ्य ततः संज्ञा वासविः क्रोधमूच्छितः॥
target: And highly distressed they began to gaze vacantly at one another with winkless eyes. Then regaining his consciousness and burning with rage, the son of Vasava.

source: प्रविशन्तीव गात्राणि स्वानि सा जनकात्मजा। वाक्शरैस्तैः सशल्येव भृशमश्रूण्यवर्तयत्॥
target: As if entering to her own person (with shame) and greatly pained with these arrow like words the daughter of king Janaka began to shed tears.

source: तस्य गात्राणि सर्वाणि चूर्णयामास पाण्डवः। अरनिना चाभिहत्य शिरः कायादपाहरत्॥ संदष्टौष्ठं विवृत्ताक्षं फलं वृक्षादिव च्युतम्। जटासुरस्य तु शिरो भीमसेनबलाद्धतम्॥
target: That son of Pandu pounded (into atoms) all his limbs; and striking him with his elbow, he severed from his body the head with bitten lips and rolling eyes like a fruit from its stem. The head of Jatasura, being severed by the strength of Bhimasena.

source: पुष्पकं नाम सुश्रोणि भ्रातुर्वैश्रवणस्य मे॥ विमानं सूर्यसंकाशं तरसा निर्जितं रणे। विशालं रमणीयं च तद्विमानं मनोजवम्॥ तत्र सीते मया सार्धं विहरस्व यथासुखम्।
target: O you of shapely hips, the car called Pușpaka, resembling the sun, which (formerly) belonged to my brother Vaiśravaņa, was through my prowess won by me in fight. And vast and beautiful is that car furnished with the speed of the mind. Do you, O Sītā, at your pleasure sport on it along with me.

source: ये च मुक्ता भवन्तीह नरा भरतसत्तम। तेषां लक्षणमेतद्धि तच्छ्वेतद्वीपवासिनाम्॥
target: O chief of Bharata's race, the characteristics of those men that become liberated the same as those by which the inhabitants of the White Island are distinguished?

source: अस्मत्परोक्षं कर्माणि कृतानि प्रवहन्ति ते। स्वामिसत्कारयुक्तानि यानि तानीह दर्शय॥
target: Men speak of many feats achieved by you out of our view. Show all those feats to me that have rendered you worthy of the applause and reverence of others."

source: सभास्थान् पाण्डवान् द्रष्टुं प्रीयमाणो मनोजवः। जयाशीर्भिस्तु तं विप्रो धर्मराजानमार्चयत्॥
target: The Rishi who moved about with the speed of mind was filled with joy on seeing the assembly-hall of the Pandavas. The Brahmana (Narada) wishing him victory uttered blessings on Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira).

source: कौन्तेय तं न हिंसेत् स यो महीं विजिगीषते। गणानां भेदने योगमीप्सेथाः सह मन्त्रिभिः॥ साधुसंग्रहणाच्चैव पापनिग्रहणात् तथा। दुर्वलाश्चैव सततं नान्वेष्टव्या बलीयसा॥
target: You should try to steal a march by producing, with the help your ministers, dissension's among his aristocracy and feudatory chiefs. A powerful king should never seek to root out weak kings, for these do good to the world by cherishing the good and punishing the wicked. O foremost of kings, you should live, conducting yourself like a cane.

source: दृष्ट्वा तयोस्तं युधि सम्प्रहारं परस्परस्यान्तरमीक्षमाणयोः। र्योधाः सर्वे विस्मयमभ्यगच्छन्॥
target: The other warriors were struck with wonder in seeing that fearful combat between those great warriors who were always trying to take advantage of each other's failings (weak points).

source: अत्रैवोदाहरन्तीमं बोध्यस्य पदसंचयम्। निर्वेदं प्रति विन्यस्तं तं निबोध युधिष्ठिर॥
target: Once on a time the royal son of Nahusa (Yayati) asked the Rishi Vodhya who had, on account of Rcnunciation, attained to tranquillity of soul and who had a through knowledge of the scriptures. The king said

source: यावन्ति रोमकूपाणि तस्य गात्रेषु पाण्डव। तावन्त्येव सहस्राणि वर्षाणां दिवि मोदते॥
target: Such a person enjoys all sorts of happiness in Heaven for as many years as there are pores in his body.

source: किं न मे सीतया कार्यं लब्धया जीवितेन वा। शयानं योऽद्य पश्यामि भ्रातरं युधि निर्जितम्॥
target: Of what use to me is the recovery of Sītă, or life either, when today I see my brother vanquished in fight and lying down in the field?

source: द्रवतश्च महीपालान् पश्य यौधिष्ठिरे बले। दृष्ट्वा हि भीष्मं समरे व्यात्ताननमिवान्तकम्॥
target: Behold, all the kings of Yudhisthira's army are flying away, on seeing Bhishma in battle who looks like the destroyer himself with his wide open mouth.

source: त्वत्तोऽप्यहं ग्रहीष्यामि अस्त्रमाग्नेयमुत्तमम्। तथा योग्यं बीभत्सो चिराय भरतर्षभ॥
target: O best of the Bharata race, O Bibhatsa, so that the obligation may be not only on one side, I shall take from you your excellent and eternal fire-weapon.

source: प्रज्ञाश्रुताभ्यां वृत्तेन शीलेन च समन्वितः। तारयेत कुलं सर्वमेकोऽपीह द्विजर्षभः॥ गामश्वं वित्तमन्नं व तद्विधे प्रतिपादयेत्। द्रव्याणि चान्यानि तथा प्रेत्यभावे न शोचति॥
target: One should make gifts of kine and horses and riches and food and other kinds of articles to Brahmana who is gifted with such qualifications. By making such gifts to such persons one acquires great happiness in the next world.

source: यच्च मामात्थ गाड्नेय बाणघातरूज प्रति। गृहाणात्र वरं भीष्म मत्प्रसादकृतं प्रभो॥
target: Regarding what you have said about the pain of wounds, receive, O Bhishma, this boon what I grant you, O powerful one, from favour.

source: पृथोर्वैन्यस्य यत्रोक्तमाख्यानं परमर्षिणा। संवादश्च सरस्वत्यास्तायर्षेः सुमहात्मनः॥
target: The story of Pritha, the son of Vena, was told by the Rishi; also the debate of Sarasvati and that of Rishi Tarkshya.

source: पादबद्धोऽक्षरसमस्तन्त्रीलयसमन्वितः। शोकार्तस्य प्रवृत्तो मे श्लोको भवतु नान्यथा॥
target: This speech that I have uttered is of equal bound with metre and accents; it has rhythm and is capable of being chanted according to measure to stringed accompaniment. Let it therefore go forth as a sloka!

source: क्षिपन्तीन्द्रजितं संख्ये वानरा भीमविक्रमाः। वृक्षशैलमहावर्षं विसृजन्तः प्लवङ्गमाः॥ शत्रूणां कदनं चक्रुर्नेदुश्च विविधैः स्वनैः।
target: The monkeys gifted with dreadful prowess began to make a down-pour of crags and trees. They thus assailed the enemies and frequently emitted cries.

source: करिष्यत: किञ्च नो भीमपार्थों तपन्तमेनं जहि पापं निशीथे। यो नः संग्रामाद् घोररूपाद् विमुच्येत् स नः पार्थान् सबलान् योधयेत॥
target: What can Bhima or Arjuna do to us? Slay this wicked Rakshasa, who is consuming us all, at this dead of night. They, that will escape alive form this encounter, will fight with the Parthas tomorrow.

source: क्लिश्यमानाश्च तैर्नित्यं वार्यमाणाश्च भारत। स्वकर्मभिर्महाव्यालै!द्विजन्त्यल्पबुद्धयः॥
target: Men are always assailed by them, O Bharata. Again, those dreadful beasts of prey, which are their own acts in life, never cause any, anxiety to the foolish.

source: भीमसेनो महाबाहुस्तव पुत्रस्य वै बले। सापि मज्जावसामांसैः प्रदिग्धा रुधिरेण च॥
target: Bhimasena produced a fierce carnage in the force of your son. Smeared with fat, marrow, serum and flesh, and be spattered with blood,

source: पार्थिवः। प्रायाद् द्रोणरथं प्रेप्सुर्युयुधानस्य पृष्ठतः। ततः पाञ्चालराजस्य पुत्रः समादुर्मदः॥
target: Followed Yuyudhana from behind, with a view to reach the chariot of Drona. Thereafter, the son of the king of the Panchalas, that invincible warrior.

source: सम्बन्धिबान्धवा दिक्षु पृथिव्यां मातृमातुलौ। वृद्धवालातुरकृशास्त्वाकाशे प्रभविष्णवः॥
target: Relation by marriage and collateral kinsmen have power over the several quarters of the horizon (viz., north, etc.) and the mother and the maternal uncle have power over the Earth. The old, the young, the afflicted, the worn out have power over the firmament.

source: अष्टाविंशांस्तु तान् बाणानस्तान् विप्रेक्ष्य निष्फलान्। अब्रवीत् परवीरनः कृष्णोऽर्जुनमिदं वचः॥
target: Then seeing those twenty shafts of Arjuna repelled, that slayer of hostile warriors Krishna,

source: द्रोणोऽपि रथिनां श्रेष्ठः पञ्चालान् पाण्डवांस्तथा। अभ्यद्रवत संक्रुद्धो जवमास्थाय मध्यमम्॥
target: Drona also, that best of car-warriors, inflamed with rage, proceeded against the Panchalas and the Pandavas in medium speed.

source: धर्मेण सर्वकार्याणि आरभनते सदा पार्थाः जीवितादीनि भारत प्रार्थयाना महद् यशः॥
target: The sons of Pritha, O Bharata, desirous of securing illustrious fame, ever perform all acts, even the maintenance of their lives, in perfect accordance with the rulers of morality.

source: नहि मम हरिराजसंश्रयात् क्षमतरमस्ति परत्र चेह वा। अभिमुखहतवीर सेवितं शयनमिदं मम सेवितुं क्षमम्॥
target: There is no other resource for me tending to my welfare both in this world and the next than taking refuge to this lord of monkeys. It is becoming for me to serve this bed which has been resorted to by the hero, slain (and lying before me.) monkeys, father is son's friend (in this respect) not mother.

source: प्राणानुपासृजद् वीरः सुहृदां दुःखमुत्सृजन्। अपाक्रामद् दिवं पुण्यां शरीरं क्षितिमाविशत्॥
target: Casting off his sorrow for all his killed kinsmen, he then breathed his last. His soul went to holy heaven, while his body only remained on Earth.

source: एवं तु क्रुद्धया राजा राममात्रा सशोकया। श्रावितः परुषं वाक्यं चिन्तयामास दुःखितः॥ चिन्तयित्वा स च नृपो मोहव्याकुलितेन्द्रियः। अथ दीर्पण कालेन संज्ञामाप परंतपः॥
target: Thus harshly addressed by the indignant mother of Rāma, the king aggrieved was plunged in thought. Having thought for a long while, that repressor of foes, the king, who had lost his senses through grief, regained consciousness.

source: जेतव्यमिति चान्योन्यं येषां नित्यं दि स्थितम्। अथ चेमे हताः प्राज्ञाः शेरते विगतायुषः॥
target: Alas even those who entertained in their heart the hopes of conquering one another in battle, are now lying slain deprived of their senses, in spite of all their wisdom.

source: ते वार्यमाणा हरिबाणजालैः स्वबाणजालानि समुत्सृजन्तः। धावन्ति नक्तंचरकालमेघा वायुप्रणुन्ना इव कालमेघाः॥
target: And driven by Hari's networks of arrows, and discharging (all the while) their own showers of shafts, those night-rangers resembling the clouds of doom, are driven like the veritable clouds of the universal dissolution drifted by the wind.

source: खिलेषु हरिवंशश्च भविष्यं च प्रकीर्तितम्। दश श्लोकसहस्राणि विंशच्छ्लोकशतानि च॥ खिलेषु हरिवंशे च संख्यातानि महर्षिणा। एतत्सर्वं समाख्यातं भारते पर्वसंग्रहः॥
target: There are Harivansha and Bhavishya in its appendix. The number of slokas, composed by the great Rishi in the Harivansha, is twelve thousand. These are the contents of the chapters called Parva Sangraha in the Bharata.

source: आदीप्तमिव तत् सैन्यं शरैश्छिन्नतनुच्छदम्। आसीत् सुशोणितक्किनं फुल्लाशोकवनं यथा॥
target: Resembling a forest of blooming Asoka the troops, streaming with blood, with their armours broken, looked red as if they were ablaze with fire.

source: निमिस्तु राजा विप्रांस्तान्समानीय नराधिपः। अयजद्धिमवत्पार्श्वे स्वपुरस्य समीपतः॥
target: On the other hand having united all the Brāhmaṇas the great king began to celebrate the sacrifice extending over five thousand years near his city by the side of the Himālaya.

source: सोऽयं विपुलमध्वानं कालेन ध्रुवमध्रुवः। नरोऽवशः समभ्येति सर्वभूतनिषेवितम्॥
target: Man, whose existence is so transitory is compelled, in course of Time, whether he will or no, to come upon this inevitable and broad path of all creatures.

source: ततः सागरमासाद्य कुक्षौ तस्य महोर्मिणः। समुद्रनाभ्यां शाल्वोऽभूत् सौभमास्थाय शत्रुहन्॥
target: O slayer of foes, having reached the ocean (I saw) Shalva on his (Saubha, car made of precious metal in the midst of the ocean full of heaving billows.

source: मणिरत्नं कपिवरः प्रतिगृह्याभिवाद्य च। सीतां प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा प्रणतः पार्श्वतः स्थितः॥
target: And taking the gem, and bowing to Sītā and going round her, that foremost of monkeys remained by her side in humble guise.

source: ततो योगबलं कृत्वा सर्वयोगेश्वरेश्वरः। तं यज्ञं स महातेजा भीमैरनुचरैस्तदा।॥ सहसा घातयामास देवदेवः पिनाकधूक्। केचिन्नादानमुञ्चन्त केचिद्धासांश्च चक्रिरे॥ रुधिरेणापरे राजंस्तत्राग्नि समवाकिरन्। केचिद् यूपान् समुत्पाट्य बभ्रमुर्विकृताननाः॥ आस्यैरन्ये चाग्रसन्त तथैव परिचारकान्।
target: Summoning all his Yoga powers, that Lord of all lords of Yoga, that god of gods, that holder of Pinaka, possessed of great energy, quickly proceeded to the place accompanied by all his dreadful followers and destroyed that Sacrifice. Of these followers of his, some yelled, and some laughed terribly, and some, O king, extinguished the fires with blood; and some, having dreadful faces, pulling up the sacrificial stakes, began to whirl them. Others began to devour those that were celebrating the Sacrifices.

source: तमुग्रतपसा युक्तं भावितं सुमहामुनिम्॥ उपयातो नरव्याघ्र लोकपालो यमस्तदा। तमपश्यत् सुतपस पृषि वै गौतमं तदा॥
target: One day, the Regent of the dead. Yama, O foremost of men, went to that great sage of purified soul while he was practising the severest austerities. Yama saw the great ascetic Gotama of rigid penances.

source: बभ्रमुश्चस्खलुः पेतुः सेदुर्मम्लुश्च भारत॥ तस्मिन् महाभीषण के प्रजानामिव संक्षये।
target: Began to wander or lamp of fall down. Some became paralysed and some became pale. During that terrible carnage of creatures.

source: विदुरः संजयश्चैव राज्ञः शय्यां कुशैस्ततः॥ चक्रतुः कुरुवीरस्य गान्धार्याश्चाविदूरतः।
target: Then Vidura and Sanjaya made a bed for the king by spreading some blades of Kusha grass. Near the bed of that Kuru hero they made another for Gandhari.

source: अब्रवीच्च परिष्वज्य सौमित्रिं राघवस्तदा। दिष्ट्या त्वां वीर पश्यामि मरणात्पुनरागतम्।।४७
target: Having embraced Sumitra's son, Raghava then addressed him saying, “By good fortune it is that, O hero, I see you returned from (the mansion of ) Death.

source: प्रातीपेयाः शान्तनवाः शृणुध्वं काव्यां वाचं संसदि कौरवाणाम्। वैश्वानरं प्रज्वलितं सुघोरं मा यास्यध्वं मन्दमनुप्रपन्नाः॥
target: O descendant of Shantanu, O descendant of Pratipa, listen in this assembly of the Kurus, to the words of wisdom. By following a wretch, do not enter into the terrible fire that has blazed forth.

source: ततः प्रववृते युद्धं कौरवाणां भयावहम्। तत्र पाण्डुसुतैः सार्धं भीष्मस्य विजयं प्रति॥

source: तत्रस्थोऽथ महीपालो योधयामास तां पुरीम्। अभिसारेण सर्वेण तन युद्धमवर्तत॥

source: स काञ्चनं भारसहं निवातं विद्युत्प्रभं दीप्तमिवात्मभासा। आबध्यमानः कवचं रराज संध्याभ्रसंवीत इवाद्रिराजः॥
target: Donning on his impenetrable golden mail, splendid like lightning, and shining in its own brilliance, Kumbhakarņa appeared like the monarch of mountains enveloped with evening clouds.

source: ततो राजन्नदृश्यद्भिर्ऋषिभिश्च महासुरौ। उभौ विनिश्चयं कृत्वा विकुर्वाते वधैषिणौ॥

source: ऋषिष्टुतां विष्णुपदी पुराणां सुपुण्यतोयां मनसापि लोके। स्ते ब्रह्मणः सदनं सम्प्रयाताः॥
target: Those men who, in the life, even in their minds seek that sacred river which is lauded by the Rishis, which has come out of the feet of Vishnu, which is very ancient, and which is highly sacred succeed in going to the regions of Brahman.

source: भीमसेन उवाच क्रूर पापजनैर्जुष्टमकृतार्थं प्रभाषसे। गान्धारविद्यया हि त्वं राजमध्ये विकत्थसे॥
target: Bhima said O crooked-minded wretch, you rave in words that are uttered only by the sinful. Being advanced by the skill of the Gandhara king, you (dare to) boast in the midst of these kings.

source: विद्राव्य च बहूनश्वान् नागा राजन् मदोत्कटाः। विषाणैश्चापरे जघ्नुर्ममृदुश्चापरे भृशम्॥
target: O monarch, the most furious elephants, after having crushed large numbers of horses to run away from the field, slaughtered some of them with their tusks and crushed down others most severely.

source: प्रतर्दनस्य पुत्रस्तु वत्सो नाम महाबलः॥ वत्सैः संवर्धितो गोष्ठे स मां रक्षतु पार्थिवः।
target: Pratradana's highly powerful son named Vatsa has been brought up among calves in a cowpen. Let that Kshatriya protect me.

source: साङ्गोपनिषदो वेदानधीते द्विजसत्तमः। स वृक्षमूले कस्मिंश्चिद् वेदानुच्चारयन् स्थितः॥
target: That foremost of the Brahmanas had finished the study of the Vedas with the Angas and the Upanishadas. On a certain day, he was reciting the Vedas, seated on the root of a tree.

source: भग्नचक्रान् रथान् केचिदहरंस्तुरगा रणे॥ रथाधु केचिदादाय दिशो दश विबभ्रमुः।
target: Some horses were seen to drag cars with broken wheels, while some ran on all sides, carrying the broken cars.

source: ततो वेदविदस्तात सदस्याः सर्व एव तम्। राजानमूचुः सहिता लभतां ब्राह्मणो वरम्॥
target: Thereupon, all the Sadasyas, learned in the Vedas, told the king in one voice, in the Vedas, told the king in one voice, “Let the Brahmana receive the boon (asked by him.")

source: सोद्यं ब्राह्म तपस्तेपे संहितां संयतो जपन्। तस्य वर्षसहस्रं तु नियमेन तथा गतम्॥
target: He practised, silently reciting the Gayatri, severe austerities for attaining to Brahma. A thousand years passed away while he was engaged in the observance of vows and fasts.

source: अयं श्यामो महाबाहुः सिंहस्कन्धो महाद्युतिः। कम्बुग्रीवः पुष्कराक्षो भर्ता युक्तो भवेन्मम॥
target: She thought, “His colour is like the heated gold; he is mighty armed, he is leonine shouldered, he is greatly effulgent, he is conch necked and he is lotus eyed, he is fit to be my husband.

source: गृहाण धर्मराजं वा जहि वा त्वं धनंजयम्॥ भीमसेनं च राधेय माद्रीपुत्रौ यमावपि।
target: Either attack the pious Yudhishthira or kill Arjuna and Bhima, O son of Radha and the twin sons of Madri.

source: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच ध्वजान् बहुविधाकारान् भ्राजमानानति श्रिया। पार्थानां मामकानां च तान् ममाचक्ष्व संजय॥

source: एष वेदनिधिः श्रीमानेष वै तपसो निधिः। एष योगश्च सांख्यं च ब्रह्म चाग्र्यं हविर्विभुः॥
target: The Supreme God, endued with every prosperity, is the receptacle of the Vedas. He is the receptacle of Penances also. The powerful Hari is Yoga. He is the embodiment of the Sankhya philosophy. He is that foremost Brahma of which we hear.

source: परमध्यात्मकुशलमध्यात्मगतिनिश्चयम्। मैत्रावरुणिमासीनमभिवाद्य कृताञ्जलिः॥ स्वक्षरं प्रश्रितं वाक्यं मधुरं चाप्यनुल्बणम्। पप्रच्छर्षिवरं राजा करालजनकः पुरा॥ भगवश्रोतुमिच्छामि परं ब्रह्म सनातनम्। यस्मान्न पुनरावृत्तिमाप्नुवन्ति मनीषिणः॥

source: अग्नेरावेदयन्शापं क्रियासहरमेव च। भृगुणा वै महाभागः शप्तोऽग्निः कारणान्तरे॥

target: He who practises severe austerities for a century, and he who abstains from ineat, are both equally meritorious. This is my opinion.

source: अस्मिन् मुहूर्ते सत्यं वा मिथ्या वैतद् भविष्यति। गृह्णातु च गदां यो वै योत्स्यतेऽद्य मया सह॥
target: Within this very hour, these words will either be proved or falsified. Let him amongst you take up the mace that will fight with me.

source: ते श्रान्तवाहना दूता विकृष्टेन सता पथा। गिरिव्रजं पुरवरं शीघ्रमासेदुरञ्जसा ॥
target: And with their vehicles fatigued, the ambassadors, on account of the great distance of the way; speedily reached that best of cities, Girivraja.

source: अनीकं दशसाहस्रं रथानां वातरंहसाम्। अष्टादश सहस्राणि कुञ्जराणां तरस्विनाम्।।३० चतुर्दश सहस्राणि सारोहाणां च वाजिनाम्। पूर्णे शतसहस्रे द्वे राक्षसानां पदातिनाम्॥ दिवसस्याष्टभागेन शरैरग्निशिखोपमैः। हतान्येकेन रामेण रक्षसां कामरूपिणाम्॥

source: हैरण्यांस्त्रिनलोत्सेधान् पर्वतानेकविंशतिम्। ब्राह्मणेभ्यो ददौ राजा योऽश्वमेधे महामखे॥
