source: वासुदेव उवाच ये लोका मम विमला: सकृद् विभाता ब्रह्माद्यैः सुरवृषभैरपीष्यमाणाः। तान् क्षिप्रं व्रज सतताग्निहोत्रयाजिन् मत्तुल्यो भव गरुडोत्तमाङ्गयानः॥
target: Vasudeva said You are ever devoted to the performance of sacrifices and Agnihotras; therefore repair quickly to those holy regions of mine that constantly burn with effulgence and that are coveted by the foremost of gods withi Brahman as their head and becoming equal to myself by you carried on the back of Garuda.

source: तस्य तल्लाघवं पार्थो नामृष्यत महाबलः॥ तस्मै बाणाशिलाधौतान् प्रसन्नाग्रानजिह्मगान्। प्राहिणोत् सूतपुत्राय त्रिशतं शत्रुतापनः॥ विव्याध चैन संरब्धो बाणेनैकेन वीर्यवान्। सव्ये भुजाग्रे बलवान् नाराचेन हसन्निव॥
target: The mighty car-warrior (Partha) witnessing this nimbleness on his part could not endure it. That scorcher of foes, then, shot thirty arrows sharpened on stone, having flaming points and coursing straight, at the charioteer's son. That puissant and mighty one, then, as if with a smile, pierced him angrily with another long arrow in the end of his left arms. From that hand of his which was (thus) pierced with (great) force, his bow fell down.

source: भूतशर्मा क्षेमशर्मा करकाशश्च वीर्यवान्। कलिङ्गाः सिंहलाः प्राच्याः शूराभीरा दशेरकाः॥ शका यवनकाम्बोजास्तथा हंसपथाश्च ये। ग्रीवायां शूर सेनाश्च दरदा मद्रकेकया:॥ गजाश्वरथपत्त्योघास्तस्थुः परमदंशिताः।
target: Kritavarman and the effulgent Gautama formed its eyes, Bhutasharman, Kshemasharman, the puissant Karakasha, the Kalingas, the Singhalas, the Easterners, the Sudras, the Ahiras, the Kambojas, as also the Hansapathas. The Surasenas, the Madras, the Kekayas, the Dronas, with hundreds and thousands of elephants, steeds chariots and foot-soldiers, formed its neck.

source: तं सम्मथितसर्वाङ्गं मांसपिण्डोपमं कृतम्। कृष्णाया दर्शयामास भीमसेनो महाबलः॥
target: The highly-powerful Bhimasena then showed him to Krishna; all his limbs were crushed and he was reduced into a ball of flesh.

source: सैन्धवं निहतं मेने फाल्गुनेन महात्मना॥ ततो वादित्रघोषेण स्वान् योधान् पर्यहर्षयत्।
target: Considered the ruler of the Sindhus to be slain by the high-souled Phalguna. Then he son imparted delight to his own warriors by means of the sound of his musical instruments.

source: संवर्त उवाच कथमस्मि त्वया ज्ञातः केन वा कथितोऽस्मि ते। एतदाचक्ष्व मे तत्त्वमिच्छसे चेन्मम प्रियम्॥
target: How nave you come to know me, and who has referred you to ine, do you tell this to me truly, if you desire me to do what is good to you.

source: महेश्वरश्च लोकानां महतामीश्वरच सः। बहुभिर्विविधै रूपैर्विश्वं व्याप्तमिदं जगत्। तस्य देवस्य यद् वक्त्रं समुद्रे वडवामुखम्॥
target: Because he is the master of the vast universe, therefore he is called Maheshvara. The whole universe is pervaded by him in various forms. His mouth roars and burns the waters of the sea in the form of the huge mare's head.

source: तं तु सम्प्रेक्ष्य पुत्रस्ते दुर्मुखः शत्रुकर्षणः। प्रियं चिकीर्षुद्रोणस्य धृष्टद्युम्नमवारयत्॥
target: Seeing this, your son Durmukha that grinder of foes, desirous of doing an act agreeable to Drona, set himself to oppose Dhrishtadyumna.

source: तयोः संवदतोरेवं तथैवापन्नयोर्द्वयोः॥ क्षयं जगाम सा रात्रिर्लोमशं त्वाविशद् भयम्।
target: While the mouse and the cat were thus conversing, both in serious danger, the night gradually passed away. A great fear, however, possessed the heart of the cat.

source: तेषामापततां शब्दस्तीव्र आसीद् विशाम्पते॥ उवृत्तानां यथा वृष्ट्या सागराणां भयावहः।
target: O king, the army, dashing impetuously against the enemies, caused a tumult resembling the terrible noise made by many oceans swollen with rams.

source: कदर्यकलुषा बुद्धिर्जायते शस्त्रसेवनात्। पुनर्गत्वा त्वयोध्यायां क्षत्रधर्मं चरिष्यसि ॥
target: From following arms, one's sense gets befouled and deformed. Again going to Ayodhyā, You will observe the duties of Kastriyas.

source: वातेन कुन्त्यां बलवान् सुजात: शूरस्तरस्वी द्विषतां निहन्ता। सत्ये चधर्मे च रतः सदैव पराक्रमे शत्रुभिरप्रधृष्यः॥
target: But that mighty hero was begotten by Vayu in the womb of Kunti. He was heroic and courageous; that slayer of foes was ever devoted to virtue and truth. He was incapable of being vanquished by any enemy through prowess.

source: ततश्चित्राङ्गदधरं भर्तारं सान्वपश्यत॥ विमानस्थं सुकृतिभिः पूज्यमानं महात्मभिः।
target: She then saw her husband bedecked with bracelets, seated on a (celestial) car, and worshipped of many great and meritorious beings standing around him.

source: ये दोषा यादृशाश्चैव द्विजयज्ञोपघातके। विक्रये चापहारे च ते दोषा वै स्मृताः प्रभो॥
target: O you of great power, those sins and those kinds of faults that have been said to attach to one which obstructs a Brahmana's sacrifice, are said to attach to the sale and the theft of kine.

source: बलिषष्ठेन शुल्केन दण्डेनाथापराधिनाम्। शास्त्रानीतेन लिप्सेथा वेतनेन धनागमम्॥
target: With a sixth part, making a fair calculation of the produce of the soil, as his tribute, with fines and forfeitures collected from offenders, with the other taxes, according to the scriptures, upon merchants and traders in exchange for the safety granted to them, a king should fill his treasury.

source: मही महीजाः पवनोऽन्तरिक्षं जलौकसश्चैव जलं दिवं च। स्तदुच्यतां मे भगवन् पुराणम्॥
target: Tell me also this old history, viz., whence have the Earth, all earthly objects, wind, sky aquatic animals, water, heaven, and the dwellers of heaven, all originated.

source: ततः स योजनशतं प्रविष्टो राक्षसाधिपः। देवतानां बलं सर्वं शरवरवाकिरत्॥
target: Thereupon having entered into the army up to a hundred leagues the lord of Rākşasas overpowered the celestial host with a downpour of shafts.

source: दुष्यन्ताद् भरतो जज्ञे विद्वाञ्छाकुन्तलो नृपः। तस्माद् भरतवंशस्य विप्रतस्थे महद् यशः॥
target: Dushyanta begot on his wife, Shakuntala, a learned son, named Bharata who became king. From him was the Bharata dynasty and from his spread its great fame.

source: एवं चित्रमभूद् युद्धं तस्य तैः सह भारत॥ उत्थायोत्थाय हि यथा देहिनामिन्द्रयैर्विभो।
target: That battle between him and them was indeed wonderful because it resembled the struggles, O king, between men and their Senses.

source: अल्पावशेषो दिवसो नृवीर विघातयस्वाद्य रिपुं शरौघैः। दिनक्षयं प्राप्य नरप्रवीर ध्रुवोहि नः कर्ण जयो भविष्यति॥
target: O foremost hero among men, very little remains of the day. Thwart the enemy now with the waves of your arrows. O foremost of men, if we can safely reach the expire of the day, victory will certainly be ours.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच स्वागतं देवकीमातः स्वागतं ते धनंजय। प्रियं मे दर्शनं गाढं युवयोरच्युतार्जुनौ॥
target: Yudhishthira said Welcome to you, Devaki's son and Dhananjaya, highly agreeable to me is the pleasure of you too, O Arjuna, O Achyuta.

source: या पुत्रं पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य प्रवासयति निघृणा। कस्तां प्राप्य सुखं जीवेदधा दुष्टचारिणीम्॥
target: What happiness can be ours by living with that wicked and unrighteous one who lost to every sense of shame is bent upon exiling the son of the foremost of kings?

source: धनं धनेश्वरस्येव हृत्वा पार्थस्य मे सुतः। मधुप्रेप्सुरिवाबुद्धिः प्रपातं नावबुध्यते॥
target: Having robbed Yudhishthira the son of Pritha's who is like the Lord of wealth, of his wealth, my foolish son sees not the impending fall, like a searcher of honey (on the mountains).

source: ततो भूतोपसृष्टेव वेपमाना पुनः पुनः। धरण्यां गतसत्त्वेव कौसल्या सूतमब्रवीत्॥
target: Then like one possessed by an evil spirit, and trembling again and again, Kausalyä lying down on the ground like one dead, spoke to the charioteer, saying.

source: तं विना कैकयीपुत्रं भरतं धर्मचारिणाम्। न मे स्नानं बहुमतं वस्त्राण्याभरणानि च॥
target: Without Bharata the son of Kaikeyi, ever performing pious rites, I do not value bathing or these clothes and ornaments.

source: नापश्यम रजो भौमं कश्मलेनाभिसंवृताः। रात्रौ वंशवनस्येव दह्यमानस्य पर्वते॥
target: Stupefied with unconsciousness as we were we did not see any dust on the earth. Like the (creaking sounds) of a burning bamboo forest on a mountain during a night.

source: दृष्टं दुर्योधनैतत् ते यथा पार्थेन धीमता। जलस्य धारा जनिता शीतस्यामृतगन्धिनः॥
target: You have seen, even now, O Duryodhana, how the intelligent Partha created that jet of water, cool and fraught with nectarious fragrance.

source: पझ्यामापततस्तस्य शरवृष्टिं समासृजत्॥ नुकलोऽप्यग्रसत् ता वै चर्मणा लघुविक्रमः।
target: As, however, he rushed on foot, his antagonist discharged a shower of arrows upon him. The highly active Nakula received that downpour of arrows on his shield.

source: नित्येव कृष्णश्च ततः कृतार्थः। एवंरूपे वासुदेवेऽप्रमेये महाबले गुणसम्पत् सदैव॥
target: Nor shall arms stick on your body. Krishna, too, at this considered himself gratificd. Such are ever the virtues of the son of Vasudeva of immeasurable fame and the great strength.

source: द्रोणपुत्रं च कर्णं च भूरिश्रवसमेव च। शकुनि सौबलं चैव बाह्रीकं च महाबलम्॥
target: The son of Drona, Bhurishravas, Shakuni, the son of Subala and Balhika endued with great strength.

source: आदित्योदयसम्प्राप्ते विधिमन्त्रपुरस्कृतम्। ददाति काञ्चनं यो वै दुःस्वप्नं प्रतिहन्ति सः॥
target: That person who, at sunrise, makes a gift of gold according to the ordinance and with proper Mantras, succeeds in warding off the evils foreshadowed by ominous dreams.

source: निपातिते शान्तनवे महारथे दिवाकरे भूतलमास्थिते यथा। न पार्थिवाः सोढुमलं धनंजयं गिरिप्रवोढारमिवालिनं दुमाः॥
target: When like the sun dropping down on the earth, that foremost of car-warriors, the son of Shantanu has fallen, the monarchs (of the Kuru army) are hardly capable of withstanding Dhananjaya, like trees unable to withstand the hurricane that uproots even the hills.

source: प्रास्फुरन्नयनं चास्य वाम बाहुस्तथैव च। विमनाश्चाभवद् युद्धे दृष्ट्वा पार्षतमग्रतः॥
target: His eyes and his left arms began to tremble. And beholding Prishata's son before him, he became cheerless.

source: संजय उवाच एतत् स नरशार्दूलो नामृष्यत तवात्मजः। सलिलान्तर्गतः श्वभ्रे महानाग इव श्वसन्॥
target: Sanjaya continued That foremost of men, your son, could not brook those words of Yudhishthira. He sighed heavily from within the water like a huge snake from with its hole.

source: भीतान् भग्नांश्च सम्प्रेक्ष्य भयं भूयोऽभिवर्धते। प्रभग्ना सहसा राजन् दिशो विद्रवते चमूः॥
target: Secing soldiers struck with panic and flying, the panic spreads also in other directions. O king, in such cases the whole army is soon broken up and all fly in all directions.

source: प्रतिदास्ये च भवतां सर्वं चाहं भयक्षये। नारयः प्रतिदास्यन्ति यद्धरेयुर्बलादितः॥
target: When the danger passes away, I will repay you what I now take. Our foes, however, will not return what they (if unopposed) will take from you by force.

source: वरं दत्त्वा मम प्रीतः पश्चाद् विकृतवानसि। आशाभङ्गं न कुर्वन्ति भक्तस्याः कथंचन॥
target: Pleased with me, you accorded me, a boon; but now you seem unwilling to verify your words. Noble men do never falsify the hopes of those who are devoted to them."

source: तेषामन्यतमोत्सेके विधानमुपदिश्यते। हर्षेण बाध्यते शोको हर्षः शोकेन बाध्यते॥
target: If one of these reigns supreme over the rest, remedies have been laid down. Grief is checked by joy, and joy is checked by grief.

source: कीर्तिं पुण्यं यशो लोकान् प्राप्स्यसे राजसत्तम॥ सर्वे तस्यादृता लोका यस्यैते त्रय आदृताः।
target: By acting thus, O best of kings, you may acquire fame, merit, honour, and blessed regions hereafter. He, who honours these three is honoured of all the worlds.

source: यज्ञार्थानि हि सृष्टानि यथार्था श्रूयते श्रुतिः। एवं पूर्वतरा: सर्वे प्रवृत्ताश्चैव मानवाः॥
target: This Shruti, quite of a piece with the truth, is heard that all things have been created for the celebration of Sacrifice. It was thus that all men of yore undertook the celebration of sacrifices.

source: द्वन्द्वानि तत्र यान्यासन् संसक्तानि पुरोदयात्। तान्येवाभ्युदिते सूर्ये समसज्जन्त भारत॥
target: The same soldiers, that were engaged with one another before sun rise, once more fought with each other, OBharata, after the sun rise.

source: येषु भारं समासाद्य राज्ये मतिमकुर्महि। ते संत्यज्य तनूर्याताः शूरा ब्रह्मविदां गतिम्॥
target: They, upon whom we had laid all burdens and been enjoying the kingdoin, have all repaired to regions of blessedness attainable by persons conversant with the knowledge of Brahma, casting off their bodies.

source: यदि मे याचमानस्य त्यागमेव करिष्यसि। सरथोऽग्नि प्रवेक्ष्यामि त्यक्तमात्र इह त्वया॥
target: But if you forsake me who beseech you, I will as soon as left by you, enter into fire along with the car.

source: भासि विद्युदिवाभ्रेषु शंस मे कासि कस्य वा। न हि ते मानुषं रूपं भूषणैरपि वर्जितम्॥
target: Do you blaze like lightning in the midst of clouds? O! tell me who are you and to whom do you belong? Surely your beauty is not human, although you are not decked in ornaments.

source: मिथः कृत्यं च तस्मै च आदाय वसु गच्छतु। वृद्धिं च परमां ब्रूयात् त्वत्संयोगोद्भवां तथा॥ सम्प्रीयमाणं त्वां ब्रूयाद् राजन् दुर्योधनं तथा। असकृद् द्रुपदे चैव धृष्टद्युम्ने च भारत॥
target: Let him take costly presents with him for both the bridegroom and the bride and let him speak to him (Draupada) the increase of your power and dignity that has been secured by this alliance. O king, let him say to Draupada and Dhrishtadyumna that both you and Duryodhana have become exceedingly glad by all that has happened.

source: ततः प्रभूति भद्रं ते गवां द्वैधीकृताः खुराः। हयानां च स्तना राजंस्तदाप्रभृति नाभवन्॥ पीडितानां बलवता रुद्रेणाद्भुतकर्मणा।
target: May you be blessed; from that time forward the hoofs of all animals belonging to the bevine species came to be cloven (into two parts). O monarch, froin that time also the teats of horses, that were highly oppressed by that most powered Rudra. performing miraculous deeds, ceased to appear.

source: कर्मैतत् पार्थ शक्रेण यमेन धनदेन च। दुष्करं समरे यत् ते कृमद्येति मे मतिः॥
target: 'I think, O Partha, the feat you have today achieved in battle is difficult of being performed even by Indra or Yama or Kubera himself.

source: पाण्डवैस्तु महाराज धार्तराष्ट्री महाचमूः। पुनः पुनरथो वीरैः संयुगे जितकाशिभिः॥
target: Your great army was again and again routed by the Pandava warriors desirous of victory.

source: तस्माद्भवन्तः पश्यन्तु पतितं शोकसागरे॥ नहि पश्याम्यहं भूतं किंचिद्दुःखमतोऽधिकम्।
target: Do you therefore perceive into what great abyss of sorrow and ill-fame I have fallen. Up to this time I have never experienced such a mighty grief.

source: कृत्वा नसुकरं कर्म गतौ स्वर्गमितोऽनघ। तथान्ये पुरुषव्याघ्राः परैर्विनिहता युधि॥
target: Those two foremost of persons, who were very old, were slaughtered by stratagem in the field. O sinless one, they repaired to heaven from here, after having performed the most arduous tasks; as also other foremost of men, having been slain by the enemies in battle, departed to paradise.

source: हते भीष्मे तु संदध्याच्छिवं स्यादिह माधव। न च तत् कृतवान् मूढो धार्तराष्ट्रः सुबालिशः॥
target: If peace had been made after Bhishma's fall, O Madhava, everything would have fared well. The foolish and wicked-minded Duryodhana, however, did not make peace.

source: तस्मिन्प्रविष्टे रजनीचरेन्द्रे महाबले दानवदेवशत्रौ। हरीन्विशल्यान्सह लक्ष्मणेन चकार रामः परमाहवाग्रे॥
target: On that foe of the deities and the Dănavas-the puissant lord of the night-rangers-entering (into Lankā), Rāma rendered the monkeys along with Lakşmaņa hale in that fierce conflict.

source: पश्य सैन्यानि वार्ष्णेय द्राव्यमाणानि कौरवैः। द्रोणकर्णी तु संयत्तौ पश्य युद्धे महारथौ॥
target: Behold, O scion of the Vrishni race, my troops routed by the Kouravas! Behold the two mighty car-warriors, Drona and Karna fight, yonder, to the best of their abilities.

source: वेदांश्च ब्रह्मचर्येण न्यायतः प्रार्थयामहे। न्यायेनोत्तरकालं च गृहेभ्यो निःसृता वयम्॥ धर्मदृष्टैर्विधिद्वारैस्तपस्तप्स्यामहे वयम्। भवतः सम्यगिष्टा तु बुद्धिहिंसाविवर्जिता॥
target: We should worship the celestials, practicing Brahmacharya by lawful mean. Completing the period of Brahmacharya we have come out of our house, observing lawful methods. That that your suffer any understanding, which is freed from the desire of inflicting any kind of injury on others is approved by us.

source: एवं व्यूढान्यनीकानि कौरवेयेण धीमता। अक्षौहिण्यो दशैका च संख्याताः सप्त चैव ह॥
target: In this way was the army of the intelligent Kaurava arrayed by him; there were seven and eleven Akshauhini of troops altogether.

source: अनेन हि समाविष्टो वृत्रो धर्मभृतां वरः॥ व्यजृभत ततः शक्रस्तस्मै वज्रमवासृजत्।
target: It was by him that Vritra, that foremost of virtuous persons, was possessed when he yawned. It was then that Shakra discharged his thunderbolt at him.

source: यदाश्रौषं देवराजेन दत्तां दिव्यां शक्तिं व्यंसितां माधवेन। घटोत्कचे राक्षसे घोररूपे तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय॥
target: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that through the machinations of Krishna, the celestial weapon Shakti, given to Karna by Indra, had been hurdled against Ghatotkacha of a dreadful form.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच धन्यानामुत्तमं दाक्ष्यं धनानामुत्तमं श्रुतम्। लाभानां श्रेय आरोग्यं सुखानां तुष्टिरुत्तमा॥
target: Yudhishthira replied Skillfulness is the best of all praise-worthy objects. Knowledge (of the (Vedas) is the best of all (sorts of) wealth. Of all gain health is the most important one. And of all (sorts of) happiness contentment is the best.

source: पाण्डवानां तु सैन्येषु नास्ति कश्चित् स भारत। दधार योरणे बाणान् द्रोणचापच्युतान् प्रभो॥
target: There was none, O Bharata, in the host of the Pandavas who could bear the arrows in that battle, shot, O lord, from the bow of Drona.

source: अथ देवाः समागम्य विष्णुमूचुः प्रजापतिम्। एको योऽर्हति मत्र्येभ्यः श्रेष्ठ्यं वै तं समादिश॥
target: Then, approaching that lord of creatures, viz., Vishnu, the god said to him,-Point out, O god, that one among men who deserves to reign supreme over the rest.

source: कृत्वातिपातकं कर्म यो दद्यादन्नमर्थिने। ब्राह्मणाय विशेषेण न स पापेन मुह्यते॥
target: That person who having committed even a heinous crime makes a gift of food to one who solicits, or to a Brahmana in special, is never stupefied by that heinous sin.

source: न भीतोऽस्मि न मूढोऽस्मि नोपजप्तोऽस्मि शत्रुभिः न प्रमत्तो न निःस्नेहो विस्मृता न च सत्क्रिया॥
target: I am not afraid, nor stupefied, nor have I been bribed by the foe, nor am I negligent. And I have not forgotten your affection or your good offices.

source: अवश्यमेव कर्तव्यं राज्ञा बलवतापि हि। ब्रह्म वर्धयति क्षत्रं क्षत्रतो ब्रह्म वर्धते। एवं राज्ञा विशेषेण पूज्या ब्राह्मणाः सदा॥
target: The Brahmana contributes to the advancement of the Kshatriya, Kshatriya, and the Kshatriya to that of the Brahmana. Brahmana should, therefore, be especially and always adored by kings.'

source: मवभोत्स्यन्ते भरतानां चराश्च। अन्यांश्चरेथास्तावतोऽब्दांस्तथा त्वं निश्चित्य तत् प्रतिजानीहि पार्थ॥
target: O sire, O son of Pritha, (if during that period) spies of the Bharatas, hearing of you, become successful in discovering you, you shall then have again to live in the forest for the same period passing once more the last year in secrecy. Reflecting on this, pledge yourself to it.

source: अकार्यकरणाद् भीतः कार्याणां च विवर्जनात्। अकाले मन्त्रभेदाच्च येन मायेन्न तत् पिबेत्॥
target: He by whom is feared the doing of improper acts or the omission of proper acts or the premature disclosure of his intentions, should not drink that which inebriates.

source: व्यपेतमन्युर्व्यपनीतपाप्मा विहृत्य यत्रेच्छसि तत्र कामम्। ततः प्रसिद्धं प्रथमं विशोकः प्रपत्स्यसे नागपुरं सुराष्ट्रम्॥
target: (During the appointed period) abandoning your sorrow and getting rid of your sin, wander at pleasure wherever you like; and then with a merry heart you will enter the renowned city of Hastina and also your principality.”

source: तरसा बुद्धिपूर्वं वा निग्राह्या एव शत्रवः। पापैः सह न संदध्याद् राज्यं पण्यं न कारयेत्॥
target: By power and policy should the king subjugate his foes. He must not allow sin to be committed in his kingdom, but should cause virtue to be practised.

source: त्रयो गुल्मा गणो नाम वाहिनी तु गणास्त्रयः। स्मृतास्तिस्रस्तु वाहिन्यः पृतनेति विचक्षणैः॥
target: Three Gulmas make a Gana, three Ganas a Vahini, three Vahinis taking together, form a Pritana.

source: राक्षसं शङ्कमानस्तं विकृष्य बलवद् धनुः। अभ्यधावत काकुत्स्थस्ततस्तं सहलक्ष्मणः॥
target: Suspecting him to be a Rakshasa, the descendant of Kakustha drawing his bow powerfully, rushed at him with Lakshmana.

source: आपतत्सु रथौधेषु प्रभूतगजवाजिषु। नासम्भ्रमत् तदा पार्थस्तदस्य पुरुषानति॥
target: Though myriads of chariots and thousands upon thousands of elephants and steeds assailed him, yet Partha experienced no fear; but every moment obtained advantages over his enemies.

source: बभ्रुकौशेयवर्णास्तु सुवर्णवरमालिनः। ऊहुरम्लानमनसश्चेकितानं हयोत्तमाः॥
target: Excellent steeds of the hue of yellow silk, decorated with beautiful chains of gold cheerfully bore Chekitana.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच प्रविश्याथ गृहं तस्याश्चरणावभिवाद्य च। आचख्यौ तत् समासेन यद् वृत्तं कुरुसंसदि॥
target: Vaishampayana said Then having entered her abode and saluted her feet he described in brief to her what had happened in that assembly of the Kurus.

source: यत्राधर्मो धर्मरूपाणि धत्ते धर्मः कृत्स्नो दृश्यतेऽधर्मरूपः। बिभ्रद् धर्मो धर्मरूपं तथा च विद्वांसस्तं सम्प्रपश्यन्ति बुद्ध्या॥
target: Where vice assumes the appearance of virtue and virtue appears completely as vice and virtue appears in its own form wise men should distinguish it from virtue by their intelligence.

source: द्रोणस्य च महाराज संजयानां च सर्वशः। तमसा चावृते लोके न प्राज्ञायत किंचन॥ सैन्येन रजसा चैव समन्तादुत्थितेन ह। नरस्याश्वस्य नागस्य समसजत शोणितम्॥
target: Of great king, between Drona (on one hand) and all the Srinjayas (on the other). In consequence of the night being enveloped in darkness and of the dust raised by the soldiers nothing could be discerned. The blood of men, horses and elephant mingled together.

source: प्रविश्य सीता बहुवृक्षखण्डां तां राक्षसेन्द्रस्य विहारभूमिम्। संप्रेक्ष्य संचिन्त्य च राजपुत्रौ परं विषादं समुपाजगाम्॥
target: Entering that sporting-ground of the Raksasa lord abounding in woody tracts, Sītā, having beheld those princes and reflected on them, became subject to a mighty grief.

source: धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्रेण सामात्येन जनार्दन। यथा च संजयो राज्ञा मन्त्रं रहसि श्रावितः॥
target: By the son of Dhritarashtra within ministers, O Janardana; and what message was covered through Sanjaya in private by the king.

source: स तुङ्गं शत शृङ्गं च शर्यातिवनमेव च। पुण्यमश्वशिरःस्थानं स्थानमाथर्वणस्य च।॥
target: He then reached the Sutunga and the Shatashringa hills and the woods known by the name of Sharyati. Then he went to the holy place called Ashvashiras and also to the one known by the name of Artharvana.

source: आदित्यं पातयिष्यामि सनक्षत्रं महीतले॥ शतक्रतुं वधिष्यामि पास्यामि वरुणालयम्।
target: I shall bring down the very welkin garnished with stars. And I shall slay Satakratu and drink up the abode itself of Varuna.

source: विशिरस्कानथो कायान् दृष्ट्वा ह्येताननिन्दितान्। मुह्यन्त्यनुगता नार्यो विदेहानि शिरांसि च॥ शिरः कायेन संधाय प्रेक्षमाणा विचेतसः। अपश्यन्त्योऽपरं तत्र नेदमस्येति दुःखिताः॥
target: Joining particular heads with particular trunks, those ladies, beside themselves with grief, are again discovering their mistakes, and saying,-This is not this one's—and are weeping more bitterly.

source: राजर्षीणामुदाराणामाहवेष्वनिवर्तिनाम्। सर्वधर्मप्रधानानां त्वं गतिर्मधुसूदन॥
target: O Slayer of Madhu, you are the sole refuge of the royal sages, who are of illustrious nature, who never turn back from the fight and who are devoted to all their duties.

source: विमूढास्मि कृतानेन न मे स्वास्थ्यं यथा पुरा। विह्वला चास्मि भगवंश्चेतो नष्टं च मेऽनघ॥
target: Indeed, I am overcome with weakness by this seed of yours. The health I had in days before, is no longer mine. I have been greatly agitated, O illustrious one, and my heart is dead within me, O sinless one.

source: तथा तेषूपविष्टेषु समाजग्मुर्महर्षयः। शतयूपप्रभृतयः कुरुक्षेत्रनिवासिनः॥
target: After they had sat themselves down, many great Rishis, viz., Shatayupa, and others, who were inhabitants of Kurukshetra came there.

source: यदा हि बहवो वृद्धा गुणवन्तो बहुश्रुता॥ परिप्रक्ष्यन्ति काकुत्स्थं वक्ष्यामीह कथं तदा। कैकेय्या क्लिश्यमानेन पुत्रः प्रव्राजितो मया॥
target: And when many aged folks, endowed with virtues, and accomplished in various lore will ask me concerning Kākutstha, what then shall i say to them, 'Sore pressed by Kaikeyſ, have I banished Rama?

source: धारणाद् धर्ममित्याहुर्धर्मेण विधृताः प्रजाः। यः स्याद् धारणसंयुक्तः स धर्म इति निश्चयः॥
target: Righteousness was declared for preventing creatures from injuring one another. Therefore, Righteousness is that which prevents injury to creatures.

source: एतावदुक्त्वा भीमस्तु हर्षेण महता युतः। बाहुशब्देन पृथिवीं कम्पयामास पाण्डवः॥
target: Having spoken thus much and filled with joy, Pandu's son Bhima, caused the earth to tremble with the sound of his arm-strokes.

source: हाहाकारो महानासीत् पुत्राणां ते विशाम्पते। दृष्ट्वा शक्तिं महाघोरां मृत्योर्दण्डसमप्रभाम्॥
target: O king, then loud cries of “Oh” and “Alas" rose among your sons when they saw that fearful dart which was as effulgent as the rod of death.

source: स करिष्यति ते काम पितृणां हितकाम्यया। एतच्छ्रुत्वा ततो राजन् महाराजो भगीरथः॥ कैलास पर्वतं गत्वा तोषयामास शंकरम्। तपस्तीव्रमुपागम्य कालयोगेन केनचित्॥
target: He will do what you desire for your ancestors." O king, having heard this, the great king Bhagiratha, went to the Kailasa mountain and gratified Shankara (Shiva). At the expiration of a certain time which he passed in severe asceticism.

source: तुष्टाव प्रणतश्चैव सिरसा मधुसूदनम्। विमलक्षौमसंवीतो वाचयामास स द्विजान्॥
target: And clad in a clear silk dress, he with bended head hymned the destroyer of Madhu, and made the regenerate ones perform the Svastivácana ceremony.

source: ततः परीक्षामश्वानां चक्रे राजन् स बाहुकः। अश्वशालामुपागम्य भागासुरिनृपाज्ञया॥
target: O king, thereupon Bahuka went, at the behest of the royal son of Vangasura, to the stables; and there he examined the horses.

source: तौ पुनः संन्यवर्तेतां प्राणधूतपणे रणे॥ निपीडयन्तौ बाणौधैः परस्परममर्षिणौ।
target: Those two (warriors), who resisted each other, baffled the arrowy showers of each other and could not tolerate each other, were engaged in the game of battle in which the wager was life itself.

source: अहमेव धनुष्पाणिर्गोप्ता समरमूर्धनि। यावत् प्राणान् धरिष्यामि तावद् योत्स्ये निशाचरैः॥
target: And myself bow in hand, stationed at the van of the array, will battle with the rangers of the night as long as life is spared to me.

source: किं नावबुध्यसे क्रूरे नियतं बन्धुसंश्रयम्। ज्येष्ठं पितृसमं रामं कौसल्यायात्मसम्भवम्॥
target: Does you not, O tortuous one, know that that one sprung from Kucalya's, self, my eldest brother Räma, who is like a father to me, has ever been the refuge of his friends?

source: युष्माकं राघवोऽरण्ये योगक्षेमं विधास्यति। सीता नारीजनस्यास्य योगक्षेमं करिष्यति॥
target: In the forest Rāghava will attain for you the unattainable and protect what is attained; and Sītā being a female will do the same for these (women.)

source: वाजपेयेन यज्ञेन तर्पयन्ति सुरेश्वरम्। तेषामध्वरजं धूमं स्वर्गद्वारमुपस्थितम्॥
target: Who were gratifying the lord of the gods by the performance of the sacrificial ceremony known Vajapeya. And the smoke proceeding from that sacrificial ceremony had gone to the very gates of heaven.

source: रामलक्ष्मणगुप्ता सा सुग्रीवेण च वाहिनी।। बभूव दुर्धर्षतरा सर्वैरपि सुरासुरैः॥
target: That host protected by Rāma, Lakşmaņa and Sugrīva, shall become exceedingly hard to combat even by the Asuras and gods.

source: गोवर्धनो नाम वटः सुभद्रं नाम चत्वरम्। एतद् राजकुलद्वारमाकुमारात् स्मराम्यहम्॥
target: I remember from my youth that a slaughter ground for kine and the cellars for wine mark out the gates of the palaces of Balhika kings.

source: ततस्तु सा चारुदती शुचिस्मिता विनाकृता बन्धुजनेन मैथिली। अपश्यती राधवलक्ष्मणाबुभौ विवर्षक्त्रा फयभारपीडिता॥
target: Then oppressed with the load of fear, Sītā of luminous smiles, Mithila's daughter, bereft of her friends-not beholding either Rāma or Lakşmaņa, became pale of countenance.

source: त्वां चाप्यद्य वधिष्यामि सह पुत्रं सबान्धवम्। तिष्ठेदानीं रणे यत्तः कौरवोऽसि महारथः॥
target: I will today destroy you also together with your sons and friends, you are a descendant of the Kuru race and are endued with great prowess. Now remain carefully in battle.

source: कन्दरांश्च नितम्बांश्च नदीश्चाद्भुतदर्शनाः। ददर्श तान् भीमसुता पतिमन्वेषती तदा॥
target: That daughter of Bhima saw, when roaming in quest of her husband, many caverns and ridges and rivulets of amazing sight.

source: तथैव स गिरिभूर्यः प्रपुष्पितलताद्रुमः। सपक्षिगणसंघुष्टः सश्वापदसरीसृपः॥
target: That mountain thereupon once becaine bedecked with flowering trees and creepers, and once more echoed with the notes and cries of birds and deer and animals of prey and reptiles.

source: श्रीश्च बुद्धिश्च तेजश्च विभूतिश्च प्रतापिनी। स्वाध्याये चैव माहात्म्यं विपुलं प्रतिपत्स्यते॥
target: By Vedic study he is sure to acquire prosperity, intelligence, energy and power competent to scorch all things, as also glory of the most superior kind.

source: यदहन्यत संग्रामे दैवमत्र पुरातनम्॥ नैतादृशं समुद्योगं दृष्टवन्तो हि मानुषाः। ऋषयो वा महाभागाः पुराणा भुवि संजय॥ ईदृशोऽपि बलौघस्तु संयुक्तः शस्त्रसम्पदा।
target: If that army be still slaughtered in battle, it is indeed due to predestined Fate. Neither man, nor illustrious and ancient sages, O Sanjaya, ever saw on earth such extensive preparations for battle. That such a large army well-supplied with the implements and sinews of war.

source: अमर्षणः स्वयं जेतुमशक्तः पाण्डवान् रणे। निरुत्साहश्च संप्राप्तुं सुश्रियं क्षत्रियोऽपि सन्॥ गान्धारराजसहितश्छद्मद्यूतममन्त्रयत्।
target: Being unwilling to bear all this at the same time being incapable of vanquishing the Pandavas in the field of bettle, he planned a most unjust game at dice, instead of being willing to obtain fortune by his own exertion and with the help of the king of Gandhara.

source: सरिद्भिः सविहङ्गाभिः शिखरैश्च समाकुलम्। गिरिराजमिमं तावत् पृच्छामि नृपतिं प्रति॥
target: The mountain abounding in rivers infested by water fowls; and decorated with crested summits. Now I ask about king Nala from the king of mountain.

source: दुराचारान् यदा राजा प्रदुष्टान् न नियच्छति। तस्मादुद्विजते लोकः सर्पाद् वेश्मगतादिव॥
target: If the king does not subdue those wicked men of sinful conduct, all good subjects then live in dread of him like a person living in a room within which a snake has concealed itself.

source: तथा पात्रविशेषाश्च दानानां च परो विधिः। आचारविधियोगश्च सत्यस्य च परागतिः॥
target: The different merits of charity according to the subjects of charity; the rules of living, the ceremonials of individual duty and the matchless merits of truth.

source: भर्तृपिण्डमुपाश्नन् यो राजद्विष्टानि सेवते। सोऽपि मोहसमापन्नो मृतो जायति वानरः॥
target: That man who, while living upon the food that his royal master supplies, commits deeds injurious to the interests of his master, stupefied by folly, has, after death, to take birth as a monkey.

source: तं दृष्ट्वा वदनान्मुक्तं चन्द्रं राहुमुखादिव। अब्रवीत् सुरसा देवी स्वेन रूपेण वानरम्॥
target: Seeing him out of her mouth like the Moon out of the mouth of Rāhu, the venerable Surasā spoke to the monkey in her native form, saying.

source: न त्वहं निन्दितं कर्म कुर्यां पापं कथंचन। पाण्डवार्थं हि लुभ्यन्तः स्वार्थान् हास्यन्ति ते सुताः।।२६
target: But I shall never do an act which is blamable and wicked; these sons of yours will lose their own wealth by coveting the wealth of the Pandavas.

source: सर्वे विद्यासु निष्णाता बलवन्तो दुरासदाः। कुवलाश्वश्च पितृतो गुणैरभ्यधिकोऽभवत्॥
target: All these sons were powerful and fierce, but they were learned. Kuvalashva became superior to his father in all qualifications.

source: स दर्शनीयो बहुधा विच्छिन्नः काञ्चनो ध्वजः। जगाम धरणीं सूर्यो देवतानामिवाज्ञया॥
target: And on that exceedingly graceful golden standard being hewn down it seemed as if the sun dropped to the earth at the behest of the celestials.

source: शरीरसंघातवहा ह्यसृग्जला रथोडुपा कुञ्जरशैलसङ्कटा। मनुष्यशीर्षोपलमांसकर्दमा प्रविद्धनानाविधशस्त्रमालिनी॥ भयावहा वैतरणीव दुस्तरा प्रवर्तिता योधवरैस्तदा नदी। उवाह मध्येन रणाजिरे भृशं भयावहा जीवमृतप्रवाहिनी॥
target: An awful river like the Vaitarani itself difficult of being tided over, was created there by many best of car-warriors. Its waters were formed by the blood of slain creatures. Chariots formed the rafts on which to cross it; elephants constituted its rocks and the heads of men formed its pebbles. It was muddy with the flesh of slain elephants, men and horses. Various kinds of weapons constituted the garlands floating on it. That dreadful current of blood flowed through the middle of the field of battle carrying with it living being to the doleful abodes of Death.

source: जातानां समवर्णायाः पुत्राणामविशेषतः। सर्वेषामेव वर्णानां समभागो धनात् स्मृतः॥
target: As for all the castes, the children born of the wife taken from the husband's own caste shall, it has been laid down, share equally the father's wealth.

source: नाटकेयांश्च समरे तथा हेरम्बकान् युधि॥ मारुधं च विनिर्जित्य रम्यग्राममथो बलात्। नाचीनानर्धकांश्चैव राज्ञश्चैव महाबलः॥ तांस्तानाटविकीन् सर्वानजयत् पाण्डुनन्दनः। वाताधिपं च नृपति वशं चक्रे महाबलः॥
target: Having then defeated in battle the Natakeyas and the Herambakas, and having subjugated the Marudhas, he conquered Munjagrama by force. He then vanquished the kings of the Nachinas, the Arbukas and the various other forest kings who ruled in that part of the country. The greatly powerful son of Pandu then subjugated the king Vatadhipa.

source: एवमुक्ता तु सा तेन शाल्वेनादीर्घदर्शिना। निश्चक्राम पुराद् दीना रुदती कुररी यथा॥
target: Being thus spoken to by that Shalva of short foresight, she issued out of that city sorrowing, weeping like a she osprey.

source: निर्द्वन्द्वो निर्नमस्कारो निःस्वाहाकार एव च। निर्ममो निरहङ्कारो निर्योगक्षेम आत्मवान्॥
target: Freed from all pairs of opposites, never bending his head in respect, abstaining from the rites requiring the utterance of Svaha, one should be free from mineness, and egoism. with purified soul, one should never seek to acquire what one has not and protect what one has.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच यत्र द्रोणस्तथा भीष्मो द्रौणिर्वैकर्तनः कृपः। दुर्योधनश्च राजेन्द्रस्तथान्ये च महारथाः॥ मरुद्गणैः परिवृतः साक्षादपि मरुत्पतिः। कोऽन्यो वृहन्नलायास्तान् प्रतियुध्येत सङ्गतान्॥
target: Yudhishthira said There, where Drona, Bhishma Drona's son, Vikartanas son, Kripa, the king Duryodhana, and other kings and car-warriors are, and where Indra himself is surrounded by Maruts, who else, save Brihannala, can fight with them, all collectively.

source: आनन्याय भवेद्दत्तं खङ्गमांसं पितृक्षये। कालशाकं च लौहं चाप्यानन्त्यं छाग उच्यते।
target: The flesh of the Rhinoceros, offered to the departed Manes on the anniversaries of the lunar days on which they died, becomes endless. The potherb called Kalashaka, the petals of the Kanchana flower, and meat of the goat also, thus offered, prove inexhaustible.

source: सप्तत्या सारथिं विद्ध्वा तुरङ्गांश्चत्रिस्त्रिभिः। ध्वजमेकेन चिच्छेद माधवस्य रथे स्थितम्॥
target: Piercing the charioteer of him of Madhu's race with seventy arrows and the horses with three arrows each, cut-off his standard with a single arrows.

source: त्रासयन्निव देवेन्द्र वाग्भिस्तक्षसि मामिह॥ संयते मयि नूनं त्वमात्मानं बहू मन्यसे।
target: You cut me to the quick with your words, and you seem deterinined to terrorise me. Indeed, finding me calm, you think very highly of you.

source: कस्त्वया सुखिना राजन् नाभिनन्दति पापकृत्। केनेदमुपदिष्टं ते मृत्युद्वारमुपायतः॥
target: Who of a vicious heart, O King, dose not feel himself happy at your welfare? Who has pointed out to you the way of your death under the cover of your means?

source: ब्रह्मचारी गुरुर्यस्मात् तपस्वी ब्राह्मणश्च सन्॥ अकार्षीः समयभ्रंशमावाभ्यां यः कृतो मिथः।
target: You are a Brahmacharin. You are my preceptor. You are an ascetic and a Brahmana. Yet you have broken the agreement you had made with me.

source: आप्तोर्यामेषु नियतमेकैकस्मिन् दशाददम्। गृष्टीनां क्षीरदात्रीणां रोहिणीनां शतानि च॥
target: Celebrating many Soma sacrifices, I gave away to cach Brahinana ten kine each of whom gave milk, and each of whom had brought forth only her first calf, besides making presents to them of hundreds of kine belonging to that kind which is known by the name of Rohini.

source: कर्ण उवाच काममीक्षामहे सर्वे दुर्योधन तवेप्सितम्। ऐकमत्यं हि नो राजन् सर्वेषामेव लक्षये।॥
target: Karna said: O Duryodhana, all of us scek to accomplish your wish. O king, I observe unanimity of opinion amongst us all.

source: ये चैनमभिवर्तन्ते याचितार इतस्ततः। यच्च यत्र यथावच्च सर्वे तेभ्यः प्रयच्छति॥
target: He duly confer upon such as repair to him from various quarters all those things that they ask for. And do yourself.

source: यः शेते योगमास्थाय पर्यङ्के नागभूषिते। फणासहस्ररचिते तस्मै निद्रात्मने नमः॥
target: You sleep in Yoga on your snake sofa formed by the thousand hoods (of the Naga). Salutations to you in your forms of sleep.

source: ततः प्रहृष्टाः पौरास्ते श्रुत्वा राजानमागतम्॥ तथा चक्रुश्च तत् सर्वं राज्ञा यत् प्रेषितं तदा।
target: Hearing of the king's approach, the citizens joyfully did every thing as per message they had been communicated.

source: तथा तेषु च सर्वेषु तूष्णीम्भूतेषु राजसु। जामदग्न्य इदं वाक्यमब्रवीत् कुरूसंसदि॥
target: Silence having thus prevailed in the midst of those kings, the son of Jamadagni, spoke these words in the assembly of the Kurus.

source: तत् स्तम्भितमिवातिष्ठद् भीमसेनभयादितम्॥ दुर्योधन बलं सर्वं निरुत्साहं कृतव्रणम्। निश्चेष्टं तुमुलं दीनं वभौ तस्मिन् महारणे॥
target: The army of Duryodhana, of Duryodhana, O king, melancholy, mainted and grieved through fear of Bhimasena, stood in utter confusion. That poor confounded host stood motionless in the field.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच इत्युक्त्वा तं सुरगुरुर्धर्मराज युधिष्ठिरम्। दिवमाचक्रमे धीमान् पश्यतामेव नस्तदा॥
target: Vaishampayana continued: The preceptor of the celestials endued with great intelligence, having said this to king, Yudhishthira the just, ascended upwards for proceeding to the celestial region before our eyes.

source: स भिन्नहदयो वाली वक्राच्छोणितमुद्वमन्। ददर्शावस्थितं रामं ततः सौमित्रिणा सह॥
target: With his heart riven (by Rama's arrow) Bali began to vomit blood through his mouth and then he saw Rama standing (before him) together with the son of Sumitra.

source: अस्त्रविज्जयतां रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः। राजा जयति सुग्रीवो राघवेणाभिपालितः॥ दासोऽहं कोसलेन्द्रस्य रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः। हनूमाञ्शत्रुसैन्यानां निहन्ता मारुतात्मजः॥ न रावणसहस्रं मे युद्धे प्रतिबलं भवेत्। शिलाभिश्च प्रहरतः पादपैश्च सहस्रशः॥ धर्षयित्वा पुरीं लङ्कामभिवाद्य च मैथिलीम्। समृद्धार्थो गमिष्यामि मिषतां सर्वरक्षसाम्॥
target: Victory to Rāma versed in arms! And to Laks maņa endowed with immense strength! and victory to king Sugrīva, who is protected by Raghava! Hanuman, son to the Wind-god, destroyer of hostile hosts, is the slave of Rāma of untiring deeds. And not a thousand Rāvanas can cope with me in conflict as I hurl stones and trees by thousands. Having destroyed the city of Lankā and paid my respects to Mithila's daughter, I, my object gained, shall depart in the presence of all the Rākşasas.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच जयित्र्याः कानि रूपाणि भवन्ति भरतर्षभ। पृतनायाः प्रशस्तानि तानि चेच्छामि वेदितुम्॥
target: Yudhishthira said What are the well-known signs, O foremost of Bharata's race, of the future success of an army? I wish to know them.

source: नित्यं कालपरीतस्य मम वा मद्विधस्य वा। बुद्धिर्व्यसनमासाद्य भिन्ना नौरिव सीदति॥
target: Even when we are possessed by Time, coming in contact with a calamity, shall my understanding or that of one like me allow itself to be destroyed like a wrecked vessel at sea.

source: सुप्रीताश्च सुराः सर्वे निमेश्चेतस्तदाब्रुवन्। वरं वरय राजर्षे क्व ते चेतो निरूप्यताम्॥
target: There upon the celestials, highly pleased, addressed the consciousness of Nimi saying O royal saint, do you accept boons; where shall we place your consciousness?

source: दुःशासन: प्रातिलोम्यान्निनाय सभामध्ये श्वशुराणां च कृष्णाम्। सा तत्र नीता करुणं व्यपेक्ष्य नान्यं क्षत्तु थमवाप किंचित्॥
target: Dushasana brought Krishna by force into the council chamber where there were her fathers-in-law at the time. Brought there she expected kind treatment, but she found there no protector save Vidura.

source: तेभ्यः सृजति भूतानि काल आत्मप्रचोदितः। एतेभ्यो यः परं ब्रूयादसद् ब्रूयादसंशयम्॥
target: Time, moved by the Understanding, created other objects from them. He who says that there is anything else save these, says the untruth.

source: गौतम उवाच यत्र प्रेत: यत्र प्रेतो नन्दति पुण्यकर्मा शोचते पापकर्मा। स्तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये॥
target: Gautama said O illustrious king, going even to that region of Yama where the pious live happily and the sinful in grief, I shall take from you this my elephants.

source: उत्सृज्यध्वं महावीर्यान् धृतराष्ट्रसुतानिमान्। दारांश्चैषां विमुञ्चध्वं धर्मराजस्य शासनात्॥
target: Therefore let off all these mighty sons of Dhritarashtra. Let off also these ladies at the command of Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira).

source: निषधानामधिपति नलं रिपुनिपातिनम्। भैमिधर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठं द्रक्ष्यसे विगतज्वरम्॥ विमुक्तं सर्वपापेभ्यः सर्वरत्नसमन्वितम्। तदेव नगरं श्रेष्ठं प्रशासतमरिंदमम्॥ द्विषतां भयकर्तारं सुहृदां शोकनाशनम्। पतिं द्रक्ष्यसि कल्याणि कल्याणाभिजनं नृपम्॥
target: O daughter of king Bhima! you shall meet Nala, the Ruler of the Naishadhas, the slayer of his foes and the foremost of those who protect righteousness, with his fever of misery subsided. O blessed one! you shall see your royal husband purged of all sins, adorned with diverse kings' of gems, ruling the self-same excellent of towns, the subduer of his foes, the terror of his enemies, the destroyer of the grief of his friends and crowned with all blessings."

source: ते शरा: प्रेषितास्तेन भीमसेनेन संयुगे। निपेतुः सर्वतो वीरे कूजन्त इव पक्षिणः॥
target: Those shafts then discharged by Bhimasena in that battle, fell upon the heroic Karna like so many humming birds.

source: भ्राता वैश्रवणस्याहं सापत्नो वरवर्णिनि। रावणो नाम भद्रं ते दशग्रीवः प्रतापवान्॥
target: O you of a beatiful countenance, I am the step-brother of the Lord of wealth and my name is the mighty Ten-necked Rāvana May good betide you!

source: चैत्रः श्रीमानयं मासः पुण्यः पुष्पितकाननः। यौवराज्याय रामस्य सर्वमेवोपकल्प्यताम्॥
target: This is the holy month of Caitra; and the groves look beautiful with blossoms. Do you now prepare for the installation of Rāma.

source: गजो गवाक्षो गवयः शरभो गन्धमादनः। समन्तात्परिधावन्तो ररक्षुहरिवाहिनीम्॥
target: And Gaya, and Gavāksa, and Gavaya, and Śarabha, and Gandhamādana, protected the monkey-army, coursing all around.

source: तस्य मौर्वी च मुष्टिं च स्थानं चालक्ष्य पाण्डवः। श्रुत्वा मन्त्रं भवप्रोक्तं जग्राहाचिन्त्यविक्रमः॥
target: Thereupon, seeing the mode of his grasping the bow, drawing the string, placing his legs and hearing also the mantras uttered by Bhava, Pandu's son of infinite prowess duly learnt them all.

source: तच्च मन्दा न जानन्ति दुर्योधनवशानुगाः। शेषयेदशनिर्दीप्तो विपतन् मूर्ध्नि संजय॥
target: Those fools under the control of Duryodhana do not know this. The thunderbolt falling on the head ablaze leaves some remnants undestroyed, O Sanjaya.

source: देवा महर्षयश्चापि स्वानि स्थानानि भेजिरे। तस्य पुत्रास्त्रयः शिष्टा युधिष्ठिर तदाभवन्॥
target: The celestials as well as the great sages departed to their respective residences. O Yudhishthira, then the king (Kuvalashva) had still three son left.

source: तदस्य स्याद् बलार्थ वा धनं यज्ञार्थमेव च। अभोग्याश्चौषधीश्छित्त्वा भोग्या एव पचन्त्युत॥
target: The Kshatriya should use that wealth for mairtaining his army and for the celebration of sacrifices. Tearing up useless creepers and plants, men burn them for cooking vegetables of food.

source: अनेनैवाभिषेकेण भरतो मेऽभिषिच्यताम्। यो द्वितीयो वरो देव दत्तः प्रीतेन मे त्वया॥ तदा देवासुरे युद्धे तस्य कालोऽयमागतः।
target: O exalted one, the time has also come for you to confer on me the second boon which you being pleased had promised in the war of the gods and Asuras.

source: यत् तु कारयं महाबाहो मनसा कार्यतां गतम्। सर्वोपायैर्न तच्छक्यं केनचित् कर्तुमन्यथा॥
target: Whatever act, O you with long arms, is fructified in his mind's eye cannot be prevented by any man by every mean in his power.

source: अनुसृत्य तु ये धर्मं कथयेयुरुपस्थिताः। समासाविस्तरविदां न तेषां वेत्सि निश्चयम्॥
target: You know not the words of wisdom the learned men preach, after the rules of morality, to the pupils waiting up on them.

source: मार्कण्डेय उवाच ततोऽग्निरुपयेमे तां शिवां प्रीतिमुदायुतः। प्रीत्या देवी समायुक्ता शुक्रं जग्राह पाणिना॥
target: Markandeya said : Then Agni being exceedingly pleased lived with her; and that lady too joyfully held intercourse with him; and she also held the seed in her hand.

source: ततः सा जनयित्वा तौ विशस्ता मत्स्यघातिना। संत्यज्य मत्स्यरूपं सा दिव्यं रूपमवाप्य च॥
target: Now according to these words, having given birth to the two children and being killed by the fishermen, she left the form of the fish and assumed her own celestial form.

source: शकुनिरुवाच सम्यगुक्तं हि कर्णेन तच्छ्रुतं कौरव त्वया। मया हृतां श्रियं स्फीतां तां मोहादपहाय किम्॥ त्वमल्पबुद्ध्या नृपते प्राणानुत्स्रष्टुमर्हसि। अथवाप्यवगच्छामि न वृद्धाः सेवितास्त्वया।॥
target: Shakuni said: O descendant of Kuru, you have heard that Karna has said. His words are indeed full of wisdom. O king, why should you foolishly throw away the great prosperity that I won for you by abandoning your life today through mere silliness? It appears to me today that you never waited upon (wise) old men.

source: जयश्च तेऽस्तु भद्रं ते प्रयाहि पुरुषर्षभ॥ पाण्डुपुत्रस्य सैन्यानि कुरु सर्वाणि भस्मसात्।
target: Many blessings and victory attend you. Start for battle, O foremost of men, consume the arıny of the Pandavas.

source: तच्छ्रुत्वा पाण्डवाः सर्वे स्वानि वासांसि भारत। अवकीर्योत्तरीयाणि सभायां समुपाविशन्॥
target: Vaishampayana said O descendant of Bharata, having heard this, the Pandavas took off their upper garments, and throwing them down, they sat (silently) in the Sabha.

source: चक्षुषी च स्वराज्यं च द्वौ वरौ श्वशुरस्य मे। लब्धं पितुः पुत्रशतं पुत्राणां चात्मनः शतम्॥
target: I have obtained two boons for my father-inlaw viz. recovery of his sight and kingdom. I have (further), obtained for my father a hundred sons and an equal number of sons for myself.

source: धनूर्षि बाणान् परिघानसिपट्टिशतोमरान्। मुसलानि भुशुण्डीश्च सशत्तवृष्टिपरश्वधान्॥ गदाः प्रासाञ्छितान् कुन्तान् भिन्दिपालान् महाङ्कुशान्। प्रगृह्य क्षिप्रमापेतुः परस्परजिघांसया॥
target: Having taken up the bows, the arrows, the spiked maces and the swords, lances and the battle-axes and also the short clubs, the Vushandis, the Shakti-darts, the rapiers and the axes, as well as the iron maces, the spears, the white Kuntas, the short arrows and the hooks, the warriors most rapidly fell upon one another with the desire of killing them.

source: एतत् ते कथितं तात भार्गवस्य महात्मनः। चरितं भरतश्रेष्ठ यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि॥
target: I have thus described to you, O chief of the Bharatas, the story of the great Bhargava about which you had asked me.

source: केचिद्धस्तैर्द्विधा च्छिन्नैश्छिन्नगात्रास्तथाऽपरे। निपेतुस्तुमुले तस्मिंश्छिन्नपक्षा इवाद्रयः॥
target: Some with their trunks cut in twin, others with their bodies mutilated, fell down in that sanguinary battle, like mountains having their wings cut off.

target: Those monkey-leaders, their bodies pierced with shafts and their persons riven with darts, took up trees and crags.

target: He will be conscious of his being Brahma's self ; his understanding and soul shall be devoted to Brahma, and he shall completely depend upon Brahma so as to be at one with.

source: बलदेव उवाच विदितं ते नरव्याघ्र सर्वं भवितुमर्हति। यन्मयोक्तं विराटस्य पुरा वैवाहिके तदा॥
target: O you best among men, it is fitting that what was said by me at the time of the marriage, should be known to you.

source: शेष उवाच एषः एव वरो देव कांक्षितो मे पितामह। धर्मे मे रमतां बुद्धिः शमे तपसि चेश्वर॥
target: Shesha said: Odivine Grandsire, O lord of all, I ask this boon. Let my heart always delight in virtue and in blessed penances.

source: तत्र सीता मया दृष्टा रावणान्तः पुरे सती॥ त्वयि संन्यस्य जीवन्ती रामा राम मनोरथम्। दृष्टा मे राक्षसीमध्ये तय॑माना मुहुर्मुहुः॥ राक्षसीभिर्विरूपाभी रक्षिता प्रमदावने।
target: And I saw there Sītā, in the inner appartment of Ravana. Centring all her thoughts in you, breathes that damsel, O Rama. I saw her reviled by the she demons again and again. She is being guarded in that garden by the grim-visaged Raksasis.

source: यस्मादभावी भावी वा भवेदर्थो नरं प्रति। अप्राप्तौ तस्य वा प्राप्तौ न कश्चिद् व्यथते बुधः॥
target: What is not likely to happen to man (being subject to Fate) may happen to him; or what is likely to take place may, again, happen to a person. Hence at the acquisition or nonacquisition of the purposes the learned sage should not at all grieve.

source: सर्वामिमां पृथिवीं निर्जिगाय प्रादामहं छादनं ब्राह्मणेभ्यः। स्तदा देवाः पुण्यभाजो भवन्ति॥
target: Having conquered the whole earth, I gave clothes to the Brahmanas. I gave them also one hundred horses fit for sacrificial offerings. For such pious acts the celestials become propitious to those that perform them.

source: काम क्रोधं च लोभं च दम्भं दर्थं च भूमिपः। सम्यग्विजेतुं यो वेद स महीमभिजायते॥
target: The protector of the earth, who knows how to gain complete ascendancy over desire, wrath, avarice, pride and vanity, subjugates the entire world.

source: पुराभिमन्युर्लक्ष्यं नः पश्यतां हनित वीर्यवान्। तमाद्रवत मा भैष्ट क्षिप्रं रक्षत कौरवम्॥
target: The highly puissant Abhimanyu is slaying even before our very eyes, every one he is aiming at. Assail him and be not afraid; and rescue the king of the Kurus."

source: स देवदत्तमादाय शङ्ख हेमपरिष्कृतम्। दध्मौ वेगेन महता घोषेणापूरयन् दिशः॥
target: Thereafter taken up his conch known as Devadatta of the effulgence of gold, he blew it with great force, filling the points of the compass with the blare.

source: तमुद्दिश्य तु मे सर्वं विभूषणमिदं कृतम्। यथा तस्य हि नान्यस्य भावो मां प्रति तिष्ठति ॥ तेन सत्येन मां राजन्मोक्तुमर्हस्यरिंदम्। स हि तिष्ठति धर्मात्मा मां प्रतीक्ष्य समुत्सुकः॥
target: For him I have adorned my person with these ornaments. I am not attached to any body else but him. O king, O slayer of foes, by virtue of (this relation) is behove you to save me. And that virtuous-souled one is anxiously expecting me.

source: हनुमानङ्गदो नीलः सुषेणः कुमुदो नलः। गजो गवाक्षः पनसः सानुप्रस्थो महाहरिः॥ जाम्बवानृषभः सुन्दो रम्भः शतबलिः पृथुः। व्यूढानीकाश्च यत्ताश्च दुमानादाय सर्वतः॥ वीक्षमाणा दिशः सर्वास्तिर्यगूर्ध्वं च वानराः। तृणेष्वपि च चेष्टत्सु राक्षसा इति मेनिरे॥
target: And Hanumān, and Angada, and Nīla, and Susena, and Kumuda, and Nala, and Gaya, and Gavākṣa, and Panas, and Sānuprastha-a mighty monkey-and Jämbavān, and Rishava, and Sunda, and Rambha, and Satabali, and Prthu, all forming them selves into array, and equipped with trees on all sides, and remaining vigilantthe monkeys kept gazing at all sides, awry and upwards; and even when a straw stirred, they thought it to be a Rākşasa.

source: अथान्यद् धनुरादाय सुषेणः क्रोधमूर्छितः। आविध्यन्नकुलं षष्ट्या सहदेवं च सप्तभिः।
target: Then beside himself with anger Sushena took up another bow and pierced Nakula with sixty arrows and Sahadeva with seven.

source: समाश्वास्य ततो राजा विगते कश्मले तदा। ततो मुहूर्तादिव तं ब्राह्मणं वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥
target: When that cloudedness of understanding departed and the king became comforted, he spoke after a short time these words to that Brahmana.

source: तेन सर्वानवाप्नोति कामान् यान् मनसेच्छति। इन्द्रियाणां निरोधेन सत्येन च दमेन च। ब्रह्मणः पदमाप्नोति यत् परं द्विजसत्तम।॥
target: By this means he obtains all the objects of his desire. By subduing his senses and by means of truthfulness and forbearness, O foremost of Brahmanas, he obtains the supreme state of Brahma.

source: सैन्धवं च महेष्वासं सामात्यं सह बन्धुभिः। प्राच्यांश्च दाक्षिणात्यांश्च भूमिपान् भूमिपर्षभ॥ पुत्रं च ते महेष्वासं दुर्योधनममर्षणम्। दुःसहं चैव समरे भीमसेनोऽभ्यवर्तत॥
target: As also, against that great warrior the ruler of the Sindhus supported by his friends and ministers, and, O foremost of the Bharatas, against many other kings from the West and the South. Bhimasena, in that fight, rushed against your vindictive son Duryodhana that mighty bow-men, as also against his brother Dushasana.

source: शल्यस्तु पीडितस्तेन स्वस्रीयेण महात्मना। नकुलं पीडयामास पत्रिभिर्नतपर्वभिः॥
target: Assailed by his illustrious nephew, Shalya struck him in return with many straight arrows.

source: ननाद बलवान् कर्णः पार्थाय विसृजञ्छरान्। अर्जुनश्चापि राधेयं विद्ध्वा सप्तभिराशुगैः॥
target: Then Arjuna also piercing Radha's son with seven swift-flying arrows, slew the younger brothers of Karna with three shafts of great sharpness.

source: बलं तु मत्स्यस्य बलेन राजा सर्वं त्रिगर्ताधिपतिः सुशर्मा। प्रमथ्य जित्वा च प्रसह्य मत्स्यं विराटमोजस्विनमभ्यधावत्।॥
target: Having assailed and vanquished with energy the entire army of the king of Matsya's, Susharman, the king of Trigartas, rushed furiously at the highly energetic Virata.

source: तथेत्युक्त्वा ततस्तस्मै प्रादादस्त्राणि भार्गवः। सरहस्यव्रतं चैव धनुर्वेदमशषतः॥
target: Saying “Be it so, ." the descendant of Bhrigu gave away all his weapons to him (Drona) with the whole science of arms with its rules and regulations.

source: योगी योज्यो महाबीजो महारेता महाबलः। सुवर्ण रेताः सर्वज्ञः सुबीजो बीजवाहनः॥
target: You are given to Yoga. You are he who merges himself in Brahman. You are the great seed. You display what is unmanifest as this manifest form in which the universe exists. You have infinite inight. You are he whose seed is gold. You are omniscient. You are the cause of all things. You are he who has the seed of action for the incans of going from this world to the other and the other to this,

source: दाता कुप्यति नो दान्तस्तस्माद् दानात् परं दमः। यस्तु दद्यादकुप्यन् हि तस्य लोकाः सनातनाः॥ क्रोधो हन्ति हि यद् दानं तस्माद् दानात् परं दमः। अदृश्यानि महाराज स्थानान्ययुतशो दिवि॥ ऋषीणां सर्वलोकेषु याहीतो यान्ति देवताः।
target: That man who makes gifts without yielding to anger, succeeds in acquiring eternal regions of happiness. Anger destroys the merit of a gift. Hence self-control is superior to gift. There are ten thousand invisible places, O monarch, in Heaven. Existing in all the regions of Heaven, these places belong to the Rishis. Persons, leaving this world, attain to them and become changed into deities.

source: तस्य चैतत्प्रदानस्य फलमद्यानुपश्यसि। यद् भुड्क्षे पृथिवीं कृत्स्ना शूरैर्निहतकण्टकाम्॥
target: The fruits of this bestowal you now seeyou enjoy this entire earth, subjected by those heroes, with all your thorns and barriers removed.

source: देवदानवरक्षोभिः पिशाचपतगोरगैः। पूज्यमानं महातेजा दिशागजमपश्यत॥
target: He found an exceedingly powerful elephant belonging to the cardinal point, worshipped by deities, and Dānavas, and Rākşasas, and goblins, and birds, and Uragas.

source: ब्राह्मण उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। ब्राह्मणस्य च संवादं जनकस्य च भाविनि॥
target: The Brahmana said Regarding it is cited the old discourse between a Brahmana and (king) Janaka.

source: प्रापयामास राजेन्द्र सह तेन शिखण्डिना। तां पूजां नाभ्यनन्दतं स वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह॥
target: And (the Panchala king) went up to him along with Shikhandin, O great king. But he (the messenger) did not accept that homage, but said these words,

source: तदलं साधु युद्धेन निवर्तस्व जनार्दन। द्वारकामेव रक्षस्व कार्यमेतन्महत् तव॥
target: O Janardana, therefore there is no need of fighting here. Cease fighting and defend Dvarka. This is (now) your principal duty.”

source: करेणुमातङ्गरथाश्वसंकुलं महाजनौधैः परिपूर्णचत्वरम्। प्रभूतरत्नं बहुपण्यसंचयं ददर्श रामो विमलं महापथम्॥
target: He saw the courtyard thronged with young and old elephants, horses, chariots, and the high ways crowded all over with people, many pearls and various merchandises.

source: पाण्डवाश्च महात्मानस्तेषु वेश्मसु तां क्षपाम्। सुखमूषुर्गतोद्वेगा: पूजिताः सर्वराक्षसैः॥
target: The noble-minded Pandavas dwelt happily for several sights in those mansions without anxiety and honoured by all the Rakshasas,

source: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सौमित्रिस्त्वरयान्वितः। न्यवेदयत रामाय तापसं तं समागतम्॥
target: Hearing the words of the great saint, Saumitri speedily went to Råghava and communicated to him the arrival of the ascetic, saying.

source: उपास्यो नारदो बाढं वाचि नास्य व्यतिक्रमः कामतो यदि वा लोभात् तस्मात् सर्वत्र पूजितः॥
target: Narada deserves the respectful adorations of all. He never retracts his words through desire of cupidity. For this he is adored everywhere.

source: पादयोः पातयिष्यामि कौन्तेयस्य महात्मनः। अथ ते न व्यवस्यन्ति प्रणिपाताय धीमतः॥
target: And make them fall at the fect of the noble son of Kunti. If they refuse to fall at the feet of the wise (Yudhishthira).

source: संजय उवाच एवमुक्त्वा ततो द्रोणस्तव पुत्रं महाद्युतिम्। पुनरेव वचः प्राह शनैराचार्यपुङ्गवः॥
target: Sanjaya said Having thus spoken, Drona that foremost of all preceptors, once more addressed your son

source: तपः सर्वगतं तात हीनस्यापि विधीयते। जितेन्द्रियस्य दान्तस्य स्वर्गमार्गप्रवर्तकम्॥
target: Penances, O child, are for all. They are ordained for even the lowest order of men, Penances lead the self-controlled man who has mastered all his senses to the way to heaven.

source: उमोवाच सावधं किन्नु वै कर्म निरवयं तथैव च। श्रेयः कुर्वन्नवाप्नोति मानवो देवसत्तम॥
target: Uma said What deeds, O foremost of the celestials, are faulty, and what deeds are faultless? What, indeed, are those deeds by doing which a man succeeds in acquiring what is for your highest good?

source: विधिवत् पूजयामास स्वयं किङ्करवत् स्थितः॥ अहानि कतिचित् तत्र तस्थौ स मुनिसत्तमः।
target: Himself he waited upon the Rishi as a menial. The illustrious Rishi remained there for a few days.

source: अरक्षितारं हर्तारं विलोप्तारमनायकम्। तं वै राजकलिं हन्युः प्रजाः सन्ना निघृणम्॥
target: The subjects should arm themselves for killing that king who does not protect them who simply plunders their riches, who confounds all distinctions who is incapable of taking their lead, who is without mercy, and who is considered as the most sinful of kings.

source: बहूनि च सहस्राणि प्रयुतान्यर्बुदानि च। कोट्यश्च लोकवीराणां समेताः कुरुजाङ्गले॥
target: Many thousands, many millions, many tens of millions, many hundreds of millions of warriors have assembled at Kurukshetra.

source: द्रोणपर्वणि ये शूरा निर्दिष्टाः पुरुषर्षभाः। अत्राध्यायशतं प्रोक्तं तथाध्यायाश्च सप्ततिः॥ अष्टौ श्लोकसहस्राणि तथा नव शतानि च। श्लोका नव तथैवात्र संख्यातास्तत्त्वदर्शिना॥ पाराशर्येण मुनिना संचिन्त्य द्रोणपर्वणि।
target: The number of chapters in this Parva is one hundred and seventy. The number of slokas composed in the Drona Parva by the great Rishi, the son of Parashara and the master of great knowledge, is eight thousand nine hundred and nine.

source: तत्र मासं वसेद्धीरो नियतो नियताशन:। ब्रह्मलोकं व्रजेद् राजन् कुलं चैव समुद्धरेत्॥
target: O hero, there in that Tirtha one should live for a month with regulated diet and subdued soul.

source: न चैनमत्यगाद् वह्निर्वेलामिव महोदधिः। तमुपेत्य शनैर्वह्निरुवाच कुरुनन्दनम्॥
target: Like the ocean that never pass beyond its shore, Agni did not pass over his (Sahadeva). Agni quietly came to him, and he thus spoke to that descendant of the Kuru.

source: निर्द्वन्द्वा नित्यसत्त्वस्था विमुक्ता नियमस्थिताः। असङ्गान्यविवादीनि मनःशान्तिकराणि च॥
target: Freed from the influence of all pairs of opposite (such as heat and cold, joy and sorrow, etc.), ever existing in their own (pure) state, freed (from attachments), never accepting anything (in gift), they live in places separated from their wives and children, without others with whom disputes may arise, and favourable to perfect tranquillity of hearts.

source: ते सर्वे वानरांश्च राक्षसाश्च महाबलाः। यथासुखमसंबाधं दिव्ये तस्मिन्नुपाविशन्॥
target: All the monkeys, bears and the highly powerful Rákşasas sat in that celestial car unobstructed and at their pleasure.

source: एवं ये ज्ञातयोऽर्थेषु मिथो गच्छन्ति विग्रहम्। तेऽमित्रवशमायान्ति शकुनाविव विग्रहात्॥
target: In the same way those cousins who quarrel in matters of wealth are brought under the control of enemies like the birds owing to their quarrel.

source: ततो ह्यभ्युच्छ्रयन्पौराः पताकाश्च गृहे गृहे। ऐक्ष्वाकाध्युषितं रम्यमाससाद पितुर्मुहम्।॥
target: Thereupon the citizens hoisted up flags upon every house and he reached the picturesque abode of his ancestors inhabited by the descendants of Ikşvāku.

source: दिष्ट्या स्नुषाणामाक्रन्दे घोरं विलपितं बहु। न शृणोषि महाराज सारसीनामिवार्णवे॥
target: By good luck, you do not hear those dreadful wails of woe uttered amidst this destruction by your daughter-in-law like the screams of a fight of cranes of the sea.

source: त्वत्त एताः पुनः शुक्र वीरुधो हरितच्छदाः। जायन्ते पुष्करिण्यश्च सुभद्रश्च महोदधिः॥
target: O Shukra, these plants and creepers with green leaves have all sprung through you. These tanks and ponds and the ever blessed great ocean also, have all sprung from you.

source: वृष्णीनां च कुले जाता शूरस्य दयिता सुता। दत्ता प्रीतिमता मह्यं पित्रा बाला पुरा स्वयम्॥
target: You have sprung from the race of the Vrishnis and are the beloved daughter of Shura. Formerly, your father himself gladly mmade you over to me.

source: संजय उवाच द्रोणस्य मतमाज्ञाय योद्धुकामस्य तां निशाम्। दुर्योधनो महाराज वश्यान् भ्रातूनुवाच ह॥
target: Sanjaya said Aware of the intentions of Drona as desirous of fighting during that night, Duryodhana, O mighty monarch, addressed his obedient brothers.

source: एष शेते महाबाहुर्बलवान् सत्यविक्रमः। तमद्य द्विपः संख्ये भीमसेनेन पातितः॥
target: Endued with great strength and true prowess, this mighty-armed prince, killed by Bhimasena in battle, sleeps like in elephant killed by a lion.

source: क्रुद्धे चास्मिन् हसन्त्येव न च हृष्यन्ति पूजिताः। संघर्षशीलाश्च तदा भवन्त्यन्योन्यकारणात्॥
target: If the king becomes angry, they laugh; nor are they pleased if favours be conferred upon them, though they may express joy for other reasons.

source: नैवं भीष्मो न च द्रोणो नान्ये युधि च तावकाः॥५४ चक्रुः स्म तादृशं सर्म यादृशं वै कृतं रणे।
target: Verily one of the warriors of your army may not even Bhishma or Drona, did ever achieve such an exploit, as was achieved by Karna in the battle.

source: विश्वामित्र उवाच विश्वे देवाश्च मे मित्रं मित्रमस्मि गवां तथा। विश्वामित्रमिति ख्यातं यातुधानि निबोध माम्॥
target: Vishvamitra said The celestials of the universe are my friends. I am also the friend of the universe. Hence, O Yatudhani, I am called Vishvamitra.

source: यानि रामस्य चिह्नानि लक्ष्मणस्य च वानर । तानि भूयः समाचक्ष्व न मां शोकः समाविशेत्॥
target: Do you again relate to me, O monkey, the regal signs that deck the persons of Rāma and Lakşmaņa-and I shall then relinquish all grief.

source: न लोके दीप्यते मूर्खः केवलात्मप्रशंसया। अपि चापिहितः श्वभ्रे कृतविद्यः प्रकाशते॥
target: The fool can never shine in the world by speaking out his own praise. The man, however, of real merit and learning acquires celebrity even if he be hidden in a pit.

source: निवेद्यतां दाशरथेऋषयो वयमागताः। प्रतीहारस्ततस्तूर्णमगस्त्यवचनाद्भुतम्॥ समीपं राघवस्याशु प्रविवेश महात्मनः। नयेङ्गितिज्ञः सद्वृत्तो दक्षो धैर्यसमन्वितः॥ स रामं दृश्य सहसा पूर्णचन्द्रसमद्युतिम्। अगस्त्यं कथयामास संप्राप्तमृषिसत्तमम्॥
target: Then at the words of Agastya, the gate-keeper quick* and swift presented himself with celerity before the high-souled Rāghava. And that one versed in polity and emotional expressions, of worthy ways, possessed of ability, and endowed with patience swiftly seeing Rāma resembling the full moon in brightness, communicated to him the arrival of that supreme of saintsAgastya. *Turnam-according to the commentator, is mental celerity, and drutam-physical. This distinction, however, is seldom, if ever, observed by Sanskrit authors.

source: ततस्तौ सहितौ रात्रिं कथयन्तौ पुरातनम्। वने विचरितं सर्वमूषतुर्मुदितौ नृप॥
target: O king, thercupon the happy pair passed the night at ease, relating to each other the past events of their wanderings in the forest.

source: पवित्रो मङ्गलीयश्च ख्यातो लोके महात्मनः॥ केदारश्च मतङ्गस्य महानाश्रम उत्तमः। कुण्डोदः पर्वतो रम्यो बहुमूलफलोदकः॥ नैषधस्तृषितो यत्र जलं शर्म च लब्धवान्।
target: There is also the sacred, auspicious, celebrated, great and excellent hermitage of the high-souled Matanga, called Kedara. There is also the charming Kundoda mountain which abounds in many fruits, roots and water, where the king of the Nishadas (Nala) had satisfied his thirst and rested for a while.

source: स तु तं प्रतिविव्याध नवभिर्निशितैः शरैः। सारथिं चास्य भल्लेन भृशं क्रुद्धोऽभ्यताडयत्॥
target: Then he (Duryodhana), indeed, who became highly enraged, penetrated him (Yudhishthira) in return with nine whetted arrows and again, afflicted his charioteer most dreadfully by means of his broad-headed shafts.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एतच्छ्रुत्वा व्यवसितो निकृतिं समुपाश्रितः। जितमित्येव शकुनियुधिष्ठिरमभाषत॥
target: Vaishampayana said Having heard this and adopting unfair means, Shakuni, ever ready with the dice said to Yudhisthira, “Lo, I have won!"

target: Thus addressed and encouraged, she desirous of saying that disagreeable things with the view of afflicting her lord still more, spoke to him thus.

source: नृशंस इति मां राम वक्ष्यन्ति मनुजा भुवि॥ श्रुत्वा तस्यागुणान्सर्वे वक्ष्यन्ति सुकृतं पुनः।
target: O Rāma, perhaps people of this earth will call me cruel but they will again recognise my act as good when they will hear of his vicious deeds.

source: युगान्तकालसमये दण्डहस्तमिवान्तकम्। ततस्तं गिरिशृङ्गाभ भीमरूपं भयावहम्॥
target: Look like the very destroyer himself, mace in hand, at the time of universal dissolution. (And he) resembled a mountain peak, was frightful to look at and dreadful.

source: तत्प्रयुक्तं पुनयुद्धं तुमुलं रोमहर्षणम्॥ गदानां मुसलानां च परिघाणां च निःस्वनैः। शराणां पुरवातैश्च क्षुभिताः सप्त सागराः॥
target: There again ensued a terrible conflict capable of making one's down stand on end. And the seven oceans were overwhelmed with the sound of maces, Musalas, Paraighas and gold feathered arrows.

source: स एष पार्थो विक्रान्तः सव्यसाची परंतपः। नायुद्धेन निवर्तेत सर्वैरपि सुरासुरैः॥
target: He is the powerful Partha, Savyasachin, the repressor of enemies he does no desist even in the encounter with all the celestials.

source: तेजसा तव तेजश्च विष्णुराप्याययिष्यति। विष्णुना च वरो दत्तः पूर्वं मम महीपते॥ यस्तं महासुरं रौद्रं वधिष्यति महीपतिः। तेजस्तं वैष्णवमिति प्रवेक्ष्यति दुरासदम्॥
target: Your energy will be increased by that of Vishnu, the ruler of earth. A boon was granted by Vishnu in the days of yore. Namely that he who will kill this fearful and great Asura would be pervaded by the matchless energy of Vishnu himself.

source: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच यौ तौ कर्णश्च भीमश्च सम्प्रयुद्धौ महाबलौ। अर्जुनस्य रथोपान्ते कीदृशः सोऽभवद् रणः॥
target: Dhritarashtra said How raged the battle, near Arjuna's chariot between those two mighty car-warriors, Bhima and Karna, both possessed of great strength?

source: उत्सङ्गे च व्याल इवाहितोऽसि मार्जारवत् पोषकं चोपहंसि। स्तस्मात् क्षत्तः किं न बिभेषि पापात्॥
target: You are kept by us on our lap as a serpent. Like a cat you wish to injure him who cherishes you. The wise men have said that there is no sin greater than that of injuring one's supporter. O Khattwa, how is it that you do not fear sin?

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच मया गवां पुरीषं वै श्रिया जुष्टमिति श्रुतम्। एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं संशयोऽत्र पितामह॥
target: Yudhishthira said I have heard that the dung of the cow is gifted with prosperity. I wish to hear how this has been occasioned. I have doubts, O grand father which you should remove.

source: प्रीतस्तेऽभिगमेनाहं जयं तव नराधिप। आशासिष्ये सदोत्थाय सत्यमेतद् ब्रवीमि ते॥
target: I am pleased by your coming. O king, rising every day (from my bed), I shall pray for your victory. I truly speak this to you.

source: मत्स्योपाख्यानमत्रैव प्रोच्यते तदनन्तरम्। मार्कण्डेयसमास्या च पुराणं परिकीर्त्यते॥
target: Then follows the story of Matsya and other old stories recited by Markandeya.

target: The king, who looked like a celestial, did not grieve so much for hearing that he would die, as for having done that (insulting) act to the Rishi.

source: प्रोवाच पितरं तत्र राघवौ रामलक्ष्मणौ। सुतौ दशरथस्येमौ धनुर्दर्शनकाक्षिणौ॥

source: इदं चैव हयज्ञानं त्वदीयं मयि तिष्ठति। तदुपाकर्तुमिच्छामि मन्यसे यदि पार्थिवा एवमुक्त्वा ददौ विद्यामृतुपर्णाय नैषधः॥
target: O monarch, if you like, I may give it to you.” Saying this, the prince of the Nishadhas made over that equestrian learning to king Rituparna.

source: जीवत्सु पाण्डुपुत्रेषु पञ्चालेष्वथ वृष्णिषु। दासीभूतास्मि पापानां सभामध्ये व्यवस्थिता।॥
target: During the life time of the Pandu's, the Panchalas and the Vrishnis I was treated like a maid-servant and made to stand in the Council Chamber of those incarnations of vice.

source: निवृत्तिः कर्मणः पापात् सततं पुण्यशीलता। सवृत्तिः समुदाचारः श्रेय एतदनुत्तमम्॥
target: Abstention from sinful deeds, steady practice of virtue, good conduct, the due observance of all religious duties,—these form the highest good.

source: रामं दाशरथिं चैव मृतं संजय शुश्रुम। योऽन्वकम्पत वै नित्यं प्रजाः पुत्रानिवौरसान्॥
target: We hear, O Srinjaya, that Rama also, the son of Dasharatha, met with death. He always treated his subjects like his own begotten sons.

target: Then men beheld his mighty bow of golden staff, as he slew his foes, to be always drawn to a circle.

source: वध्यतां राजपुत्राणां क्रन्दतामितरेतरम्। प्रादुरासीन्महाशब्दो भीरूणां भयवर्धनः॥

source: गिर्याश्रया दुर्गनिवासिनश्च योधाः पृथिव्यां कुलजातिशुद्धाः। म्लेच्छाश्च नानायुधवीर्यवन्तः समागताः पाण्डवार्थं निविष्टाः॥

source: कुणेर्यथा हस्तगतं ह्रियेत् फलं बलीयसा। तथा शक्तिरमोघा सा मोघीभूता घटोत्कचे॥

target: Having saluted the Supreme Deity (Narayana) and the highest of all male beings (Nara) and also the Goddess of Learning (Sarasvati), let us cry success.

target: O Bhima, I have cherished this thought in my mind for a long time, and I have a mind to behold the summit of this mountain protected by the force of your arms.

source: आज्यानि यजमानेभ्यस्तथानानि च भारत। अश्ववन्ति च यानानि वेश्मानि शयनानि च॥
target: Do you give to sacrificing Brahmanas clarified butter as also food, and cars and vehicles with horses harnessed thereto, and dwelling houses and mansions and beds.

source: योगेश्वरं देवगीतं वेस्थ कृष्ण न संशयः। तस्य चौपददौ पुत्रान् सहस्रं क्रतुसम्मितान्॥
target: Mahadeva granted him a thousand sons having qualifications proportionate to the merits of the sacrifice. Forsooth, you know, O Krishna, the Lord of Yoga, him who is, who is sung by the gods.

target: Yudhishthira the virtuous highly energetic and firm-minded son of Kunti, versed in the particulars of the science of profit having addressed his brother (Bhima) thus, kept quiet and began to ponder upon the matter. On the other hand the survivors of the Rakshasas slain by Bhimasena,

source: राम तस्य तु शैलस्य महती शोभते गुहा॥ शिलापिधाना काकुत्स्थ दुःखं चास्याः प्रवेशनम्।

source: अलं तस्य महाबाहुर्भीमसेनो महाबलः। लोकस्य समुदीर्णस्य निधनायान्तको यथा॥

source: स तत्स्मृत्वा पितुर्वाक्यं भीमवेगोऽन्तरिक्षगः। नखेन गजमेकेन कूर्ममेकेन चाक्षिपत्॥

source: रामोऽपि सह सैन्येन ससुग्रीवः सलक्ष्मणः। हर्ष लेभे रिपुं हत्वा वृत्रं वज्रधरो यथा॥

source: स्वदारतष्टस्त्वृतुकालगामी नियोगसेवी न शठो न जिह्मः। मिताशनो देवरतः कृतज्ञः सत्यो मृदुश्चानृशंसः क्षमावान्॥
target: He shouid be satisfied with his own married wife and should never approach her except in her season. He should follow prescription of the scriptures, should not be cunning and deceitful. He should be sparing in diet, devoted to the gods, grateful, mild, shorn of cruelty, and forgiving.

source: ततः सा ह्रीमती बाला भर्तुर्विजयहर्षिता। अवोचद् यदि तत् तथ्यं भवेयं शरणं हि वः।॥
target: Thereupon that modest dame, dame, greatly delighted in the prospective conquest of her husband, said, “If this be true I shall save you all.”

source: तस्य नागं मणिमयं रत्नचित्रध्वजे स्थितम्। भल्लाभ्यां कार्मुकं चैव क्षिप्रं चिच्छेद पाण्डवः॥

source: दुर्योधन उवाच आचार्य: पाण्डुपुत्रान् वै पुत्रवत् परिरक्षति। त्वमप्युपेक्षां कुरुषे तेषु नित्यं द्विजोत्तम॥
