source: स बभूवातिकायश्च बहुपादशिरोभुजः। तं ब्रह्मास्त्रेण सौमित्रिर्ददाराद्रिचयोपमम्॥
target: His body then assumed formidable proportions and his head and arms began to multiply in large numbers. The son of Sumitra, then, pierced Kumbhakarna, looking like heaps of rocks, by that weapon presided over by Brahma.

source: जज्ञे क्रमेण चैतेन तेषां दुर्योधनो नृपः। जन्मतस्तु प्रमाणेन ज्येष्ठो राजा युधिष्ठिरः॥
target: King Duryodhana was then in time born from them (the parts of the fleshy ball). According to the order of birth, Yudhisthira was the eldest.

source: नहि वै त्वद्विधो लोके पापमेवं समाचरेत्। कोपमार्येण यो हन्ति स वीरः पुरुषोत्तमः॥ नेदमत्र त्वया ग्राह्यं साधुवृत्तेन लक्ष्मण। तां प्रीतिमनुवर्तस्व पूर्ववृत्तं च संगतम्॥
target: Persons like you on this earth do not perpetrate the crime of destroying their friends. He is truly a great hero and an excellent person who subdues anger by his right understanding, O Lakṣmaṇa, it is not proper for you to bring about the destruction of your friend, do you follow your former friendship and good feelings.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच स पुत्रस्य वचः श्रुत्वा विराटो राष्ट्रवर्धनः। क्षमयामास कौन्तेयं भस्मच्छन्नमिवानलम्॥
target: Hearing the words of his son Virata, enhancer of the state begged pardon with the son of Kunti, radiant like fire within ashes,

source: धूमायन्ते व्यपेतानि ज्वलन्ति सहितानि च। धृतराष्ट्रोल्मकानीव ज्ञातयो भरतर्षभ॥
target: Separated pieces of burning wood produce only smoke; but united they blaze. The same is the case, O Dhritarashtra, with blood relations.

source: वशे स्थितोऽहं त्वय्यद्य क्षमावति महात्मनि। बिभेमि तपसः साधो प्रसादं कुरु मे प्रभो॥
target: You are endued with a powerful soul. You are endued with forgiveness. I stand here today, acknowledging your sway. I fear your penances, O righteous one! Do you, O powerful Rishi, show me favour.

source: शराभिघाताच रुषा च राजन् स्वया च भासास्त्रसमीरणाच। मिद्धो यथाऽऽज्याहुतिभिर्हताशः॥ कर्णस्य पुत्रो नकुलस्य राजन् सर्वानश्वानक्षिणोदुत्तमास्त्रैः। नुदग्रगान् हेमजालावनद्धान्॥
target: O monarch, Karna's son with his fine shots, indeed killed the white and good looking chargers of Nakula, who were of the Vanayu breed and were adorned with fittings of gold. The son of Karna, out of rage from the hits of his enemy as also from the brilliancy and might of his own weapons, looked like the fire ablaze when helped with clarified butter.

source: ते चास्य हयमुख्येषु तूर्णमुत्पत्य वानराः। चतुर्षु सुमहावीर्या निपेतुर्भीमविक्रमाः॥
target: And suddenly springing up, those highly powerful monkeys endowed with terrific prowess descended upon those four best of steeds.

source: केचिद् भ्रान्तै रथैस्तूर्णं निहतैः पाणियन्तृभिः। विपताकध्वजच्छत्रैः पार्थिवाः शीर्णकूबरैः॥ भग्ननीडैराकुलाश्वैः प्रारुग्णाश्च विशेषतः। भग्नाक्षयुगचक्ष व्याकृष्यन्त समन्ततः॥
target: Some rulers of men fled on chariots borne along irregular courses, with parshni drivers slain, deprived of standards, streamers and umbrellas, with their boxes and Kuvaras shattered and all their decorations displaced. Others again, panic-struck and deprived of reason, goading the steeds of their chariots with their toes, fled in all haste.

source: नगरादपि याः काश्चिद् गमिष्यन्ति जनार्दनम्। द्रष्टुं कन्याश्च कल्याणयस्ताश्च यास्यन्त्यनावृताः॥
target: The beautiful girls, that will go out from this ten to see Janardana, will go with out their veils drawn.

source: क्व नु तेऽद्य पिता राजन् क्व नु तेऽद्य पितामहाः। न त्वं पश्यसि तानद्य न त्वां पश्यन्ति तेऽनघ॥
target: Where, O king, is your father, to-day and where your grandfathers? You do not see them to-day and they do not see you. O sinless one.

source: प्रसीद वशगोऽहं ते भक्तं मां भज भाविनि। दृष्ट्वैव त्वां वरारोहे मन्मथो भृशमङ्गने॥
target: O beautiful maiden, be merciful, I am your obedient (slave), (I am) your adorer; accept me. O beautiful lady, O large-eyed maiden, as soon as I saw you, he god of love,

source: सम्पतद्भिः सुरगणैस्तेषां चाभरणौजसा॥ शतादित्यमिवाभाति गगनं गततोयदम्।
target: And eager to witness the spectacle, celestial hosts of immeasurable energy thither and the effulgence of their ornaments, the firmament free from clouds, shone as if with an hundred suns.

source: दृष्टोमयाऽऽश्रमः सौम्य बह्वाश्चर्यः कृतात्मनाम्। विश्वस्तमृगशार्दूलो नानाविहगसेवितः॥
target: Beheld have I, O gentle one, the wondrous asylum of the pure-souled ascetics filled with diverse birds and tigers rambling friendly with antelopes.

source: एवमेव गवामुक्तं प्रदानं ते नृगेण ह। ऋषिणा नाचिकेतेन पूर्वमेव निदर्शितम्॥
target: You have described to me the gifts of kine formerly made by king Nriga. The Rishi Nachiketa, in ancient times, had described the merits of this act.

source: श्यामास्तन्व्यो दीर्घकेश्यो हेमाभरणभूषिताः। शूद्रा विप्रोत्तमाएणि राङ्कवाण्यजिनानि च॥ बलिं च कृत्स्नमादाय भरुकच्छनिवासिनः। उपनिन्युर्महाराज हयान् गान्धारदेशजान्॥
target: All of beautiful features of slender waist, and of long hair, and all adorned with golden ornaments, also many skins of Ranku deer worthy of the best Brahmanas, and also horses of the Gandhara country, were brought by the Shudra kings who lived in the regions on the coast of the sea. O great king,

source: राजसूयं पाण्डवस्य दृष्ट्वा क्रतुवरं महत्। मम स्पृहा समुत्पन्ना तां सम्पादय सूतज॥
target: O Suta's son, seeing the great sacrifice Rajasuya of the Pandavas, I desire to perform the same. Fulfill my this desire."

source: विबुधोऽग्रवरः सूक्ष्मः सर्वदेवस्तपोमयः। सुयुक्तः शोभनो वज्री प्रासानां प्रभवोऽव्ययः॥
target: You are profoundly wise; you are he who first takes a share of the offerings in sacrifices; you are imperceptible; you are the collection of all the celestials; you are he in whom penances prevail; you are always in excellent Yoga; you are auspicious; you are armed with the thunderbolt; you are the source whence the weapons called maces have taken their origin. You are he whom your devotees acquire in various ways. are

source: ततो नरेन्द्रसंकाशैस्तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रैर्महाबलैः। कृत्स्ना संछादिता भूमिरसंख्येयैः प्लवङ्गमैः॥
target: Then the whole ground was covered with innumerable monkeys gifted with great strength, and having sharp teeth, and resembling kings of men.

source: तस्य तच्छतधा चर्म व्यधमत् सायकैस्तथा॥ रथादनवरूढस्य तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्।
target: But before he (Bhishma) could descend from his chariot, Arjuna with his shafts splintered that buckler into hundred fragments. Indeed that looked like something marvelous.

source: प्रसुप्ते हि यथा सिंहे श्वानस्तस्मिन् समागताः। भषेयुः सहिताः सर्वे तथेमे वसुधाधिपाः॥
target: As a pack of dogs bark all together at a sleeping lion, so do all these rulers of the earth.

source: राज्यं गृहाण भरत पितृपैतामहं ध्रुवम्। अभिषेचय चात्मानं पाहि चास्मान् नरर्षभ॥
target: Do you, O Bharata, take charge of this secure kingdom bequeathed by your father and grandfather. Do you, O foremost of men, have yourself sprinkled, and rule over us.

source: अदामहं पृथिवीं ब्राह्मणेभ्यः पूर्णामिमामखिलां वाहनेन। स्तदाददं गाः शतमर्बुदानि।२४॥
target: gave also to Brahmanas this whole earth with her horses, elephants, kine, gold and all kinds of wealth. I gave away also one hundred Arbudas, the excellent milk cows.

source: समरेषु च विक्रान्तं पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम्। आदित्याश्चैव रुद्राश्च साध्याश्च वसुभिः सह॥ मया विनिर्जिताः पूर्वं मरुतश्च शचीपते। त्वमेव शक्र जानासि देवासुरसमागमे॥ नियतं कालपाशेन बद्धं शक्र विकस्थसे। समेता विबुधा भग्नास्तरसा समरे मया। पर्वताश्चासकृत् क्षिप्ताः सवनाः सवनौकसः॥
target: The energy and might used to display in all my battles, prove it clearly. The Adityas, the Rudras, the Saddhyas, the Vasus, and the Maruts, O lord of Shachi, were all defeated by me. You know it well yourself, O Shakra, that in the great battle between the gods and the Asuras, the assembled gods were speedily। routed by me by the fury of my attack. Mountains with their forests and the denizens, were repeatedly hurled by us.

source: श्वश्रूश्वशुरयोरने वधूः प्रेष्यानशासत॥ अन्वशासच्च भर्तारं समाहूयाभिजल्पति।
target: Daughter-in-law, in the presence of their husband's mothers and fathers, rebuke and chastise servants and maids, and calling their husbands lecture and rebuke them.

source: युधिष्ठिराभिषेकं च वासुदेवस्य चाहणम्। न स्याद् यथा तथा कार्यमेवं सर्वे तदाब्रुवन्॥
target: They all said, “We must act in such a way as the final sacrificial rites to be performed by Yudhishthira and this worship of Krishna may not be supposed to have our acquiescence”.

source: नमः स्कन्दविशाखाय ब्रह्मदण्डाय वै नमः। नमो भवाय शर्वाय विश्वरूपाय वै नमः॥
target: I bow to you who are Skanda, to you who are Visakha, to you who are the rod of the are Brahmana, to you who are Bhava, to you who are Sarvam, to you who are of universal form.

source: यदन्यथा भवेदेतद् द्वौ मासौ जीवितं मम। न मां द्रक्ष्यति काकुत्स्थो म्रिये साहमनाथवत्॥
target: Or else there remain two months more of my me. Rāghava shall not see me and I shall quit my life like one having no husband.

source: अस्तम्भनीयं युधि मन्यमानो ज्यां कर्षतां श्रेष्ठतमं पृथिव्याम्। सर्वोत्साहं क्षत्रियाणां निहत्य प्रसह्य कृष्णस्तरसा सम्ममर्द॥
target: He was regarded as being incapable of being vanquished in battle and the foremost among all the users of the bow. Krishna at once killed him by force of his own strength and thus destroyed all the hopes of the Kshatriyas.

source: शीतस्यामृतकल्पस्य दिव्यगन्धरसस्य च। अतर्पयत् ततः पार्थः शीतया जलधारया।॥
target: And cool and nectar-like an fraught with celestial fragrance and tastefulness. Then with that cool jet of water did the son of Pritha gratify.

source: तपः संतापलब्धस्ते सोऽयं धर्मपरिग्रहः। न स नाशयितुं न्याय्य आत्मप्राणपरिग्रहः॥
target: It is not proper to destroy religious merit reaped by undergoing extreme mortification, as well as access of life attained by the same means). (By such an iniquitous act as this.)

source: तमापतन्तं सम्प्रेक्ष्य मागधस्य महागजम्। जघानैकेषुणा वीरः सौभद्रः परवीरहा॥
target: Then the heroic son of Subhadra, that slayer of hostile heroes, beholding that mighty elephant of the ruler of the Magadhas make towards himself, killed it with a single shaft.

source: अन्तरिक्षे च वागुक्ता प्रतिमामानुषि किल। एवमेतन्नरपते धर्मेण तनया तव॥
target: Then there were uttered words in the welkin, resembling those of a human being,! 'O king, in all righteousness, this is your daughter'.

source: न चाहं शीघ्रयानेऽद्य समर्थो वयसान्वितः। सेनामुर न च पार्थानामेतद् बलमुपस्थितम्॥
target: Grown up in years, I cannot indeed proceed so has ily. Moreover, there! do you see the whole army of the Parthas assailing our van.

source: कर्ण उवाच न चैतच्छ्रद्दधे वाक्यं क्षत्रिये त्वया। धर्मद्वारं ममैतत् स्यान्नियोगकरणं तव॥
target: Karna said O Kshatriya, lady, I do not respect the words spoken by you, namely the way to virtue lies in my case to do what you urge me to do.

source: यदि चैतत् कथञ्जित् स्यालोकपर्यासनं भवेत्। हन्यां कर्णं तथा शल्यं बाहुभ्यामेव संयुगे॥
target: But if it so happens you must know that revolution of the word is near and as for myself I will send both Shalya and Kama to the Pluto's den with my army:

target: The greatly strong and powerful Bhima challenges one hundred of us in pride.

source: हन्यादवध्यान् वरदानपि चैव तपस्विनः। संकल्पाभिरुचिः काम: सनातनतोऽभवत्॥
target: They who are endued with penances can destroy even the boongiving deities who are indestructible. Will, or Like, or Desire sprang in former times and is the most eternal of all creatures.

target: They also took Vijaya, who was making a dreadful havoc all round, to be Death himself, who in the guise of Arjuna, was putting an end to all creatures around. And wounded by Partha the bodies of the Kuru soldiers were distressed like those slain by Partha by his superhuman deed. He sundered the heads of the enemies like the tops of Oshadhis.

source: स्तदैन्द्रिरिन्द्रावरजप्रभावः। सज्यं च चक्रे निमिषान्तरेण शरांश्च जग्राह दशार्धसंख्यान्॥

target: This fearful sylvan sovereign, of expanded jaws and frightful figure and oppressed with hunger, is distressing me. Do it not befit you to save me?

source: मनसा सुविशुद्धेन दुष्करेणाल्पचेतसा। सोऽहमात्मोपहारेण यक्ष्ये त्रिपुरघातिनम्॥
target: Purifying my soul, and possessing small energy, I adore the Destroyer of the three cities, and offer myself as the victim.

source: दुर्मरं पुरुषेणेह मन्ये ह्यध्वन्यनागते। यत्र नाहं न मे माता विप्रयुज्येत जीवितात्॥
target: It is clear that one does not die till one's hour comes, since neither myself, nor my mother is deprived of life.

source: अर्चयामास देवांश्च द्विजांश्च यदुपुङ्गवः। माल्यजाप्यनमस्कारैर्गन्धैरुच्चावचैरपि।॥
target: The best of the Yadu race, (Krishna) then worshipped the celestials and the Brahmanas with garlands, with mantras, with various kinds of excellent perfumes and with bowing down his head.

source: पुष्ट्यर्थमेताः सेवेत शान्त्यथर्मपि चैव ह। पयोदधिघृतं चासां सर्वपापप्रमोचनम्॥
target: People should cherish kine for getting prosperity and even peace. The milk, curds, and clarified butter that kine yield are capable of purifying one from every kind of sin.

source: भीष्मेण सर्वमुक्तोऽसि कृष्णेन विदुरेण च। मयाप्यवश्यं वक्तव्यं प्रीत्या ते नृपसत्तम॥
target: You have been instructed in all duties by Bhishma, by Krishna, and by Vidura, I should, also, O best of kings, from the affection I bear you, give you these instructions.

source: सत्कृतासत्कृताश्चापि विकुर्वन्ति मनः सदा। कस्ताः शक्तो रक्षितुं स्यादिति मे संशयो महान्।।१३
target: This great doubt fills my mind, viz., when their conduct is such, what man is there that can restrain them within the limits of virtue? Do you explain this to me, O highly blessed scion of Kuru's race.

source: न वैमनस्यं तस्यास्तु मुखभेदोऽथवाभवत्। शरीरमग्निनादीप्य जलमध्येऽव वहर्पिता॥
target: Her face did not at all change its colour under its agony, nor did she fell sorrow for it. Having thrust her limbs into the fire, she felt as much joy as if she had put them into cool water.

source: सारथिश्च यथा युक्त्वा सदश्वान् सुसमाहितः। देशमिष्टं नयत्याशु धन्विनं पुरुषर्षभ॥ तथैव नृपते योगी धारणासु समाहितः। प्राप्नोत्याशु परं स्थानं लक्षं मुक्त इवाशुगः॥
target: As a careful charioteer, O king, having yoked good horses takes the car warrior to where he likes, even so the Yogin, O king, careful in concentration, soon attains to the highest spot like an arrow shot off the bow reaching the object aimed at.

source: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे वीरः सहदेवो जनाधिप। अपोवाह रथेनाजौ पार्षतं शत्रुतापनम्॥
target: In the interval O king, the heroic Sahadeva carried away on his chariot Parshata the scorcher of his enemies.

source: तमसो लक्षणानीह भक्षणाद्यभिरोचनम्। भोजनानामपर्याप्तिस्तथा पेयेष्वतृप्तता॥ गन्धवासो विहारेषु शयनेष्वासनेषु च। दिवास्वप्नेऽतिवादे च प्रामदेषु च वै रतिः॥ नृत्यवादित्रगीतानामज्ञानाच्छ्रद्दधानता। द्वेषो धर्मविशेषाणामेते वै तामसा गुणाः॥
target: Besides these, the other marks of Ignorance are greediness for food, ceaseless appetite for both food and drink, taking pleasure in scents and dresses and sports and beds and seats and sleep during the day and calumny and all sorts of acts proceeding from carelessness, taking pleasure, in dancing and instrumental and vocal music, and aversion for every sort of religion. These, indeed, are the characteristics of Ignorance.

source: जाटासुरिर्मोक्षयित्वा आत्मानं च घटोत्कचात्। पुनरुत्थाय वेगेन घटोत्कचमुपाद्रवत्॥
target: a And then seizing him by his two arms began to press him with great force against the earth. Then the son of Jatasura freeing himself from the grasp of Ghatotkacha.

source: इहाप्लुतानां कौन्तेय सद्यः पाप्माभिहन्यते। कुरुश्रेष्ठाभिषेकं वै तस्मात् कुरु सहानुजः॥
target: O son of Kunti, if one bathes here his sins are immediately destroyed. O foremost of the Kurus, therefore perform your oblations here with your younger brothers.

source: यद्यप्रियं किंचिदसम्प्रधार्य कृतं मया स्यात् तव दीर्घबाहो। क्षमस्व मे तद्धरिवंशनाथ व्रजामि मूर्धा तव वीर पादौ ॥
target: you of long arms, O lord of monkeys, if I have offended you in any way, do you forgive me, after ascertaining my crime.

source: बाल्यवृत्तानि सर्वाणि प्रीयमाणौ विचिन्त्य तौ। अन्योन्यं प्रेक्षमाणौ च स्मयमानौ पुनः पुनः॥
target: Recollecting their conduct towards each other in their early days and reflecting with pleasure on the same, they looked at each other and smiled repeatedly.

source: मनुरुवाच यदिन्द्रियैस्तूपहितं पुरस्तात् प्राप्तान् गुणान् सस्मरते चिराय। तेष्विन्द्रियेषूपहतेषु पश्चात् स बुद्धिरूप: परमः स्वभावः॥
target: Manu said The mind united with the senses, remembers after a long time the impressions of objects received in the past. When the action of the senses is suspended, the Supreme Soul in the form in the Understanding, exists in its own true nature.

source: अक्षयं यौवनं तेऽस्तु तेजश्चैवानलोपमम्। क्षीरोदः सागरश्चैव यत्र यत्रेच्छसि प्रियम्॥ तत्र ते भविता कामं सांनिध्यं पयसो निधेः। क्षीरोदनं च भुड्क्ष्व त्वममृतेन समन्वितम्॥
target: May you possess everlasting youth, and let your energy be like that of fire. Whenever, again, you may wish for the presence, which is so agreeable to you, of the ocean of milk, there shall that ocean appear before you. Do you, with your friends, always obtain food prepared with milk, with the celestial nectar being mixed। with it.

source: जीवो विनयितासाक्षी मुकुन्दोऽमितविक्रमः। अम्भोनिधिरनन्तात्मा महोदधिशयोऽन्तकः॥
target: He who holds the life-breaths. He who sces all His creatures as objects of direct vision. He who never sees anything besides His own Self. He who gives Liberation. He whose footsteps covered Heaven. Earth, and the Nether regions. He who is the receptacle of all the waters. He who overwhelms all Space. all Tinic. and all things. He who lies on the vast expanse of waters after the universal dissolution. He who causes the destruction of all things. (513-520)

source: कैलासशिखराकारे त्रिकूटशिखरे स्थिताम्। लङ्कामीक्षस्व वैदेहि निर्मितां विश्वकर्मणा॥
target: O Vaidehi, do you behold Lanka, situate on the summit of the mount Citrakūta, resembling that of Kailasa and constructed by Viswakarma.

source: मृतान् महानुभावांस्त्वं श्रुत्वैव पृथिवीपतीन्॥ शममानय संतापं शृणु विस्तरशश्च मे।
target: Listening to the story of those high souled kings, lessen your sorrow. Hear me as I recite fully their stories to you.

source: मृगैर्मुगाणां ग्रहणं पक्षिणां पक्षिभिर्यथा। गजानां च गजैरेव ज्ञेयं ज्ञानेन गृह्यते॥
target: Animals are caught by employing animals as the agents. Birds are caught by employing birds as the agents. Elephants are taken by employing elephants. In this way the Soul may be apprehended by the principle of Knowledge.

source: पितामहो हि कुशलः परेषामात्मनस्तथा। श्रोतुमिच्छाम्यहं सर्वैः सहैभिर्वसुधाधिपैः॥
target: Our grandfather is familiar with ourselves as also with our enemies and I desire to hear all about it, along with these rulers of the earth.

source: चिक्षेप भीमसेनाय जीवितान्तकरीमिव। शक्तिं विसृज्य राधेयः पुरंदर इवाशनिम्॥
target: Hurled it at Bhimasena, charging it with a force capable of taking out Bhima's life. Then like Indra hurling the bolt of heaven, hurling that lance, the son of Radha.

source: उत्थितेषु महाराज पृथिव्यां सर्वराजसु। रहिते संजयं राजा परिप्रष्टुं प्रचक्रमे॥ आशंसमानो विजयं तेषां पुत्रवशानुगः। आत्मनश्च परेषां च पाण्डवानां च निश्चयम्॥
target: After all the kings of the earth have stood up, the great king (Dhritarashtra) began to enquire of Sanjaya in secret, the resolves of his own party and of his enemies and Pandavas, after the one who was subject to wishes of his son had wished them (the kings) success.

source: भीमसेनोऽपि तेजस्वी कौन्तेयोऽमितविक्रमः। समर्थो रक्षितुं राष्ट्र नकुलश्च विशाम्पते॥
target: Bhimasena also is gifted with great energy. That of Kunti is possessed of immeasurable power. He is competent to protect the kingdom, helped by Nakula, O monarch.

source: ततस्तु तावकाः शूराः पुरस्कृत्य महाव्रतम्। शिखण्डिप्रमुखान् पार्थान् योधयन्ति स्म संयुगे॥
target: Then all your warriors placing before them Bhishma of regulated vows began to fight with the Partha's having Shikhandin at their van.

source: सीतापि देवकार्याणि कृत्वा पौर्वाहिणकानि वै। श्वश्रूणामकरोत्पूजां सर्वासामविशेषतः॥
target: Sītā, too, having performed all religious ceremonies of morning, first in all, attended to the service of her mother-in-law.

source: किं पुनर्हन्यमानानां तरसा जीवितार्थिनाम्। अरोगाणामपापानां पापैराँसोपजीविभिः॥
target: What necessity there be said those innocent and healthy creatures gifted with love of life, when they are sought to be killed by sinful wretches living by slaughter?

source: रथिनोऽभ्यधिको वीर कर्तव्यो रथसारथिः। तस्मात्त्वं पुरुषव्याघ्र नियच्छ तुरगान् युधि॥
target: That hero, who is superior to the warrior on the car, should be made to act as the charioteer. You do, therefore, hold the reins of the horses in the field of battle, O foremost of persons.

source: तदिदं व्याकुलं सर्वं कृतं धर्मस्य पीडनात्। भीमसेने न गोविन्द कामं तु यथाऽऽत्य माम्॥
target: It is because Bhimasena, has deviated from morality this harmony, of which I have spoken, has been disturbed, Inspite, O Govinda, of all your arguments to me!'

source: स्वस्ति प्राप्नुत भद्रं वः स्वर्गे न: संगमः पुनः। इत्येवमुक्त्वा तूष्णीं च कुरुराजो महामनाः॥
target: Good be to you all. May you prosper. All of US will again meet together in heaven.'-Having said this the great king of the Kurus became silent.

source: नहि कोपपरीतानि हर्षपर्युत्सुकानि च। भवन्ति युधि योधानां मुखानि निहते पतौ॥
target: When their leader fall, the countenances of the warriors in battle are not overspread with passion, or display cheerfulness and vivacity.

source: पितामहपिता चैव अहमेवात्र कारणम्। इत्येतदुक्त्वा वचनं देवदेवो वृषाकपिः॥ वराहपर्वते विप्र दत्त्वा पिण्डान् सविस्तरान्। आत्मानं पूजयित्वैव तत्रैवादर्शनं गतः॥
target: I am, indeed, the Grandfather and the father, I am the one cause! Having said these words, that God of gods, viz., He called Vrishakapi, offered those funeral cakes, O learned Brahmana, on the breast of the Varaha mountains, with elaborate rites. By those rites. He adored His own self, and having finished the adoration, disappeared there and then.

source: चक्षुषी सोमसूर्यो ते नासा संध्या पुनः स्मृता। ॐकारस्त्वथ संस्कारो विद्युज्जिह्वा च निर्मिता॥
target: The Sun and the Moon became his two eyes. The twilight became his nose. The syllable OM became his memory and intelligence. The lightning became his tongue.

source: स्तमोवृता द्यौर्विचचाल भूमिः। पपात चोल्का ज्वलनप्रकाशा निशाचराश्चाप्यभवन् प्रहृष्टाः॥
target: At Karna's death all the minor points of compass were ablaze. The sky was enshrouded with darkness. The Earth shook. Burning meteors dropped. The Rakshasas and other night rangers were filled with joy.

source: लोमश उवाच युधिष्ठिरासीनृपतिः सोमको नामधार्मिकः। तस्य भार्याशतं राजन् सदृशीनामभूत् तदा।॥
target: Lomasha said: O king, O Yudhishthira, there was a virtuous king, named Somaka. He had one hundred wives, all suitably matched to him.

source: एते चान्ये च बहवो हरियूथपयूथपाः। असंख्येया महाराज समीयू रामकारणात्॥
target: O great king, these and countless other monkey-chiefs arrived thither for the sake of Rama.

source: अस्मिल्लोके सदा ह्येते परत्र च सुखप्रदाः। चरन्ते मान्यमाना वै प्रदास्यन्ति सुखं तव।॥
target: Those persons of whom I speak are always givers of happiness in this world as well as in the next. Respected by all, they move about in this world, and, if adored by you are sure to grant you happiness.

source: अग्निमध्ये गवां मध्ये ब्राह्मणानां च संसदि। विद्यादेवव्रतस्नाता ब्राह्मणाः पुण्यकर्मिणः॥ अध्यापयेरन्शिष्यान् वै गोमतों यज्ञसम्मिताम्। त्रिरात्रापोषितो भूत्वा गोमती लभते वरम्॥
target: Brahmanas of righteous deeds, who have been purified by knowledge, study of the Vedas, and observance of vows, should, only in the midst of sacred fires or kine or conclaves of Brahmanas, impart to their disciples a knowledge of the Gomati Mantras which are in every way like a sacrifice. One should observed a fast for three nights for receiving the boon formed by a knowledge of the meaning of the Gomati Mantras.

source: यत्र मामभिसंधत्से त्वां चाहं शिनिपुङ्गव। त्वं हि प्राणैः प्रियतरो ममाहं च सदा तव॥
target: Inasmuch as you aim weapons at me and I am directing mine at you, O foremost of the descendants of Sins's race. In the days of childhood, you were dearer to me than my very life and I also was so to you.

source: उपासीनस्यधनदं तुम्बुरोः पर्वसंधिषु। गीतसामस्वनस्तात श्रूयते गन्धमादने॥
target: O affectionate one, during the Parvas, when Tambura worships the Lord of wealth, his chanting of the verses of the Samaveda is heard all over the mountain Gandhamadana.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच आसीत् पूर्वं महाराज मुनिर्धीमान् महातपाः। दधीच इति विख्यातो ब्रह्मचारी जितेन्द्रियः॥
target: Vaishampayana said Formerly. O king, there was an intelligent sage of great ascetic viriuc. He was celebrated by the name of Dadhicha. Having governed his senses, he led the life of a Brahmacharin.

source: तिलालाभे तु यो दद्याज्जलधेनुं यतव्रतः। स कामप्रवहां शीतां नदीमेतामुपाश्नुते॥
target: If a cow made of sesame seeds, is not available, one makes a gift of a cow made of water, he succeeds in coming to these happy regions and enjoying this river of cool and transparent water, that can grant the fruition of every desire.

source: तस्मिंस्तदा सम्प्रहारे दारुणे संकुले भृशम्। उभावपि परिश्रान्तौ युध्यमानावरिंदमौ॥
target: During the onset of that dreadful battle, both those chastisers of foes, while fight became exhausted.

source: तेषामन्ये पङ्क्तिदूषास्तथान्ये पङ्क्तिपावनाः। अपाङ्क्तेयास्तु ये राजन् कीर्तयिष्यामि तान् शृणु॥
target: Amongst the Brahmanas there are some who pollute the line and some who purify it. Listen to me, O king, as I tell you those Brahmanas are that should be excluded from the line.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच यदि ते ब्राह्मणा लोके वतिनो भुञ्जते हविः। दत्तं ब्राह्मणकामाय कथं तत् सुकृतं भवेत्॥१६
target: Yudhishinira said If Brahmanas observing the vow of celibacy in this world eat, begging the same the offerings one makes during funeral rites, I ask can the shraddha be considered wellperformed if the performer actually makes over those offerings to such Brahmanas.

source: जगभ्रमन्तोऽनिलवद्दुरासदा रणेषु मृत्युप्रतिमानतेजसः। वरप्रदानादपि गर्विता भृशं क्रतुक्रियाणां प्रशमंकराः सदा॥
target: Incapable of being confronted (in battle), these resembling Death himself in energy, wondrous elated in consequences of the boon having been conferred on them, ranging the world like to the Wind, were ever engaged in disturbing the sacrifices (of the sages).

source: ततो जानपदीं नाम देवकन्यां सुरेश्वरः। प्राहिणोत् तपसो विनं कुरु तस्येति कौरव॥
target: O descendant of Kuru, the king of the celestial summoned a celestial maiden named Janapadi and told her, “Destroy the penances (of Sharadvata).

source: चिन्तयामास कृष्णोऽथ गरुत्मन्तं स चाभ्ययात्। क्षणे तस्मिन् स तेनासीच्चैत्यवृक्ष इवोत्थितः॥
target: When coming out, Krishna thought of Garuda. As soon as thought of, he came there like a large tree worshipped by all.

source: द्वारमुत्तरमासाद्य चिन्तयामास वानरः॥ कैलासनिलयप्रख्यमालिखन्तमिवाम्बरम्। ध्रियमाणमिवाकाशमुच्छ्रितैर्भवनोत्तमैः॥ सम्पूर्णां राक्षसै।रैर्गुहामाशीविषैरिव। तस्याश्च महतीं गुप्तिं सागरं च निरीक्ष्य सः। रावणं च रिपुं घोरं चिन्तयामास वानरः॥ आगत्यापीह हरयो भविष्यन्ति निरर्थकाः। नहि युद्धेन लङ्का शक्या जेतुं सुरैरपि॥
target: And arriving at the Northern gate resembling the mansion of Kailāsa, and cleaving, as it were, the welkin, and as if holding the firmament with lofty and glorious edifices, and observing the sea; his dreadful enemy, Ravana; the city teeming with poisonous snakes, as well as the method of defence (displayed in it)-the monkeys reflected, Even if the monkeys came here, they should fail to achieve success; for Lankā is incapable of being taken in battle by the celestials themselves.

source: अज्ञानात्तु हतो यस्मात् क्षत्रियेण त्वया मुनिः। तस्मात् त्वां नाविशत्याशु ब्रह्महत्या नराधिप॥ त्वामप्येतादृशो भावः क्षिप्रमेव गमिष्यति। जीवितान्तकरो घोरो दातारमिव दक्षिणाम्॥
target: As you a Kşatriya has through ignorance slain an ascetic, the sin, O lord of men, of slaying a Brāhmaṇa will not envelope you speedily; but you shall shortly come by this dreadful and mortal condition, like a donor of Dakşiņās (coming by the things given away).'

source: प्रातिपेयं महेष्वासं हतं भल्लेन बाह्निकम्। प्रसुप्तमिव शार्दूलं पश्य कृष्ण मनस्विनम्॥
target: See, Pratipa's son Valhika, that powerful and highly energetic bowman, slain with a broad-headed shaft, is now lying on the ground like a sleeping tiger.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच किं चिकीर्षत्ययं कर्म भीमो भीमपराक्रमः। भवत्यनुमते कच्चित् स्वयं वा कर्तुमिच्छति॥
target: Yudhisthira said: What is the work that the greatly powerful Bhima wants to performs? Does he wish to do it by your command or of his own will?

source: ततो देवाः सर्षिगणा उपगम्य पितामहम्॥ अब्रुवन्किमिवेहाद्य महद्दाहकृतं भयम्।
target: Then the celestials with the Rishis went to the Grandsire (Brahma) and said, "What is this great and fearful heat today?"

source: तेषां पुरस्ताद्वलवान्गच्छतां गहने वने। विनदन्सुमहानादं विराधः प्रत्यदृश्यत॥
target: Your entering the dense forest there appeared before them the powerful Virādha* emitting a dreadful sound. *A demon of that name.

source: तस्य पञ्चायसास्तीक्ष्णाः सिताः पीतमुखाः शराः। शिरस्युत्पलपत्राभा दुर्धरण निपातिताः॥
target: And Durdhasa discharged at Hanumān's head five white iron (This may rather look an incongruous mixture of images; but the iron arrows may have been silvered over) arrows with yellow heads, and possessing the lustre of lotus-leaves.

source: तत्र कृष्णाजिनधरं जटामण्डलधारिणम्। ददर्श नियताहारं मारीचं नाम राक्षसम्॥
target: And there he saw a Rākṣasa, named Mārīca, clad in a dark deer-skin, bearing a head of matted locks, subsisting on restricted fare.

source: नद्यां चेह यथा काष्ठमुह्यसानं यदृच्छया। यदृच्छयैव काष्ठेन सन्धिं गच्छेत केनचित्॥ तत्रापराणि दारूणि संसृज्यन्ते परस्परम्। तृणकाष्ठकरीषाणि कदाचिन्न समीक्षया।॥
target: In this world, as in a river, a piece of wood that is being carried away by the current, is seen to come into contact (for some time) with another piece which is being likewise carried away. There on the current, other pieces of wood that had been collected together, are scen to again separate from one another. Grass, sticks, and cow dung cakes are seen to be joined together. This union is merely accidental and not brought about by any set design.

source: स महामेघसंकाशं समीक्ष्यात्मानमात्मवान्। निरुन्धन्तमिवाकाशं चकार मतिमान् मतिम्॥
target: Surveying his own person resembling a mighty mass of clouds, and as if closing up the sky, that self-possessed one ascertained his course of action.

source: अथात्वरद् बलानि राजन् समरे निहत्य। त्रिगर्तराजो निहतान् समीक्ष्य महात्मना तानथ बन्धुवर्गान्॥
target: Ever-attended with victory, hide to slay Bhishma, having slain that division of kings. The king of the Trigaretas beholding those mighty car-warriors, his friends slain,

source: पशव्यश्चाल्परोगश्च फलमूलरसायुतः। बहुस्नेहो बहुक्षीरः सुगन्धिर्विविधौषधिः॥
target: This place shall be filled with food nourishing beasts; and ailments shall be rare here. And the fruits and roots shall be replete with relish; and it shall abound in oil and overflow with milk; and it shall contain various adorous drugs.

source: पञ्चविंशे तु दिवसे यः प्राशेदेकभोजनम्॥ सदा द्वादशमासांस्तु पुष्कलं यानमारूहेत्।
target: That man who having fasted for twenty four days, takes a single meal on the twentyfifth day, and acts thus for full year, Succeeds in getting a car of the foremost kind, full of every object of enjoyment.

source: याः काश्चिज्जीवता शक्याः कर्तुमभ्युदयक्रियाः। ताः सर्वाः समतिक्रम्य निमेषादिव्यवस्थिताः॥ तासु चाष्यनवस्थासु त्यक्तसर्वेन्द्रियक्रियः। सम्परित्यक्तधर्मार्थः सुनिर्णिक्तात्मकल्मषः॥
target: Washing my heart of all sins, I shall certainly transcend those sacred rites productive of happiness that men perform at inauspicious moments. I shall also abstain from all acts of Dharma and Artha and from all those acts those that lead to the gratification of senses.

target: Rāma beheld his mother Kausalyā running after the car, bewailing aloud, “Rāma, Rāma, Ah Sītā, Lakşmaņa,” shedding tears for Rāma, Laks maņa and Sītā, and appearing as if she had been dancing incessantly.

source: स धनुर्धन्विनां श्रेष्ठः प्रगृह्य सुसमाहितः। मुमोचाशीविषप्रख्याञ्छरान्देहविदारणान्॥
target: And heedfully taking his bow, that first of bowmen discharged shafts resembling venomous serpents capable of piercing the body.

source: ब्रूयाद् एवं गाण्डीवमन्यस्मै देयमित्युत। वध्योऽस्य स पुमाँल्लोके त्वया चोक्तोऽयमीदृशम्॥५०
target: Whoever in this world tells him, 'Give your Gandiva to anotehr,' would be slain by him. And even these words you addressed him just now.

target: Having performed the Udaka ceremony for that best of birds and considering him in the light of a father they went away and entered the forest in quest of Sītā like to the two best of celestials-Visnu and Vasava. glorious work, that king of vultures, consecrated by the ascetic-like Rāma, attained to an excellent state.

source: पितरं सम्परित्यज्य जगाम मुनिसत्तमः। कैलासपृष्ठं विपुलं सिद्धसंघनिषेवितम्॥
target: Leaving his father, that foremost of Rishis then went to the spacious breast, of Kailasa which was inhabited by numbers of ascetics crowned with success.

source: तेन त्वा परिपृच्छामि धर्मज्ञे धर्मवादिनि। स्त्रीधर्मं श्रोतुमिच्छामि त्वयोदाहृतमादितः॥
target: It is, therefore, O you knowing every duty, that I wish to question you about the duties of women, you whose words are always consistent with righteousness. I wish to hear you describe that subject from the beginning.

target: Some were of very short statures, and some were very high. Some were tall and very dreadful. Some had grim features, some had long lips, and some had long genital organs.

target: The powerful lord of Raksasas-the Tennecked one-made that general of forces-Nilaaflame with dreadful shafts entering into the vitals, resembling snakes.

target: And in that darkness-Indra, Ravana and Meghanāda— these three were not possessed by the influence of illusion. Beholding his whole army slain in a moment, Ravana, worked up with dreadful ire, sent out terrible roars.

source: वासुदेव उवाच जातस्य भारते वंशे तथा कुन्त्याः सुतस्य च। या वै युक्ता मतिः सेयमर्जुनेन प्रदर्शिता॥

source: यं यमुद्दिश्य दीयेरन् देवं सुमनसः प्रभो। मङ्गलार्थं स तेनास्य प्रीतो भवति दैत्यप॥

source: अभिप्रेता च या यस्य तस्मै देया युधिष्ठिर। गान्धर्वमिति तं धर्मं प्राहुर्वेदविदो जनाः॥

target: Markandeya said : O Yudhishthira, that virtuous fowler then said to that Brahmana, “The acts that I perform are certainly cruel, there is no doubt.

target: You will say to him, “O thousand-eyed lord, I will give you the two ear-rings and the excellent armour, if you will bestow on me an infallible dart destructive of enemies."

source: मत्स्यो विराटो बलवान् कृतास्त्रो युद्धदुर्मदः। प्रसहिष्यति संग्रामे भीष्मं तांश्च महारथान्॥

source: एते वानरमुख्याश्च शतशः शत्रुसूदन। प्राप्ताश्चादाय बलिनः पृथिव्यां सर्ववानरान्॥

source: दुर्योधनमभित्यज्य त्रय एते व्यवस्थिताः। कृपश्च कृतवर्मा च द्रौणिश्चैव महारथः॥

target: Arjuna, who was ape-bannered, hearing these words smiled and told Krishna whose prowess was inexhaustible.

source: वैनतेयसुतैः सूत षड्भिस्ततमिदं कुलम्। सुमुखेन सुनाम्ना च सुनेत्रेण सुवर्चसा॥ सुरुचा पक्षिराजेन सुबलेन च मातले। वर्धितानि प्रसृत्या वै विनताकुलकर्तृभिः॥ पक्षिराजाभिजात्यानां सहस्राणि शतानि च। कश्यपस्य ततो वंशे जातैर्भूतिविवर्धनैः॥
target: This species, O Suta, proceed from the six sons of Vainateya (Garuda)-Sumukha, Sunamana, Sunetra, Suvarchas and from the king of birds, Surucha and from Subala; O Matali, they have multiplied from the race of Vinata. Hundreds and thousands of birds, all of noble blood, have founded dynasties by means of begetting children in the race of Kashyapa.

source: किमङ्गदं साङ्गदवीरबाहो विहाय यातोऽसि चिरं प्रवासम्। न युक्तमेवं गुणसंनिकृष्टं विहाय पुत्रं प्रियचारुवेषम्॥
target: O hero, having Arigada on your arms, why are you proceeding on a journey for good in a foreign land leaving behind (your son) Angada. It does not behove you (to leave aside) your dear son, gifted with diverse accomplishments and wearing a charming and beautiful cloth.

source: सर्वे वानरवृद्धाश्च ये चान्ये वानरोत्तमाः। वासोभिर्भूषणैश्चैव यथार्ह प्रतिपूजिताः॥
target: All other elderly and leading monkeys were respectively honoured with clothes and ornaments.

source: गदां त्यक्त्वा ततस्तत्र मुष्टियुद्धमकुर्वत । अन्योन्यं जघ्नतुस्तत्र तावुभौ हरिराक्षसौ॥ रुधिरोद्गारिणौ तौ तु प्रहारैर्जनितश्रमौ। बभूवतुः सुविक्रान्तावङ्गारकबुधाविव॥
target: Thereupon, giving up his mace, he entered into a boxing encounter (with Angada). And hitting each other there, they both-the monkey and the Rākṣasa, richly with prowess, appeared like Angāraka and Budha.

source: लोकानिमांस्त्रीन् यशसा वितत्य सिद्धिं प्राप्य महतीं तां दुरापाम्। गङ्गाकृतानचिरेणैव लोकान् यथेष्टमिष्टान् विहरिष्यसि त्वम्॥
target: On account of your having listened to those merits which I have recounted, you are sure to fill all the three regions with fame and acquire a measure of success that is very large and that is difficult of being won by any other person. Indeed, you will soon after that, sport in joy in many a region of great happiness created by Ganga herself for those that respect her.

source: अद्य पापास्य तद् वाक्यं सुवर्णविकृताः शराः।।९० शमयन्तु शिलाधौतास्त्वयास्ता जीवितच्छिदः।
target: Let your gold-plated and sharpened shafts, capable of dealing death to the living today assuage the sorrows caused by those words of effrontery.

source: आत्मानं च विशेषेण प्रशंसाम्यनपायिनी। यस्य मे त्वं विशालाक्षि भार्या गुणसमन्विता॥
target: I praise my own self greatly since, O largeeyed one, I am fortunate enough to have you as my wife,-you who are possessed of every virtue and who have inexhaustible merits.

source: स विपन्नरथो भीमो नकुलस्याप्लुतो रथम्। हरिर्यथा गिरेः शृङ्गं समाक्रामदरिंदमः॥
target: When his chariot was thus rendered useless, hat subduer of foes, viz., Bhima, quickly jumped into the chariot of Nakula like a lion leaping upon a mountain chest.

source: तत् सुपर्णार्कचरितमास्थितं वैष्णवं पदम्। भाभिरप्रतिमं भाति त्रैलोक्यमवभासयत्॥
target: Riding upon Vishnu's vehicle adorned with Garuda and Surya himself, that object shone forth with matchless splendour and seemed to the three worlds.

source: अनेन धनुषा राम हत्वा संख्ये महासुरान्। आजहार श्रियं दीप्तां पुरा विष्णुर्दिवौकसाम् ॥ तद्धनुस्तौ च तूणी च शरं खङ्गं च मानद। जयाय प्रतिगृह्णष्व वज्रं वज्रधरो यथा॥
target: Having, O Rama, slain the mighty Asuras with this bow, Vişņu in days of yorc in battle secured the effulgent Fortune of the celestials. O bestower of honour, do you for securing victory, take this bow, these quivers, this arrow, and this scimitar, like the holder of the thunderbolt, taking the same.

source: ततः सलिलमुत्पन्नं तमसीवापरं तमः। तस्माच्च सलिलोत्पीडादुदतिष्ठत मारुतः॥
target: Then water originated like something darker within darkness. Then from the pressure of water sprang wing.

source: न श्रावयन् न च यजन् न ददद् ब्राह्मणेषु च। काम्यां वृत्तिं लिप्समानः किंगतिं याति जाजले। इदं तु दैवतं कृत्वा यथा यज्ञमवाप्नुयात्॥
target: What, O Jajali, will be the end of him who does not recite the Vedas to others, who does not celebrate Sacrifices, who does not make gifts to Brahmans, and who follows a calling in which every sort of desire is indulged? By duly respecting, however, the duties which belong to Renunciation, one is sure to attain to Brahima.

source: अंशुमांश्चेकितानश्च श्रेणिमांश्च महाबलः। समुद्रसेनपुत्रश्च चन्द्रसेनः प्रतापवान्॥
target: Angshumana, Chekitana, the mighty Srinimana, Chandrasena, the son of the mighty Subhadrasena both the father and the son,

source: अनूपाधिपतिश्चैव नीलः स्वबलमास्थितः। महता रथवंशेन हैडिम्बं पर्यवारयन्॥
target: And Nila the sovereign of the low countries accompanied by his own divisions. They surrounded the son of Hidimba with a mighty division of cars.

source: प्रभुर्नियमने राजा य एतान् न नियच्छति। भुक्कते स तस्य पापस्य चतुर्भागपिति श्रुतिः॥
target: The king alone is able to restrain and check. That king who does not prevent his subjects (from committing sins) is visited by a fourth part of the sins committed by them. This is the injunction of the Shrutis.

source: द्रोणो भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्चैव महारथाः। साधु साध्विति भाषन्तोऽपूजयन् कर्म तस्य तत्॥
target: Exclaiming "Well-done Well-done" Drona, Bhishma, Karna, and the mighty carwarrior Kripa too, applauded his deed.

source: संजय उवाच कृतवर्माणमामन्त्र्य कृपं च स महारथः। द्रौणिर्मन्युपरीतात्मा शिविरद्वारमागमत्॥
target: Sanjaya said "Inviting Kritavarman as also the great carwarrior Kripa, Drona's son, worked up with rage, approached the gate of the camp.

source: पितर ऊचुः और्व दृष्टः प्रभावस्ते तपसोग्रस्य पुत्रका प्रसादं कुरु लोकानां नियच्छ क्रोधमात्मनः॥
target: The Pitris said : O Aurva, O son, fierce you have become by your asceticism. Your power has been seen by us. Be propitious to the worlds; control your anger.

source: सोऽवतीर्य स्थात् तूर्णमभिवाद्य जनार्दनः। यथावृत्तानृषीन् सर्वानभ्यभाषत पूजयन्॥
target: Then Janardana quickly step down from his chariot, and said all those Rishis with adoration and respect.

source: शान्तिस्वस्तिकरा लोके दिशांपालाः प्रकीर्तिताः। यस्यां यस्यां दिशि ह्येते तन्मुखः शरणं व्रजेत्॥
target: They are the creators of that peace and good which men enjoy. They are said to be the Regents of the quarters. One should turn his face to that direction in which one of these Rishis live if one desires to adore him.

source: उच्चिक्षेप पुनर्दोवा॑मिन्द्रायुधमिवोच्छ्रितम्। नोद्धर्तुमशकद् भीमो दोर्ध्यामपि महाबलः॥
target: Then with both arms he pulled the tail resembling the sacrificial) pole raised up in honour of Indra. But the mighty Bhima failed to raise the tail with both his arms.

source: अथापि तैर्विमुच्येत व्याधिभिः पुरुषो नृप। आवृणोत्येव तं पश्चाजरा रूपविनाशिनी॥
target: If any person, O king, somehow escapes from diseases, Decrepitude, that destroyer of beauty, assails him after-wards.

source: एवं त्वयि न तच्चित्रं भवेद् यत् सौम्य शोभनम्। जानाम्यहं त्वां सुग्रीव सततं प्रियवादिनम्॥
target: I know, O Sugrīva, that you always speakst what is for my good.

source: प्रवृत्तवाक् चित्रकथ ऊहवान् प्रतिभानवान्। आशु ग्रन्थस्य वक्ता च यः स पण्डित उच्यते॥
target: He is said to be a wise man who speaks boldly, can talk on diverse subjects, can argue well, has genius and who can explain the meaning of what is written in books at once.

source: तत्र रावणमासाद्य पुत्रभ्रातृभिरावृतम्। अब्रवीद्गगने तिष्ठन्सामपूर्व प्रजापतिः॥
target: Having obtained Rāvana encircled by his sons and brothers the Patriarch, stationed in the welkin, calmly said.

source: मत्तभ्रमरसंजुष्टं नीलकण्ठरवाकुलम्। सप्तच्छदसमाकीर्णं पुन्नागबकुलैर्युतम्॥
target: The place was swarmed with bees intoxicated with the honey of the flowers; it echoed with the sweet notes of blue throated jay (bird); it was shaded by Saptachadas and Punnyagas and Bakulas.

source: स कदाचिद्वनं गत्वा विप्रः पितृवचः स्मरन्। चुक्रोश कन्याभिक्षार्थी तिस्रो वाचः शनैरिव॥
target: One day he went into the forest and remembering the words of his ancestors, he thrice begged for a bride in a faint voice.

source: लङ्कायां दह्यमानायां शुशुभे च महोदधिः। छायासंसक्तसलिलो लोहितोद इवार्णवे॥
target: On Larkā burning, the mighty main with the reflection (of the conflagration) looked like an ocean of red waters.

source: जरामृत्युभयव्याधिभावाभावविनिश्चयः। विविधस्य च धर्मस्य ह्याश्रमाणां च लक्षणम्॥
target: And it contains the nature of decay, death, fear, disease existence and non-existence; a description of creeds and the account of various modes of life.

source: अश्वमेधे श्रुतिश्चयमश्वसंज्ञपनं प्रति। लोकान्तरगता नित्यं प्राणा नित्यं शरीरिणाम्॥
target: In the Horse-Sacrifice, this Shruti is heard in the matter of the killing of the horse. The certain possessions of embodied creatures, viz., their vital airs (and the senses, etc.) exist eternally even when they are borne to the other world.

source: श्लाध्यः पार्थिववंशस्य प्रमुखे वाहिनीपतिः। पुत्रपौत्रैः परिवृतः शतशाख इव द्रुमः॥
target: He who is enviable in the races of the rulers of the earth, the foremost of all leaders of armies and who surrounded by sons and grandsons is like a tree with a hundred branches,

source: तमब्रवीन्महाराज पुत्रस्तव विशाम्पते॥ ममाज्ञया द्विजश्रेष्ठ द्रोणपुत्रोऽभिषिच्यताम्। सैनापत्येन भद्रं ते मम चेदिच्छसि प्रियम्॥
target: Your son then, O king, said to Kripa-'Let the son of Drona, O foremost of Brahmanas, blessed by you, if you wish to do me good, be, at my command, appointed as generalissimo.

source: षष्टिं गवां सहस्राणि कुरवः कालयन्ति ते। तद् विजेतुं समुत्तिष्ठ गोधनं राष्ट्रवर्धन॥
target: The Kauravas are taking away your sixty thousand kine; rise up, o increaser of territories, to bring them back.

source: सर्प उवाच नहुषो नाम राजाहमासं पूर्वस्तवानघ। प्रथितः पञ्चमः सोमादायोः पुत्रो नराधिप।॥
target: The snake replied O sinless being, O monarch, I was your ancestor, the son of Ayu and fifth in descent from Soma and was known by the name of king Nahusha.

source: तस्मिन् प्रयाते दुर्धर्षे दिवि शब्दो महानभूत्। एष श्रीमानवध्योऽद्य धुन्धुमारो भविष्यति॥
target: When the haughty one was gone away, a loud noise was heard in the heaven, uttering the words-'this invincible hero will this day be the slayer of Dhundhu.'

source: धन्या सा प्रमदा या त्वां पुत्रत्वे कल्पयिष्यति। यस्यास्त्वं तृषितः पुत्र स्तनं पास्यसि देवज॥
target: And O son of a deity, that lady is also blessed who will adopt you as her son and feed you from her breast when you are thirsty.

source: चन्द्रसूर्यौ महाभागावुत्तिष्ठन्तौ परंतपौ॥ निवारयति बाहुभ्यां यः शैलशिखरोपमः।
target: And, who, himself resembling a mountain summit, had by means of his upraised arms, obstructed the rising of these repressor of foes the exalted Sun and Moon;

source: सगदानुद्यतान् बाहून् सखगांश्च विशाम्पते। सप्रासांश्च सतूणीरान् सशरान् शसरासनान्॥ साङ्कुशान् सपताकांश्च तत्र तत्रार्जुनो नृणाम्। निचकर्त शरैरुचै रौद्रं वपुरधारयत्॥
target: Assuming a fierce countenance, Arjuna cut down with fearful arrows the upraised arms of warriors with maces in their hands, also with swords, darts, quivers arrows, bows, hooks and standards.

source: यथाग्नौ शान्ते घृतमाजुहोति तन्नैव देवान् न पितृनुपैति। तथा दत्तं नर्तने गायने च यां चानृते दक्षिणामावृणोति॥
target: When the offerings made at Shraddhas are exchanged by the performers with one another, they become Pishacha presents. Such offerings please neither the gods nor the departed Manes, Instead of reaching the other world, they wander about even here like a cow which has lost her calf wandering about within the fold.

source: क्रीडता हि मया बाल्ये वासुदेव महामनाः । पांसुरूषितगात्रेण महात्मा परुषीकृतः॥
target: O Vasudeva, while playing in the days of childhood, I used to soil the garments of the high-souled and illustrious one by climbing on his lap with my body smeared with dust.

source: अष्टादश दिनान्यद्य युद्धस्यास्य जनार्दन।
target: Today is the eighteenth day, O Janarddana, of this great battle.

source: न तद् भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः। यद् गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद् धाम परमं मम॥
target: The sun lights not that place, nor the Moon, nor the fire. Going there none returns, that is my Supreme seat.

source: सत्यं च नापि हर्तव्यं सारविघ्नं च मा कृथाः। पूज्यन्ते यत्र देवाश्च पितरोऽतिथयस्तथा॥
target: You should never sacrifice truth. You should never obstruct the marriages of men. You should never injure those houses in which the deities, the Pitris, and guests and adored.

source: इति जजल्पुस्ते महर्षयः। संपेतुश्चात्र संतप्ता गन्धर्वाः सह चारणैः॥
target: The Maharsis said, 'Fair befell creatures.' And the Gandharvas along with the Cāranas grew exceedingly agitated.

source: अस्तुवन् विविधैः स्तोत्रैर्महादेवं सुरास्तदा। ब्रह्मा भवं तदाऽस्तौषीद् रथन्तरमुदीरयन्॥
target: The gods were engaged in singing the praises of Mahadeva in various hymns. The Grandfather Brahman, uttering a Rathantara, landed Mahadeva.

source: अन्येषु शिल्पेषु च यान्यपि स्युः सर्वाणि कृत्यान्यखिलेन तत्र। क्रीडानिमित्तान्यपि यानि तत्र सर्वाणि तत्रोपजहार राजा॥
target: The king also collected every article appertaining to other arts and various implements and apparatus of every kind of sports.

source: तस्यापि च महाबाहो नित्यं पश्यामि संयुगे। नान्यं हि प्रतियोद्धारं रौक्मिणेयादृते प्रभो॥
target: I see every day, O mighty-armed one that except Rukmini's son there is no one who can be a match for Drona in battle,Omaster.

source: महीवियद्दिगम्बूनां सर्वनाशमिवाद्भुतम्। कर्मणोरिव वैफल्यमुभयोः पुण्यपापयोः॥
target: And which (the fall of Karna), again, was as extraordinary as the total destruction of the earth, the firmament, the different points of the horizon and the waters and also as the fruitlessness of both virtuous and vicious acts.

source: वयं हि क्षत्रिया राजन् पाण्डोः पुत्रा महात्मनः। ज्येष्ठं मां विद्धि कौन्तेयं भीसेनार्जुनाविमौ॥
target: O king, we are Kshatriyas and we are the sons of the illustrious Pandu. Know me to be the eldest of the sons of Kunti and these two to be Bhima and Arjuna.

source: तत्र ते वचनं शूरः करिष्यति तदा खरः॥ रक्षसां कामरूपाणां प्रभुरेष भविष्यति।
target: There the heroic Khara shall obey your words and be the lord of Raksasas assuming shapes at will.

source: संछिन्ना नेमिभिश्चैव मृदिताश्च हयद्विपैः। क्रोशन्तस्तात पुत्रेति पलायन्ते परे भयात्॥
target: Some loudly calling their sires and their sons fled away in fear, without recognising one another and reduced in energy by grief.

source: प्रपेततुः स्पर्धया च ततस्तौ हंसवायसौ॥ एकपाती च चक्राङ्गः काकः पातशतेन च। पेतिवानथ चक्राङ्ग पेतिवानथ वायसः॥
target: Then those two, the swan the crow, rose into the sky challenging each other-the swan coursing in one motion and the crow in a hundred different ways. The swan flew and the crow flew.

source: दीपिकाः काञ्चनीः काश्चिज्जगृहुस्तत्र योषितः। वालव्यजनहस्ताश्च तालवृन्तानि चापराः॥
target: There among those fair ones, some carried torches with gold handles, chowries and some fans.

source: हस्त्यश्वस्थयानानि वाहनानि विशेषतः। कटके कुण्डले चैव ब्रह्मसूत्रं तथा परम्॥ वस्त्रं चैव विचित्रं च गन्धं चैव विशेषतः। देववत् पूजयेत् तं तु विष्णुलोकमवाप्नुयात्॥
target: Elephants and horses and and conveyances, especially animals and the vehicles they draw, a bracelet of gold a pair of ear-rings, sacred threads, beautiful dresses, and perfumes in especial (should be give). By adoring him as a deity one acquires the regions of Vishnu.

source: तस्यैवं भाषमाणस्य हसतश्च मुहुर्मुहुः। शत्रुघ्नो वीर्यसंपन्नो रोषादश्रूण्यासृजत्॥
target: Lavaņa having said this again and again laughing the great hero Satrughna shed tears in anger.

source: उपस्थितरथं शौरि प्रयास्यन्तमरिंदमम्। धृतराष्ट्रो महाराजः पुनरेवाभ्यभाषत॥
target: The great king Dhritarashtra again said to Shouri, that chastiser of foes, who was about to depart on the chariot which was ready before him.

source: इमौ कुमारौ भद्रं ते देवतुल्यपराक्रमौ। गजसिंहगती वीरौ शार्दूलवृषभोपमौ॥ पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षौ खङ्गतूणधनुर्धरौ। अश्विनाविव रूपेण समुपस्थितयौवनौ॥ यदृच्छयेव गां प्राप्तौ देवलोकादिवामरौ। कथं पद्भयामिह प्राप्तौ किमर्थं कस्य वा मुने॥
target: Good betide you, boasting the prowess of celestials of elephantine or leonine gait, heroic, resembling tigers or bulls, possessed of come expansive eyes like lotus-patals, bearing scimitars and bows and quivers, like to the Aśvins in grace, endowed with youth, like to celestials fancy-led, descended from ethereal regions to the earth beneath, whose sons; O ascetic, are these boys, and what for have they come hither, and why also is it that they journey of foot?

source: राजा तस्याः परं दृष्ट्वा सौकुमार्यं वपुस्तदा। केयं कस्य कुतो वेति बभूवागतविस्मयः॥
target: The king, beholding her delicate form, became filed with wonder and enquired who she was, whose she was, and whence she came.

source: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रान्ते तं तं विधिमकल्पयत्। जलाशी मारुताहारो निराहारस्तथैव च। एवं वर्षसहस्राणि जग्मुस्तान्येकवर्षवत्॥
target: And on a thousand years having been numbered, he by turns observed the rules relative to each term; (at first) living on water, (then) on air, and (last) going absolutely without any food. Thus passed away a thousand years like one.

source: अन्तरिक्षे महानादो भूतानामभवन्नृप॥ अब्रवीच पुनस्तत्र त्वरमाणो जनार्दनः।
target: Loud shouts were heard, O king, in the welkin. Then Janardana once more quickly addressing Arjuna said

source: यस्तु न च्यवते नित्यं यशसा वर्चसा श्रिया। अग्निनिश्च्यवनो नाम पृथिवीं स्तौति केवलम्॥
target: The fire Nischyavana only praises the earth; he never suffers in reputation, splendour and prosperity.

source: न चाकाम: शकुनिना देविताहं न चेन्मां जिष्णुराहयिता सभायाम्। आहूतोऽहं न निवर्ते कदाचित् तदाहितं शाश्वतं वै व्रतं मे॥
target: I am unwilling to gamble. I will not do it (gamble) unless the wicked Shakuni does not challenge me in the Sabha. If however he challenges me, I will never refuse. This is my settled and eternal vow.

source: मैत्रैयेणाभिशप्तश्च पूर्वमेव महर्षिणा। ऊरू ते भेत्स्यते भीमो गदयेति परंतप॥
target: The great Rishi Maitreya also had formerly imprecated Duryodhana, saying, Bhima will, with his mace, break your thighs.

source: तदनीकं महाबाहो भित्तवा परमदुर्जयम्। बलेन महता युक्ताः स्वर्गाय विजयैषिणः॥
target: Breaking through that invincible cavalry division of Iravat, desirous of victory and longing for paradise and endued with great strength,

source: सूक्ष्मयोनीनि भूतानि तर्कगम्यानि कानिचित्। पक्ष्मणोऽपि निपातेन येषां स्यात् स्कन्धपर्ययः॥
target: There are many creatures that are so ininute that their existence is not perceptible. The falling of the eyelids even kills them.

source: कदाचित् पुनरभ्येत्य पुनर्गच्छन्ति संततम्। त्यक्ता मातापितृभ्यां ते न चाकम्पत जाजलिः॥
target: Sometime after he saw that, left by their parents, they went out alone and came back again alone, Jajali did not still move.

source: स्कन्नमात्रं च तच्छुक्रं स्रवेण परिवृज्ञ सः। आज्यवन्मन्त्रतश्चापि सोऽजूहांद् भृगुनन्दन॥
target: As soon as the seed came out, he took it up with the sacrificial ladle and poured it as a libation of clarified butter, O delighter of the Bhrigus with the necessary Mantras, on the burning fire.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच असंशयं संजय सत्यमेतद् धर्मो वरः कर्णणां यत् त्वमात्थ। ज्ञात्वा तु मां संजय गर्हयेस्त्वं यदि धर्मं यद्यधर्मं चरेयम्॥
target: Yudhishthira said Undoubtedly, O Sanjaya, it is as you say namely that virtuous acts are the best among deeds; and knowing, O Sanjaya, whether it is Qur virtue or vice that I follow should you blame me.

source: आजगामाश्रमं तस्यास्त्रिदशाधिपतिः प्रभुः। आस्थाय रूपं विप्रर्वसिष्ठस्य महात्मनः॥
target: The powerful Lord of the celestials then came to that hermitage, having assumed the form of the great Rishi Vashishtha.

source: ततो दक्षिणमल्लांश्च भोगवन्तं च पर्वतम्। तरसैवाजयद् भीमो नातितीव्रण कर्मणा॥

target: Having thus slaughtered your elephants, those foremost of car-warriors, belonging to the side of the Pandavas, looked at the army (on your side), that was running away from the field like a river, flowing down a shore other than where it took its rise.

source: आजहार सुरेशस्य हविषा मुदमाहरत्। अन्यैश्च विविधैर्यज्ञैरीजे बहुगुणैर्नृपः॥
target: He created great joy in Indra by pouring libations of clarified butter on the fire. And, O king, he celebrated many other kinds of sacrifice, all productive of great religious merit.

source: क्रौञ्चहंससमाकीर्णा शरत् प्रमुदिताभवत्। रूढकक्षवनप्रस्था प्रसन्नजलनिम्नगा।॥
target: Then came autumn, crowded with ganders and cranes, when the forest tracts were over grown with verdure and the streams became clear.

source: न ह्यस्य निन्दितं जिष्णोः सुसूक्ष्ममपि लक्षये। चरितं तस्य शूरस्य तन्मे सर्वं प्रकीर्तय॥
target: I do not find the most trivial thing in Jishnu (Arjuna) which might be called censurable. (Therefore) narrate the history of that hero to me.

source: ततो वायुमहाराज दिव्यैर्माल्यैः सुगन्धिभिः। अभितः पाण्डवं चित्ररवचक्रे समन्ततः॥
target: (And) then, O mighty monarch, Vayu (the wind-god) bearing bearing variegated celestials flowers, began to strew them all around the Pandava (Arjuna).

source: हाहेति दिवि देवानां पार्थिवानां च भारत॥ पतमाने बभूव सुमहास्वनः।
target: Then at the overthrow of Bhishma loud lamentations of “Alas" and "Oh" were heard,O Bharata, among the kings, and the celestial in the heaven.

source: अथाभिपत्य वेगेन समुद्धाम्य च राक्षसम्। बलेनाक्षिप्य हैडिम्बिश्चकर्तास्य शिरो महत्॥
target: Then rushing with great violence and whirling the Rakshasa on high and dashing him down again, Hidimba's son cut-off the large head of his adversary.

source: अहं च प्रियकृद् राजन् सात्यकिश्च महायशाः॥ विराटद्रुपदौ चेमौ धृष्टद्युम्नश्च
target: I am also engaged in doing good to you, so are the great car-warriors Satyaki, the revered Virata and Drupada and also the descendant of Prishata, Dhrishtadyumna.

target: The Supreme Being by his constant transformation creates this universe; the Vedas make it plain that the Supreme Being possesses the power (of constant transformation) and that He is the cause of transformation in this world.

source: एवं सर्वेषु भूतेषु भूतात्मा सम्प्रकाशते। दृश्यते त्वङ्घयया बुद्ध्या सूक्ष्मया ज्ञानवेदिभिः॥

source: कर्णद्रोणौ रणे पूर्वं हन्तव्याविति मे मतिः। एतौ हि मूलं दुःखानामस्माकं पुरुषर्षभ॥
target: Then, I think, Drona and Karna should have been slain ere now. O foremost of men, they are the cause of all our miseries.

target: Thereupon the sons of Sagara mutually united together could not find the horse nor the person who had stolen it.

source: हयान् काञ्चनसंनाहान् रथयुक्तान् ससारथीन्। गजांश्च सगजारोहान् सहयान् सादिनस्तदा॥ चिच्छिदुर्बिभिदुश्चैव रामबाणा गुणच्युताः। पदातीन् समरे हत्वा अनयद् यमसादनम्॥
target: And the arrows of Rāma discharged from the string pierced and cut off steeds mailed in gold, yoked to cars, together with the charioteer; and elephants with their riders; and horsemen with horses. And slaying foot-soldiers, he despatched them to the abode of Yama.

source: न चापि भगवान् वाच्यो दीयतामिति भार्गव। देया मे दुहिता चैव त्वद्विधाय महात्मने।॥
target: O son of Bhrigu, O exalted one, you cannot be asked to give (such a dowry). O exalted one, my daughter also cannot be refused (when asked by you). Do what is proper."

target: Persons adorned with ornaments distributed the victuals among the Brāhmaṇas, and they were assisted by others wearing jewelled pendants.
