target: And although strongly dissuaded by Mārīca, saying. You ought not to enter into hostilities with that powerful one. Do you, therefore, O Ravana, excuse me! yet, disregarding those words of his, Ravana, urged on by Fate, went into that asylum in company with Mārīca.

source: नायं लोकोऽस्त्ययज्ञानां परचेति विनिश्चयः। वेदवादविदश्चैव प्रमाणमुभयं तदा॥
target: This is certain, viz., that they who do not celebrate sacrifices have neither this world nor the next. They who are really conversant with the sayings of the Vedas consider both kinds of declarations as equally authoritative.

source: मातलिरुवाच अयं हर्यश्वयुग जैत्रो मघोनः स्पन्दनोत्तमः। अनेन शक्रः काकुत्स्थ समरे दैत्यदानवान्॥ शतशः पुरुषव्याघ्र रथोदारेण जजिवान्। तदनेन नरव्याघ्र मया यत्तेन संयुगे।॥ स्पन्दनेन जहि क्षिप्रं रावणं मा चिरं कृथाः।
target: Matali said: "This excellent and victorious car yoked with this team of tawny horses belongs to Maghavana (Indra). O descendant of Kakustha, O foremost of men, riding on this splendid car Shakra slew in battle numerous Daityas and Danavas. Therefore, O most valiant of men, ascending this car guided by me, do you soon kill Ravana in battle. Do not make any delay."

source: नह्यन्यः साधने हेतुः कर्मणोऽस्य हनूमतः। कार्यसिद्धिहर्नुमति मतिश्च हरिपुङ्गवे॥ व्यवसायश्च वीर्यं च श्रुतं चापि प्रतिष्ठितम्।
target: There is none else but Hanumān who is the instrumental of this work, for that best of monkeys has in him a high intellect, know the art of success, is gifted with courage, strength and prowess and is conversant with Śāstras.

source: तस्मिन्वृक्षे नरः कश्चिदिन्धनार्थाय पार्थिवः। विचिन्वन्पूर्वमारूढः शुष्कशाखावनस्पतौ॥
target: O king, a certain man had climbed that lord of the forest to collect its dry twigs for sacrificial fuel.

source: अशङ्कितमतिः स्वस्थो न शठः परिसर्पति। न चास्य दुष्टवागस्ति तस्मान्मे नास्ति संशयः॥
target: The wily can never come fearless and undisturbed. Nor were his words cunning. So I do not suspect him.

source: दक्षिणं च मुखं रौद्रं केनोर्चे कपिला जटाः। केन कण्ठश्च ते नीलो बर्हिवर्हनिभः कृतः॥
target: And why is that face of yours which is on the truth so dreadful? Why are your matted locks tawny in colour and so erect? Why is your throat blue like the peacock's plumes?

source: यदि बुद्धिः कृता द्रष्टुमगस्त्यं तं महामुनिम्। अद्यैव गमने बुद्धिं रोचयस्व महामते।॥
target: O magnanimous one, if you intend to see the mighty ascetic, Agastya, in that charming woodland, containing a great many trees, then do you make up your mind to set out this very day.

source: किंचिद् धर्मं प्रवक्ष्यामि चित्रगुप्तमतं शुभम्। पानीयं चैव दीपं च दातव्यं सतलं तथा॥ उपानहौ च च्छत्रं च कपिला च यथातथम्। पुष्करे कपिला देया ब्राह्मणे वेदपारगे॥
target: I shall now tell you of some auspicious duties that are approved of by Chitragupta. Water for drink, and lamps for lighting darkness, should always be given as also sandals and umbrellas and Kapila kine with due rites. In Pushkara especially, one should make the gift of a Kapila cow to a Brahmana conversant with the Vedas.

source: दुःशासनं रथास्तूर्णं युज्यन्तां भीष्मरक्षिणः। अनीकानि च सर्वाणि शीघ्रं त्वमनुचोदय॥
target: O Dushasana, let cars be immediately ordered for the protection of Bhishma. Speedily urge all our troops to advance.

source: गोदावरीयं सरितां वरिष्ठा प्रिया प्रियाया मम नित्यकालम्। अप्यत्र गच्छेदिति चिन्तयामि नैकाकिनी याति हि सा कदाचित् ॥
target: This is Godāvarī, the best of rivers, my dear wife took delight in her-has she gone there?—But she never goes there alone.

source: भीष्मस्तु निहते तस्मिन् सारथौ रथिनां वरः। वातायमानैस्तैरश्वैरपनीतो रणाजिरात्॥
target: When his charioteer was thus killed, that foremost of car-warriors Bhishma was borne away from the battle field by his horses which ran with the speed of wind.

source: अतीव कामसंपन्नो वैदेहीमनुचिन्तयन्। अतीतसमये काले तस्मिन्वै युधि रावणः। अमात्यैश्च सुहृद्भिश्च प्राप्तकालममन्यत॥
target: The occasion for war was (wanting Rāvana, possessed by lust, and continually thinking of Vaidehī, conceived along with his counsellors that the time for entering into hostilities had arrived.

source: त्रिशूलपाणे: स्थानं च त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतम्। देविकायाः नरः स्नात्वा समभ्यर्च्य महेश्वरम्॥ यथाशक्ति चरूं तत्र निवेद्य भरतर्षभ। सर्वकामसमृद्धस्य यज्ञस्य लभते फलम्॥
target: Here is situated the region of the wielder of the trident (Shiva) which is celebrated all over the world. Bathing in the Davika and worshipping Maheshvara and by offering Charu to the best of the deities, O best of the Bharata race, one obtains the fruit of sacrifices that is capable of fulfilling every desire.

source: न शक्योऽसौ रणे जेतुं सर्वैरपि सुरासुरैः। बाहुयुद्धेन जेतव्यः स इत्युपलभामहे॥
target: He is incapable of being vanquished in battle by all the celestials and the Asuras. Therefore, my opinion is to defeat him in a single combat.

source: वालिनः सदृशः पुत्रः सुग्रीवस्य सदा प्रियः। राघवार्थे पराक्रान्तः शक्रार्थे वरुणो यथा॥ एतस्य सा मतिः सर्वा यदृष्टा जनकात्मजा। हनूमता वेगवता राघवस्य हितैषिणा॥
target: The worthy son of Vālī and ever dear to Sugrīva, he puts forth his prowess, as Varuņa does for Sakra. That that well-wished of Rāghava, the vehement Hanumān, has seen Janaka's daughter, was owing to the advice of this one.

source: यातुधान्युवाच नामनैरुक्तमेतत् ते दुःखव्याभाषिताक्षरम्। नैतद् धारयितुं शक्यं गच्छावतर पद्मिनीम्॥
target: Yatudhani said The explanation you have given of your name is beyond my understanding on account of the inflections the roots have undergone. Go and plunge into this lake of lotuses.

source: कस्यचित् त्वथ कालस्य व्यासः सत्यवतीसुतः॥ आजगाम महायोगी पाण्डवानवलोककः। तमागतमभिप्रेक्ष्य कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः॥ प्रत्युद्गम्य महात्मानं प्रत्यगृह्णाद् यथाविधि।
target: After a while the son of Satyavati, Vyasa, the great Yogi came there to see the Pandavas. Seeing him coming, the son of Kunti, Yudhishthira, went forward and duly received that high-souled one.

source: सहदेवं तथा राजन् यान्तं भीष्मरथं प्रति॥ वारयामास संक्रुद्धः कृपः शारद्वतो युधि।
target: Then Kripa, the son of Sharadvata, wrought up with rage, checked, in battle, Sahadeva proceeding towards the car of Bhishma.

source: भोजनं भोजनार्थिभ्यो दापयामास शत्रुहा। भीमसनो महातेजाः सततं राजशासनात्॥
target: Bhimasena of great energy, at the command of the king, caused food to be ceaselessly distributed among those who desired to eat.

source: तथोत्थितेषु बहुषु कबधेषु नराधिप। तथा रुधिरगन्धेन योधाः कश्मलमाविशन्॥ मन्दीभूते ततः शब्दे पाण्डवानां महद् बलम्। अल्पावशिष्टैस्तुरगैरभ्यवर्तत सौबलः॥
target: When many headless forms, O king, had thus rise up, when the smell of blood had made the warriors almost senseless and the loud noise had somewhat subsided, Subala's son again approached the large army of the Pandavas, with the small remnant of his cavalry.

source: स गत्वा पाण्डुपुत्रेण तरसा बाहुशालिना। अनायुधेन वीरेण निहतः किं ततोऽधिकम्॥
target: The son of Pandu, the heroic of long arms, having approached him without any arms, killed him. What can be more (wonderful) than this?

source: वाक्येनतेन हि तदा तं जनं पुरुषर्षभः। ह्लादयामास स विभुर्धर्मार्ते सलिलैरवि॥
target: The powerful Krishna, that foremost of men, by uttering these words, pleased all the people assembled there, like one pouring cold water on a person afflicted with sweat.

source: अमोघाः सूर्यसंकाशा निशिता मे शरा इमे। तस्मिन् वालिनि दुर्वृत्ते पतिष्यन्ति रुषान्विताः॥
target: These sharpened shafts of mine, resembling the sun, and never missing, shall furiously fall upon the wicked Vāli.

source: च्यवन उवाच कृपणस्य च यच्चक्षुर्मुनेराशीविषस्य च। नरं समूलं दहति कक्षमग्निरिव ज्वलन्।॥
target: Chyavana said The eye of a poor or distressed person, the eye of an ascetic, or the eye of a snake of dreadful poison, consume a man with his very roots even as a fire, that burning with the aid of the wind and consumes a stack of dry grass or straw.

source: भरतश्चापि दौष्यन्तिर्लेभे भूमिशयादसिम्॥ तस्माल्लेभे च धर्मज्ञो राजन्नैलविलस्तथा।
target: Bhumishaya gave it to Dhushmanta's son Bharata. Bharata, O king, gave it to the righteous Ailavila.

source: ततोऽन्यं देशमास्थाय शक्रः संत्यज्य रावणम्। अयुध्यत महाराज राक्षसांस्त्रासयरणे॥
target: Having said this and left aside Råvaņa, Sakra went to another side, O King, and fought terrifying the Rākşasas in the conflict.

source: पाञ्चालनगरे चापि लक्ष्यं भित्त्वा धनंजयः। द्रौपदी लब्धवानत्र मध्ये सर्वमहीक्षिताम्॥
target: The hitting of the mark at the city of Panchala by Arjuna and the acquisition of Draupadi by him in the midst of all the kings of the world.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच गमने कृतबुद्धिं तु पाण्डवं लोमशोऽब्रवीत्। लघुर्भव महाराज लघुः स्वैरं गमिष्यसि॥
target: Vaishampayana said: Lomasha then thus spoke to the Pandava (Yudhishthira) who had made up his mind, "O great king, be light (as regards your retinue), for if you be thus light, you will be able to go more easily.

source: यो लोभान समीक्षेत धर्मसेतुं सनातनम्। निहन्ति यस्तं समरे क्षत्रियो वै स धर्मवित्॥
target: That Kshatriya knows his duty who kills in battle the person who out of covetousness neglects the eternal restrictions of virtue.

source: बालमतयन्तसुखिनं विचरन्तमभीतवत्। कृतास्त्रा बहवो जघ्नुइँहि गावल्गणे कथम्॥
target: Describe into me, O Gavalgana's son, how did so many warriors accomplished in the use of weapons, slay that veritable child, brought up in luxury and careering (then) dauntlessly in the field?

source: उपायमेते वक्ष्यन्ति ग्रहणे नात्र संशयः। कृत्स्नाद्भयाज्ज्ञातिभयं सुकष्टं विदितं च नः॥
target: They alone unfold the means of our detection, there is not the least doubt about it. Fear from kinsmen is therefore known as the worst of all fears.

source: कृतप्रतिकृतं दृष्ट्वा शल्यो विस्मितमानसः॥ गदामाश्रित्य धर्मात्मा प्रत्यमित्रमवैक्षत।
target: Beholding his own attempt thus thwarted, Shalya was struck with wonder. Of quiescent soul, the king of the Madras took up his mace and began to eye his enemy.

source: आत्तशस्त्रो रणे यत्तो गृहीतवरकार्मुकः। मां पातयतु बीभत्सुरेवं तव जयो ध्रुवम्॥ एतत् कुरुष्व कौन्तेय यथोक्तं मम सुव्रत। संग्रामे धार्तराष्ट्रांश्च हन्याः सर्वान् समागतान्॥
target: Therefore let Vibhatsu armed with weapons and excreting in battle to the best of his abilities and wielding his excellent bow, overthrow me in battle, placing (this Shikhandin or) any one else before him. Thus victory will be yours with certainty. O foremost of kings, O you of chaste vows, do as I tell you. Then you shall be able to slay in battle all the Dhritarashtra assembled together.

source: प्रकीर्णकेशां सुश्रोणी दुर्योधनशुभाङ्कगाम्। रुक्मवेदीनिभां पश्य कृष्ण लक्ष्मणमातरम्॥
target: Behold, O Krishna, the mother of Lakshmana, that lady having large hips, with her hairs disheveled, that dear wife of Duryodhana, resembling a golden sacrificial altar.

source: अस्य रूपस्य ते युक्ता भार्याहं वरवर्णिनी। मया सह सुखं सर्वान् दण्डकान् विचरिष्यसि।७।।
target: I am fit to be your wife possessed of transcendental grace, having regard to this beauty of yours. And with me you will happily range these Dandakas.

source: तत्र यत् सत्यं स धर्मो यो धर्म: स प्रकाशो यः प्रकाशस्तत् सुखमिति। तत्र यदनृतं सोऽधर्मो योऽधर्मस्तत् तमोयत् तमस्तद् दुःखमिति॥
target: Amongst these, Truth is Righteousness; Righteousness is Light; and Light is Happiness. Likewise Untruth is Unrighteousness; Unrighteousness is Darkness; and darkness is Sorrow or Misery.

source: रथे रथे शतं चाश्वा बलिनो हेममालिनः। अश्वे अश्वे गोसहस्रं गवां पञ्चाशदाविकाः॥
target: With each car were a hundred horses adorned with chains of gold and with each horse a thousand cows. With each cow were fifty goats.

source: किं कार्यं ब्राह्मणेनेह मोक्षार्थश्च किमात्मकः। कथं च मोक्षः प्राप्तव्यो ज्ञानेन तपसाथवा॥
target: What are the duties of a Brahmana, and what is the essence of those duties that have Liberation for their object. How, also, is Liberation to be acquired. Is it to be acquired by the help of Knowledge or by that Penances?

source: पश्य कर्णेन हैडिम्बे पाण्डवानामनीकिनी। काल्यमाना यथा गावः पालेन रणमूर्धनि॥
target: Behold, O son of Hidimba, the hosts of the Pandavas afflicted by Karna in battle like a herd of kine belaboured by the keeper.

source: नैनं दुःशासनः सूतं नापि कश्चन सैनिकः। कृत्तोत्तमाङ्गमाशुत्वात् सहदेवेन बुद्धवान्॥
target: Owing to the quickness with which the charioteer's head was cut-off, neither any one among the troops nor Dushasana himself perceived him to have been decapitated by Sahadeva.

source: सा हृतानेन भगवन् मुक्ताहं त्वद्बलेन तु। त्वया देवेन्द्र निर्दिष्टं पतिमिच्छामि दुर्जयम्॥
target: O exalted one, she was carried away, but I have been rescued by your prowess. O lord of the celestials, I desire that you should select for me an invincible husband.

source: यद्येष राजा मत्स्यानां यदि बीभत्सुरागतः। अहमावारयिष्यामि वेलेव मकरालयम्॥
target: If he be the king of Matsya's or Bibhatsu that has come I shall resist him as the banks resist the waving sea.

source: कायाच्छिरः सर्पविषाग्निकल्पैः शरोत्तमैरुन्मथितास्मि रामा खड्न चाहं निशितेन संख्ये कायाच्छिरस्तस्य बलात् प्रमथ्य।॥
target: O Rama, I shall in anger cut off his head from his body with my excellent weapons which are like snakes or poison or fire. I shall by force with my sword sever his head from his body in the field of battle.

source: अयं गिरिश्चित्रकूटस्तथा मन्दाकिनी नदी। एतत् प्रकाशते दूरान्नीलमेघनिभं वनम्॥
target: This is the mountain Citrakuta and that the river Mandakinī. And from a distance this forest appears like dark clouds.

source: सौभद्रस्तु ततः शङ्ख प्रध्माष्य पुरुषर्षभः। शीघ्रमभ्यपतत् सेनां भारती भरतर्षभ॥
target: Thereupon, that foremost of princes viz., Subhadra's son, blowing his conch fell. O foremost of the Bharatas, upon the army of Bharatas.

source: पितॄन् पूज्यादितः पश्चाद्देवतास्तर्पयन्ति वै। तस्मात् तान् सर्वयज्ञेन पुरुषः पूजयेत् सदा॥
target: It is seen that people adore the departed Manes first, and please the celestials next by offering them their worship. Hence, one should always adore the departed Manes with every care.

source: पर्याप्तः परिहासोऽयमेतावान् पुरुषर्षभ। भीताहमतिदुर्धर्ष दर्शयात्मानमीश्वर॥
target: O foremost of men! enough of this joke, let us have no more of it. O invincible one! I am awfully frightened. O lord! show yourself.

source: कर्मणा जायते प्रेत्य मूर्तिमान् षोडशात्मकः। विद्यया जायते नित्यमव्यक्तं ह्यव्ययात्मकम्॥
target: Through acts one is compelled to take rebirth, after death which a body composed of the sixteen ingredients. Through knowledge, however, one becomes metamorphosed into that which is Eternal, is Eternal, Unmanifest, and Immutable.

source: तं च पार्थिवशार्दूलमानयामास तत् पुरम्। तपत्या सहितं राजन् व्युषितं शाश्वतीः समाः। ततः प्रवृष्टस्तत्रासीद् यथापूर्वं सुरारिहा॥
target: O king, he brought back that best of kings (Samvarana) with his wife (Tapati) to that city, after he had passed many years with her.

source: ततः समेत्य नकुलं पर्यपृच्छन्त ते द्विजाः। कुतस्त्वं समनुप्राप्तो यज्ञं साधुसमागमम्॥
target: Approaching the mongoose, they then asked him, saying, 'Whence have you come to this sacrifice this resort of the good and the pious?

source: एवमुक्त्वा दुहितरं समाश्वास्य स भार्गवः। पुनर्जगाम ब्रह्मर्षिर्भवनं स्वं महायशाः॥
target: Having thus imprecated the curse and consoled his sorrowful daughter the highly illustrious Rși Bhārgava repaired to his own habitation.

source: कुण्डलोष्णीषधारीणि जातरूपस्रजस्तथा। पतितानि स्म दृश्यन्ते शिरांसि रणमूर्धनि॥
target: 1 There were seen, fallen in the battle-field, heads having earrings and helmets and golden necklaces.

source: कन्या ऊचुः दिष्ट्या सैरन्ध्र मुक्तासि दिष्ट्यासि पुनरागता। दिष्ट्या विनिहताः सूता ये त्वां क्लिश्यन्त्यनागसम्॥
target: The Daughters said By good luck, O Sairandhri, you have been released and by good-luck you have returned. And by good luck the Sutas have been slain from whom this your misery came.

source: दर्भचीरं निवस्याथ दण्डाजिनविभूषितः। शीर्णं च पतितं भूमौ पर्णं समुपयुक्तवान्।॥
target: Clad in cloth made of grass and with deerskin and holding the Danda (stick), he ate withered leaves fallen on the ground.

source: तस्माद् गोब्राह्मणं नित्यमर्चयेत यथाविधि॥ स्वदेशे परदेशे वाप्यतिथिं नोपवासयेत्।
target: Therefore one should adoren always Brahinanas and kines. One should never cause his guest to go without food whether he lives in his own country or in a foreign land.

source: यदाश्रौषं निर्जितस्याधनस्य प्रताजितस्य स्वजनात्प्रच्युतस्या अक्षौहिणीः सप्त युधिष्ठिरस्य तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय॥
target: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Yudhishthira, who was defeated at dice and deprived of his wealth, who was exiled and separated from his relatives and friends, had collected an army of seven Akshauhinis.

source: द्वैपायनप्रभृतयस्तथा चेमे तपोधनाः। ऋषयः सुव्रता दान्ताः शृण्वन्तु गदतस्तव॥
target: Do you recite those names before this assemblage of Rishis having asceticism for their wealth, observant of high vows, possessed hear you. of self-control, and numbering the Islandborn Krishna among them, may

source: तदत्यद्भुतमालोक्य भूतं लोकभयंकरम्। द्रौणिरव्यथितो दिव्यैरस्त्रवर्षेरवाकिरत्॥
target: Seeing that extraordinary being capable of striking terror to the entire world, Drona's son, without any fear covered him with showers of celestial weapons. That being, however, devoured all those arrows discharged by Drona's son.

source: सर्वतः शुशुभे राजन् रणेऽरीणां दुरासदः। मण्डलं तु समालोक्य व्यूहं परमदुर्जयम्॥
target: Invulnerable in battle by the enemies, O monarch, that array appeared beautiful in every pare. Then beholding that formidable Mandala, array.

source: अर्जुन उवाच संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि। यच्छ्रेय एतयोरेकं तन्मे ब्रूहि सुनिश्चितम्॥
target: Arjuna said O Krishna, you praise Karma Sannyasa (renunciation of action) and also Karma yoga (the pursuit of action). Tell me definitely, which of the two is superior?

source: रक्षमाणः स्वकं व्यूह द्रोणोऽपि सह सैनिकैः। अयोधयद् रणे पार्थान् प्रार्थयानो महद् यशः॥
target: Drona also, desirous of winning great fame, fought on with the Parthas, protecting his array and helped, in the encounter, by his own troops.

source: इन्द्र उवाच न ते बीभत्सता कर्ण भविष्यति कथञ्चन। व्रपाश्चैव न गात्रेषु यस्त्वं नानृतमिच्छसि॥
target: Indra said: O Karna, since you are are desirous of observing the truth, you will not look ugly nor will there be any scars on your body.

source: हत्वा कुरून् महाजन्ये राज्यं प्राप्य धनंजयः। भ्रातृभिः सह कौन्तेयस्त्रीन् मेधानाहरिष्यति॥
target: Slaughtering the Kurus in a great battle and obtaining the kingdom, Dhananjaya, the son of Kunti, along with his brothers, will perform three grand sacrificial rites.'

source: तस्य जिष्णुरुपावृत्य ध्वजं मूलादपातयत्। विकृष्य कलधौताप्रैः स विद्धः प्रापतद् भुवि॥
target: Then approaching him and drawing out a sharp arrow, Vishnu cut off with it the root of his banner. Struck down it fell on the ground.

source: काक्षमाणाः श्रियं कृत्स्नां पृथिव्यां च महद् यशः। कृतान्तविधिसंयुक्ताः कालेन निधनं गताः॥
target: Pursuing great prosperity and fame on Earth, those foremost of men, all of whom were liable to death, have died through the influence of Time.

source: संजय उवाच ततः समभवद् युद्धं शुक्राङ्गिरसवर्चसोः। नक्षत्रमभितो व्योम्नि शुक्राङ्गिरसयोरिव॥
target: Sanjaya said Thereupon the battle waged between them (Arjuna and Ashvatthaman) who were like the planets Sakra and Angirasa in splendour; even as there had taken place a battle between Sakra and Angirasa in the firmament for entering the constellation.

source: अयुद्धमव्यस्थानं नैष धर्मः सनातनः। अनार्यजुष्टमस्वयँ रणे राजन् पलायनम्॥
target: This is no the duty of a Kshatriya. Flight from battle, O king, is not the practice of honourable men, nor it leads to heaven.

source: ततः प्रबुद्धः कौन्तेयः सर्वं संछिद्य बन्धनम्। पोथयामास तान् सर्वान् केचिद् भीताः प्रदुद्रुवुः॥ हतावशेषा भीमेन सर्वे वासुकिमभ्ययुः। ऊचुश्च सर्पराजानं वासुकिं वासवोपमम्॥
target: The son of Kunti (Bhima), having regained his consciousness, burst open the cords and he then pressed them (snakes) all under the ground. Some fled in boar and the rest, that escaped death from Bhima's hands, went and spoke to Vasuki, the king of the snakes, equal to Indra.

source: न दृष्टं न श्रुतं वापि युद्धमेतादृशं नृप। यथा तव सुतानां च पाण्डवानां च भारत॥
target: O king, O descendant of Bharata, a battle like the one that was fought between your sons and the Pandavas was never before seen or heard of.

source: पद्भिरेव गमिष्यामो मा राजन् विमना भव। अहं वहिष्ये पाञ्चालीं यत्र यत्र न शक्ष्यति॥
target: We shall walk on foot. O King, you need not trouble yourself about it. I shall carry the Panchala Princess, wherever and whenever she will be incapable of walking.

source: सागरस्य च तीरेषु शैलेषु च वनेषु च। पिङ्गलास्ते विरूपाक्ष राक्षसैर्बहवो हताः॥
target: And on the shore of the sea, and in mountains and woods many are the tawny-hued monkeys that have been slain by Rākşasas of frightful forms.

source: ते अयं कालो महाबाहो वधायास्य दुरात्मनः॥ छिन्धि मूर्धानमस्याशु कुरु साफल्यमात्मनः।
target: O mighty-armed one this is the opportune moment to slay the wicked-souled weight. Now quickly lop off the head of this fellow and fulfill your vows.

source: तदेतदुपशान्तेन बोद्धव्यं शुचिकर्मणा। योगदोषान् समुच्छिद्य पञ्च यान् कवयो विदुः॥
target: This last is acquired by those who are of pure acts and endued with tranquillity of soul, the means being the subjugation of those five obstacles of Yoga of which the learned speak.

source: विषमं जनयन्त्येत आक्रन्दजननं महत्। त्रिषु सर्वेषु नक्षत्रनक्षत्रेषु विशाम्पते। गृध्रः सम्पतते शीर्ष जनयन् भयमुत्तमम्॥
target: All these bring in a war, which is characterised by many weeping. The constellations are divided into three classes. Upon one or the other of each class evil planet has shed its influence. All this forebodes terrible consequences.

source: हन्यामहमिमां पापां कैकेयीं दुष्टचारिणीम्। यदि मां धार्मिको रामो नासूयेन्मातृघातकम्॥
target: I myself would have slain this wicked Kaikeyi of impious deeds, if the righteous Rāma should not be displeased with me on account of my slaying my mother.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच अर्जुनस्य वचः श्रुत्वा त्वरावानुत्तरस्तदा। अर्जुनस्यायुधान् गृह्य शीघेणावातरत् ततः॥
target: Vaishampayana said Hearing those words of Arjuna, Uttara became active He quickly got down from the tree with Arjuna's weapon.

source: एवं चतुर्णां वर्णानमाश्रमाणां प्रवृत्तिषु। एकमालम्बमानानां निर्णये किं निरामयम्॥
target: Tell me, in what then, if we are to determine the question of happiness, consists pure happiness for all the four castes and all the four modes of life who and which have the same basis.

source: पारिक्षितकथां दिव्यां पुण्याय विजयाय च। कथ्यमानां मया कृत्स्नां शृणु हर्षकरीमिमाम्॥
target: O son of Parikshit, this pleasant and sacred history that secures victory, (to the hearer), I shall now recite to you in full, Listen to it.

source: पौरेषु प्रेषयामास दूतान् वै शीघ्रगामिनः। क्रियतां नगरं सर्वं क्षिप्रमेव स्वलंकृतम्॥ धूपितं सिक्तसम्मृष्टं पताकाभिरलंकृतम्।
target: He despatched swift messengers to the citizens, saying, Let the entire city be embellished; let it be perfumed with dhupa, and watered and decked with pennons.

source: आक्रोष्टा क्रुध्यते राजंस्तथा द्वेष्यत्वमाप्नुते॥ येन येन शरीरेण यद्यत् कर्म करोति यः। तेन तेन शरीरेण तत्तत् फलमुपाश्नुते॥
target: He who acts with hostility towards another becomes the victim of similar deeds done by that other. Whatever acts one does in whatever bodies, he has to suffer the consequences thereof in those bodies.

source: तेन यज्ञेर्बहुविधैरिष्टं पर्याप्तदक्षिणैः। स राजा वीर्यवान् धीमानवाप्य वसु पुष्कलम्॥
target: He celebrated various sacrifices attended with profuse sacrificial presents; that highly puissant and intelligent monarch acquired enormous quality of wealth.

source: सा च दृष्ट्वा तदा व्यासं कामसंविग्नमानसम्। शुकी भूत्वा महाराज घृताची समुपागमत्॥
target: The Apsara, seeing the Rishi's heart smitten with desire, changed herself into a she-parrot and came to that spot.

source: शीलयौवनतस्त्वन्यस्तथान्यः सिद्धसाध्ययोः। ऋभवो मरुतश्चैव देवानां चोदितो गणः॥
target: The Siddhas and the Saddhyas were divided into two classes for their conduct and youth. The deities were formerly divided into two classes, viz., the Ribhus and the Maruts.

source: विरूप उवाच दीयमानं यदि मया नेषिष्यसि कथञ्चन। नियंस्यति त्वां नृपतिरयं धर्मानुशासकः॥
target: Virupa said If you refuge to take when I am ready to give, this king will, forsooth, punish you, for he is an upholder of justice. Vikrita said,

source: दंष्ट्राकरलवदनं व्यादितास्यं भयानकम्। नयनानां सहस्त्रैश्च विचित्रैरभिभूषितम्॥
target: His teeth made his face terrible to look at. His mouth was open and dreadful. His face had a thousand of beautiful eyes.

source: द्रवमाणं तु तत् सैन्यं दृष्ट्वा विगतचेतनम्। मध्यस्थतां च पार्थस्य धर्मपुत्रोऽब्रवीदिदम्॥
target: Then behoiding the army broken and deprived of its senses and seeing the indifference of Partha, the very virtuous king Yudhishthira thus spokeधृष्टद्युम्न पलायस्व सह पाञ्चालसेनया।

source: अतीव खलु ते कान्ता वसुधा वसुधाधिप। गतासुरपि तां गात्रैर्मा विहाय निषेवसे॥
target: O lord of earth, indeed earth is your favourite wife; since renouncing me, you, though dead, are serving her with your body.

source: ब्राह्मणा ऊचुः गच्छताद्यैव पञ्चालान् दुपदस्य निवेशने। स्वयंवरो महांस्तत्र भविता सुमहाधनः॥
target: The Brahmanas said: Go even this very day to the house of the Panchala Drupada. There will be held a great Svaimvara, in which a large sum of money will be spent. with eyes

source: तेषामसंभ्रमं दृष्ट्वा वाजिनां रावणस्तदा॥ भूय एव सुसंक्रुद्धः शरवर्षं मुमोच ह। गदाश्च परिघांश्चैव चक्राणि मुसलानि च ॥ गिरिशृङ्गाणि वृक्षांश्च तथा शूलपलवधान्। मायाविहितमेतत्तु शस्त्रवर्षमपातयत्।। सहस्रशस्तदा बाणानश्रान्तहृदयोद्यमः॥
target: Beholding the steeds thus unmoved Rāvana was again exercise with wrath and began to discharged afresh his various weapons-gadás parighas, chakras and musalas, mountain tops trees, darts and parashus and thousands of other shafts by virtue of his illusive powers. And unmoved was his energy.

source: सूतपुत्रं च संरब्धं पश्य कृष्ण महारणे। अन्तकप्रतिमं वीर्ये कुर्वाणं कर्म दारुणम्॥
target: Behold again in this great encounter O Krishna, the great son of a charioteer, resembling Death himself in power and performing a dreadful feat.

source: वसारुधिरसम्पृक्ता: संध्यायामिव तोयदाः। पिशाचान् पक्षिणो नागान् पशृंश्चैव सहस्रशः॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, the Vrishni hero Krishna, moving about like Death himself, killed again and again thousands of birds, the Pishachas, the Nagas and other creatures.

source: अतीतेष्वनपेक्षा ये प्राप्तेष्वर्थेषु निर्ममाः। शोचमेव परं तेषां येषां नोत्पद्यते स्पृहा॥
target: They who never busy themselves with what is past, they who feel no attachment for present acquisitions, indeed, they who are free from desire, are said to be possessed of the highest purity.

source: त्वयाद्य हि ममानार्य चिरकालमुपार्जितम्। यशो वीर्यं च तेजश्च प्रत्ययश्च विनाशितः॥
target: O abject one! by you have my long earned renown and energy and prowess and credit been brought to naught.

source: तमुवाचाऽव्ययो देवो वरदोऽस्मीति खेचरम्। स वने तव तिष्ठेयमुपरीत्यन्तरिक्षगः॥
target: The undeteriorating Deity said to the great bird, “I am willing to grant you a boon." Thereupon the bird said, "I want to stay above you.”

source: नारायणोऽपीषुवराशनीभिर्विदारयामास धनुर्विमुक्तैः। नक्तंचरान्धूतविमुक्तकेशान्यथाशनीभिः सतडिन्महाभ्रः।।
target: And as the thunder-bolt with lightening (riveth) a mighty mass of clouds, Narayana by means of the thunder-bolts of his arrows discharged from his bow, rived the night-rangers with their hair dishevelled and streaming (in the wind).

source: गिरि कोलाहलं तं तु पदा वसुरताडयत्। निश्चक्राम ततस्तेन प्रहारविवरेण सा॥
target: The mountain Kolahala was kicked by Vasu and the river came out of the embrace of the mountain by the indentation caused by his kick.

source: न मां ब्रूयुरधर्मिष्ठा मूढा ह्यसुहृदस्तथा। शक्तो नावारयत् कृष्णः संरब्धान् कुरुपाण्डवान्॥
target: In order that unrighteous, foolish and unfriendly people may not call me that Krishna though competent did not dissuade the Kurus and Pandavas inspired with rage against each other.

source: यथा वा वाससी शुक्के महारञ्जनिञ्जिते॥ बिभृयाद् युवती श्यामा तद्वदासीद् वसुंधरा। मासंशोणितचित्रेव शातुकम्भमयीव च॥
target: The earth assumed, as it were, the form of youthful maiden of great beauty clad in white robes dyed with deep red. Variegated with flesh and blood the earth appeared as if decked with gold.

source: विवशां धर्षयित्वा च कां त्वं प्रीतिमवाप्स्यसि। प्रजापतिसमो विप्रो ब्रह्मयोनिः पिता तव॥
target: What pleasure will you derive from violating an unwilling woman? Your father is equal to the lord of (all) creatures, a Brahmana and begotten of Brahma.

source: मनसैव हि भूतानि धातैव कुरुते वशे। यद् ब्रवीषि च वार्ष्णेय धार्तराष्ट्रानहं रणे॥
target: By the force of the mind alone, does the Creator bring all creatures under his control. You too, O scion of the Vrishni race, said at the time namely.

source: वाश्चि यूपा यावन्त अश्वमेधे महामखे। ते तथैव पुनश्चान्ते तावन्तः काञ्चनाऽभवन्॥
target: In that great Horse-sacrifice of his, he gave away unlimited wealth and in other sacrifices also he gave away equal amount of gold.

source: जलेचरः काञ्चयष्टिसंस्थो व्यात्ताननः सर्वतिमिप्रमाथी। वित्रासयन् राजति वाहमुख्ये शाल्वस्य सेनाप्रमुखध्वजावयः॥
target: The aquatic creature (Makara), that devourer of all fishes, which was on the golden flag-staff of that best of cars with wide-opened mouth, struck terror into the hearts of all the warriors of (king) Shalva.

source: तत्र देवगणाः साध्या महाभूता महाबलाः। तेषामप्यभवत् पुत्रः समानो नाम दुर्जयः॥
target: The body has the senses. The senses are ruled over by the Sadhyas and many great beings of great strength. These gave birth to an invincible son named Samana.

source: ततः सर्वां महीं जेतुमारब्धावुग्रशासनौ। सैनिकांश्च समाहूय सुतीक्ष्णं वाक्यमूचतुः॥ राजर्षयो महायज्ञैर्हव्यकव्यैर्द्विजातयः। तेजो बलं च देवानां वर्धयन्ति श्रियं तथा॥
target: Being desirous of subjugating the whole earth, those two greatly irresistible heroes, summoning their soldiers, spoke these cruel words, “The royal sages with the help of the Brahmanas increase the strength and prosperity of the celestials by pouring libations on the fire and offering other foods in grand sacrifices.

source: बलेन तुल्यश्च न विद्यते मया नियुद्धशीलश्च सदैव पार्थिवा गजैश्च सिंहैश्च समेयिवानहं सदा करिष्यामि तवानघ प्रियम्॥
target: O ruler of the earth, I am also a wrestler, there is no equal to me in strength. O sinless one, I shall always entertain you by fighting with elephants and lions.

source: परिचिन्त्य तु पश्यामि चक्रायुधमरिंदमम्। न सोऽस्ति त्रिषु लोकेषु यो जयेत जनार्दनम्॥
target: Upon mature thought, I see that there is no person in the three worlds who is able to defeat that subduer of foe viz., Janaraddana, that hero bearing the discus in hand.

source: स्तथा हतात्मा भवितासि पार्थ। तथास्तु कृष्णेत्यभिनन्द्य तद्वचो धनंजयः प्राह धनुर्विनाम्य॥ युधिष्ठिरं धर्मभृतां वरिष्ठं शृणुष्व राजनिति शक्रसूनुः।
target: Therefore, O Partha, now recount to him your merits and valourous deeds and you shall thereby slay yourself.” Dhananjaya, the son of Sakra (Indra) hailed these words, saying-"Be it so." Then lowering his bow, he said unto Yudhishthira, the adored of the virtuous, "Hear me, O king.

source: ततस्तुष्टो महादेवः सर्वलोकेश्वरः प्रभुः। एकभक्त इति ज्ञात्वा जिज्ञासां कुरुते तदा॥ शक्ररूपं स कृत्वा तु सर्वैर्देवगणैर्वृतः। सहस्राक्षस्तदा भूत्वा वज्रपाणिर्महायशाः॥
target: After this, the powerful Mahadeva the Lord of all the universe became propitiated with me. Desirous of determining whether I was solely devoted to him only, he appeared before me in the form of Shakra surrounded by all the gods. As the celebrated Shakra, he had a thousand eyes on his body and was armed with the thunderbolt.

source: अभिवाद्याभिवाद्यांस्त्वं हत्वा विघ्नकरानपि। सिद्धार्थः संनिवर्तस्व मम यज्ञस्व पारगः॥
target: And honouring those that deserve to be honoured and slaying such as disturb you, do you, having attained your end, come back, becoming the instrument for the completion of my sacrifice.'

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच स मित्रसहमासाद्य अभिज्ञानमयाचत। तस्मै ददावभिज्ञानं स चेक्ष्वाकुवरस्तदा॥
target: Vaishampayana said Returning to king Saudasa who was always well-disposed towards all his friends, Utanka solicited him for some sign. That foremost one of Ikshaku's race then gave him a sign.

source: ततः शोकेन महता शैलराजसुतां नृपः॥ प्रणिपत्य उमां देवीं सर्वेणैवान्तरात्मना। ईशे वराणां वरदे लोकानामसि भामिनी॥ अमोघदर्शने देवी भज सौम्येन चक्षुषा।
target: Being stricken with great sorrow, the king, with whole heart, saluted the daughter of the mountain-chief and said:-0 goddess, you are the protectress of all-you do confer boons on all; seeing you does not become fruitless. Do you therefore have compassion on me.

source: तौ दृष्ट्वा तु तदा सिद्धा समुत्थाय कृताञ्जलिः। पादौ जग्राह रामस्य लक्ष्मणस्य च धीमतः॥ पाद्यमाचमनीयं च सर्वं प्रादाद् यथाविधि। तामुवाच श्रमणी धर्मसंस्थिताम्॥
target: No sooner had that one of perfect asceticism beheld those highly intelligent Rāma and Laks maņa than she rose up with folded hands and touching their feet offered them duly water for washing their feet and mouth. Thereupon Rāma spoke to that female ascetic, engaged in religious services.

source: संपूजितो मघवता वसुश्चेदीश्वरो नृपः। पालयामास धर्मेण चेदिस्थः पृथिवीमिमाम्॥ इन्द्रप्रीत्या चेदिपतिश्चकारेन्द्रमहं वसुः। पुत्राश्चाऽस्य महावीर्याः पञ्चासन्नमितौजसः॥
target: Vasu, the King of Chedi, thus being blessed by Indra and bestowing boons and performing great sacrifices, continued to observe the festival of Indra. He had five greatly powerful and immeasurably effulgent sons.

source: कृषिगोरक्ष्यमित्येके प्रतिपद्यन्ति मानवाः। पुरुषाः प्रेष्यतामेके निर्गच्छन्ति धनार्थिनः॥
target: For wealth some take to agriculture, some to the tending of the kine and some serve others. Therefore it is extremely difficult to part with wealth which is obtained with such great difficulty.

source: नायं पापसमाचारो मत्तो जीवितुमर्हति। किं तु शक्यं मया कर्तुं यद् राजा सततं घृणी॥५४।
target: This perpetrator of impious deeds does not deserve living at my hands. But what can I do, the king is always merciful.

source: संधाय च शितं बाणं कालाग्निसमतेजसम्। मुमोज परमक्रुद्धस्तस्मिन् घोरे निशाचरे॥
target: Then placing on his bow string whetted shafts blazing like the Fire of dissolution, and highly excited with rage, he discharged them at that dreadful ranger of the night.

source: अस्मान् युधि विनिर्जित्य परिभूय सबान्धवान्। गवां शतसहस्राणि त्रिगर्ताः कालयन्ति ते॥
target: Vanquishing and humiliating us with our relatives in battle, the Trigartas are taking away thousands of your kine.'

source: संहरस्व पुनर्बाणमवध्योऽयं त्वया रणे। एतस्य च शरस्याजौ नावध्योऽस्ति पुमान् क्वचित्।।
target: There is none who cannot be killed by that arrow. He is however unslayable by you in battle, therefore draw back the arrow.

source: दशशताक्षककुब्दरिनिःसृतः किरणकेसरभासुरपिञ्जरः। तिमिरवारणयूथविदारण: समुदियादुदयाचलकेसरी॥
target: Indeed like a lion of the Udaya mountain with beams constituting his manes of glittering yellow, he issued out of his cave in the cast, dispelling the palpable darkness of night, resembling a large herd of elephants.

source: स मुनिस्तस्य विज्ञाय भावज्ञो भयकारणम्। रुतज्ञः सर्वसत्त्वानां तमैश्वर्यसमन्वितः॥
target: Reading the thoughts of all creatures, the sage felt that the dog had sufficient cause for fear. Endued with the six attributes and capable of reading the voices of all animals, the sage said as follows.

source: गाव ऊचुः नावमन्यामहे देवि न त्वां परिभवामहे। अध्रुवा चलचित्तासि ततस्त्वां वर्जयामहे॥
target: The kine said We do not disregard you, O goddess! We do not slight you! You are fickle and of a very restless heart. It is for this only that we take leave of you.

source: नमोऽस्तु वाचस्पतये सवज्रिणे स्वयम्भुवे चैव हुताशनाय। अनेन चोक्तं यदिदं ममाग्रतो वनौकसा तच्च तथास्तु नान्यथा॥
target: Be glory to Vācaspati, Indra, the self existent Brahmā, the lord of fire and may they so grant that the creature who has spoken before me, be real and not imaginary.

source: ऐन्द्रो धर्मः क्षत्रियाणां ब्राह्मणानामथाग्निकः। ब्रह्मवह्निर्मम बलं भक्ष्यामि शमयन् क्षुधाम्॥
target: The Kshatriyas should follow the conduct of Indra. It is the duty of the Brahmanas to behave like Agni. The Vedas are fire. They form my strength. I shall, therefore, eat even this impure food for satisfying my appetite.

source: कर्मणां तु प्रशस्तानामनुष्ठानं सुखावहम्। तेषामेवाननुष्ठानं पश्चात्तापकरं मतम्॥
target: The doing of acts that are commendable leads to happiness; the omission to do these acts causes injury afterwards, which is my opinion.

source: सत्त्वेन कुरुते युद्धं राजन् सुबलवानपि। नोद्यमेन न होत्राभिः सर्वाः स्वीकुरुते प्रजाः॥
target: O king, those that are strong engage in battle by depending on their own courage. They do not conquer people by continued efforts or by the arts of conciliation.

source: यथा हि सार्थं गच्छन्तं ब्रूयात् कश्चित् पथि स्थितः। अहमप्यागमिष्यामि पृष्ठतो भवतामिति ॥ एवं पूर्वैर्गतो मार्गः पैतृपितामहैध्रुवः। तमापन्नः कथं शोचेद् यस्य नास्ति व्यतिक्रमः॥ वयसः पतमानस्य स्रोतसो वानिवर्तिनः। आत्मा सुखे नियोक्तव्यः सुखभाजः प्रजाः स्मृताः।।३१।
target: As while one is proceeding on a road, another stationed by the way, says, 'I too will go in your wake,' even so, the way that has been followed by our predecessors, (must be followed as well by us.) Why should people mourn for deceased relatives), when they are themselves subject to the fate that knows no turning? (Perceiving the destruction of) life declining, like to a current that never turns back, one should engage his soul in happiness; for all men are said to be born for the same.

source: ऋते त्वां राक्षसश्रेष्ठं सर्वविद्यासु पारगम्। स गत्वा त्वरितं वीरं जहि सौभद्रमाहवे॥
target: Save and except, ( foremost of the Rakshasas, your oneself who have seen the end of all learning. So encountering without delay the heroic son of Subhadra, do you slay him in battle.

source: अथाप्युपायं पश्येत दुःखस्य परिमोक्षणे। अशोचन्नारभेतैवं मुक्तश्चाव्यसनी भवेत्॥
target: Instead of gruinbling, one must try to find out the means by which he can be freed from all misery.

source: अग्नि उवाच अहं गच्छामि मघवन् दूतोऽद्य बृहस्पतिं परिदातुं मरुत्ते। वाचं सत्यां पुरुहूतस्य कर्तुं बृहस्पतेश्चापचितिं चिकीर्षुः॥
target: Agni said I shall presently, O worshipful one, go there, as your messenger, to present Brihaspati to king Marutta; and to make Indra's words true, and to show respect to Brihaspati, Agni departed.

source: स वध्यमानो बहुधा राजपुत्रैर्महारथैः। क्रोधमाहारयत् तेषामभावाय द्विजर्षभः॥
target: Thus wounded by those princes, all mighty car-warriors, that foremost of the regenerate wrought himself up with anger, for putting an end to their existence.

source: सूर्यास्तमनमिच्छन्तो लोहितायति भास्करे। ते भुजैर्भोगिभोगाभै—yष्यानम्य सायकान्॥
target: Meanwhile the sun and the heavens had assumed a crimson hue. Desirous of the speedy setting of the sun, the Kaurava warriors bending their bows with arms resembling the tapering bodies of serpents.

source: अश्रुपूर्णे ततो नेत्रे व्यपमृज्य पुनः पुनः। उवाच कोपान्निःश्वस्य दुर्योधनमिदं वचः॥
target: Then repeatedly wiping off his eyes shedding copious tears and breathing in rage, he said these words unto king Duryodhana.

source: विपुल उवाच ब्रह्मर्षे मिथुनं किं तत् के च ते पुरुषा विभो। ये मां जानन्ति तत्त्वेन यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि।॥
target: Vipula said O twiceborn Rishi, who are those two whom I first saw? Who also are those other six whom I saw afterwards? All of them know me. Who indeed, are they to whom you prefer in your speech to me?

source: द्वाभ्यामूर्ध्वं तु मासाभ्यां भर्तारं मामनिच्छतीम्। मम त्वां प्रातराशार्थे सूदाश्छेत्स्यन्ति खण्डशः॥
target: Even then if you do refuse to regard me as your husband, my cooks shall mince your limbs with steel and serve you for my morning meal.

source: धारयन्ति प्रजाश्चैव पयसा हविषा तथा। एतासां तनयाश्चापि कृषियोगमुपासते॥ जनयन्ति च धान्यानि बीजानि विविधानि च।
target: With their milk and the Havi produced therefrom, they sustain all creatures. Their male children are engaged in helping the cultivation and thereby produce various kinds of paddy and other seeds.

source: हनूमान्वक्षसि व्यूढे संचचाल पुनः पुनः। विह्वलं तं तदा दृष्ट्वा हनूमन्तं महाबलम्॥ रथेनातिरथः शीघ्रं नीलं प्रतिसमभ्यगात्।
target: Hit at his spacious chest, Hanumān shook over and over again. And seeing the mighty Hanumān overwhelmed, that powerful carwarrior ascended on his car, approached Nīla.

source: तस्याज्ञां शिरसा योधाः परिगृह्य विशाम्पते। विवर्णवदना राजन् न्यविशन्त महारथाः॥
target: Obeying his orders, O king, the great carwarriors, bending low their heads, left the battle-field depressed and with pale countenances.

source: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच अभिनन्द्यत्वां तात वदामि संजय अजातशत्रु च सुखेन पार्थम्। कच्चित् स राजा कुशली सपुत्रः सहामात्यः सानुजः कौरवाणाम्॥
target: Dhritarashtra said Blessing you, I say, O Sanjaya, is the son of Pritha he who creates no enemies, in happiness? Is that king of the Kauravas well with his sons, ministers and younger brothers.

source: ऊर्ध्वा दृष्टिर्बाहवश्च एकाग्रं च मनोऽभवत्। एकपादाः स्थिताः सर्वे काष्ठभूताः समाहिताः॥
target: They stood there with mind fixed, immovable as stakes of wood, and with eyes upturned and arms raised upward.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच षडपध्वंसजाः के स्युः के वाप्यपसदास्तथा। एतत् सर्वं यथातत्त्वं व्याख्यातुं मे त्वमर्हसि॥
target: Yudhishthira said Who the six that are called Apadhvansaja? Who also are the Apasadas? You should fully explain all this to me.

source: अष्टवक्र उवाच न भद्रे परदारेषु मनो मे सम्प्रसज्जति। उत्तिष्ठ भद्रे भद्रं ते स्वयं वै विरमस्व च॥
target: Ashtavakra said O blessed lady, I am not inclined for sexual union with one who is the wife of another. Leave my bed, O good lady. Blessed be you do, you desist from this of your own accord.

source: विस्था रथिनश्चान्ये धावमानाः समन्ततः। तत्र तत्रैव दृश्यन्ते सायुधाः साङ्गदैर्भुजैः॥
target: Many other car-warriors, deprived of their cars, were seen to rove about with their weapons in their hands and other arm adorned with Angadas.

source: विविक्ते पर्वततटे पाराशर्यो महातपाः। वेदानध्यापयामास व्यास: शिष्यान् महामतिः॥
target: At the foot of those mountains, in a retired spot, Parashara's son of great ascetic merit, viz., Vyasa, taught the Vedas to his disciples.

source: तस्य पार्थो धनुश्छित्त्वा केतुं चिच्छेद मारिष॥
target: He once more pierced Vasudeva's son with three and Partha with five arrows, then O Sire, Pritha's son bursting open his bow, cut down his standard;

source: ममैष आचार्यसुतो द्रोणस्यापि प्रियः सुतः। ब्राह्मणश्च विशेषेण माननीयो ममेति च॥
target: This is the son of my preceptor; this is the very dear son of Drona; especially he is a Brahmana, and so worthy of my veneration.

source: शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः। नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम्॥ तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः। उपविश्यासने युज्याद् योगमात्मविशुद्धये॥
target: Fixing his seat firmly on a clean spot, not too high and not too low, and spreading over it a piece of cloth, a deer-skin and Kusha (grass), there, seated on that seat, with his mind fixed on one point, and restraining his mind and senses, one should practice contemplation for the purification of his self.

source: नदीकुञ्जनितम्बैश्च प्रासादैरुपशोभितम्। गुहाकन्दरसंलीनसिंहव्याघ्रनिषेवितम्॥
target: Beautified with rivers, groves and rocky spurs as so many places in a city), frequented by lions and tigers, hidden in its caves and caverns.

source: इत्यब्रवीत् सदा मां हि विदुरः सत्यदर्शनः॥ तत् सर्वमद्य जानामि व्यवसायं दुरात्मनः।
target: All the Acts of that wicked man, I now find, to be exactly as the great Vidura had said.

source: राम उवाच हिरण्यं मम यच्चान्यद् वसु किंचिदिह स्थितम्। ब्राह्मणेभ्यो मया दत्तं सर्वमेतत् तपोधन॥ तथैवेयं धरा देवी सागरान्ता सपत्तना। कश्यपाय मया दत्ता कृत्स्ना नगरमालिनी॥
target: Rama said: O ascetic, whatever gold and other wealth I had, I have already given them away to the Brahmanas. This lady earth, bounded by the sea and adorned with the garlands of towns and cities, I have given away to Kashyapa.

source: तमतिक्रम्य लक्ष्मीवान् समुद्रे शतयोजने। गिरिः पुष्पितको नाम सिद्धचारणसेवितः॥ चन्द्रसूर्यांशुसंकाशः सागराम्बुसमाश्रयः। भ्राजते विपुलैः शृङ्गैरम्बरं विलिखन्निव॥ तस्यैकं काञ्चनं शृङ्ग सेवते यं दिवाकरः। न तं कृतघ्नाः पश्यन्ति न नृशंसा न नास्तिकाः॥
target: In the sea extending over an hundred Yojanas, a lovely hill, named Puspitaka, the abode of Siddhas and Chăraņas; resembling the rays of the sun or the moon,-resting on the waters of the ocean, looks splendid, piercing the heavens with its giant peaks. Of this (mountain), there is a particular golden summit, which the sun approaches. It is incapable of being beheld by the ungrateful or the atheistical.

source: अवमानमहं प्राप्य न योत्स्यामि कथञ्चन। आपृच्छे त्वाद्य गान्धारे गमिष्यामि गृहाय वै॥
target: Thus having obtained this insult I will never battle in the field, O son of Gandhari, today. I ask your permission, as I am really willing to return home.

source: न हि सस्मार स नृपस्तं शापं काममोहितः। देव्याः सोऽथ वचः श्रुत्वा सम्भ्रान्तो नृपसत्तमः॥
target: Maddened by desire, the king had no recollection of the curse. Hearing the words of the lady (his wife), that best of kings become very much alarmed. a

source: ततः प्रत्यर्चितः सद्भिर्धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः। प्रतिपेदे महद् राज्यं सुहृद्भिः सह भारत॥
target: Thus worshipped by those pious men, king Yudhishthira, with his friends, became installed on the throne of a large kingdom, O Bharata.

source: तथा त्वं संपरिष्वज्य रौद्रयातिनृशंसया। कालरात्र्या मयाच्छिद्य हतः कमललोचनः॥ इह शेषे महाबाहो मां विहाय तपस्विनीम्। प्रियामिव यथा नारी पृथिवीं पुरुषर्षभ ॥
target: Having been brought hither by representing the Fatal Night, fierce and fell, after (being) embraced, and by force, the lotus-eyed one has met with his death. Here lie you, O longarmed one, leaving me lone, and embracing the Earth like your beloved fair.

source: ये नलोभानयन्त्यर्थान् राजानो रजसान्विताः। विषयान् परिरक्षन्ति दुर्गाण्यतितरन्ति ते॥
target: Those kings, who do not, under the influence of passion and covetousness, impose oppressive taxes, and those who protect their own dominions succeed in getting over all difficulties

source: ततोऽहं विप्रमुख्यैस्तैर्यैरस्मि पतितो रथात्। उत्थापितो धृतश्चैव मा भैरिति च सान्त्वितः॥
target: Those foremost of Brahmanas by whom I had been raised up when I had fallen down from chariot, and who had held me and comforted me, saying, “Fear not.”

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एवं स बहुशः सर्वानुक्तवांस्तान् सभासदः। न च ते पृथिवीपालास्तमूचुः साध्वसाधु वा॥
target: Vaishampayana said Thus did he (Vikarna) repeatedly appeal to those that were present in the assembly to answer Draupadi's question. But the kings present did not say a word good or ill.

source: ते पदं विष्णुविक्रान्तं पतत्रिज्योतिरध्वगाः। प्रयाताः प्रहिता राज्ञा हरयस्तु क्षणेन वै॥
target: Despatched by the king, the monkeys, ranging the sphere of birds and stars, immediately went through the welkin.

source: क्षेमधूर्तिस्तु संक्रुद्धः कैकेयस्य महात्मनः। धनुचिच्छेद भल्लेन पीतेन निशितेन ह॥
target: Thereat Kshemadhurti excited the highest pitch of fury, cut-off the bow of the illustrious ruler of the Kekayas with a welltempered and well-sharpened arrow.

source: आगच्छ तात गच्छामो रणकर्म निवर्तताम्। जितं नो विदितं तेऽस्तु स्वस्थो भव गतज्वरः।।३३
target: Do you come, O father, our work in the battle field is finished; know, we have achieved victory; be you consoled and divested of agonies.

source: आचार्यं पूजयित्वा च केतुं सर्वधनुष्मताम्॥ हतं मयाद्य शंसेथा धृष्टद्युम्नं नराधिप।
target: Having adored your preceptor, preceptor, that foremost of bowmen, tell hiin, O king, that Dhrishtadyumna has been killed by me.

source: गच्छेदानीं न ते स्थानमनृतस्येह विद्यते। न त्वया सदृशो युद्धे भविता क्षत्रियो भुवि॥
target: Go hence, this is not the place for a person who behaves falsely. On Earth, no Kshatriya will be your equal in battle.

source: ततस्ते सहिताः सर्वे जलक्रीडामकुर्वत। पाण्डवा धार्तराष्ट्राश्च तदा मुदितमानसाः॥
target: They then, all the Pandavas and the Kurus, were joyfully engaged in sporting in the water.

source: ॐ नमो विश्वगुप्ताय नमो विश्वपराय ते। सांनिध्यं कुरु देवेश सागरे लवणाम्भसि॥
target: “I bow to the god who protects the universe. I bow to the god who is beyond this universe. O lord of gods, come near this salt sea."

source: तेऽपि सर्वे महेष्वासा अयुद्धार्थिनि कौरवे। निर्बन्धं परमं चक्रुस्तदा वै युद्धकाङ्क्षिणः॥
target: Finding the Kuru king reluctant to fight, those great bowmen, themselves desirous of fighting, began to urge him greatly to accept their advice.

source: अज्ञायमाने हीनत्वे संधिं कुर्यात् परेण वै। लिप्सुर्वा कंचिदेवार्थं त्वरमाणो विचक्षणः॥
target: The wise king should quickly make peace with enemies even when he knows that he is not weak, if he can derive any advantage out of it.

source: स बाणजालान्यपि तानि तानि मोघानि पश्यंत्रिदशारिराजः। विसिस्मिये लक्ष्मणलाघवेन पुनश्च बाणानिशितान्मुमोच॥
target: Seeing his arrowy net-v orks rendered ineffectual, that enemy of the celestials-the kingwas seized with wonderment, and again shot sharpened arrows.

source: कथं नरवर श्रेष्ठ पुत्रौ तौ सह सीतया। दुःखितौ सुखसंवृद्धौ वने दुःखं सहिष्यतः॥
target: Why then have you forsaken those foremost of men along with Sītā? Brought up in happiness, and now brought to misery, how can they bear it?

source: तथैव पाण्डवो युद्धे द्रौणि शरशतैः शितैः। नाकम्पयत् संहृष्टो वार्योघ इव पर्वतम्॥
target: In the same way, the son of Pandu, highly gratified, could not shake the son of Drona, in the field of battle, with hundreds of his sharphanded arrows; even as the torrents of rain cannot shake the mountain.

source: वायुवेगसमाः संख्ये कुन्देन्दुरजप्रभाः। आपतन्तं रणे तं तु शंखवणैर्हयोत्तमैः॥
target: The steeds yoked to Satyaki's car resembled the wind in fleetness and were of the effulgence of silver or the moon or the lotus. Then as Satyaki advanced in battle being borne be excellent steeds of the hue of conch-shells.

source: विकृष्य च धनुश्चित्रमाकर्णात् परवीरहा। द्रोणस्यान्तकरं घोरं व्यसृजत् सायकं ततः॥
target: That handsome warrior, the slayer of his foes, then drawing back the string of that bow to his cars, let go a dreadful shaft capable of achieving Drona's destruction.

source: ततः संस्मारितो रामस्तेन वाक्येन मातलेः। जग्राह स शरं दीप्तं निःश्वसन्तमिवोरगम्॥
target: Being reminded by those words of Mätali, Rāma took up the flaming shaft breathing as if like a serpent.

source: उक्तवानर्थतत्त्वेन मयासम्भिन्नदर्शनः। न तु मामन्यथा साधो त्वं ग्रहीतुमिहार्हसि॥
target: Guided by the science of profit, you have said that there is sufficient cause for a breach between you and me. You should not, however, O good friend, take me for what I am not!

source: शिरसाभिनतो ब्रूयाः सर्वासामेव लक्ष्मण। वक्तव्यश्चापि नृपतिर्धर्मेषु सुसमाहितः॥ जानासि च यथा शुद्धा सीता तत्त्वेन राघव। भक्त्या च परया युक्ता हिता च तव नित्यशः॥
target: Thereupon saluting the pious King do you address him, in my name, saying:-You know, O Råghava, that Sitā is pure, ever devoted to you and engaged in your well-being.

source: प्रापितं ते मया वित्तं बहुरूपमनन्तकम्। यत् कृतं धनरत्नाढ्यं दासीशतपरिच्छदम्॥ रूपलावण्ययुक्ताभिर्युवतीभिरलंकृतम्। गृहं चान्तःपुरं सुभ्र क्रीडारतिविराजितम्। तत् सर्वं त्वां समुद्दिश्य सहसाहमुपागतः॥ अकस्मान्मां प्रशंसन्ति सदा गृहगताः स्त्रियः। सुवासा दर्शनीयश्च नान्योऽस्ति त्वादृशः पुमान्॥
target: I have already given to you immense and various wealth and for you a hundred maid servants, with riches and jems and finest robes; O you of air eye-brows, also a palace with inner apartment filled with beautiful, lovely and youthful maid servants and adorned with various sorts of sports and amusements. Having arranged all this, I have all on a sudden come here; the women of my house have begun to praise me, saying: 'There is none like you amongst all the people so well-dressed and beautiful.

source: सेनापतिर्महाराज सत्यवांस्ते महारथः। रणेष्वद्भुतकर्मा च रथी पररथारुजः॥
target: Satyavana, the leader of your armies, O great king, is Maharatha. A car-warrior himself, he is the doer of wonders in battle and works havoc among the enemies' charioteers.

source: यथा सैरन्ध्रदोषेण न ते राजनिदं पुरम्। विनाशमेति वै क्षिप्रं तथा नीतिविधीयताम्॥
target: Soon find out some means O king, by which your kingdom may not be ruined on account of the injuries done to Sairandhri.'

source: संजय उवाच कृतेऽवहारे सैन्यानां प्रथमे भरतर्षभ। भीष्मे च युद्धसंरब्धे हृष्टे दुर्योधने तथा॥
target: Sanjaya said O best of the Bharata race, when the troops were withdrawn on the first day (of battle) and when Duryodhana was exceedingly glad in seeing Bhishma angry in the field of battle.

source: संध्येयं वर्तते रौद्रा ना रात्रिर्दिवसं न च। वृत्रश्चावश्यवध्योऽयं मम सर्वहरो रिपुः॥
target: This is evening, it is not in the sun; it is neither the night nor the day. And Vritra, the enemy who has robbed me of all must be slain.

source: शौनक उवाच भृगुवंशात्प्रभृत्येव त्वया मे कीर्तितं महत्। आख्यानमखिलं तात सौते प्रीतोऽस्मि तेन ते॥
target: Shaunaka said: O child, O Sauti, you have narrated to me this great and extensive history of the Bhrigu race from the birth of Bhrigu. I am much pleased with you.

source: एते नर्दन्ति कौरव्या दृष्ट्वा कर्णस्य विक्रमम्। त्रासयन्तो रणे पाण्डून् सृञ्जयांश्च समन्ततः॥
target: Witnessing Karna's power there the Kauravas are shouting and striking terror to the Pandavas and Srinjayas.

source: जानामि त्वां मह बाहो क्षत्रियाणां क्षयंकर। मया श्रुतं च ते युद्धं जामदग्न्टे. वै सह॥
target: Said these words to Bhishma in battle licking at the same time the corners of his and mouth. “I know you, O mighty-armed hero, to be the destroyer of the Kshatriyas.

source: प्रतर्दन उवाच पृच्छामि त्वां स्पृहणीयरूप प्रतर्दनोऽहं यदि मे सन्ति लोकाः। यद्यन्तरिक्षे यदि वा दिवि श्रिताः क्षेत्रज्ञं त्वां तस्य धर्मस्य मन्ये॥
target: Pratardana said : O handsome one, I am Pratardana by name. I ask you, is there any region for me in heaven or in the firmament to enjoy as fruits of my virtues? You know everything.

source: स किंचिदारात् सम्प्राप्तः समालोक्य महागिरिम्॥ महेन्द्र मेघसंकाशं ननाद स महाकपिः।
target: And from a distance approaching and beholding that mighty mountain, Mahendra, resembling clouds, that redoubted monkey began to roar.

source: अथ वाभ्यर्चनीयोऽयं युष्माकं मधुसूदनः। किं राजभिरिहानीवैरवमानाय भारत॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, if it was your intention to offer the first worship to the slayer of Madhu, why were these kings brought here to be insulted?

source: एवमुक्ते तु गृध्रेण उलूको वाक्यमब्रवीत्। सोमाच्छतक्रतोः सूर्याद्धनदाद्वा यमात्तथा॥ जायते वै नृपो राम किंचिद्भवति मानुषः। त्वं त सर्वमयो देवो नारायण इवापरः॥ याचते सौम्यता राजन्सम्यकप्रणिहिता विभो। समं चरसि चान्विष्य तेन सोमांशको भवान्॥ क्रोधे दण्डे प्रजानाथ दाने पापभयापहः। दाता हर्तासि गोप्तासि तेनेन्द्र इव नो भवान्॥ अधृष्यः सर्वभूतेषु तेजसा चानलोपमः। अभीक्ष्णं तपसे लोकांस्तेन भास्करसंनिमः॥
target: The vulture having said this, the owl began:"True, it is, o king, that is him are the portions of the Moon, Indra, the Sun, Kubera and Yama, but there is in him also a portion of man. But you are yourself the omnipresent deity, Narayana. You, impelled by your own self, do judge all creatures impartially; therefore, a portion of gentleness is well manifest in you and therefore do people call you, a portion of the Moon. O patriarch, in anger, punishment, gift with and fear, you are our giver, destroyer and protector,-it is for this that you are called Indra. in energy you are like fire irrepressible to all creatures, and because you do spread your lustre upon all creatures that you are called the Sun.

source: यथा पितुर्गृहे विप्र प्रासादे शयनं मम। तथाविधे त्वं शयने मामुपैतुमिहार्हसि॥
target: O Brahmana, you should come to me on a bed like the one in which I used to lie in my father's house, his palace.

source: परिणामश्च वयसः सर्वबन्धुक्षयश्च मे॥ सुहृन्मित्रविनाशश्च दैवयोगादुपागतः। कोऽन्योऽस्ति दुःखिततरो मत्तोऽन्यो हि पुमान् भुवि॥
target: This destruction of all my relatives, wellwishers and friends, at this old age has been brought about by Destiny. Who is there on Earth more afflicted than my wretched self.

source: स सूतो राममादाय लक्ष्मणं मैथिली तथा। जगामाभिमुखस्तूर्णं सकाशं जगतीपतेः॥
target: Thereat the charioteer taking Răma, Lakşmaņa an Mithila's daughter, speedily came before the lord of earth.

source: उपसृत्याब्रुवं चार्यामभिगम्य रहोगताम्। सीते रामस्य दूतोऽहं वानरो मारुतात्मजः॥
target: I approached her and bowing down to that worshipful lady who was alone, said “Sita, I am Ram's messenger, a monkey and the son of Pavana (the wind-god).

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच भगवन्नार्थ माहैतद् यथावद्धर्मनिश्चयम्। यथाशक्ति यथान्यायं क्रियते विधिवन्मया॥
target: Yudhishthira said: O adorable one, the duties just mentioned by you are indeed excellent and I perform them properly to the best of my ability.

source: क्रीडत: क्रीडनीयानि ददुः पक्षिगणाश्च ह। सुपर्णोऽस्य ददौ पुत्रं मयूरं चित्रबर्हिणम्॥
target: As he played like a child, various sorts of toys and birds were given to him. Garuda of excellent feathers gave to him a child of his, viz., a peacock having plumes of variegated colour.

source: मामकस्यास्य सैन्यस्य हतोत्सेधस्य संजय। अवशेषं न पश्यामि ककुदे मृदिते सति॥
target: When the best of the leaders were slain, I do not see, O Sanjaya, that even some of the soldiers of my side, who had already lost their courage, will survive (the terrible slaughter).

source: वेदवेदाङ्गविदुषः सत्यधर्मरतस्य ते। ब्राह्मणस्य विशेषेण तवैतन्नोपपद्यते॥
target: You are learned in the Vedas and their auxiliaries and devoted truth and righteousness specially you are a Brahman, so these acts do not become you.

source: ततो याज्यनिमित्ते तु विश्वामित्रवसिष्ठयोः। वैरमासीत् तदा तं तु विश्वामित्रोऽन्वपद्यत॥
target: At this time Vishvamitra, with whom Vasishtha had a great quarrel on the matter of becoming the priest (of the king Kalmashapada), came to the place (where Vasishtha's son and the king were.)

source: अनर्थमर्थं मन्यसे राजपुत्र संग्रन्थनं कलहस्याति घोरम्। तद् वै प्रवृत्तं तु तथा कथंचित् सृजेदसीन् निशितान् सायकांच॥
target: O prince, you consider an act, which will bring in its train the fearful consequences of war and which is really fraught with mischief, as a great blessing. If it once begins, it will produce sharp swords and pointed arrows.

source: कर्णो जाम्बूनदैर्जालैः संछन्नान् वातरंहसः। हयान् विव्याध भीमस्य पञ्चभिः पञ्चभिः शरैः॥
target: Then the heroic Karna pierced each of the steeds of Bhima with five shafts, steeds that were decked with golden caparisons and endued with the fleetness of the wind.

source: कालिङ्गमभिदुद्राव तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रवीत्। ततः श्रुतायुर्बलवान् भीमाय निशिताशरान्॥ प्रेषयामास संक्रुद्धो दर्शयन् पाणिलाघवम्। स कार्मुकवरोत्सृष्टैर्नवभिर्निशितैः शरैः॥ समाहतो महाराज कालिङ्गेन महात्मना। संचुक्रुशे भृशं भीमो दण्डाहत इवोरगः॥
target: Then he rushed towards the Kalinga king, shouting “Wait” “Wait”. Then the greatly powerful Shrutayu, in great anger, shot at Bhima many sharp arrows and thus displayed his great lightness of hands. O king, thus wounded by those nine sharp arrows shot by the Kalinga king from his excellent bow, that great warrior Bhima blazed up in anger like a snake struck with a rod.

source: संशयं स तु कामात्मा चलचित्तोऽल्पचेतनः। अप्राज्ञो न तरत्येनं यो ह्यास्ते न स गच्छति॥
target: The man, however, of weak and little understanding, and whose soul is full of desire and cupidity, is always stricken with doubt. Hence, the man shorn of wisdom never succeeds in crossing over that stream. He also who sits inactively, can never cross it over.

source: अद्य चापि महत् कर्म प्रकरिष्ये महाबल। अहं वाद्य हतः शेष्ये हनिष्ये वाऽद्य पाण्डवान्॥
target: This day, O highly puissant hero, I shall perform a marvelous feat. Either slain I shall lie on the field, or I will today slay the Pandavas.

source: स्वागतं तेऽस्त्विति मुनि मुद्गलः प्रत्यभाषत। पाद्यमाचमनीयं च प्रतिपाद्यार्थ्यमुत्तमम्॥ प्रादात् स तापसायान्नं क्षुधितायातिथिव्रती। उन्मत्ताय परां श्रद्धामास्थाय स धृतव्रतः॥ ततस्तदन्नं रसवत् स एव क्षुधयान्वितः। बुभुजे कृत्स्नमुन्मत्तः प्रादात् तस्मै च मुद्गलः॥
target: The Rishi Mudgala replied by saying “Welcome.” Offered to that hungry, mad ascetic, water to wash his feet and mouth; that Rishi, ever observant of the vow of feeding guests, then placed before him excellent food. Affected by hunger, the mad Rishi ate up all the food given to him. Then Mudgala gave him more food.

source: उपदेशो न कर्तव्यः कदाचिदपि कस्यचित्। उपदेशाद्धि तत् पापं ब्राह्मण: समवाप्नुयात्॥
target: Instruction should never be given on anything to any person. If on account of the instructions given, the instructed cominit any sin, that sin attaches to the Brahmana who gave the instruction.

source: राक्षसा विस्मयं जग्मुः सहसाभिनिपीडिताः। वानरैर्मेघसंकाशैः शक्रतुल्यपराक्रमैः॥
target: The Rākşasas, sore pressed by thousands of monkeys resembling masses of clouds, and like to Śakra himself in battle, were seized with amazement.

source: एवमादि मया सृष्टं पृथिव्यां त्वत्प्रसादजम्। पद्मनाभ विशालाक्ष कृष्ण दुःखप्रणाशन॥
target: All these have been created by me in the first instance, on earth, through your grace. O you that have the lotus springing from your navel, O you of expanded eyes, O Krishna,O soother of all afflictions.

source: गन्धर्व उवाच जितोऽहं पूर्वकं नाम मुञ्चाम्यङ्गारपर्णताम्। न च श्लाघे बलेनाङ्गन नाम्ना जनसंसदि॥
target: The Gandharva said: I have been defeated by you, therefore, I shall give up my former name of Angarparna. In name only I shall not be boastful when really I am not strong in prowess like men.

source: मनसा कर्मणा वाचा शुश्रूषा नैव हीयते। न चान्या हि तथा बुद्धिदृश्यते साम्प्रतं तव॥
target: In thought, in word or in action, your attention to us never flags and it appears, even at present, that you have no other thought in your mind.

source: पाद्यार्थ्याचमनीयैस्तमर्चयामास भारत। स नृपो राज्यसहितं पुत्रं तस्मै न्यवेदयत्॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, worshipping the Rishi with water to wash his feet and with Arghya, the king offered him his on with the whole of his kingdom.

source: ततो नरवरः श्रीमान् नलो राजा विशाम्पते। सान्त्वयामास तानश्वांस्तेजोबलसमन्वितान्॥
target: O monarch, thereupon that most auspicious and best of men, king Nala, comforted the horse, that were endued with strength and energy.

source: कथमेका बहूनां स्याद् धर्मपत्नी न संकरः। एतन्मे भगवान् सर्वं प्रब्रवीतु यथातथम्॥
target: Drupada said : O illustrious one, how can one women become the wife of many men without being defiled by sin. Tell me truly all this in detail.

source: अज्ञश्चाश्रद्धधानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति। नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः॥
target: He, who is ignorant, who has no faith and whose mind is full of misgivings and doubt, is lost. Not this world, not the next, not (any) happiness is for him whose mind is full of doubts.

source: ततो देवो विशुद्धात्मा विमानेन चतुर्मुखः। पायोनिर्जगत्स्रष्टा दर्शयामास राघवम्॥
target: Then the pure-souled and the four-faced god (Brahma) the creator of the universe, who sprang from a lotus (on the nave of Vishnu), appeared before the descendant of Raghu on a chariot.

source: बभूव रजनी घोरा भीरूणां भयवर्धिनी। योधानामशिवा रौद्रा राजन्नन्तकगामिनी॥
target: The night became dark increasing the terror of the cowards. (And) that dismal (night) O king, proved destructive of (numerous) warriors.

source: वनस्थान् भवतो ज्ञात्वा क्लिश्यमानाननाथवत्। समस्थो विषमस्थांस्तान् द्रक्ष्यामीत्यनवस्थितान्॥
target: That purpose is this, knowing that you are exiled in the forest and suffering great afflictions, as if you had no one to take care of you, himself in prosperity, this wretch desired to see you in adversity and misfortune.

source: तथैव ते परिष्वक्ताः परिष्वज्य च ते नृपम्। पुनः पुनः प्रेक्षमाणाः स्वकानारुरुहू रथान्॥
target: The three heroes repeatedly embraced the king and looked steadfastly at him. They then got upon their cars.

source: धर्मज्ञा युद्धकुशला हन्युर्युद्धे सुरानपि॥ एते स्थास्यन्ति संग्रामे पाण्डवानां वधार्थिनः।
target: Conversant with religion and well skilled in battle, would slay the very gods in battle. These will remain on the field of battle for the purpose of destroying the Pandavas.

source: कर्णिनालीकनाराचैर्भिन्नमर्माणमाहवे। अद्यापि न जहात्येनं लक्ष्मीर्भरतसत्तमम्॥
target: Thought all his vital parts have been cut with cloth-yard and bearded arrows and Nalikas, yet the natural beauty of his body has not left this best of the Bharatas.

source: आपदश्चापि बोद्वव्या बहुरूपा नराधिप। भवन्ति राज्ञा कौरव्य यास्ताः पृथगतः शृणु॥
target: Calamity, O king, with which rulers are overtaken, is of many forms. Listen, O you of Kuru's race, as to what those various forms are.

source: वरूथिनी वेगवतीं विद्रुतां सपताकिनीम्। परिगृह्य महासेनां सूतपुत्रोऽपयाद् भयात्॥
target: Taking with him his numerous divisions that were flying with all their standards, Suta's son also, out of fear, fled away.

source: अनुरुवाच जीर्ण: शिशुवदादत्तेऽकालेऽत्रमशुचिर्यथा। न जुहोति च कालेऽग्निं तां जरां नाभिकामये।॥
target: Anu said: Those that are decrepit eat like children and they are always impure. They cannot pour libations on sacrificial fire at the proper time. Therefore, I do not like to take upon myself your old age.

source: चक्रे तेन स संग्राम सहदेवेन भारत। स तमाजौ विनिर्जित्य दक्षिणाभिमुखो ययौ॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, he fought a battle with Sahadeva, but he (Sahadeva) defeated him and then marched towards the south.

source: सभवान् मोक्षयत्वस्मान् यत्नेनास्माद्भुताशनात्। अस्मास्विह हि दग्धेषु सकामः स्यात् सुयोधनः॥
target: Save us with exertion from the impending conflagration. If we are brunt to death, the desire of Duryodhana will be fulfilled.

source: एकः स्वयम्भूर्भगवानाद्यो ब्रह्मा सनातनः। ब्रह्मणः सप्त व पुत्रा महात्मानः स्वयम्भुवः॥
target: There was at first one Eternal, Divine, and Self-create Brahman. The self-create Brahman begat seven illustrious sons.

source: यच्चैव मानुषे लोके यच्च देवेषु किञ्चन। सर्वे तु तपसा साध्यं ज्ञानेन नियमेन च॥
target: Whatever things exist in the world of men, whatever things exist in the region of the celestials, can all be achieved and acquired with the help of penances and knowledge and the observance of vows and restraints.

source: ते तु तं विकृतं सुप्तं विकीर्णमिव पर्वतम्। कुम्भकर्ण महानिद्रं समेताः प्रत्यबोधयन्॥ ऊर्ध्वलोमाञ्चिततनुं श्वसन्तमिव पन्नगम्। भ्रामयन्तं विनिःश्वासैः शयानं भीमविक्रमम्॥ भीमनासापुटं तं तु पातालविपुलाननम्। शयने न्यस्तसर्वाङ्ग मेदोरुधिरगन्धिनम्॥ काञ्चनाङ्गदनद्धाङ्गं किरीटेनार्कवर्चसम्। ददृशुर्नैर्ऋतव्याघ्र कुम्भकर्णमरिंदमम्॥
target: Then they together set about waking up the slumbering Kumbhakarņa looking like a hill extended, and sunk in profound slumber; with his body having its down standing on end; lying down; like a sighing serpent; rolling people* with his powerful breath, reposing; possessed of dreadful prowess; having a huge nose; of a person vast as the nether sphere; lying stretched at length; smelling of fat and blood; decked with golden Angadas; and warning a diadem endowed with the splendour of the sun. And (they) saw that subduer of enemies and foremost of Nairtas-Kumbhakarna.

source: आमन्त्र्य यक्षराजं वै ततः पिब हरस्व च। नातोऽन्यथा त्वया शक्यं किंचित् पुष्करमीक्षितुम्।।८।
target: First take the permission of the king of the Yakshas and then drink (the water of this lake) and take away (the lotuses) If you do not act thus, you will not be able even to look at these flowers.

source: पञ्चालास्त्वेकतो द्रोणमभ्यमन् निशितैः शरैः॥ भीमसेनपुरोगाश्चाप्येकतः पर्यवारयन्।
target: Then the Panchalas, from one side began to assail Drona with their arrows, whilst those headed by Bhima began to check him on the other said,

source: बृहस्पति उवाच संतोषो वै स्वर्गतमः संतोषः परमं सुखम्। तुष्टेन किंचित् परतः सा सम्यक् प्रतितिष्ठति॥
target: Brihaspati said 'Contentment is the highest heaven, and the greatest bliss. There is nothing superior to Contentment. Contentment heads all.

source: तदद्य नैवानघ राज्यमव्ययं न सर्वकामान् वसुधां न मैथिलीम्। न चिन्तितं त्वामनृतेन योजयन् वृणीय सत्यं व्रतमस्तु ते तथा॥
target: Associating you with untruth, I would not, O sinless one, wish even for your company who are agitated with anxiety,* or this entire kingdom, or every object of desire, or the earth, or Mithilā's daughter. Even this is my truthful vow, let also your vow prove true. *Some texts, Living.

source: यथा च स महाबाहुः पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननः। समाश्वासयितुं न्याय्यः सीतादर्शनलालसः॥
target: She is worthy of being consoled like to the great armed (Rāma) having the countenance of the full-moon and anxious to behold Sita.

source: दुःखस्यानुचितो दुःखं सुमन्त्र शयनोचितः। भूमिपालात्मजो भूमौ शेते कथमनाथवत्॥
target: Unworthy of privations, and worthy of excellent beds, how, O Sumantra, a king's son, he is sleeping on the ground like one forlorn?

source: त एते मुदिता राजन्नवध्याः सर्वदैवतैः। निवसन्त्यत्र राजेन्द्र गतोद्वेगा निरुत्सुकाः॥
target: O king of kings, there they dwell happily, indestructible by the gods, free from anxiety and having all their desires fulfilled.

source: षट्कर्मा वर्तयत्येकस्त्रिभिरन्यः प्रवर्तते। द्वाभ्यामेकश्चतुर्थस्तु ब्रह्मसत्रे व्यवस्थितः॥
target: Observing the first kind of conduct a householder may practise all the six well as known duties. He who observes the second kind of conduct should perform three only of these duties, namely learning, giving and taking. He who follows the third kind of conduct should practise only two of the duties (viz., learning, and giving and taking. He who follows the third kind of conduct should practise only two of duties (viz., learning, and giving). The householder practising the fourth mode of life should observe only one duty (viz., reading the scriptures).

source: कृतार्थं चावगच्छामि परमात्मानमाहवे। शत्रूश्च विजितान् सर्वान् निर्वृत्तं च प्रयोजनम्॥
target: I consider myself greatly blessed; I have already vanquished all my enemies in battle and my object has been accomplished.”

source: स पितुः प्रियमन्विच्छन् सहभार्यः सहानुजः। सधनुर्धन्विनां श्रेष्ठो दण्डकारण्यमाश्रितः॥
target: In order to please his father, he with his wife and brother, armed with the best of bows, resided in the Dandaka forest.

source: एतच्च पुष्पकं नाम विमानं सूर्यसंनिभम्। प्रतिगृह्णीष्व यानार्थं त्रिदशैः समतां व्रज॥
target: Do you take for your vehicle this car, named Puşpaka, resembling the Sun himself, and thus raise yourself to an equality with the celestials.

source: स तवास्त्रोपदेशेन वीर्येण च समन्वितः। प्राविशत् तद्बलं बालः सुपर्ण इव सागरम्॥
target: Then that boy of tender years, endued with energy and possessed of the knowledge of weapons received from you, broke through that array, like Suparna entering into the ocean.

source: प्रधावनुरुवेगेन बभञ्ज तरसा दुमान् । हनूमान्परमनुद्धश्चरणैर्दारयन्महीम्॥
target: Thereat rushing a main vehemently (Akampana) speedily broke the trees. And (seeing this) Hanumān, transported with passion, rived the earth with his kicks.

source: महर्षेः कश्यपस्यैते गात्रेभ्यः प्रसृतास्तिलाः। ततो दिव्यं गता भावं प्रदानेषु तिलाः प्रभो॥
target: Sesame seeds sprang from the limbs of the great Rishi Kashyapa. Hence in the matter of gifts, they have come to be considered as possessed of great efficacy.

source: आचार्यपुत्रो यः शूरः सर्वशस्त्रभृतामपि। अश्वत्थामेति विख्यातस्तेनासीत् संगरः कथम्॥
target: How is the battle was that of Ashvatthama with you, the son of your preceptor who was the best among the warriors and armed heroes.

source: ततः पर्वतशृङ्गाणि वनानि विविधानि च। पश्यन् सह मया कामी दण्डकान् विचरिष्यसि॥
target: Then having your wish, in company you will range the Daņdakas, surveying the various mountain summits and forests.

source: अद्य कर्णे हते युद्धे सोमकानां महारथाः॥ कृतं कार्यं च मन्यन्तां मित्रकार्येप्सवो युधि।
target: With the fall of Karna in battle, today, let the mighty car-warriors of the line of Somakas, all anxious for the interests of their allies, rest assured of the issue of this, their engagement.

source: शुश्रुवुस्तस्य ये सर्वे वानराः परिदेवितम्।। वर्तयांचक्रिरेऽश्रूणि नेत्रैः कृष्णेतरेक्षणाः॥
target: Hearing Rāma's lament, the monkeys-those dark-eyed and others-began to shed tears from their eyes.

source: अत्र मध्ये समुद्रस्य कबन्धः प्रतिदृश्यते। स्वर्भानोः सूर्यकल्पस्य सोमसूर्यो जिघांसतः॥
target: Here in the midst of this ocean is seen the hcadless truck of Svarabhanu, (Rahu) who is like the sun himself, lever bent on allowing the sun the moon.

source: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्। दिधक्षन्निव तां सेनां रुषितः पावको यथा॥
target: Thus accosted by Rama, Laksmana, as if consuming that army by his wrath resembling fire, said.

source: कारयामास राज्यं च पितरि स्वर्गते नृपा वर्षाणां शतमेकं च सहस्रं भीमविक्रमः॥
target: Of great prowess, he ascended the throne of his father after the latter had died, and reigned for one thousand and one hundred years.

source: यदा छित्वा भुजौ रामस्त्वां दहेद् विजने वने॥ तदा त्वं प्राप्स्यसे रूपं स्वमेव विपुलं शुभम्। श्रिया विराजितं पुत्रं दनोस्त्वं विद्धि लक्ष्मण॥
target: You shall regain your stalwart and beautiful shape when you shall be burnt by Rāma in a dense forest having got your arms dissevered by him.

source: तस्यास्तद् वचनं श्रुत्वा विष्णुर्लोकनमस्कृतः। उवाच वाक्यं प्रहसन् पृथिवी देवसंसदि॥ धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राणां यस्तु ज्येष्ठः शतस्य वै। दुर्योधन इति ख्यातः स ते कार्यं करिष्यति॥ तं च प्राप्य महीपालं कृतकृत्या भविष्यसि।
target: Hearing these words of hers, Vishnu, adored of all the worlds, smilingly addressed her in the midst of the celestials, saving,-The eldest of the hundred sons of Dhritarashtra, viz., Duryodhana, will accomplish your work. Through that king you object will be achieved.

source: आवयोः कृतमन्योन्यं पुनः संधिर्न विद्यते। स्मृत्वा स्मृत्वा हि ते पुत्रं नवं वैरं भविष्यति।६८॥
target: There cannot be a reconciliation after what we have done to each other. Whenever you will thirt of your son, .'our enmity towards me will become fresh.

source: वाक्यानि सुमहार्थानि परितप्यामि दुर्मतिः॥ उक्तवान् विदुरो यन्मां धर्मात्मा दिव्यदर्शनः।
target: The virtuous Vidura, gifted with divine insight, had told me, your family will be extinct for the sins of Duryodhana.

source: न च ते प्रसभं यस्मात् ते निगृह्य निवारिताः। तस्मान्मन्युपरीतस्त्वां शप्स्यामि मधुसूदन॥
target: Since you did not forcibly compel them to forbear, therefore, O destroyer of Madhu, I shall, filled with anger denounce a course on you.

source: यस्य स्म विषये राज्ञः स्नातकः सीदति क्षुधा। अवृद्धिमेति तद्राष्ट्रं विन्दते सहराजकम्॥
target: That kingdom in which a Brahmana of the Snataka class starves, becomes overwhelmed with adversity. Such a kingdom with its king also incurs reproach.

source: दयित: फाल्गुनो नित्यमाचार्यस्य महात्मनः। ततोऽस्य दत्तवान् द्वारमयुद्धेनैव शत्रुहन्।॥ अभयं सिन्धुराजाय दत्त्वा द्रोणः परंतपः। प्रादात् किरीटिने द्वारं पश्य निर्गुणतां मयि॥
target: (But) The afterwards allowed Kiriti to enter into the array. If he had before given permission to the king of Sindhu to return home, this dreadful havoc would never have taken place in battle. Jayadratha was for returning home in order to save his life.

source: सेयमापदनुप्राप्ता क्षत्ता यां दृष्टवान् पुरा। पुरोचनस्याविदितानस्मांस्त्वं प्रतिमोचय॥
target: The danger that Kshatta (Vidura) saw beforehand is now at our door, Save us from this without the knowledge of Purochana.

source: अर्थाश्चैवाधिगम्यन्ते संघातबलपौरुषैः। बाह्याश्च मैत्री कुर्वन्ति तेषु संघातवृत्तिषु॥
target: If they be united together, they may acquire valuable properties by means of their strength and prowess. When they are thus united, many people from outside seek their alliance.

source: एतान् विमुच्य संवादान् सर्वपापैर्विमुच्यते॥ एतैर्जितस्तु जयति सर्वाल्लोकान् न संशयः।
target: By avoiding quarrels with these, the householder becomes purged of all sins. By conquering such disputes, he succeeds in conquering all the blessed regions. There is no doubt in this.

source: एष ब्रह्मा च विष्णुश्च शिवः स्कन्दः प्रजापतिः। महेन्द्रो धनदः कालो यमः सोमो ह्यपांपतिः॥ पितरो वसवः साध्या अश्विनौ मरुतो मनुः। वायुर्वह्निः प्रजाः प्राण ऋतुकर्मा प्रभाकरः।।।।।
target: This Sun is Brahmā and Vişņu and Śiva and Skanda (a) and Prajāpati, (b) and Mahendra and Dhanada (c) and the Destroyer-Yama and Soma (d) and the lord of waters: and the Pitris (e) and the Vasus, and the Sādhyas (f) and the two Aśvinis (g) and the Maruts and Manu, (h) and the Wind-god and the God of fie and the creatures and the creator of life and the seasons. (a) The celestial generallissimo. The commentator gives a spiritual interpretation. 'He that by mean of his rays openent up the five organs of perception. (b) The lord of all creatures, by virtue of his bringing forth all beings through his energy. (c) Dispenser of riches, a name of Kubera. (d) Furnished with splendour, a name of the Moon. According to some endowed with energy. (e) Lit. the ancestral manes. Here the generator of everything. (1) An order of semi-divine beings. Here, "he who is adored by the spiritual." (g) In virtue of his omnipresence and his being the healer of all ailments. (h) All-knowing and being the primeval sovereign.

source: द्वारकायां सुभद्रा च कामयानेन भामिनी। वासुदेवस्यानुमते प्राप्ता चैव किरीटिना॥
target: Arjuna's taking of Subhadra by force with the permission of Krishna on the car which goes every where at the will of the rider;

source: पौरजानपदाश्चैव राजभक्तिपुरस्कृताः। गङ्गां प्रजग्मुरभितो वाससैकेन संवृताः॥
target: The inhabitants of the city as also those of the provinces, actuated by their loyalty, also went out. They all proceeded towards the banks of Ganga, every one clad on only a single piece of cloth.

source: स प्रस्थितः केशवेनानुशिष्टो मदातुरो ज्ञातिवधार्दितश्च। तं विश्रान्तं संनिधौ केशवस्य दुरन्तमेकं सहसैव बभ्रम्॥ ब्रह्मानुशप्तमवधीन्महद् वै कूटे युक्तं मुसलं लुब्धकस्य।
target: Thus orderded by Keshava, Vabhru still helpless with wine but cheerless at the destruction of his kinsmen, wen away. He had rested for a while by the side of Keshava, but as soon as he had gone to a distance the ironbolt, attached to a mallet in the hands of a hunter, suddenly sprang of itself upon that solitary survivor of the Yadava family and killed him who also had been included in the curs of the Brahmans.

source: ते यूयं सहिताः सर्वे भृशं यत्ता महारथाः। द्रोणं रक्षत पाञ्चालाद् धृष्टद्युम्नान्महारथात्॥
target: United together and exerting your very best in (this) dreadful engagement, all of you protect Drona from that invincible and mighty car-warrior Dhristadyumna.

source: दुर्योधनो गुरुद्वेषी त्यक्ताचारसुहृज्जनः। अर्थलुब्धोऽभिमानी च नीचः प्रकृतिनिघृणः॥
target: Duryodhana is malicious towards his superiors; he has abandoned all good conduct; he is covetous, vain, mean and by nature cruel.

source: अर्जुन उवाच को न्वसौ ब्राह्मणः कृष्ण कश्च शिष्योजनार्दन। श्रोतव्यं चेन्मयैतद् वै तत्त्वमाचक्ष्व मे विभो॥
target: Arjuna said Who, indeed, was was that Brahmana, O Krishna, and who the pupil, O Janardana! Truly, if am worthy of hearing it, do you then tell me, O Lord!

source: अस्त्रैरस्त्राणि संवार्य छित्वा सर्वायुधानि च। प्राप्तमयहितं द्रौणिर्न जघान रणेप्सया॥
target: Having restrained the weapons (shot by his antagonist) by the weapons of his own and also having struck down all these weapons, the son of Drona, most desirous of encountering (with his foe), did not slaughter him even on receiving his antagonist (within his reach).

source: अयं ब्रह्मादिभिः सिद्धैर्गुहायां गोपितः प्रभुः। देवासुरमनुष्याणामप्रकाशो भवेदिति॥
target: Beings crowned with success and having Brahman amongst them have concealed you in a cave for preventing the deities and Asuras and human beings from seeing you.

source: मोहितां राक्षसेन्द्रेण सीतां परमदुःखिताम्। आश्वासयामास तदा सरमा मृदुभाषिणी॥
target: The mild-speeched Saramă comforted the exceedingly distressed Sītā, who had been bereft of her senses by the lord of Rākşasas.

source: सुखभागी निरायासो निरुद्वेगः सदा नरः। एष देवि सतां मार्गो बाधा यत्र न विद्यते॥
target: Happy and not compelled to work for his livelihood, he lives freed from every kind of anxiety. Even this, O goddess, is the path of the virtuous. In it there are no obstacles or afflictions.

source: धृष्टद्युम्नोऽपि पाञ्चाल्यः प्रविश्य महतीं चमूम्॥ आससादरणे द्रोणं तदाऽऽसीत् तुमुलं महत्।
target: The Panchala price Dhristadyumna also, pushing into the heart your mighty troops, approached Drona; whereupon a confused and terrible encounter commenced.

source: तेऽभिनिष्क्रम्य मुदिता राक्षसेन्द्रा महाबलाः॥ ददृशुर्वानरानीकं समुद्यतशिलानगम्।
target: Issuing out cheerfully, those foremost of Rāks asas endowed with great strength beheld that monkey-army staying with upraised rocks and stones.
