source: ततः पर्वतभारार्ता मन्दप्राणविचेष्टिताः। हया मम महाराज वेपमाना इवाभवन्॥
target: O great king, my horses, afflicted with the weight of the rocks and almost at the point of death, stood trembling.

source: आदर्श स्वामिव च्छायां पश्यस्यात्मानमात्मना। व्यस्यात्मनि स्वयं वेदान् बुद्ध्या समनुचिन्तय॥
target: You see now your Soul with your Soul as one sees his own shadow in a mirror. Staying yourself on your own Soul, do you reflect on the Vedas.

source: घोरास्तस्यास्त्रयः पुत्राः पापकर्मरताः सदा। भयो महाभयश्चैव मृत्युर्भूतान्तकस्तथा॥
target: She had also three other fearful and cruel sons, always engaged in sinful deeds. (They were) Bhaya, Mahabhaya and Mrityu, the destroyer of every created thing.

source: अभ्युद्ययुस्ते शितशस्त्रहस्ता रिरक्षिषन्तो रथमर्जुनस्य। पार्थोऽपि तानापतत: समीक्ष्य त्रिगर्तराज्ञा सहितान् नृवीरान्॥
target: Grasping in their hand well-sharpened weapons, rushed in battle desirous of protecting the car of Arjuna. Beholding those king make towards himself, the son of Pritha,

source: वामदेव उवाच छन्दांसि वै मादृशं संवहन्ति लोकेऽमुष्मिन् पार्थिव यानि सन्ति। अस्मिन्स्तु लोके मम यानमेतदस्मद्विधानामपरेषां च राजन्॥
target: Vamadeva said : O king, the Vedas indeed carry persons like us, but that is in the next world. But in this world animals like these (horses) carry me and also men like me and also all others,

source: विश्वकर्मन् नमस्तेऽस्तु विश्वात्मन् विश्वसत्तम। तथ त्वामभिजानामि यथा चाहं भवन्मतः॥
target: O you who have this universe for your handiwork, salutations to you, O Soul of the universe, O best of all beings in the universe. I know you in that measure in which I am approved by you.

source: अतिविद्धाश्च नाराचैर्वमन्तो रुधिरं मुखैः। सारोहा न्यपतन् भूमौ दुमवन्त इवाचलाः॥
target: Deeply pierced with Narachas and vomitting blood through the mouth, elephants with their riders, began to fall down on the ground like so many mountains covered with trees.

source: अर्जुनस्य महास्त्राणि क्रोधं वीर्य धनुः शरान्। अहं शल्याभिजानाभि विक्रमं च महात्मनः॥
target: O Shalya, I know that powerful weapons of Arjuna, his anger, energy, bow, arrows and as well as the prowess of that high-souled one.

source: स्वासु प्रकृतिषुच्छिद्रं लक्षयेरन् परस्य च। मन्त्रिणां मन्त्रमूलं हि राज्ञो राष्ट्रं विवर्धते॥
target: Ministers should be employed in noticing the shortcomings of their masters, of themselves, of the subject, and of the foes of their masters. The kingdom depends upon the counsels of policy which the ministers give, and its growth originates from the same source.

source: धर्मज्ञस्य कृतज्ञस्य रामस्य विदितात्मनः। इयं सा दयिता भार्या राक्षसीवशमागता॥
target: And She is the beloved spouse of the pious and grateful Rāma, knowing his ownself, and has been brought under the control of the Raksasis.

source: धर्मं वायुं च शक्रं च विजानाम्यश्विनौ तथा। पाण्डं च कुरुशार्दूल षडेतान् कुरुवर्धनान्। पितृनेतानहं पार्थ देवमानुषसत्तमान्॥
target: O best of the Kuru race, O Partha, I know also Dharma, Vayu, Indra, Ashvinis and Pandu, these six spreaders of the Kuru race. These (six) excellent celestials and man are your fathers.

source: तथैवः क्रोधसंरक्तो भीमः परबलार्दनः॥ पुनरेवाब्रवीद् वाक्यं यत् तच्छृणु नराधिप येऽस्मान् पुरोपनृत्यन्त मूढा गौरिति गौरिति॥ तान् वयं प्रतिनृत्यामः पुनर्गौरिति गौरिति। नास्माकं निकृतिर्वह्नि क्षयूतं न वञ्चना। स्वबाहुबलमाश्रित्य प्रबाधामो वयं रिपून्॥ सोऽवाप्य वैरस्य परस्य पारं वृकोदरः प्राह शनैः प्रहस्या युधिष्ठिरं केशवसंजयांश्च धनंजयं माद्रवतीसुतौ च॥
target: With eyes reddened in wrath, Bhimascna, that grinder of hostile armies, once more said these words. Listen to thein, O king, we will now dance and call them Cows!-who formerly insulted us by calling us so. We have no deceipt, no fire, no match at dice, no deception! Depending upon the strength of our own arins we our resist and check foes!-Having brought those fierce hostilities to a close, Vrikodara once more slowly and laughingly said these words unto Yudhisthira and Keshava and the Shrinjayas and Dhananjaya and the two sons of Madri.

source: बृहस्पतिसमं बुद्ध्या क्षमया पृथिवीससम्। समुद्रमिव गाम्भीर्ये हिमवन्तमिव स्थिरम्॥
target: In intelligence equal to Brihaspati, in power equal to the earth, in gravity equal to the sea, in calmness equal to the Himavat,

source: विषण्णा हरयः सर्वे हनुमन् किमुपेक्षसे। विक्रमस्व महावेग विष्णुस्त्रीन् विक्रमानिव ॥
target: All the monkeys are depressed. O Hanuman, did you overlook this? Put forth your you endowed with mighty vehemence, like Vişnu sing over the three worlds in three steps.

source: जगाम धृतराष्ट्रस्य भवनं ब्राह्मणोत्तमः।
target: Saying it the greatly energetic Vaka, that best of Brahmanas, then went to the palace of Dhritarashtra.

source: त्वमप्याशंसये योद्धं कुलजः क्षत्रियो ह्यसि। इमान् किं क्षत्रियान् सर्वान् घातयिष्यस्यनागसः॥
target: Why then do you cause the ruin of all these other un-offending Kshatriyas? You are the root of this hostility, so, do you yourself encounter Arjuna.

source: ततो बाणांश्चतुःष्टिं तव पुत्रो महारणे। सहदेवरथं तूर्णं प्रेषयामास भारत॥
target: Thereupon, O descendant of the Bharata race, your son most rapidly directed sixty-four arrows against the car of Shahadeva, in that dreadful battle.

source: एवमेतासु रक्षा वै शक्या कर्तुं महात्मभिः। अन्यथा राजशार्दूल न शक्या रक्षितुं स्त्रियः॥
target: It is thus that great persons are capable of protecting women. They cannot, O foremost of kings, be protected in any other way.

source: ततो रथेन शुभ्रेण महता किङ्किणीकिना। कुरूणां पश्यतां दुष्टुं स्वसारं स पितुर्ययौ॥
target: Then in that white chariot and large, furnished with thinking bells he went to the sister of his father, the Kurus looking at him.

source: तृषितेन च कौन्तेय भिक्षितश्चित्रभानुना। सहस्रबाहुर्विक्रान्तः प्रादाद् भिक्षामथाग्नये॥
target: Once begged by the thirsty god of fire, O son of Kunti, the thousand-armed king of great prowess gave alms to that deity.

source: बहुप्रकारैर्विविधैर्वरसंस्कारसंस्कृतैः॥ मांसैः कुशलसंयुक्तैः पानभूमिगतैः पृथक् । दिव्या प्रसन्ना विविधाः सुराः कृतसुरा अपि॥ शर्करासवमाध्वीकाः पुष्पासवफलासवाः। वासचूर्णैश्च विविधैर्मुष्टास्तैस्तैः पृथक् पृथक् ॥ संतता शुशुभे भूमिर्माल्यैश्च बहुसंस्थितैः। हिरण्मयैश्च कलशैर्भाजनैः स्फाटिकैरपि॥ जाम्बूनदमयैश्चान्यैः करकैरभिसंवृता।
target: With meat consisting of many ingredients, fraught with diverse tastes, seasoned with many substances, and dressed by skilful cooks, arranged separately in the scene of revel; and with noble and pleasant wines, natural and artifical, asavas from sugar; and Madhvika' and āsavas from flowers and fruits; and impregnated separately with different kinds of fragrant dust, the pavement, furnished with innumerable garlands, surrounded with golden water vessels and crystal bowls, and golden water-pots, looked exceedingly beautiful.

source: एवं कृतास्त्रः कौन्तेयो गान्धर्वं वेदमाप्तवान्। सुखं वसति बीभत्सुरनुजस्यानुजस्तव॥
target: Having thus acquired all weapons and learnt the Gandharva Veda (knowledge) your third brother Vivatsu (Arjuna) lives happily in (heaven).

source: तावुद्यतगदौ वीरावन्योन्यवधकाक्षिणौ॥ भ्रातृव्यौ सम्प्रजह्राते पुरेवत्र्यम्बकान्धकौ।
target: Then those two heroes with maces upraised, both desirous of compassing one another's death, Those two cousins, began to strike one another, like the three-eyed (Mahadeva) and the Asura Andhaka fighting in the days of yore.

source: स त्वं भवता यद् विधातव्यं तन्नः श्रेयः परंतप। संग्रामादपयातानां भग्नानां शरणैषिणाम्॥
target: What ever will be decided on by you will conduce to our good, O subduer of foes, why those fly from the field of battle out of the original army and are at our mercy.

source: भगवन् द्रष्टुमिच्छामि पितामहसभां शुभाम्। येन वा तपसा शक्या कर्मणा वापि गोपते॥ औषधैर्वा तथा युक्तैरुत्तमा पापनाशिनी। तन्ममाचक्ष्व भगवन् पश्येयं तां सभा यथा॥
target: "O illustrious one, I desire to see the sacred Sabha of the Grandsire. O exalted one, O lord of light, tell me by what ascetic penances, by what acts, by what charms, and by what rites, I may be able to see that sincleansing excellent Sabha."

source: उद्वेपते मे हृदयं ये मे दुर्योधनादयः। बाल्येऽपि तेन युध्यन्तो वारणेनेव मर्दिताः॥
target: My heart quakes that Duryodhana and other sons of mine even when fighting with him in their childhood were smashed as by elephants.

source: ऋचश्चाप्यत्र शंसन्ति नारायणविदो जनाः। नारायणाय देवाय यदविन्दन् पशून् पुरा॥
target: People conversant with Narayana, recite some Richs on this subject. Formerly animals were offered to the divine Narayana.

source: शरैः कनकपुडैश्च चित्रा रेजुर्गजोत्तमाः। उल्काभिः सम्प्रदीप्तायाः पर्वता इव भारत॥
target: Many leading elephants, struck with goldwinged arrows, looked beautiful, like mountains whose summits are lighted with torches.

source: विदुर उवाच एष पार्थो महाराज फाल्गुनः पाण्डुनन्दनः। अवतीर्णः सकवचस्तत्रैष सुमहास्वनः॥
target: Vidura said: O great king, the son of Pritha and Pandu, Falguni (Arjuna), clad in armour; has entered, the arena; and therefore is this uproar.

source: दुःखमषारयन्ती माद्रीसुतस्तत् परिगृह्य वाक्यं धर्मेण धर्मप्रतिमस्य राज्ञः। ययौ रथेनालयमाशु देव्याः पाञ्चालराजस्य च यत्र दाराः॥
target: Following the mandate of the king who was righteous like Yama himself, Nakula speedily proceeded on his car to the palace of Draupadi where that princess lived with all the wives of the Panchala king.

source: यद्यग्नयो हि स्पृश्येयुनिवेशस्था दवाग्निना। इष्टिरष्टाकपालेन कार्या तु शुचयेऽग्नये॥
target: If the fire named Nivasa comes in contact with the fire called Davagni, then Ashtakapala rites must be performed in honour of the fire called Suchi.

source: आचार्यः स्थविरो राजशीघ्रयाने तथाक्षमः। बाहुव्यायामचेष्टायामशक्तस्तु नराधिप।॥
target: (On the other hand), Oking, the preceptor is old and incapable of quick movements and o lord of men, (he is) also unable to exercise his arms (for a long time).

source: अथ युद्धं समभवत् तयोर्नारायणस्य वै॥ रजस्तमोविष्टतनू तावुभौ मधुकैटभौ। ब्रह्मणोपचितिं कुर्वन् जघान मधुसूदनः॥
target: Thereupon an encounter took place between those two and Narayana. The Asuras Madhu and Kaitabha were embodiments of the qualities of Darkness and Ignorance. Narayana killed them both for pleasing Brahman. He thence passed by the name of Madhusudana (slayer of Madhu).

source: ततः प्रगृह्य विपुलां शतघण्टां विभीषणः। अनुमन्त्र्य महाशक्तिं चिक्षेपास्य शिरः प्रति॥
target: Then Vibhishana, taking up a huge and mighty Javelin studded with a hundred bells and inspiring it with the mantras hurled it at the head of Prahasta.

source: दुर्योधनस्तदा राजन्नार्घ्यशृङ्गिमभाषत। एष कर्णिमहाबाहो द्वितीय इव फाल्गुनः॥
target: Your son Duryodhana, O king, addressing Rishyashringa's son said 'Single-handed the nephew of Krishna, O mighty-armed hero, like a second Phalguna,

source: इत्येवमुच्यमाना सा सशब्दं प्ररुरोद ह॥ स्नपयन्ती तदास्त्रेण स्तनौ वक्रं सुनिर्मलम्।
target: Being thus accosted she again wept aloud bathing with tears her breast and beautiful countenance.

source: धनानि रत्नानि सुभूषणानि वासांसि दिव्यानि मणींश्च चित्रान्। सीतां च रामाय निवेद्य देवी वसेम राजनिह वीतशोकाः॥
target: Do you render back Sītā, O king, to Rāma, with riches, jewels, excellent ornaments, clothes and jems and we shall then be able to live here void of grief.

source: न च ते ब्राह्मणं हन्तुं कार्या बुद्धिः कथंचन। अवध्यः सर्वभूतानां ब्राह्मणो ह्यनलोपमः॥
target: But let not your heart be ever set on killing a Brahmana. A Brahmana is not to be killed amongst all creatures; he is like the fire.

source: शयानमनघं रात्रौ पितेवाभिपरिष्वजन्। धर्मघ्नः संस्पृशञ्छीतश्चन्द्रमा ह्लादयिष्यति॥
target: And when he will lie down at night, the Moon touching him with his beams and embracing him even like his own father, will gladden his heart.

source: अनूपवासी नीलश्च व्याघ्रदत्तश्च वीर्यवान्॥ अश्वत्थाम्ना विकर्णेन गमितो यमसादनम्।
target: O powerful monarch, Neela, the dweller of Anupa and Vyaghradatta, endued with great prowess, both these were sent to the abode of Yama by Ashvatthaman.

source: अश्मसारमयं भाण्डं शुद्धदन्तत्सरूनसीन्। प्राग्ज्योतिषाधिपो दत्त्वा भगदत्तोऽव्रजत् तदा॥
target: Thereupon the king of Pragjyotisha Bhagadatta had to go away from the gate, giving away a number of swords with handles made of the purest ivory and well-adorned with diamonds and every kind of gems.

source: यानीहागमशास्त्राणि याश्च काश्चित् प्रवृत्तयः। तानि वेदं पुरस्कृत्य प्रवृत्तानि यथाक्रमम्॥
target: All scriptures, religious treatises, and rites that are seen in the world, have all originated from the Vedas, according to their due order.

source: अवाप्य वासं नरदेवपुत्राः प्रसादजं वैश्रवणस्य राज्ञः। न प्राणिनां ते स्पृहयन्ति राजन् शिवश्च कालः स बभूव तेषाम्॥
target: O monarch, those sons of a king, having obtained a residence through the favour of king Vaisravana, did not long for the prosperity of earthly creatures, (in as much as) that period (of their lives) was (quite) a blessing (to them).

source: निहते कौरवेन्द्रे तु सानुबन्धे सुयोधने। विदुरः संजयश्चैव धर्मराजमुपस्थितौ॥
target: Upon the destruction of the Kaurava-king Suyodhana with all his followers and allies, Vidura and Sanjaya have come to the presence of king Yudhishthira the just.

source: संजय उवाच
target: son

source: तान्सर्वान्हि समादिश्य रावणो राक्षसाधिपः। मन्युशल्यं वहन्दीनः प्रविवेश स्वमालयम्॥
target: Having directed them, Ravana, lord O Rākşasas, bearing the dart of ire (in his heart), i forlorn guise entered his own mansion.

source: यस्मात् त्रस्यन्ति भूतानि मृगव्याधान्मृगा इव। सागरान्तामपि महीं लब्वा स परिहीयते॥
target: He, whom all creatures dread as deer fear the hunter, loses it in the end even after acquiring the earth (for his kingdom) having the sea round it.

source: पूरणात् सदनाच्चापि ततोऽसौ पुरुषोत्तमः। असतश्च सतश्चैव सर्वस्य प्रभवाप्ययात्॥
target: From his creating and preserving beings (Parva) and from destroying them (Sa) is he called Purushottama, as also from his being the creator of causes and effects which are also lost in him in the end.

source: द्वादशानां तु सर्वेषां सौवीराणां धनंजयः। चकर्त निशितैर्भल्लैर्धनूंषि च शिरांसि च॥
target: With his sharp crescent-shaped shafts Dhananjaya also cut off the heads and bows of all the twelve Sauvira heroes.

source: किं वाच्याः पाण्डवेयास्ते भवत्या वचनान्मया। तद् ब्रूहि त्वं महाप्राज्ञे शुश्रूषे वचनं तव॥
target: What should be said by me to those sons of Pandu, by your command, tell me, O you of great wisdom; I desire to hear your words.

source: नारदोऽपि मयि प्राह गुणानेतान् महाद्युते। त्वमप्येतद् विदित्वेह सर्वमाचर पुत्रक॥
target: The celestial Rishi Narada recited to me merits of the several acts mentioned. Informed of those merits, do you, O son, perform the several acts mentioned.

source: एवमुक्तो दशग्रीवः प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना॥ चिन्तयित्वा मुहूर्त वै बाढमित्येव सोऽब्रवीत्। स तु तेनैव हर्षेण तस्मिनहनि वीर्यवान्॥ वनं गतो दशग्रीवः सह तैः क्षणदाचरैः।
target: Thus exhorted, the Ten-necked one, with a delighted heart, reflecting for a moment, said, 'Very well.' And wrought up with delight, the Ten-necked one endowed with prowess the very same day went to the forest, accompanied by the night-rangers.

source: युयुत्सवस्ते विक्रान्ता विजयाय महाबलाः। अन्योन्यमभिगर्जन्तो गोष्ठेष्विव महर्षभाः॥
target: Those mighty warriors endued with great prowess, fighting with one another out of a desires for victory roared at one another like bulls among a herd of kine.

source: सृजते च पुनर्लोकान् नेह विद्यति शाश्वतम्। ज्ञातीनां वै कुरूणां च सम्बन्धिसुहृदां तथा॥ धयं देशय पन्थानं समर्थो ह्यसि वारणे। क्षुद्रं जातिवधं प्राहुर्मा कुरुष्व ममाप्रियम्॥
target: It is Time also which creates the worlds. There is nothing here on earth which is everlasting. Therefore show the path of virtue। to the Kurus, to your relations, your kinsmen and friends. You are the proper person to restrain them. It is said that slaughter of kinsmen is sinful. Do not act in a way which would be disagreeable to me.

source: मैत्रेय उवाच तीर्थयात्रामनुकामन् प्राप्तोऽस्मि कुरुजाङ्गलान्। यदृच्छयाधर्मराजं दृष्टवान् काम्यके वने॥
target: Maitreya said : Setting out on a pilgrimage, I arrived at the Kurujangala. I suddenly met there Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira) in the forest of Kamyaka.

source: तस्य शब्देन वित्रस्ताः प्राद्रवंस्तावका युधि। क्षत्रधर्मं समुत्सृज्य पलायनपरायणाः॥
target: At that sound your troops, panic stricken, began to fly away; and disregarding the duties of Kshatriyas they exerted themselves in flying away.

source: शयने नागभोगाढ्ये ज्वालामालासपावृते॥ निष्कल्मषेण सत्त्वेन सम्पन्नं रुचिरप्रभम्।
target: Highly effulgent and endued with the pure quality of Goodness, the body of the Supreme Lord lay on the excellent hood of a snake that seemed to throw out flames of fire for the resplendence attaching to it.

source: व्यस्फारयद् वै गाण्डीव सुमहद् भैरवारवम्॥ घोरवज्रविनिष्पेषं स्तनयित्नुरिवाम्बरे।
target: The awful sound made by his out-stretched Gandiva was like the clash of thunder amidst the gloomy clouds.

source: सूर्य उवाच असंशयं मां विप्रर्षे भेत्स्यसे धन्विनां वर। अपकारिणं मां विद्धि भगवञ्छरणागतम्॥
target: Surya said O twiceborn Rishi, forsooth, you know me, O best of archers! But, O holy one, though I have offended, see I pray for your protection.

source: तथा तैरवकीर्णस्य दिव्यैरस्त्रैः समन्ततः। न तस्य व्यङ्गुलमपि विवृतं सम्प्रदृश्यते॥
target: He being thus covered with celestials weapons, not even a space measuring two fingers was seen on him.

source: वत्सभूमिं विनिर्जित्य केवलां मृत्तिकावतीम्। मोहं पत्तनं चैव त्रिपुरी कोसलां तथा॥ एतान् सर्वान् विनिर्जित्य करमादाय सर्वशः।
target: Having then conquered Vatsabhumi, he subjugated Kevala, Mrittikavati, Mohana and Pattana, Tripuri and Kosala. He made them all pay tributes.

source: मित्राणि ते प्रहृष्यन्तु व्यथन्तु रिपवस्तथा। सौमात्रं चैव तेऽद्यास्तु भ्रातृभिः सह पाण्डवैः॥
target: Let your friends rejoice in the same way let your enemies feel pained; let there be today brotherly feelings with your brothers, the sons of Pandu.

source: उपास्यते तिग्मतेजा यत्र भूतैः समन्ततः। नरनारायणौ ब्रह्मा मनुः स्थाणुश्च पञ्चमः॥
target: Endued with supreme energy, surrounded by his ghostly attendants, is adored. There Nara and Narayana and Brahma and Manu and Sthanu are ever present.

source: स विसृष्टो बलवता शरो घोरो महामृधे। भासयामास तत् सैन्यं दिवाकर इवोदितः॥
target: In that terrible battle that shaft, shot by his strong arm, flooded the Kuru troops with its lustre like the risen sun.

source: पिनाकगोप्जे सूर्याय मङ्गल्याय च वेधसे। प्रसादये त्वां भगवन् सर्वभूतमहेश्वर॥
target: O wielder of the Pinaka, O Surya, O pure bodied deity, O exalted one, O lord of all creatures, I adore you.

source: न संवत्सरसत्राणि तिष्ठेयुरकुतोभयाः। विधिवद् दक्षिणावन्ति यदि दण्डो न पालयेत्॥
target: If chastisement did not uphold and protect, people could never duly celebrate annual sacrifices with profuse presents.

source: नाशंसमानः सहरौहिणेयः। जगाम तां भार्गवकर्मशाला यत्रासते ते पुरुषप्रवीराः॥
target: The chief of the Vrishnis (Krishna), with the son of Rohini (Balarama) suspecting them to be the chief of the Kurus, came to the potter's house where those best of men (the Pandavas) were living.

source: स त्वनेकाग्रहृदयो द्वा:स्थं प्रत्यर्च्य तं जनम्। सूतमश्वपतेः क्लान्तमब्रवीत् तत्र राघवः॥ किमहं त्वरयानीत: कारणेन विनानघ। अशुभाशङ्कि हृदयं शीलं च पततीव मे॥
target: Then courteously telling the warders to desist, he with an agitated heart spoke to the tired charioteer of Aśvapati, “O sinless one, why have I been brought in this haste without any (adequate) reason?" My heart apprehended some evil; and my disposition gives way.

source: स मुहूर्तमिव ध्यात्वा बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणः। बभूव संरब्धतरो युगान्त इव पावकः॥
target: But reflecting only for a while, he with his eyes surcharged with tears was filled with greater martial ardour, and resembled the fire risen at the universal dissolution. Then thinking.

source: अन्यो धर्मः समर्थानामापत्स्वन्यश्च भारत। प्राक्कोशात् प्राप्यतें धर्मो वृत्तिधर्माद् गरीयसी॥
target: For able and competent men the duties are of one kind. In times of distress, however, one's duties assume a different aspect. Without riches a king may, by penances acquire religious merit. Life, however, is much more important than religious merit.

source: इदं व्यसनमालोक्य राज्ञश्च मतिविभ्रमम्। काम एवार्थधर्माभ्यां गरीयानिति मे मतिः॥
target: Viewing this calamity that has overtaken us) and the disorder that has taken place in the senses of the monarch, I deem even lust as more potent than either virtue or interest.

source: ततः प्रसन्नो भगवाननिर्दिष्टशरीरगः। ऋषीनुवाच तान् सर्वानदृश्यः पुरुषोत्तमः॥ कृतं शतसहस्रं हि श्लोकानादिमुत्तमम्। लोकतन्त्रस्य कृत्स्नस्य यस्माद् धर्मः प्रवर्तते।॥
target: The illustrious and bodiless Narayana became highly pleased with what he heard. That foremost of all Beings then addressed those Rishis in an incorporeal voice and said,-Excellent is this work that you have composed containing a hundred thousand verses. The duties and observances of all the worlds will originate from this your work.

source: निहत्य तं वज्रिसुतोपमं रणे कुमारमक्षं क्षतजोपमेक्षणम्। तदेव वीरोऽभिजगाम तोरणं कृतक्षणः काल इव प्रजाक्षये॥
target: And having slain in battle prince Akşa resembling a son of the celestials and possessed of blood-red eyes, the hero (again) neared the same gate, and waited there like Kāla bent upon destroying all creatures.

source: निहत्य मानं क्रोधं च प्रहर्षं शोकमेव च। वर्षाणि द्वादश मुनिर्जलवासे धृतव्रतः॥
target: Renouncing pride, anger, joy and grief, the ascetic, pledging himself to observe that vow, set himself to live for twelve years, according to the rules of Udavasa.

source: सुखश्रव्यतया विद्वन् मुहूर्त इव मे गतः। न हि तृप्तोऽस्मि भगवन् शृण्वानो धर्ममुत्तमम्॥
target: Listening to you, O learned man, O exalted one, my time has passed away as if it were but a (fleeting) moment. But I am not as yet satiated with hearing about Dharma.

source: स तथा नोदितोऽस्माभिः सदश्व इव वीर्यवान्। असह्यपि तं भारं वोदुमेवोपचक्रमे॥
target: That highly puissant hero then thus urged on by ourselves, like a good horse, prepared himself to take that burden upon himself, however unbearable it might have been for him.

source: अस्माकमपि ते जन्म विदितं कमलेक्षण॥ कृष्णद्वैपायनाद्भीरु कुरूणां वंशवृद्धये।
target: O louts-eyed one, O timid girl, you know our birth, begotten by Krishna Dvaipayana, in order to expand the Kuru race.

source: अथ रामस्तदा श्रुत्वा पितुरातस्य भाषितम्। लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा दीनो वचनमब्रवीत्॥
target: Hearing these words of his distressed father, the humble Rāma, along with his brother Laksmana, said.

source: धनुध्यनवरः शूरः कार्तवीर्यसमो युधि। तद्वीर्यश्चापि तत्रैव कुले शिनिरभून्नृप॥
target: Foremost of all wielders of bows, Sura was equal to Kartikeya in battle. O king, in his race and equal to him in energy was born Sini, O monarch.

source: मेरुशृङ्गे किल पुरा कर्णिकारवनायुते। विजहार महादेवो भीमैर्भूतगणैर्वृतः॥
target: Once on a time on the summit of Meru adorned with Karnikara flowers, Mahadeva sported, in company of his followers, the terrible spirits.

source: साम्बं च निहतं दृष्ट्वा चारुदेष्णं च माधवः॥ प्रद्युम्नं चानिरुद्धं च ततश्चुक्रोध भारत।
target: Seeing that Shamba was killed, as also Charudeshna and Pradyumna and Aniruddha, Madhava became filled with anger.

source: मयस्य मायाविहितं गिरिदुर्गे विचिन्वताम्। तेषां मासो व्यतिक्रान्तो यो राज्ञा समयः कृतः॥
target: Exploring the mountain fateness of Maya*, they spent the month that had been set by the king. *Named Rhiksavila.

source: त्वचो विनिर्भिद्य पिबन् वसामसृक् तथैव मज्जाः पिशितानि चाश्नुवन्। वपां विलुम्पन्ति हसन्ति गान्ति च प्रकर्षमाणा: कुणपान्यनेकशः॥
target: Tore open the corpses and drank their fat marrow and blood and then fell upon eating their flesh. They began also to drink the secretions of rotten corpses, while some of the Rakshasa laughed terribly and dragged out dead bodies by thousands.

source: देवतेयं गृहस्यास्य शापात् किं नु विरूपिता। अस्याश्च कारणं वेत्तुं न युक्तं सहसा मया॥
target: This lady is forsooth, the mistress of this palace. Has she been made ugly through some curse! It is not proper that I should quickly determine the cause of this.

source: उदासीनेषु योऽस्मासु विक्रमोऽयं प्रकाशितः। अपकारिषु ते राम नैवं पश्यामि विक्रमम्॥
target: The prowess, you had displayed towards me, careless, O Rāma you did never employ for the suppression of the iniquitous.

source: भीष्म उवाच ये च गां सम्प्रयच्छन्ति हतशिष्टाशिनश्च ये। तेषां सत्राणि यज्ञाश्च नित्यमेव युधिष्ठिर॥
target: Bhishma said on They who make gifts of kine, and who live upon the remnants of things offered as libations the sacred fire, are considered, O Yudhishthira as always performing sacrifices of kind.

source: मार्कण्डेय उवाच धर्मव्याधस्तु निपुणं पुनरेव युधिष्ठिर। विप्रर्षभमुवाचेदं सर्वधर्मभृतां वर॥
target: Markandeya said : O Yudhishthira, that foremost of all virtuous men, that pious fowler, then skillfully thus again spoke to that best of Brahmanas.

source: ददस्ताभ्यां कुमाराभ्यामास्थितः स गजोत्तमः। सीतया च विशालाक्ष्या लङ्काया उपरिस्थितः। पाण्डुरर्षभयुक्तेन रथेनाष्टयुजा स्वयम्॥ शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरो लक्ष्मणेन सहागतः।
target: Then that best of the elephants, with those two princes and the large eyed Sītā on him, stood high above Lanka. I again saw Rāma, clad in white, and adorned with garlands, ride along with Lakşmaņa in a chariot drawn by eight white bullocks.

source: पर्वतेन्द्रं सुनाभं च समुपस्पृश्य वीर्यवान्॥ व्यामुक्त इव नाराचो महावेगोऽभ्युपागमत्।
target: And touching Mainaka-foremost of mountains-that one endowed with prowess proceeded amain like an iron dart let go from a string.

source: यज्ञो दानं तपः शौर्यं प्रज्ञा संतानमेव च। माहात्म्यं बलमोजश्च नित्यमाशंसितं मया॥
target: The performance of sacrificial rites, liberality, devotion, heroism, greatness, might and energy, were ever expected of you by me.

source: तामाहूय तदा देवो लोकानामादिरीश्वरः। मृत्यो इति महीपाल जहि चेमाः प्रजा इति॥
target: Then, O king, the powerful Self-create, the prime Cause of all the worlds, saluted her and said, O Death, kill these creatures of the universe.

source: ततोऽहं शरजालेन दिव्यास्त्रनुदितेन च। व्यगृहणं सह दैतेयैस्तत् पुरं पुरुषर्षभ॥
target: And, O best of the Bharatas, I assailed that city together with the Daityas by showers of arrows, shot from celestials weapons.

source: पुष्पवृष्टिं च तरवो मुमुचुर्यस्य वै भयात्। शैलाः सुनुवुः पानीयं जलदाश्च यदेच्छति॥ तस्य नैऋतराजस्य राजराजस्य भामिनि। किं त्वं न कुरुषे बुद्धिं भार्यार्थे रावणस्य हि॥
target: O dame, why do you not wish to be the consort of Rāvana, the lord of Rākṣasas, at whose command the trees shower blossoms and the hills and clouds pour down water. Why do you not make up your mind to be the wife of Rāvana?

source: सर्वांश्चाहूय सुग्रीवः प्लवगान् प्लवगर्षभः। समस्तांश्चाब्रवीद् राजा रामकार्यार्थसिद्धये॥
target: Summoning all the monkeys, that foremost of monkeys, king Sugriva, spoke to them all touching the success of Rāma's work.

source: लोकेश्वर प्रभुत्वं हि महदेतद् दुरात्मभिः। राज्यं नामेप्सितं स्थानं न शक्यमभिरक्षितुम्॥
target: The sovereignty enjoyed by a ruler of men is a great thing; a kingdom can easily be wished for by those that are of wicked souls but it cannot be suitably protected by them.

source: भीमार्जुनावुभौ नेत्रे मनो मन्ये जनार्दनम्। मनश्चक्षुर्विहीनस्य कीदृशं जीवितं भवेत्॥
target: I consider Bhima and Arjuna as my eyes and you Jarasandha as my mind. How shall I able to live without my eyes and mind?

source: इयं हि योनिः प्रथमा यां प्राप्य जगतीपते। आत्मा वै शक्यते त्रातुं कर्मभिः शुभलक्षणैः॥
target: Indeed, O king, that order of birth (viz., humanity) is the foremost, since by becoming a human being one succeeds in rescuing his self by meritorious acts.

source: एतत्सोमवचः श्रुत्वा तथास्विति दिवौकसः। प्रत्यूचुः सहिताः सर्वे ताराधिपमपूजयन्॥
target: Having heard these words of Soma, the celestials said, “Be it so.” They then all worshipped and praised the lord of the stars (Soma).

source: अभिमन्युर्यथावृत्तः श्रोतुमिच्छाम्यहं तथा॥
target: O lord of Earth, that mighty-armed one, that one possessed of eyes large lake lotus petals namely Abhimanyu, how he fought, I desire to know?

source: त एते मन्ति नस्तात विशिखा: पार्थचोदिताः। तांस्तदाऽऽख्यायमानस्त्वं विदुरेण च बुद्धवान्॥
target: Those arrows, O child, now discharged by aya are destroying us; you did not then understand when Vidura told you what those (dice) were.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्त्वा ययौ व्यासो धृतराष्ट्राय धीमते। धृतराष्ट्रोऽपि तच्छ्रुत्वा ध्यानमेवान्वपद्यत॥
target: Vaishampayana said Having thus spoken to Dhritarashtra Vyasa went away. Having heard these words, Dhritarashtra also reflected in silence.

source: तस्यामुपासते नित्यं महात्मानं शतक्रतुम्। मरुतः सर्वशो राजन् सर्वे च गृहमेधिनः॥
target: There daily wait upon that illustrious deity of one thousand sacrifices (Indra) all the Marutas that lead the life of house holders,

source: स भग्नबाहूरुमुखो विह्वलः शोणितोक्षितः। प्रमुमोह महावीरो मुहूर्तं कपिकुञ्जरः॥
target: His arms and thighs were broken and his countenance was disfigured and that great hero, the foremost of the monkeys, bathed in a pool of blood, remained senseless for sometime.

source: रथं तत्रैव संत्यज्य प्राद्रवन्महतो भयात्। तस्मिन् विनिर्जिते तूर्णं कूटयोधिनि राक्षसे॥
target: Fled out fear, forsaking his chariot even where he was. When that Rakshasas, ever fighting unfairly, had been thus speedily vanquished,

source: ततः पाशुपतं दिव्यमस्त्रं संधाय कार्मुके। तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति तानुक्त्वा यच्चापं व्यपकर्षत॥
target: Now fixing the divine Pāśupata on his bow, and saying to them, 'stay! stay!' he drew that bow.

source: वरदासंगमे स्नात्वा गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्। ब्रह्मस्थानं समासाद्य त्रिरात्रोपोषितो नरः॥ गोसहस्रफलं विन्द्यात् स्वर्गलोकं च गच्छति।
target: Bathing at the confluence of Varada one obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine. Going to Brahmasthana and living there for three nights a man. Obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine and goes to the celestials region.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच प्रविश्य तां सभां पार्था युधिष्ठिरपुरोगमाः। समेत्य पार्थिवान् सर्वान् पूजार्हानभिपूज्य च॥ यथावयः समेयाना उपविष्टा यथार्हतः। आसनेषु विचित्रेषु स्पर्ध्यास्तरणवत्सु च॥
target: Vaishampayana said Having entered the Sabha, the sons of Pritha with Yudhishthira at their head met all the kings that were present there. Worshipping all those that deserved to be worshipped and saluting others as each deserved according to his age, they took their seats on pure seats covered with costly carpets.

source: मतङ्गवाप्यां यः स्नायादेकरात्रेण सिद्ध्यति। विगाहति ह्यनालम्बमन्धकं वै सनातनम्॥ नैमिषे स्वर्गतीर्थे च उपस्पृश्य जितेन्द्रियः। फलं पुरुषमेधस्य लभेन्मासं कृतोदकः॥
target: He who bathes in the lake Matanga is sure to acquire success in one night. He who bathes in Analamva or the eternal, Andhaka, or in Naimisha, or the tirtha called Svarga, and offers oblations of water to the departed manes, controlling his senses all the while, acquires the merit of a human sacrifice.

source: एतत् क्षेममहं मन्ये न च पार्थेश्च विग्रहम्। न त्वां ब्रवीमि कार्पण्यान प्राणपरिरक्षणात्॥ पथ्यं राजन् ब्रवीमि त्वां तत्परासुः स्मरिष्यसि। इति वृद्धो विलप्यैतत् कृपः शारद्वतो वचः। दीर्घमुष्णं च निःश्वस्य शुशोच च मुमोह च॥
target: The end of hostilities with the sons of Pritha is what I consider to be for your good, I do not say this to you from any mean motives nor for saving my life. I say, king, that which I think beneficial. You will recollect these words when no the verge of death if you neglect them now. Old Kripa, the son of Sharadvata, weepingly said these words. Breathing hard breaths, he was beside himself with sorrow.

source: अतिबलसदृशैः पराक्रमैस्त्वं मम कुलवंशविवर्धनः प्रभो। यदयमतुलबलस्त्वयाद्य वै त्रिदशपतिस्त्रिदशाश्च निर्जिताः॥
target: You have enhanced the glory of our race displaying the prowess like a highly powerful man. You have vanquished the celestials and their king of unequalled might.

source: गोलाङ्गुलेश्वरं चैव वालिपुत्रमथाङ्गदम्। विव्याध बहुभिर्बाणैस्त्वरमाणोऽथ रावणिः॥
target: And Rāvana's son, summoning celerity, pierced the king of Golangulas and Vāli's son, Angada, with innumerable arrows.

source: समाददानः पृथगस्त्रमार्गान् यथाग्निरिद्धो गहन् निदाघे। स्थूणाकर्णं पाशुपतं महास्त्रं ब्राह्मं चास्त्रं यच्च शक्रोऽप्यदान्मे॥
target: I shall fling the great weapons, called Sthuna, Karna, Pashupata and Brahma all of which Shakra gave me, in different directions; as fire in the hot season burns up a forest.

source: एवं प्रविश्यैव नृपस्तदानीं श्वभ्रं महद्रत्नविभूषितं तत्। संपादयामास तदा महात्मा शाप द्विजाभ्यां हि रुषा विमुक्तम्॥
target: Having entered the den filled with many jewels the high-souled king began to spend his days in the satisfaction of the curse imprecated by the two Brāhmaṇas.

source: तत् तु श्रुत्वा तथा वाक्यमङ्गदस्य मुखोद्गतम्। अब्रवीद् वचनं गृध्रस्तीक्ष्णतुण्डो महास्वनः॥
target: Hearing the words that issued from Angada's mouth, the sharp-beaked and high-toned vulture, said,

source: एवं बहुविधं भूरि विललाप स लुब्धकः। गार्हयन् स्वानि कर्माणि द्विजं दृष्ट्वा तथागतम्॥
target: Indeed, seeing the bird lay down his life, the fowler, considering his own acts, began to bewail thus piteously.

source: इति श्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य सोऽथ तं वरुणोऽब्रवीत्॥ ममैषा सुप्रिया भार्यां नैनामुत्स्रष्टुमुत्सहे।
target: Hearing these words of Narada, Varuna replied to him, saying, This timed girl is very dear to me. I dare not let her go.

source: प्रतिलभ्य ततः संज्ञां श्वेतचाश्वः कृष्णसारथिः॥ ऐन्द्रमस्त्रममेयात्मा प्रादुश्चक्ते त्वरान्वितः।
target: Then regaining his consciousness the highly energetic Arjuna of white steeds and with Krishna for his charioteer, quickly discharged the Aindra weapon.

source: एषोऽस्य पुत्रोऽभिमतः पुष्करः पुष्करेक्षणः। रुपवान् दर्शनीयश्च सोमपुत्र्या वृतः पतिः॥
target: This is his dear son, Pushkara of eyes like lotus leaves. He is endued with beauty, is worth looking at and has been selected by the daughter of Soma as her husband.

source: कथं तस्मात् समुत्पन्नास्तनिष्ठास्तदुपाश्रयाः। तदेव निन्दा भाषेयुर्धाता तत्र न गर्यते॥
target: How can those who are born in that order, who follow the practices of that order, and that have their refuse in them, censure those duties? If indeed those duties be censurable, then why should not the Supreme Ordainer be blamed?

source: रावणस्य वचः श्रुत्वा बलिर्वैरोचनोऽब्रवीत्। एष त्रैलोक्यधाता च हरिर्नारायणः प्रभुः॥ अनन्तः कपिलो जिष्णुर्नरसिंहो महाद्युतिः। ऋतुधामा सुधामा च पाशहस्तो भयानकः॥ द्वादशादित्यसदृशः पुराणपुरुषोत्तमः। नीलजीमूतसंकाशः सुरनाथः सुरोत्तमः॥
target: Hearing the words of Rāvaņa Bali said, "He is the lord Hari, Nārāyana the protector of the three worlds. He is Ananta,' Kapila-Jisnu' and the highly effulgent Manlion. He is Kratudhămas Sudhāman and has the dreadful mace in his hand. He is like to the twelve Adityas, Purāna and the excellent Puruşa; he is like to the red clouds, the lord of gods and the best god. 1. Lit, etermal endless. Here it is the name of Visnu. 2. A celebrated Muni or saint, the founder of the Sāṁkhya system of philosophy; the son of Kardama by Devahuti and according to some an incarnation of Visnu. 3. Lit-victorious, or triumphant, aname of Visnu. 4. Narasinha-a name of Visnu. When sprayed for by Prahlada to appear from a pillar Vişnu came out in the shape of man-lion and slew Hiranyakaśipu— the king of Daityas and father of Prahlada. 5. Protector of sacrifices-a name of Visnu. 6. Here it is evidently one of the names of Vişņu. In Visnu Purana. Book I, Chap. X. we find another account, Vireyas, married to Gauri, had Sudaman, a Lokapāla, or ruler of the east quarter, as his son.

source: तस्मिंस्तूर्यशतैः कीर्णे गन्धर्वाप्सरसंकुले। सरयूसलिलं रामः पद्भ्यां समुपचक्रमे॥
target: The place was filled with the noise of hundreds of bugles sounded by Gandharvas and Apsarās. And then Rāma prepared himself to descend to the waters of Sarayů.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच तच्छ्रुत्वा मन्दपालस्तु वचस्तेषां दिवौकसाम्। क्व नु शीघ्रमपत्यं स्याद् बहुलं चेत्यचिन्तयत्॥
target: Vaishampayana said : Having heard these words of the dwellers of heaven, Mandapala thought how he could obtain the largest number offspring within the shortest period of time.

source: बाहू महान्तौ कृत्वा तु तथाऽऽस्यं च भयानकम् स्थितमावृत्य पन्थानं येन यान्ति कुरूद्वहाः॥
target: With out-stretched arms and terrible face he stood obstructing the way on which those perpetuators of the Kuru race (the Pandavas) were proceeding.

source: य एवोक्ताः सुमनसां प्रदाने गुणहेतवः। धूपेष्वपि परिज्ञेयास्त एव प्रीतिवर्धनाः॥
target: The offer of flowers and the gift of such Dhupas as yield gratification are equal in merits.

source: ब्राह्मणाः कथयिष्यन्ति महाभारतमाहवम्। समागमेषु वार्ष्णेय क्षत्रियाणां यशोधनम्॥
target: The Brahmanas will tell the world of the great battle of Mahabharata. The wealth of Kshatriyas, O you of the Vrishni race, is what they win in the field of battle.

source: क्षीरोदमथनं चैव जन्मोच्चैःश्रवसस्तथा। यजतः सर्पसत्रेण राज्ञः पारिक्षितस्य च॥ कथेयमभिनिर्वृत्ता भरतानां महात्मनाम्। विविधाः संभवा राज्ञामुक्ता: संभवपर्वणि॥ अन्येषां चैव शूराणामृषेद्वैपायनस्य च। अंशावतरणं चात्र देवानां परिकीर्तितम्॥
target: That of the churning of the ocean, the birth of Uchaishrava and last of all, the Bharata dynasty as described at the snake-sacrifice of king Parikshit. Sambhava Parva treats of the births of various kings. sages and heroes and that of the sage, Krishna Dvaipayana, the partial incarnations of the celestials,

source: तत्र विज्ञानसंयुक्ता त्रिविधा चेतना ध्रुवा। सुखदुःखेति यामाहुरदुःखामसुखेति च॥
target: The mind, which is as an attribute of Chit, has three states, viz., pleasure, pain and absence of both pleasure and pain.

source: हिरण्यकवचाः सर्वे सर्वे चोत्तमधन्विनः। सर्वेऽश्वमेधैरीजाना: कुमारा: शशबिन्दवः॥
target: All of them, (on occasions of battle) used to don golden coats of mail; and all were excellent bowmen. All those of Shashabindu accomplished the Horse-sacrifice.

source: त्रैलोक्यस्यापि राज्येन नास्मान् कश्चित् प्रहर्षयेत्। बान्धवान् निहतान् दृष्ट्वा पृथिव्यां विजयैषिणः॥
target: Seeing those kinsmen of ours that were determined on acquiring the sovereignty of the world killed on the field of battle, we have been so much laden with grief that one cannot gladden us by giving us even the sovereignty of the three worlds.

source: ततो गाण्डीवधन्वानमभ्यभाषत केशवः। अयं महत्तरः पार्थ पालितेन समावृतः॥ वलीसंछन्ननयनः शूरू परमदुर्जयः। अक्ष्णोरुन्मीलनार्थाय बद्धपट्टो ह्यसौ नृपः॥
target: God Sri Krishna then said to Arjuna-O son of Kunti! Bhagadatta is in his old age with all hair lured grey and eyes covered by the forehead flesh due to wrinkles appear as if these are closed. He is great warrior and gallant. It is tough to defeat him in the battle. He has tied the eyelids with a strip of cloth with the forehead so as to keep both eyes opened.

source: वायुनेव विधूतानि तव सैन्यानि सर्वतः। शरदम्भोदजालानि व्यशीर्यन्त समन्ततः॥
target: The diverse detachments of your army are routed and dispersed like autumnal clouds scattered by the wind.

source: तथैव निश्चिता बुद्धिरेषा साधु मता मम। वार्तिकैः कथ्यमानस्तु मित्राणां मे पराभवः॥ पाण्डवानां च विजयो हृदयं दहतीव मे।
target: I am infouned by the messengers of the defeat of my friends and the victory of the Pandavas. That is consuming my heart.

source: ततः प्रववृते युद्धं घोररूपं भयावहम्। तावकानां परेषां च निघ्नतामितरेतरम्॥
target: There raged a fierce and frightening battle between your warriors and those of the enemy, as they smote down one another.

source: स काञ्चनविचित्राङ्गमारुरोह महारथम्॥ आदाय रुचिरं चित्रं समार्गणगुणं धनुः।
target: He got upon his great golden car, and took his beautiful bow with its arrow fixed on the string.

source: तस्य तद्भाषितं श्रुत्वा रामः सत्यपराक्रमः। तां कथां कथयामास वसिष्ठस्य महात्मनः॥
target: Hearing the words of Laksmana, Rama, having truth for his prowess, began to relate the story of Vasiştha.

source: नाकम्पत महाबाहुः स्ववार्यं समपाश्रितः॥ सायकांश्चैव विविधानश्वत्थाग्नि मुमोच ह।
target: (Yet) that mighty-armed one did not tremble; (but) resorting to his own prowess discharged at Ashvatthama numerous arrows.

source: प्रव्राज्य पाण्डवान् वीरान् स्वेन वीर्येण भारत। भुक्ष्येमां पृथिवीमेको दिवि शम्बरहा यथा॥
target: Shakuni said: Having exiled the heroic Pandavas through your own prowess, O descendant of Bharata, you now rule this earth without a rival, as the slayer of Shambara rules the heaven.

source: सा तान् दृष्ट्वा वीडमानेव बाला सूर्यं देवी वचनं प्राह भीता। गच्छ त्वं वै गोपते स्वं विमानं कन्याभावाद् दुःख एवापचारः॥
target: Beholding them, the maiden was covered with shame. And being alarmed, the damsel spoke these words to Surya “O lord of rays, go to your own place. This outrage on your part is greatly distressing to me as I am a maiden.

source: निहतौ भ्रातरौ दृष्ट्वा मायाशतविशारदः। कृष्णौ सम्मोहयन् मायां विदधे शकुनिस्ततः॥
target: Then, conversant with hundred kinds of illusion, Shakuni beholding his two brothers slain spread a mighty illusion for confounding the two Krishnas.

source: पूर्वे वयसि तत् कुर्याद् येन वृद्धः सुखं वसेत्। यावज्जीवेन तत् कुर्याद् येन प्रेत्य सुखं वसेत्॥
target: That act should be done during the early years of life, which will enable one to live in comfort during the old age. That act should be done in this life which will enable one to live in happiness after death.

source: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु सखा दशरथस्य लोमपाद इति ख्यातो ह्यङ्गानामीश्वरोऽभवत्॥
target: At this time there was a king of Anga, known by the name of Lomapada, who was the friend of Dasharatha.

source: एवमामत्र्य ते वीराः पाण्डवाः पाण्डुपूर्वजम्। जग्मुस्ते सहितः सर्वे वासुदेवश्च वीर्यवान्॥
target: Having thus consulted, the heroic Pandavas, together with the highly powerful son of Vasudeva, went, O elder brother of Pandu,

source: सर्वाण्येवानुपूर्वेण यद् यदानुविधीयते। अविभागगता बुद्धिर्भावे मनसि वर्तते॥
target: When one sense becomes subordinate to the Understanding, the latter, though really not different, enters the Mind in the form of existent things. Such is the case with the senses one after another with reference to the ideas that are said to be apprehended by them.

source: ऋचीकस्यात्मजश्चैव शुनःशेपो महातपाः। विमोक्षितो महासत्रात् पशुतामप्युपागतः॥
target: Having been sought to be killed as an animal in the great sacrifice of Amvarisha, Shunashepha of austere penances the son of Richika acquired his deliverance through Vishvamitra.

source: मार्कण्डेय उवाच त्वयुक्तोऽयमनुप्रश्नो यथावद् वदतां वर। विदितं वेदितव्यं ते स्थित्यर्थं त्वं तु पृच्छसि॥
target: Markandeya said : "O the best of speakers, this question is worthy of you and is just what you should ask. You are well informed of whatever is fit to be known But it is for the sake of form that you are asking the question.

source: तपोमयं तपोराशिं तपोमूर्तिं तपात्मकम्। तपसा त्वां सुतप्तेन पश्यामि पुरुषोत्तमम्॥ शरीरे तव पश्यामि जगत् सर्वमिदं प्रभो। त्वमनादिरनिर्देश्यस्त्वामहं शरणं गतः॥ तमुवाच हरिः प्रीत: कश्यपं गतकल्मषम्। वरं वरय भद्रं ते वरार्होऽसि मतो मम॥
target: By means of warm austerities, will I behold you composed of penances, a mass of mortifications, and endowed with a form and a soul of austerities. And in your person, O lord, will I behold this entire universe. And in You without beginning, and incapable of being pointed out, do I take refuge! Thereupon exceedingly pleased, Hari spoke to Kasyapa, with his sins purged off, saying, Do you mention the boon! Good betide you. Methinks you deserve a boon.

source: किंचिद् दैवाद्धद्दात् किंचित् किंचिदेव स्वकर्मभिः। प्राप्नुवन्ति नरा राजन् मा तेऽस्त्वन्या विचारणा॥
target: O monarch, by practising Yoga or by Destiny or by their own acts, men attain to (happiness or misery). Do not thing otherwise.

source: ज्ञातिसम्बन्धिनस्तुष्टाः शौचेन च नृपस्य नः। देवा हविर्भिः पुण्यैश्च रक्षणैः शरणागताः॥
target: Kinsmen and relatives have been pleased by the purity of conduct shown by our king. The celestials have been pleased by libations of clarified butter and acts of merit, and dependents and followers by protection.

source: सुचिराय मनुष्येन्द्रो नगरी पुण्यलक्षणाम्। विवेश सहिस्तेन वसिष्ठेन महर्षिणा॥
target: The accompanied by the great Rishi Vasishtha entered without delay his auspicious capital.

source: ददृशुस्ते समायान्तं राघवं सपुरःसरम्। विराजमानं वपुषा रथेनातिरथं तदा॥
target: They (citizens) beheld Raghava enter the city with a graceful person and seated in the car.

source: यस्यार्थे शस्त्रमादाय यमपेक्ष्य च जीवसि। च साद्य पतितः शेते पृष्ठे नावेदितस्तव॥
target: He for whose sake you have taken up arms and for whom you live, he, deprived of life, today lies on the field of battle, unknown to you and behind your back.

source: धृतिमानात्मवान् बुद्धिं निगृह्णीयादसंशयम्। मनो बुद्ध्या निगृह्णीयाद् विषयान्मनसाऽऽत्मनः॥
target: One endued with patience and a pure soul should, forsooth, control his understanding. With the understanding, one should next restrain mind, and then with the mind overpower the objects of the senses.

source: न दैवं नाशुभं किंचिद् विद्यते तत्र वासव। तत्र दिव्यान्यरण्यानि दिव्यानि भवनानि च॥ विमानानि सुयुक्तानि कामगानि च वासव। ब्रह्मचर्येण तपसा यत्नेन च दमेन च॥
target: There may be seen many beautiful cars, all excellently equipt and which move at the will of the rider, O Vasava. O you having eyes like lotus petals, it is only by celibacy, by penances, by Truth, by self-control, by gifts, by various kinds of righteous deeds, by sojourns lo sacred waters, in fact, by severe austerities and righteous deeds well-performed, that one can attain to Goloka.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच कच्चित् पितामहेनासीच्छुतं वा दृष्टमेव च। कच्चिन्मो मृतो राजन् पुनरुज्जीवितोऽभवत्॥
target: Yudhishthira said Have you, O grandfather, ever seen or heard of any mortal restored to life after having met with death.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एवं सम्भाषमाणे तुधौम्ये कौरवनन्दन। लोमशः स महातेजा ऋषिस्तत्राजगाम ह॥ तं पाण्डवाचजो राजा सगणो ब्राह्मणाश्च ते। उपातिष्ठन्महाभागं दिवि शक्रमिवामराः॥
target: Vaishampayana said : O descendant of Kuru, when Dhaumya was thus talking, at that very time the greatly effulgent Rishi Lomasha came here. Thereupon the eldest Pandava, the king (Yudhishthira) with his followers and other Brahmanas sat round that greatly exalted one (Lomasha), as Shakra (Indra) is surrounded by the celestials.

source: किमन्यद् दैवसंयोगान्मन्यसे पुरुषाधम॥ यांश्च तान् स्तौषि सततं दुर्योधनरिपून् द्विजा
target: To what do you, that are the basest of men, attribute all this except the hand of fate? O twice-born one, as to the enemies, Duryodhana whom you always extol.

source: ततो भीमो महाबाहुः सहसाऽभ्यपतद् बली। साहाय्यकारी समरे पार्षतस्य महात्मनः॥
target: Then the greatly strong and mighty Bhimasena soon came there with the desire of helping the Prishata prince in that combat.

source: मुहूर्तेन यमं ते तु हया हरिहयोपमाः। प्रापयन्मनसस्तुल्या यत्र तत्प्रस्तुतं रणम्॥ दृष्ट्वा तथैव विकृतं रथं मृत्युसमन्वितम्। सचिवा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य सहसा विप्रदुर्दुवुः॥
target: In a moment those horses like to thought (in celerity,) and resembling the steeds themselves of Hari, took Yama where the warfare had already begun. Seeing the frightful car in that aspect with Death present in it, the ministers of the Rākşasa monarch at once took to their heels.

source: गृहणीत बध्नीत विकर्ततेमं पचाम खादाम च भीमसेनम्। क्रुद्धा ब्रुवन्तोऽभिययुटुंतं ते शस्त्राणि चोद्यम्य विवृत्तनेत्राः॥
target: With rolling eyes, they upraised their arms and rushed in anger at Bhimasena, crying "Seize him" "Bind him," "Cut him down" "Look to Bhima and eat him up."

source: मण्डलीभूतवास्य नित्यं धनुरदृश्यत। संग्रामे युद्ध्यमानस्य शक्रचापोपमं महत्॥
target: As Bhishma fought on, his bow that resembled the mighty bow of Indra (Rainbow) was seen to remain continuously in a circular form.

source: एष एव वधोऽस्माकं सुपर्याप्तस्तपोधन। यद् वयं संशितात्मानं प्रलोव्धुं त्वामिहागताः॥
target: I was enough death to us that we had at all come here to tempt such an ascetic of controlled soul as you are.

source: श्चिच्छेद पार्थः प्रहसञ्छरौघैः। भूयश्च तानहन बाणसङ्घान् गाण्डीवधन्वायतपूर्णमण्डलः॥
target: Smiling and stretching his bow Gandiva to the fullest extent he sent out numberless arrows from it, destroying all the powerful weapons sent against him by the great car-warriors and hitting them at the same time.

source: क्षामयित्वा तु कौरव्यं रणादुत्तरमागतम्। प्रशशंस ततो मत्स्यः शृण्वत: सव्यसाचिनः॥ त्वया दायादवानस्मि कैकेयीनन्दिवर्धन। त्वया मे सदृशः पुत्रो न भूतो न भविष्यति॥
target: Having pacified Yudhishthira, the king began to praise Uttara in the hearing of Arjuna. "O descendant of Kaikeya, in you I have truly got a son. Like you I never had nor shall have a son."

source: जितशिश्नोदरो मैत्रः शिष्टाचारसमन्वितः। वैणवीं धारयेद् यष्टिं सोदकं च कमण्डलुम्॥
target: One should govern his lust and stomach, practise universal compassion, and be characterised by good conduct. One should bear a bamboo-stick, and a water-pot filled with water.

source: गन्धर्व उवाच यवीयान् देवलस्यैष वने भ्राता तपस्यति। धौम्य उत्कोचके तीर्थे वृणुध्वं यदीच्छथ॥
target: The Gandharva said: There is a shrine in this forest, it is called Utkochaka. The younger brother of Devala, Dhaumya, is engaged there in ascetic penances. If you desire, you can appoint him as priest.

source: अरण्ये वसतां तात भ्रातृणां ते मनस्विनाम्। मनोरथा महाराज ये तत्रासन् युधिष्ठिर॥ तानिमे भरतश्रेष्ठ प्राप्नुवन्तु महारथाः। प्रशाधि पृथिवीं पार्थ ययातिरिव नाहुषः॥
target: Let these great car-warriors, possessing sufficient mental strength, O king, let these your brothers, O Yudhishthira the chief of the Bharatas, satisfying those wishes of theirs which they entertained while living in the woods. Rule you the Earth, O son of Pritha, like (another) Yayati the son of Nahusha.

source: वषट्कार :प्रतोदोऽभूद्गायत्री शीर्षबन्धना॥
target: The Vashatkara (the chief Vedic sound) formed the goad; and Gayatri formed the chord attacked to the goad.

source: हतोऽहमिति चाचख्यौ पृष्टो ब्राह्मणकन्यया। स पुनर्देवयान्योक्तः पुष्पाहारो यदृच्छया॥ वनं ययौ कचो विप्रो ददृशुर्दानवाश्च तम्। पुनस्तं पेषयित्वा तु समुद्राम्भस्यमिश्रयन्॥
target: On another occasion, the Brahmana Kacha at the request of Devayani, went into the forest to collect flowers and when he was freely roaming there, he was again seen by the Danavas. They again killed him, (pounded him to powders) and mixed him with the waters of the ocean.

source: वयं त्विह विना भूता गुणवद्भिर्महारथैः। कृपणं वर्तयिष्याम पातयिता नृपान् बहून्।१४।।
target: As regards ourselves, deprived of those great car-warriors of numerous accomplishments, we shall have to pass our time in sorrow, having caused many kings to die.

source: न तु पापकृतां राज्ञां प्रतिगृह्णन्ति साधवः। एतस्मात् कारणाद् यज्ञैर्यजेद् राजाऽऽप्तदक्षिणैः॥
target: The good and righteous, do not accept the gifts of persons of the royal order, who perpetrate sinful deeds. Therefore, the king should celebrate sacrifices with profuse gifts in the form of Dakshina.

source: जाज्वल्यमानो वपुषा तपनीयपरिच्छदः। मृगैश्चन्द्रार्धचन्द्रश्च स रथः समलंकृतः॥
target: The chariot was brilliant with its own native resplendence, adorned with gold and painted with the figures of deer and a cresent.

source: दशन् वै मानुषान्नित्यं पापात्मा स विशाम्पते। घृतं हृत्वा तु दुर्बुद्धिः काकमद्गुः प्रजायते॥
target: He bites human beings every day and, therefore, becomes sinful and passes through a varied round of rebirths. That foolish man who steals clarified butter has to take birth as a gallinule.

source: ततोऽन्यद् धनुरादाय भीमसेनो महाबलः। अवाकिरत् तव सुतं तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रवीत्॥
target: Then Bhimasena, that great car-warrior, taking up another bow, covered your son with arrows and said to him "Wait, wait."

source: तदा प्रभृति राजा च शकुनिश्चापि सौबलः। जानते निर्जितान् पार्थान् कर्णेन युधि भारत॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, from that day king Duryodhana and Shakuni, the son of Subala, thought that the sons of Pritha (the Pandavas) had already been defeated by Karna.

source: अद्य श्रेष्ठस्य जानीतां पाण्डवस्य पराक्रमम्। मद्रराजं हतं श्रुत्वा देवैरपि सुदुःसहम्॥
target: Hearing of the death of the ruler of the Madras who was incapable of defeat by the very celestials, that king will know the prowess of Yudhishthira.

source: अगस्त्य उवाच गवां दशसहस्राणि राज्ञामेकैकशोऽसुर। तावदेव सुवर्णस्य दित्सितं ते महासुर॥
target: Agastya said : O Asura, you have intended to give to each of these kings ten thousand kine and as many gold coins.

source: तत्र सामानि गायन्ति तत्र चाहुर्निदर्शनम्। देवं नारायणं भीरु सर्वात्मानं निबोध तम्॥
target: Then are sung some Samans. There is an authority on this subject. O timid one, know that the divine Narayana is the Soul of all.

source: बालिशस्तु नरो नित्यं वैक्लव्यं योऽनुवर्तते। स मज्जत्यवशः शोके भाराक्रान्तेव नौ ले॥
target: He that is senseless as well as he that suffers himself to be overwhelmed with grief, losing all control over self, drown themselves in sorrow like a boat bearing a heavy load in water.

source: वासुकिरुवाच अयं शापो यथोद्दिष्टो विदितं वस्तथाऽनघाः। तस्य शापस्य मोक्षार्थ मन्त्रयित्वा यतामहे॥
target: Vasuki said: O sinless ones, the curse on us is well known to you. We should try to neutralise it.

source: अक्षयं ददतो विततं श्रद्धा कीर्तिस्तथा क्रियाः। यथोक्तमेव भूतानां प्रियत्वं स्वर्गमुत्तमम्॥
target: “As you give away numerous presents, let your wealth, your devotion, your renown, your meritorious deeds, the love that people cherish for you and the paradise that you shall attain to, let all these of yours, be inexhaustible.”

source: स्नाता मङ्गलसंयुक्तास्ततः प्राश्नीत पन्नगाः। भवद्भिरिदमासीनैर्यदुक्तं तद्वचस्तदा॥
target: O snakes, drink it after performing your ablutions and religious rites. I have done what you asked me to do.

source: दक्षिणश्चाभवत् पक्षः कैकेयोऽक्षौहिणीपतिः। पृष्ठतो द्रौपदेयाश्च सौभद्रश्चापि वीर्यवान्॥
target: Its right wing was formed by Kaikeya the commander of a division consisting of a Akshauhini; in its back were the sons of Draupadi and the highly powerful son of Subhadra.

source: अशिष्टा गतमर्यादा लोभेन हृतचेतसः। स्वेषु बन्धुषु मुख्येषु तद् वेत्थ पुरुषर्षभ॥
target: Those wicked ones, whose self-respect is gone and whose hearts have been perverted by avarice (are acting unfairly) towards their own chief friends, O best of men.

source: तत्राद्भुतं महाराज दृष्टवानस्मि संयुगे। यद् द्रोणो रभसं युद्धे पाञ्चाल्यं नाभ्यवर्तत॥
target: Then O mighty monarch, we beheld a wonderful sight in that battle, in as much Drona striving hard could not approach the Panchala prince.

source: तूर्णं प्रासृजदुग्राणि शरवर्षाणि पाण्डवः। ततो द्रौणिर्महाराज छित्त्वास्य विशिखैर्धनुः॥
target: That son of Pandu, soon discharged dreadful arrowy showers in Drona's son. Thereupon, O mighty monarch, cutting off with sharp arrows the bow of his foe, Drona's son.

source: तस्मिन् कर्मणि संसिद्धे पर्यष्वजत पाण्डवम्। मेने च दुपदं संख्ये सानुबन्धं पराजितम्॥
target: As soon as this feat was performed, he (Drona) embraced the son of Pandu (Arjuna) and thought that Drupada with his friends were already vanquished in the battle.

source: यज्ञं चकार सुमहानसुरेन्द्रो महाबलः। बलेस्तु यजमानस्य देवाः साग्निपुरोगमाः। समागम्य स्वयं चैव विष्णुमूचुरिहाश्रमे॥
target: And that mighty chief of the Asuras celebrated a sacrifice. And as Vāli was performing that sacrifice, the deities with Agni at their head, coming to Vişnu himself at this asylum, addressed him saying,

source: गजेन्द्रैः पर्वताकारैः पर्वताग्रैर्वनौकसाम्। मथितैर्वाजिभिः कीर्णं सारोहैर्वसुधातलम्॥
target: And (anon) the earth was covered with huge elephants measuring mountains, and mountaintops, and steeds crushed and the riders thereof, all borne down by the monkeys.

source: यथाहं धृतराष्ट्रेण शिष्टः पूर्वमितो गतः। अब्रुवं पाण्डवान् गत्वा तन्निबोधत पार्थिवाः॥
target: What I, instructed by Dhritarashtra before having gone there from hence said to the sons Pandu, listen to that, O rulers.

source: युधिष्ठिरोऽपि कैतव्यमुलूकमिदमब्रवीत्। उलूक मद्वचो ब्रूहि गत्वा तात सुयोधनम्॥
target: Yudhishthira too said to Uluka the gambler's son, “Uluka, tell my words when you go to Suyodhana.'

source: अथवार्जुन शंस त्वं प्रियां तामर्जुनप्रियाम्। जनकस्य सुता तन्वी यदि जीवति वा न वा॥
target: Or, O Aryunā, she was very fond of you, tell me if live that daughter of Janaka of slender frame.

source: शरान्धकारे तु माहत्मभिः कुते महामृधे योधवरैः परस्परम्। चतुर्दिशो वै विदिशश्च पार्थिव प्रभा च सूर्यस्य तमोवृताभवत्॥
target: In fact, those brave and picked warriors sent out such hosts of shots against one another that the light of the sun became almost indistinct and the very atmosphere was filled with darkness.

source: ऋतुकाले ततः स्नाता कदाचिद्वासुके: स्वसा। भर्तारं वै यथान्यायमुपतस्थे महामुनिम्॥
target: One day the sister of Vasuki, when her season of impurity came, bathed according to custom and went to the great Rishi, her husband.

source: राजयाजकयाज्यानां मद्रकाणां च यन्मलम्। तद् भवेद् वै तव मलं यद्यस्मान विमुञ्चसि॥
target: The sin of those persons who appoint Kshatriyas as their priests as well as that of the Madrakas will visit you if you do not abandon me.

source: अमर्षवशमापन्नः सौमित्रिर्दृढविक्रमः॥ प्रत्यविध्यद्धयांस्तस्य शरैर्वित्रासयन्रणे।
target: Then Sumitrā's son of steady prowess, fired with anger, in that contest, frightening all, pierced his horses with arrows.

source: प्रजानामतिवृद्धानां युगान्ते समुपस्थिते। त्रेताविमोक्षसमये द्वापरप्रतिपादने॥ ववर्ष सहस्त्राक्षः प्रतिलोमोऽभवद् गुरुः। जगाम दक्षिणं मार्गं सोमो व्यावृत्तलक्षणः॥ न
target: At that time which was the end of Treta and the commencement of Dvapara, when the time came for many sufficiently old creatures to give up their lives, the thousand-eyed god poured no rain. The planet Brihaspati began to move in the opposite course, and Soma, giving up his own orbit, receded towards the south.

source: स्वलंकृताश्च कल्याण्यः पादैरेव सहस्रशः। वारमुख्या महाभागं प्रत्युद्यास्यन्ति केशवम्॥
target: Blessed damsels, the foremost among dancing girls, by thousands with ornaments on will go out on foot to receive Keshava of large parts.

source: ततो वाजिरथान् युक्त्वा दिव्यान् हेमविभूषितान्। अध्यारोहत् प्रयाणार्थं बहून् बहुविधो जनः॥
target: Thereupon, getting ready excellent steeds and cars decked with gold, many people mounted, with the intention of departing.

source: विदेहराजस्य महीपतेस्तौ विप्रावुभौ मातुलभागिनेयौ। प्रविश्य यज्ञायतनं विवादे बन्दिं निजग्राहतुरप्रमेयौ॥
target: These two Brahmanas of matchless energy went to the sacrificial ground of the king of Videha and defeated Bandi (in a controversy).

source: उत्तिष्ठते च शीतांशुः शशी लोकतमोनुदः। ह्लादयन् प्राणिनां लोके मनांसि प्रभया स्वया॥
target: And that dispeller of darkness, the mildbeaming moon is rising, gladdening the hearts of all creatures with his splendour.

source: सर्वैर्धर्मः समुपेतास्तु पार्थाः संस्थानेन मार्दवेनार्जवेन। जाताः कुले ह्यनृशंसा वदान्या ह्रीनिषेवाः कर्मणां निश्चयज्ञाः॥
target: With all virtues are the sons of Pritha endued, with steadiness, with mildness and with frankness. They are born in a good family, the reverse of cruel and generous, they avoid all deeds that one, should be ashamed of and know for certainly the nature of each deed.

source: त्रेलोक्यनिर्माणकरं जनित्रं देवासुराणामथ नागरक्षसाम्। मिन्द्रानुजं तं शरणं प्रपद्ये॥
target: I shall take refuge under the creator of the three worlds, the creator of the gods, Asuras, Nagas and Rakshasas, the chief among the rulers of men and learned men and that younger brother of Indra. On the return of Sanjaya, Yudhishthira, the king of virtue, said to the scion of the Dhritarashtra race (Krishna), that bull among all the Sattvatas.

source: बलिकर्मसु वक्ष्यामि गुणान् कर्मफलोदयान्। देवयक्षोरगनृणां भूतानामथ रक्षसाम्॥
target: I shall now describe to you the merits, with the fruits they bring about, of Bali offerings man own made to the celestials, the Yakshas, the Uragas, human beings, spirits and Rakshasas.

source: महाव्रतं चरेद् यस्तु दद्यात् सर्वस्वमेव तु। गुर्वर्थे वा हतो युद्धे स मुच्येत् कर्मणोऽशुभात्॥
target: The person who practises a very rigid vow, or gives away the whole of his wealth, or dies in a battle fought for the sake of his preceptor, becomes freed off of all his sins.

source: सम्मुह्यति तदा सैन्ये त्वरमाणो धनंजयः। भीष्मं शरसहस्रेण विव्याध रणमूर्धनि॥
target: Upon the confusion of the the force, Dhananjaya proceeding heavily, pierced Bhishma with a thousand shafts, at the van of battle.

source: धूम्राक्षेण समागम्य माणिभद्रो महारणे। मुसलेनोरसि क्रोधात्ताडितो न च कम्पितः॥
target: And Dhūmrākşa, confronting Māņibhadra in the mighty conflict hit him as the chest with a bludgeon; but he did not move thereat.

source: केन भद्र सुखार्थेन सम्प्राप्तोऽसि तपोवनम्। पदातिर्बद्धनिस्त्रिंशो धन्वी बाणी नरेश्वर॥
target: And they said,-Blessed be you, in pursuit of what delightful object have you, O king, come to this hermitage, walking on foot and armed with sword, bow and arrows?

source: नल उवाच भवद्भिरहमादिष्टो दमयन्त्या निवेशनम्। प्रविष्टः सुमहाकक्षं दण्डिभिः स्थविरैर्वृतम्॥
target: Nala said: At your behest, I entered the mansion of Damayanti consisting of large and beautiful chambers and guarded by old guards with bludgeons in their hands.

source: शरैश्च विविधैरन्यैर्धक्ष्यते भूरितेजसम्। इति द्रोणं समाधाय शंसन्ति च रुदन्ति च॥
target: Having collected various other sorts of arrows, that highly energetic hero is being consumed by them. Having placed his body on the pyre, they are singing and weeping.

source: ब्राह्मणाय च राज्ञे च सर्वाः परिददे प्रजाः। तस्य वृत्तिं प्रवक्ष्यामि यच्च तस्योपजीवनम्॥
target: To the Brahmana and the Kshatriya he assigned (the protection of) all creatures. I shall tell you what the Vaishya's profession is and how he is to earn the means of his maintenance.

source: स ताड्यमानो नाराचैर्वृष्टिवेगैरिवाचलः॥ जघान पञ्चभिर्बाणैः पञ्चैवातिरथान् बली।
target: Destroyed those five kings endued with great prowess, with five arrows. Those foremost of kings (who were present in that battle) seeing the destruction of those five heroes began to waver.

source: यशस्विभिर्नागरथाश्वयोधिभिः पदातिभिश्चाभिमुखैर्हतैः परैः। वृता प्रशान्तैरिव तावकैर्मही॥
target: Covered with the dead bodies of elephants warriors, horsemen and car-warriors of great repute and of foot soldiers killed while combating with one another, divested of armours, ornaments and weapons the Earth looked like the sky covered with clouds.

source: सौतिरुवाच श्रुत्वा तु सर्पसत्राय दीक्षितं जनमेजयम्। अभ्यगच्छदृषिविद्वान्कृष्णद्वैपायनस्तदा।॥
target: Sauti said : Having heard that Janamejaya has been installed in the Snake-sacrifice, the learned Rishi Krishna Dvaipayana went there.

source: सैन्धवं प्राप्स्यते वीरः सव्यसाची धनंजयः। यत्तु भक्तिमता कार्यं सततं हितकाङ्क्षिणा॥
target: The brave Dhananjaya, who can shoot weapons even with his left hand, will not be able to reach the ruler of the Sindhus. Everything that a man bearing love and devotion to you and always anxious for your welfare, ought to do for you.

source: अपूर्वमिव पश्याम उदकं नात्र नीयत इत्यथामात्योऽनुदकं वनं कारयित्वोदारवृक्षं। बहुपुष्पफलमूलं तस्य मध्ये मुक्ताजालमायीं पार्श्वे वापी गूढां सुधासलिललिप्तां स रहस्युपगम्य राजान-मब्रवीत्॥ वनमिदमुदारकं साध्वत्र रम्यतामिति॥
target: “We see here a matchlessly beautiful damsel and the king has married her giving her a pledge, namely that he would never show her any water." Having heard all this, he (the minister) made an artificial forest containing many trees with numerous fruits and flowers. He excavated a large and deep tank within that forest in one of its corners. He covered it with a net of pearls and its water looked like ambrosia. One day he spoke thus to the king in private. “This is a beautiful forest having no water any where. Sport here in joy."

source: भृगुरुवाच सत्यं ब्रह्म तपः सत्यं सत्यं विसृजते प्रजाः। सत्येन धार्यते लोकः स्वर्गं सत्येन गच्छति॥
target: Bhrigu said Truth is Brahma; truth is Penance it is Truth which Creates all creatures. Truth sustains the entire universe and it is with the help of Truth that one goes to Heaven.

source: नार्थमल्पं परिभवेन्नावमन्येत शात्रवान्। बुद्ध्या तु बुद्ध्येदात्मानं न चाबुद्धिषु विश्वसेत्॥
target: The king should never disregard any wealth, however little it may be; he should never belittle his foes for their powerlessness; he should by his own intelligence, examine his ownself; he should never place confidence in ignorant persons.

source: सप्त या धारणाः कृत्स्ना वाग्यतः प्रतिपद्यते। पृष्ठतः पार्वतश्चान्यास्तावत्यस्ताः प्रधारणाः॥
target: To fix the mind upon one thing at a time is called Dharana, following proper vows and restraints, the Yogin practises in all seven kinds of Dharana. There are, again, as many sorts of Dharanas originating out of these, upon subjects which are near or distant.

source: ज्ञानेन खलु पश्यामि दृष्ट्वा प्रत्यागमिष्यथ। आद्यः पन्थाः कुलिङ्गानां ये चान्ये धान्यजीविनः।।२६।
target: I perceive by my knowledge that having seen (that place) you shall come back. The first course belongs to forktailed shrikes and others living on grain.

source: ततोऽहं कृपयाऽऽविष्टो विष्टभ्यात्मानमात्मना। धिग्धिगित्यब्रुवं युद्धं क्षत्रधर्मं च भारत॥
target: Then was I filled with pity and stopped of my own will and said: "Fie, fie on battle and on Kshatriya practices." O Bharata.

source: स भगवता वासुदेवेनासंजातबलवीर्यपराक्रमोऽकालजातोऽस्त्राग्निना दग्धस्तेजसा स्वेन संजीवितः। जीवयित्वा चैनमुवाचपरिक्षीणे कुले जातो भवत्वयं परिक्षिन्नामेति॥ परिक्षित् खलु माद्रवती नामोपयेमे त्वन्मातरम्। तस्यां भवान् जनमेजयः॥
target: Though born before time, having been burnt by the fire of the weapon (hurled by Ashvathama), though deprived of life, strength and energy, he was revived by Vasudeva and was given strength, energy and prowess. After thus making him alive, Vasudeva said, “As this child is born in an extinct race, let him be called Parikshit.” Parikshit married Madravati, your mother and she gave birth to you, Janamejaya.

source: स देशः परराष्ट्राणि विमृज्याभिप्रवर्धितः। भीष्मेण विहितं राष्ट्र धर्मचक्रमवर्तत॥
target: The wheel of virtue being thus set in motion by Bhishma, the country was full of increased population, people coming from other countries.

source: दृष्ट्वा तयोश्च तद्वीर्यमप्रमेयममानुषम्। शङ्कमानौ पाण्डवांस्तान् रामकृष्णौ महामती॥
target: The doubting by Rama and Krishna from the great exploits of the brothers that whether they were Pandavas.

source: दिव्यमस्त्रं विकुर्वाणान् प्रसहेद् वा परान् मम। अन्योदुर्योधनात् कर्णाच्छकुनेश्चापि सौबलात्॥ दुःशासनचतुर्थानां नान्यं पश्यामि पञ्चमम्।
target: Who else again will face my enemies when they will display their celestial weapons. Save and except Duryodhana, Karna, Shakuni the son of Subala and Dushasana as their fourth; I do not indeed see a fifth man.

source: ततो वीक्ष्य दिशः सर्वा दृष्ट्वा शून्यां च मेदिनीम्। विहीनः सर्वयोधैश्च पाण्डवान् वीक्ष्य संयुगे॥ मुदितान् सर्वतः सिद्धान् नर्दमानान् समन्ततः। बाणशब्दरवांश्चैव श्रुत्वा तेषां महात्मनाम्॥ दुर्योधनो महाराज कश्मलेनाभिसंवृतः। अपयाने मनश्चक्रे विहीनबलवाहनः॥
target: Looking on all sides and seeing the earth vacant, himself deprived all his troops while the Pandavas were joyously roaring aloud for the fulfillment of all their objects, Duryodhana, O king, unable to bear the sound of arrows discharged by those great heroes, became stupefied. Deprived of troops and animals, he made up his mind to fly from the field.

source: दृष्टवानस्मि गोविन्द तदस्त्रं रुद्रसंनिधौ। परशुस्तीक्ष्णधारश्च दत्तो रामस्य यः पुरा॥ महादेवेन तुष्टेन क्षत्रियाणां क्षयंकरः। कार्तवीर्यो हतो येन चक्रवर्ती महामृधे॥
target: I saw this weapon, O Govinda, in the hand of Mahadeva. I saw also another weapon, viz., that shar-pedged battle-axe which, was given, formerly unto Rama by Mahadeva for enabling him to root out the Kshatriyas. It was with this weapon that Rama killed in dreadful battle the great Karttaviryya who was the king of the entire world.

source: न चापि तव संकल्प मोघमिच्छामि दानव। कृष्णस्य क्रियतां किंचित् तथा प्रतिकृतं मयि॥
target: O Danava, I am not willing to frustrate your intention also. Do something for Krishna; that will be sufficient requital for my services to you.

source: गन्धर्वनगराकारान् रथांश्च निहतेश्वरान्। छिन्नध्वजपताकाक्षान् विचक्रान् हतसारथीन्॥ निकृत्तकूबरयुगान् भग्नेषाबन्धुरान् प्रभो। पश्य पार्थ हयान् भूमौ विमानोपमदर्शनान्॥
target: Behold, O Partha, O lord, these cars resembling the city of the Gandharvas, with their lords slain and their standards, banners and Akshas cut to pieces, deprived of their wheels and charioteers, with their yokes cut to pieces, with broken shafts and crests and looking (splendid) like the celestial vehicles.

source: कर्मणा क्षत्रियाश्चैते निघृणा भोगिभोजिनः। ज्ञातिसंक्षयकर्तृत्वाद् ब्राह्मण्यं न लभन्ति वै॥
target: By their habits of life they are Kshatriyas; but as they live on snakes, they are without humanity; and owing to their constant warfare with their kinsmen they never attain to the region of Brahma.

source: संजय उवाच क्षयं मनुष्यदेहानां तथा नागाश्वसंक्षयम्॥ शृणु राजन् स्थिरो भूत्वा संग्रामं शंसतो मम।
target: Sanjaya said Hear, O king, patiently of the destruction of human beings, elephants and horses as I describe the battle.

source: अपत्यार्थ महाराज प्रसादं कृतवांश्च सः। त्रीन् स पुत्रानजनयत् तदा भरतसत्तम॥
target: To beget children, and great king he too complied with our request and then did he beget children, O you best among the Bharatas.

source: त्वमिन्द्रस्त्वं हयमुखस्त्वं शर्वस्त्वं जगत्पतिः। त्वं मुखं पद्मजो विप्रस्त्वमग्निः पवनस्तथा।॥
target: You are Indra, you are steed-necked Vishnu, you are Shiva, You are the Lord of the universe, you are the principal, you are Brahma and Brahmanas, you are Agni, you are the wind.

source: अथ वैश्रवणं प्रीतो भगवान् प्रत्यभाषत। अर्चितोऽस्मि यथान्यायं गमिष्यामि धनेश्वर।॥
target: Thus addressed by king Vaishravana, the illustrious Ashtavakra, replied to him, with a pleased heart, saying I have been duly honoured by you. I desire now, O Lord of Riches, to go hence.

source: सुदुष्कृतं कृतवती कुन्ती पुत्रानपश्यती। राज्यश्रियं परित्यज्य वनं सा समरोचयत्॥
target: Difficult is the feat that Kunti has performed by separating herself from her sons. Alas, renouncing royal prosperity, she choose a life in the forest.

source: एवं द्वन्द्वसहस्राणि रथवारणवाजिनाम्। पदातीनं च समरे तव तेषां च संकुले॥
target: Thus in that great battle thousands of single combats were fought between car-warriors, elephants men, horse-men sand foot-soldiers of both the sides.

source: अन्योन्यैराहताः सक्ताः सस्वनुर्भीमनिःस्वनाः। ऊर्मयः सिन्धुराजस्य महाभेर्य इवाम्बरे॥
target: The waves of the mighty deep beating at each other continually, set up a sound resembling that of a trumpet in the sky.

source: मम वाक्यकरौ वीरौ मम गौरवयन्त्रितौ। सैन्यार्णवं समुत्तीर्णौ दिष्ट्या पश्यामि वामहम्॥
target: It is high time to feel gaiety when I am seeing you both warriors duly crossed the army ocean. You hold obligation of my dignity and honour the directions issued by me.

source: एकः पालयते लोकमेकः पालयते कुलम्। मज्जत्येको हि निरय एकः स्वर्गे महीयते॥
target: One protects men, another his family; one is plunged in hell, another is honoured in heaven.

source: ऋत्विज ऊचुः यथा शास्त्राणि न: प्राहुर्यथा शंसति पावकः। इन्द्रस्य भवने राजस्तक्षको भयपीडितः॥
target: The Ritvijas said : O king, Takshaka is now living in fear in the abode of Indra. The Shastra declares this to us and the Fire also says it.

source: त्वं नित्यं सुविषण्णं मामाश्वासयसि लक्ष्मण। गतासुर्नाद्य शक्तोऽसि मामार्तमभिभाषितुम्॥
target: O Lakşmaņa, you ever comforts me when I am dispirited. But today, having lost your life, you can not speak to me, who am afflicted.

source: सर्वर्तुसुखसेव्यानि फलन्त्यन्ये नगोत्तमाः। महार्हमणिचित्राणि फलन्त्यन्ये नगोत्तमाः।४६।।
target: And other excellent trees bear fruits fit to be partaken at all seasons. And other excellent trees bring forth precious beds dight with costly jewels and furnished with variegated covers.

source: ततोऽर्जुनः प्रीतमना बभूव विगतज्वरः। द्रोणश्च सत्यवागासीनान्योऽभिभवितार्जुनम्॥
target: Arjuna became pleased and his fever (of jealous) was gone. “None will equal Arjuna," these words of Drona now became true.

source: अशोकैश्चम्पकैशूतैरनेकैरतिमुक्तकैः। पुन्नागैः कर्णिकारैश्च बकुलैर्दिव्यपाटलैः॥
target: There were in the forest in which the king went to hunt) many Ashoka, Champaka, Chutas, Atimuktas, Punnagas, Karnikaras, Bakula, Divya-patala.

source: त्राहि मां पद्मपत्राक्षि सत्ये सत्या भवस्व नः॥ शरणं भव मे दुर्गे शरण्ये भक्तवत्सले।
target: O possessor of eyes like the petals of lotuses, be truth to us who are seeking after truth. O Durga, O refuge of all, O affectionate to devotees, be pleased to grant me protection.

source: कृष्णद्वैपायनोऽप्येतत् सत्यवत्यै न्यवेदयत्। प्रलम्भमात्मनश्चैव शूद्रायाः पुत्रजन्म च॥ स धर्मस्यानृणो भूत्वा पुनर्मात्रा समेत्य च। तस्यै गर्भ समावेद्य तत्रैवान्तरधीयत॥
target: When Krishna Dvaipayana was met by his mother as before, he told her, how he had been deceived by the eldest of the princesses and how he had begotten a son on a Shudra woman. Having said this, he disappeared in her sight.

source: भीष्म उवाच तमागतमभिप्रेक्ष्य शिष्यं वाक्यमथाब्रवीत्। देवशर्मा महातेजा यत् तच्छृणु जनाधिप॥
target: Bhishma said Seeing his disciple returned from his mission, Devasharman of great energy addressed him in words which I shall recite to you, O king.

source: न हि पार्थाः सपाञ्चाला: स्थातुं शक्तास्तवाग्रतः। आत्तशस्त्रस्य समरे महेन्द्रस्येव दानवाः॥
target: Having put on all the weapons, the sons of Pritha, along with the Panchalas, will not be able to stay before you in the field, even as the Danavas are not able to stand before Indra (in battle).

source: प्रतर्दन उवाच तांस्ते ददानि मा प्रपत प्रपातं ये मे लोकास्तव ते वै भवन्तु। स्तानाक्रम क्षिप्रमपेतमोहः॥
target: Pratardana said : I give to you all of them. Therefore, though falling, you must not fall. Let all the regions for me to enjoy be yours, whether they may be in heaven or in the firmament. Take them soon and let your sorrow cease.

source: तत्र पाण्डुरमेघाभं जाम्बूनदपरिष्कृतम्। कुबेरभवनं रम्यं निर्मितं विश्वकर्मणा ॥ विशाला नलिनी यत्र प्रभूतकमलोत्पला। हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णा अप्सरोगणसेविता ॥
target: There (you will behold) the charming mansion of Kuvera, resembling pale clouds, of burnished gold, built by Viśvakarmā; where (lies) the spacious tank overflowing with lotuses and lilies, thronged with swans and Kāraņdavas, and frequented by troops of Apsarās.

source: गन्धर्व उवाच अनग्नयोऽनाहुतयो न च विप्रपुरस्कृताः। यूयं ततो धर्षिताः स्थ माया वै पाण्डुनन्दनाः॥
target: The Gandharva said : O sons of Pandu, you do not keep fire; you have no wives; you have no Brahmanas walking before you; therefore you were censured by me.

source: कण्व उवाच अक्षयश्चाव्ययश्चैव ब्रह्मा लोकपितामहः। तथैव भगवन्तौ तौ नरनारायणावृषी॥
target: Kanva said Brahma, the grand-father of this world, is eternal and undecaying; of the same nature are the two divine Rishis, Nara and Narayana.

source: यतो धर्मस्ततः कृष्णो यत: कृष्णस्ततो जयः। युद्ध्यस्व गच्छ कौन्तेये पृच्छं मां किं ब्रवीमि ते॥
target: Drona said Where there is righteousness there is Krishna. Where there is Krishna, victory is certain to be there. O son of Kunti, go and fight. Ask me, what shall I speak to you?

source: अस्मिन्मुहूर्ते सुग्रीवप्रयाणमभिरोचय। युक्तो मुहूर्ते विजये प्राप्तो मध्यं दिवाकरः॥
target: Therefore, at this very moment arrange for Sugrīva's march. The Sun has attained his meridian at this proper moment, capable of conferring victory.* *The moment is named abhijit.

source: दृष्टद्वारो लभेद् द्रष्टुं राजस्वेषु न विश्वसेत्। तदेवासनमन्विच्छेद् यत्र नाभिपतेत् परः॥
target: One ought to obtain previous permission should he want to appear before the king. As regards royal secrets one should not give credit when they are mentioned; one should rather court that seat where no one can defeat him.

source: सर्वेषां परितुष्टाऽस्मि वानराणां तरस्विनाम्॥ चरन्त्या मम धर्मेण न कार्यमिह केनचित्।
target: Well pleased am I with the fast-footing monkeys. But by one engaged in your duties, there is no work that is desiderated.

source: तस्योग्ररूपस्योग्रं त्वं दण्डमाज्ञातुमर्हसि। सीता सम्भाषिता येन वनं तेन विनाशितम्॥ मनः परिगृहीतां तां तव रक्षोगणेश्वर। कः सीतामभिभाषेत यो न स्यात् त्यक्तजीवितः॥
target: It behove you to order sharp chastisement to be inflicted on that one of a fierce form, who, having carried on converse with Sītā, has laid your wood waste. Who, O Sovereign of the Rākşasas, that has not his life served from him, converse with Sītā, who has captivated your heart?"

source: आगमिष्यति बीभत्सुरिमां द्वारवतीं पुरीम्॥ आख्येयं तस्य यद् वृत्तं वृष्णीनां वैशसं महत्।
target: Vibhatsa will come to this city, viz., Dvaravati. Tell him what has taken place viz., this great destruction of the Vrishnis.

source: अभ्यवर्तन्त संहृष्टाः परस्परवधैषिणः। ते वै समेयुः संग्रामे राजन् दुर्मन्त्रिते तव॥
target: It is, O monarch, through the wicked policy of yours that those warriors inflamed with rage then approached and encountered one another in battle, out of a desire for slaying one another.

source: एवं परमसम्बोधात् पञ्चविंशोऽनुबुद्धवान्। अक्षरत्वं नियच्छेत त्यक्त्वा क्षरमनामयम्॥
target: The twenty-fifth (viz., Individual Soul), when he thus succeeds in understanding the Supreme, becomes able to able to cast off the Destructible and at one with the Indestructible and which is the essence of all that is auspicious.

source: बद्धश्च वारुणैः पाशैर्वज्रेण च समाहतः। हतदारो हृतधनो ब्रूहि कस्मान्न शोचसि॥
target: You are fettered with Varuna's noose and has been struck with my thunderbolt. Your wives and riches have been taken away. Tell us why you do not grieve.

source: तस्मात्पुत्रेषु दारेषु मित्रेषु च धनेषु च। नातिप्रसङ्गः कर्तव्यो विप्रयोगो हि तैध्रुवम्॥
target: Therefore attachment to wife, sons, friends and riches is not proper, for surely shall be brought about separation with them.

source: ततः पार्वाद् वृषाङ्कस्य ब्रह्मचारी न्यवर्तत। पिङ्गाक्षस्तपसः क्षेत्रं बलवान् नीललोहितः॥
target: Thereafter from one of the sides of Siva's body, a Brahmacharin issued forth; his eyes were tawny and he seemed to be the refuge of all asceticism. Having blue throat and red hair, he was possessed of great energy.

source: अथ तत्रैव संग्रामे वर्तमाने सुदारुणे। अपसव्यं ततश्चक्रे द्रौणिस्तत्र वृकोदरम्॥
target: Then at that moment, in that dreadful battle, the son of Drona made Vrikodara in the field occupy his right position.

source: ये च पक्षधरा धर्मे सद्वृत्तरुचयश्च ये। यान् दृष्ट्वाहीयते पापं तेभ्यः कार्यानमस्क्रिया॥
target: They who are the supporters of the wings of Virtue, they who are of good conduct and excellent disposition, they on seeing whom sins disappear, we should all bow to them.

source: भयमोहपरीवारं भूतसम्मोहकारकम्। आनन्दप्रीतिचारं च कामक्रोधपरिग्रहम्॥
target: It is full of fear and delusion, and is the cause of the delusion of all beings. It moves towards joy and pleasure, and has desire and anger for its possession.

source: न चैनमभ्यजास्ते तदा विकृतदर्शनम्। अथैनं परिपप्रच्छुः को भवान् कस्य वेत्युत॥
target: Seeing that man of grim visage, a total stranger to them, they asked, “Who are you and whose son are you?"

source: मुनयश्च महात्मानो वसन्त्यस्मिशिलोच्चये। अयं वासो भवेत् तात वयमत्र वसेमहि ॥
target: And the hill is inhabited by high-souled ascetics. Let this, O child, be our abode. We will dwell here.

source: सात्यकिश्चेकितानश्च तेषां गोप्ता महारथा धृष्टद्युम्नस्ततः पश्चात्यञ्चालैरभिरक्षितः॥
target: Then Satyaki and Chekitana, each a mighty car-warrior, became the protector of these last named. Behind them came Dhrishtadyumna protected by the Panchalas.

source: इति संप्रविचार्य राजसिंहः श्वोभूते शपथस्य निश्चयम्। विससर्ज मुनीनृपांश्च सर्वान् स महात्मा महतो महानुभावः॥
target: And having made arrangements that Sītā would go through the trial next day, the highminded, generous king Rama bade adieu to all kings and Rşis.

source: दक्षिणामिति काकुत्स्थो विदित्वास्य तदिङ्गितम्। संस्कारं लम्भयामास सखायं पूजयन् पितुः॥
target: Knowing from the sign made by the vulture that it was the south (towards which Ravana had gone) the descendant of Kakustha, out of regard for his father's friend, caused his last rites to be performed.

source: यत् पृथिव्यां व्रीहियवं हिरण्यं पशवः स्त्रियः। नालमेकस्य तत् सर्वमिति मत्वा शमं व्रजेत्॥
target: "Whatever of paddy, wheat, gold, animals and women there are on the face of the earth, are not sufficient for even one single man. Knowing such to be the fact, one should betake to contentment."

source: सोऽभ्ययात् कृतवर्माणं धृतराष्ट्रसुतो नृपः। कृतवर्मा ददौ तस्य सेनामक्षौहिणी तदा॥
target: The son of Dhritarashtra, himself a king, then went to Kritavarma and Kritavarma gave him an army counting an Akshauhini.

source: यश्चेदं श्रावयेद् विद्वान् सदा पर्वणि पर्वणि। धूतपाप्मा जितस्वर्गो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते॥
