source: एवंविधेन तपसा तस्य भक्त्या च भारत। महेश्वरः प्रसन्नात्मा चकार मनसा मतिम्॥
target: Pleased with such penances and such devotion, O Bharata, of the Rishi, the great God resolved to grant him his wish.

source: पततां चैव नागानां घिष्ठितानां तथाम्बरे। अश्रूयतानिशं शब्दः पच्यतां चाग्निना भृशम्॥
target: Incessant were the piteous cries of the snakes that fell into the fire and of those that were in the air about to fall into it.

source: विश्वामित्रोऽपि धर्मात्मा भूयस्तेपे महातपाः। पुष्करेषु नरश्रेष्ठ दशवर्षशतानि च॥
target: O Rāma, And, O best of men, the righteous Viśvāmitra of mighty asceticism again carried on austerities at Puskara for ten hundred years.

source: इत्युक्त्वा वचनं मत्स्यः क्षणेनादर्शनं गतः। इष्टुकामः प्रजाश्चापि मनुर्वैवस्वतः स्वयम्॥
target: Having said this, the fish disappeared in a moment. Vaivasvata Manu also became esirous of creating the creatures.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्त: संजयेन धृतराष्ट्रो महामनाः। ध्यानमन्वगमद् राजन् पुत्रान् प्रति जनाधिप॥
target: Vaishampayana said O king, having been thus addressed by Sanjaya, the illustrious king Dhritarashtra meditated long about his sons.

source: तमुवाच महातेजा रामो राजर्षिसत्तमः। किं मां भरत कुर्वाणं तात प्रत्युपवेक्ष्यसे॥
target: To him spoke that foremost of Rājarşis, the highly energetic Rāma, O Bharata, my dear brother, what have I done that you have down by me?

source: एवमुक्ताः सुराः सर्वे प्रत्यूचुर्विष्णुमव्ययम्। मानुषं रूपमास्थाय रावणं जहि संयुगे॥
target: Thus addressed, the deities answered Visnu, incapable of deterioration, saying,-Assuming the form of a human being, do you in battle slay Rāvana!

source: शतं गवां सहस्राणि शतमश्वतराणि च। उत्थायोत्थाय वै प्रादात् सहस्रं परिवत्सरान्॥
target: Rising (at the termination of every sacrifice) he distributed a hundred thousand kine and hundreds of mules during this time.

source: ततोऽर्जुनो महाराज लज्जया वै समन्वितः। धर्मराजस्य चरणौ प्रपद्य शिरसा नतः॥ उवाच भरतश्रेष्ठं प्रसीदेति पुनः पुनः। क्षमस्व राजन् यत् प्रोक्तं धर्मकामेन भीरुणा॥
target: After this, O monarch, Arjuna became quite ashamed of himself; bending his head down he touched Yudhishthira's feet and repeatedly said unto that chief of the Bharatas, "O king, be appeased; forgive me for the impropriety of my language towards you; they were given expression to (as the only course left me) for maintaining truthfulness and avoiding sin.”

source: मृतायामपि वैदेह्यां नष्टायामपि राघव। शोचितुं नार्हसे वीर यथान्यः प्राकृतस्तथा॥
target: O descendant of Raghu, it become you not to lament like an ordinary person even if Janakí is dead or has been carried away.

source: यामेव रात्रिं ते दूताः प्रविशन्ति स्म तां पुरीम्। भरतेनापि तां रात्रि स्वप्नो दृष्टोऽयमप्रियः॥
target: The very same night that the envoys entered the city, Bharata saw an evil dream.

source: शक्तस्त्वमसि विक्रम्य विश्रमस्व निशामिमाम्। चिरं ते जाग्रत स्तात स्वप तावन्निशामिमाम्॥
target: If you display your energy your quite competent to achieve that feat! Take rest, therefore, for this night. You have kept us many a night.

source: गते भीष्मे महाराज धार्तराष्ट्रो जनेश्वरः। पुनरागम्य तं देशममन्त्रयत मन्त्रिभिः॥
target: O great king, when Bhishma had gone away, that lord of men, the son of Dhritarashtra (Duryodhana) again came there and consulted with his counsellors.

source: तमेवमुक्त्वा सौहार्दाद् भ्रातरं लक्ष्मणाग्रजः। उवाच भूयः कौसल्यां प्राञ्जलिः शिरसा नतः॥
target: Saying these words to Lakşmaņa out of fraternal affection, spoke again Rāma to Kausalyā with clasped hands and with his head bending low.

source: ये ये महाबलाः सन्ति लघवश्च प्लवंगमाः। लङ्कामभिपतन्त्वाशु गृह्योल्काः प्लवगर्षभाः॥
target: Now let those principal monkeys that are endowed with great strength and that are furnished with fleetness, taking fire-brands (in their hands) rapidly rush towards Lankā.

source: नास्तीत्येवं व्यवस्यन्ति सत्यं संशयमेव च॥ तदयुक्तं व्यवस्यन्ति बालाः पण्डितमानिनः।
target: They assert that nothing, however true, exists which is not directly perceivable; or, at least, they doubt the existence of those objects. Such assertions however are absurd and they who make them are fools, whatever their pride of learning.

source: पुनश्च सृजते सर्वमनाद्यन्तं महेश्वरः। इष्टं चैव हि दत्तं च हुतं चैव निशाचर॥
target: And that lord of all gods again creates the universe without beginning or end. O night-ranger, he governs and preserves all sacrifices, gifts and oblations to fire.

source: गच्छ पुत्र नदी पुण्यां वधूसरकृताह्वयाम्। तत्रोपस्पृश्य तीर्थेषु पुनर्वपुरवाप्स्यसि॥
target: O son, go to the sacred river which is known by the name of Vadhusara. Bathing in all the Tirthas in that river, you will regain your old effulgence.

source: आत्मानमात्मनाऽऽश्वास्य मा शुचः पुरुषर्षभ। नाद्य शोकाभिभूतस्त्वं कायमुत्स्रष्टुमर्हसि॥
target: Solacing yourself, by you own self, cease to grieve, O best of men. You should not allow yourself to be overwhelmed with sorrow and to all action.

source: शस्त्राणि च विचित्राणि क्रुद्धास्तव व्यदर्शयन्। छादयन्तः शरैः पार्थं मेघा इव दिवाकरम्॥
target: Inflamed with rage, they then displayed numerous wonderful weapons; and like the clouds covering the solar disc, they covered Pritha's son with their arrows.

source: एवमुक्त्वा च सुग्रीवमाश्लिष्य च पुनः पुनः। विभीषणमुवाचाथ रामो मधुरया गिरा।९।।
target: Having said this and embraced Sugrīva again and again Rāma addressed Vibhișana with sweet accents.

source: एवं वदन्तस्ते सोढुं न शेकुर्बाष्पमागतम्। नरास्तमनुगच्छन्ति प्रियमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनम्॥
target: Saying this; they could not suppress their fears; and the men followed the beloved descendant of Ikşvāku.

source: संदश्य दशनैरोष्ठं क्रोधसंरक्तलोचनः। राक्षसैरपि दुर्दर्शः कालाग्निरिव मूर्तिमान् ॥
target: Having his eyes reddened with anger and gnashing his teeth and biting the lips, that one, irrepressible by other Raksasas, looked like the fire of dissolution incarnate.

source: वैश्यस्यापि हि यो धर्मस्तं ते वक्ष्यामि शाश्वतम्। दानमध्ययनं यज्ञः शौचेन धनसंचयः॥
target: I shall now tell you, O Yudhishthira, what the eternal duties of the Vaishyas are.-A Vaishya should make gifts, study the Vedas, celebrate sacrifices, and acquire wealth by fair means.

source: पितरस्तेऽवलम्बन्ते गर्ते दीना अधोमुखाः। साधु दारान्कुरुष्वेति प्रजामुत्पादयेति च॥
target: “Your ancestors are hanging in grief with their faces downwards. O holy man, take a wife and beget offspring.

source: गुर्वर्थश्च कृतः पार्थ महाशत्रून् घनता मम। एवमेव सदा भाव्यं स्थिरेणाजौधनंजय॥
target: O Partha, you have (now) paid your preceptor's fees by slaying my powerful enemies. O Dhananjaya, you will, thus, ever remain cool-headed in battle,

source: शतान्यष्टौ वारणानामवश्यं विशातितैः कुम्भकराग्रहस्तः। भीमेनाजौ निहतान्यद्य बाणैः स मां क्रूरं वक्तुमर्हत्यरिजः॥
target: I have seen that in today's battle Bhimasena has cut asunder with his arrows, the heads, bodies and proboscis of eight hundred elephants and thereby killed them therefore, that Brikodara, the slayer of foes, may use harsh words me.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच इत्येवंवादिनं वीरं भीममक्लिष्टकारिणम्। भोगेन महता गृह्य समन्तात् पर्यवेष्टयत्॥
target: When the heroic Bhima of great achievements was saying all this, the serpent seized him and coiled him all round with its gigantic body.

source: मन्त्रे व्यूहे नये चारे युक्तो भवितुमर्हसि। वानराणां च भद्रं ते परेषां च परंतप॥
target: O slayer of foes, it now behove you to be particularly careful about the counsels, arrangement of soldiers, polity-civil and military and spies of our own party as well as those of the enemies.

source: तद् बाणैरर्दितं यूथं रक्षसां पीनवक्षसाम्। सिंहैरिव बभौ मत्तं गजानामाकुलं कुलम्॥
target: That great host of the broad-chested Rakshasas, sore oppressed with his arrows, looked like a herd of furious elephants attacked) by a lion.

source: तयोः प्रतिभयं युद्धमासीद् राक्षससिंहयोः। कुर्वतोर्विविधा मायाः शक्रशम्बरयोरिव॥
target: Then like the battle between Shakra and Shambara in the days of yore, the battle between those two foremost of Rakshasas became terrible, as they invoked into existence many illusions.

source: पूजयांचक्रिरे शङ्ख कुरवः सहसैनिकाः। अर्जुनेन तथा ध्मातः शतधा यन्न दीर्यते॥
target: Seeing that the conch was not broken into a hundred pieces when blown by Arjuna, the Kuru warriors spoke highly of it.

source: उपाध्यायः स विधिना हुत्वा शान्तिमनामयम्। हुतहव्यावशेषेण बाह्यं बलिमकल्पयत्॥ मधुदध्यक्षतघृतैः स्वस्तिवाच्यं द्विजांस्ततः। वाचयामास रामस्य वनेस्वस्त्ययनक्रियाम्॥
target: The spiritual preceptor, after offering oblations to the fire with due rites for his peace and health, presenting what was then left as offerings to the lords of the four cardinal points and others,* and giving the Brahmins a dish of curd, ghi and honey, made them benedictory prayers for Rāma who was going to the forest. *The Gürhyasthabuli or the daily offering of the householder, meant here, may be thus explained. After the performance of oblation to the fire, the householder should present offerings to the lords of the four cardinal points. Indra, Yama Varuņa, Soma and to their retinue. The offering for the Marutas should be placed on the threshold; for the presiding deities of the water in water; for the lords of the forest to the wooden pestle and mortar; for Śrī and Bhadrakäli on the grounds adjacent to the beddings on the side of the head and that of the feet respectively; for Brahmanaspati and Vāstupati on the site of the habitation; for Viśvedeva and for day and night thrown in the air of the house, for Sarvātmabhūta scattered on the terrace. After offering to all these what remains should be thrown on the south for the manes. The offerings to the dogs, the fallen, the drags of the people, the lepers, the crows and the worms and the insects should be placed on uncovered ground.

source: पुरा द्वैतवने चासि मया पुत्र परीक्षितः। पानीयार्थे पराक्रान्ता यत्र ने भ्रातरो हताः॥
target: Formerly, O son, you were once examined by me in the forest of Dvaita, where your brothers of great prowess met with (an appearance of) death,

source: पुण्याहवाचने राज्ञः सुनन्दासहितां स्थिताम्। मन्दं प्रख्यायमानेन रूपेणाप्रतिमेन ताम्॥ निबद्धां धूमजालेन प्रभामिव विभावसोः। तां समीक्ष्य विशालाक्षीमधिकं मलिनां कृशाम्। तर्कयामास भैमीति कारणैरुपपादयन्॥
target: She seated with Sunanda, in the house of that monarch, who at the time was repeating his prayers. She was faintly seen, on account of the great luminosity of her extraordinary beauty. Even as her splendour was like the blazing of a fire enveloped by smokes. Thus beholding that lady, with large eyes, colorless and weak, he, after arguing from various reasons, decided her to be the daughter of Bhima.

source: अन्धेन तमसा लोकाः प्रावृता न चकाशिरे। प्रणष्टा ज्योतिषां भाश्च सह सूर्येण भारत॥
target: All the worlds became covered with darkness. Nothing could be seen. The light of all the luminaries became darkened, along with that of the Sun himself, O Bharata.

source: बहुप्रसादः सुस्वप्नो दर्पणोऽथ त्वमित्रजित्। वेदकारो मन्त्रकारो विद्वान् समरमर्दनः॥
target: You are he whose favour is of the largest measure; you are he who has good dreams; you are a mirror in which the universe is reflected; you are he who has subjugated of all internal and external enemy; you are the maker of the Veda; you are the maker of the sayings contained in the Tantras and the Puranas and which are embodied in human language; you are highly learned; you are the grinder of enemies in battle.

source: तादृशो बध्यते बालो यत्र सत्यमनिष्ठितम्। सत्यानृते विनिश्चित्य ततो भवति धर्मवित्॥
target: That ignorant person commits sin, who says truth which is not righteous. That person is a master of duties who can distinguish truth from untruth.

source: अनाया वचः तुत्वा मारुतः प्रत्यभाषत। न त्वां हिंसामि सुश्रोणि माभूत् ते मनसो भयम्॥
target: Hearing Anjana's words, the Wind answered, do not wrong you, O you of shapely hips. Let not her enter your heart.

source: प्रायश्चित्तं न तस्यास्ति योधर्ममभिशङ्कते। ध्यायन् स कृपणः पापो न लोकान् प्रतिपद्यते॥
target: Whoever, doubts religion has no expatiation of his sin; that wretched and vile person feels anxicty (here) and does not attain to the regions (of bliss) hereafter.

source: संजय उवाच शृणु राजन् स्थिरो भूत्वा तवापनयनो महान्। न च दुर्योधने दोषमिममाधातुमर्हसि॥
target: Sanjaya said O king, hear about your great transgressions. You should not put all blame on Duryodhana.

source: तेषां मध्यगतो देवो रराज भगवाञ्छिवः॥ शरदभ्रविनिर्मुक्तः परिधिस्थ इवांशुमान्।
target: In their midst was the illustrious god like the sun in the midst of his corona, come from autumnal clouds.

source: कृष्ण एव हि लोकानां भावनो मोहनस्तथा। संहारकारकश्चैव कारणं च विशांपते॥
target: It is Krishna who is the protector of the universe and its beguiler. It is He who is the destroyer and the cause, O king.

source: इदं वः क्षत्रिया द्वारं स्वर्गायापावृतं महत्। गच्छध्वं तेन शक्रस्य ब्रह्मणः सहलोकताम्॥
target: "O Kshatriyas, this broad door is wide open for you to enter heaven. Go through it to the abodes of Indra and Brahma.

source: शिरसा वन्दमानं मामुपमन्युरभाषत॥ स्वागतं पुण्डरीकाक्ष सफलानि तपांसि नः। यः पूज्यः पूजयसि मां द्रष्टव्यो द्रष्टुमिच्छसि॥
target: His name was Upamanyu. He said to me who bowed to him vith my head down: Welcome are you, O you of eyes like lotus petals! Today, by this visit of yours, we see that our penances have fructified. You are worthy of our adoration, but you worship us still. You are worthy of being scen, but you wish to see me.

source: चचाल च मही कृत्स्ना सागरचापि चुक्षुभे। विस्मयं परमं जग्मुः पार्थिवा भरतर्षभ॥
target: And the whole earth moved together and the waters of the sea were agitated and the rulers of the earth were struck with great wonder, O best among the Bharatas.

source: दीयतां भुज्यतां चेष्टं दिवारात्रमवारितम्। तं महोत्सवसंकाशं हृष्टपुष्टजनाकुलम्॥ कथयन्ति स्म पुरुषा नानादेशनिवासिनः।
target: 'Let agreeable things be given away,' 'Let agreeable food be eaten.' These were the sounds which were repeatedly heard day and night in that sacrifice. It was like a great festival, full of rejoicing and contented men. People of various kingdoms speak of that sacrifice to this day.

source: एकधा च द्विधा चैव चतुर्धा च महाबलम्। योगिनामीश्वरं देवं शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः॥
target: Hundreds and thousands of people described that Lord of Yogins of shining form and great might, as the son of one of those or of either of two of those or of any one of four of those. son

source: ततश्चक्रोध बलवांश्चक्रे वेगं च संयुगे। आर्थ्यशृङ्गिस्तथा दृष्ट्वा समरे शत्रुमूर्जितम्॥
target: Thereafter that of Rishyashringa possessed of great strength, beholding his puissant antagonist blaze forth in that battle, became inflamed with fury and put forth his own powers in that battle.

source: नदीमाश्रमसम्बद्धां दृष्ट्वाऽऽश्रमपदं तथा। चकाराभिप्रवेशाय मतिं स नृपतिस्तदा॥
target: Having seen the river and the hermitage he desired to enter into that sacred place.

source: रमिताऽभ्यधिकं स्त्रीत्वे सत्यं वै देवसत्तम। स्त्रीभावेन हि तुष्यामि गम्यतां त्रिदशाधिप॥
target: O foremost of the gods, truly do I say to you that I derive greater pleasure in my present state of womanhood. I am quite content with this state of womanhood that I now have. Do you leave me now, O king of heaven.

source: अथवा पौरुषेणेयं न शक्या रक्षितुं मया॥ बहुरूपो हि भगवाञ्छूयते पाकशासनः।
target: By displaying my prowess I shall not be able to protect the lady, for the powerful chastiser of Paka, it has been heard by me, is capable of assuming any form he likes.

source: जातं वृद्धं च धर्मेण सुदीर्घेणायुधान्वितम्। चत्वारोऽपि ततो वर्णा बभूवुर्ब्राह्मणोत्तराः॥
target: The new generation, blessed with long life, began to thrive in virtue and thus were again established the four castes having Brahmanas at their head.

source: सुपर्णवचनं श्रुत्वा सोंऽशुमानतिवीर्यवान्। त्वरितं हयमादाय पुनरायान्महातपाः॥
target: O hero, Hearing Suparna's speech, the exceedingly powerful Ansumat of mighty asceticism speedily taking the horse, retraced his steps.

source: पितुराज्ञां पुरस्कृत्य पौरकार्याणि सर्वशः॥ चकार रामः सर्वाणि प्रियाणि च हितानि च।
target: And paying the utmost regard to the command of his father, Rāma discharged all the duties of the city, having for his object the pleasure or welfare (of the citizens).21

source: मुमोचास्त्रं महाराज वायव्यं पृतनामुखे। प्रादुरासीत् ततो वायुः क्षोभयाणो नभस्तलम्॥
target: Discharged, O monarch, the Vayavya weapon at the head of the hostile ranks. Thereupon raged a tempest agitation the whole welkin,

source: समेत्य मातुलं गत्वा बलदेवं च मानद। पूजयेथा महाप्राज्ञ मद्वाक्येन यथार्हतः॥
target: Meeting my maternal uncle and going to Baladeva also, O giver of honours, you well, O you of great wisdom, adore both of them at my word as they deserve.

source: शिखण्डिनं याज्ञसेनि रुन्धानमपराजितम्। बाह्रीकः प्रतिसंयत्तः पराक्रान्तमवारयत्॥
target: Exerting his best, Balhika resisted the invincible and puissant Sikhandin the son of Yajnasena, capable resisting all foes.

source: स हत्वा सर्वकालिङ्गान् सेनामध्ये व्यतिष्ठता नैनमभ्युत्सहन् केचित् तावका भरतर्षभ॥
target: Having killed all the Kalingas, O best of the Bharata race, he stood in the midst of the troops, and none dared to withstand him.

source: किं नु तत् कारणं मन्ये येनाहं भवतः प्रियः॥ अन्यत्राभ्यवहारार्थं तत्रापि च बुधा वयम्।
target: What is that reason, I ask, for which I have become so dear to you, besides your desire for eating me up? You should know that I am not forgetful of this.

source: इति ते सर्वमाख्यातं यो दण्डो मनुजर्षभ। नियन्ता सर्वलोकस्य धर्माकान्तस्य भारत॥
target: I have now, O foremost of men, told you everything as to who punishment is, that restrainer of the universe which is governed by righteousness.

source: उदारं यद् भवानाह नैतच्चित्रं भवद्विधे। विहितो यस्तु मार्गो मे हितार्थं शृणु तं मम॥
target: You have spoken most magnanimously. It could be expected from one like you. Hear I shall describe the expedient I have thought of for benefiting both of us.

source: प्रणमाम्यभिगम्याहं राजपुत्रीं निबोध माम्। राज्ञः स्नुषां राजभार्यां दमयन्तीति विश्रुताम्॥
target: Approaching I bow down unto you. Know me for a kings' daughter, a king's daughter-inlaw, a king's wife and for Damayanti by name.

source: पश्यामि च महाराज मेरुं कनकपर्वतम्। महेन्द्रं चैव पश्यामि विन्ध्यं च गिरिमुत्तमम्॥
target: O great king, I saw also the golden mountain Meru, also Mahendra and also that excellent mountain Vindhya.

source: ततो रक्तजलं प्राप्य शोणाख्यं शीघ्रवाहिनम्। गत्वा पारं समुद्रस्य सिद्धचारणसेवितम्॥
target: Then, arriving at the rapid red waters going under the name of Sona, and repairing to the other shore of the ocean, the abode of Siddhas and Chāraņas, do you search all round for Răvaņa in company with Sītā in the sweet sacred spots and picturesque woods.

source: इदं धर्मरहस्यं च तव वक्ष्यामि पाण्डव। यद् ब्रूयात् तव भीष्मो हि पाण्डवो वा युधिष्ठिरः॥२ विदुरो वा यथा क्षत्ता कुन्ती वापि यशस्विनी। तत् ते वक्ष्यामि तत्त्वेन निबोधैतद् धनंजय॥
target: O son of Pandu, this mystery of virtue I will now explain to you as it was explained by Bhishma, by the pious Yudhishthira, by Vidura or the so-called Kshatri and by Kunti of great renown. I will tell it you in all its detail; listen to it, O Dhananjaya.

source: ते हेमनिष्काभरणा: कुण्डलाङ्गदधारिणः। निहता बह्वशोभन्त पुष्पिता इव किंशुकाः॥
target: Adorned as they were with golden ornaments and earrings, they (the Danavas), when killed, looked as beautiful as the Palasha tree when full of blossoms.

source: विक्लवानां ह्यबुद्धीनां राज्ञां पण्डितमानिनाम्। रोचते त्वद्वचो नित्यं कथ्यमानं महोदर॥
target: O Mahodara, what you say is ever acceptable only to kings that are incompetent, and foolish, pluming themselves on their knowledge.

source: यथाकामं व्रजत्येष यज्ञियाश्वो नरर्षभा स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु गमिष्यामि न स्थानं विद्यते मम॥
target: O foremost of men, this sacrificial horse wanders at will. Blessings on you. I must go away. I have no place to rest for even a short while!

source: दशाश्वस्य सुतस्त्वासीद् राजा परमधार्मिकः। सत्ये तपसि दाने च यस्य नित्यं रतं मनः॥
target: Dashashva's son, o king, was a pious prince whose mind was continually devoted to the practice of truth and charity and devotion.

source: इक्ष्वाकूणामिहाद्यैव कश्चिद् राजा विधीयताम्। अराजकं हि नो राष्ट्र विनाशं समवाप्नुयात् ।।८
target: Do you select some on this very day from the descendants of Ikşvāku, to be king here. Verily does a kingdom go to ruin, when without a king.

source: अनावृताः स्त्रियः सर्वा नराश्च वरवर्णिनि। स्वभाव एष लोकानां विकारोऽन्य इति स्मृतः॥
target: O fair complexioned girl, it is the human nature that all men and women should be without restraint. And it is asserted that the contrary (condition) is (its) perversion.

source: इत्यासीत् तुमुलः शब्दो दुर्धर्षस्य रथं प्रति। ततो द्रोणः कृपः कर्णो द्रौणी राजा जयद्रथः॥
target: Thereupon Drona, Kripa, Karna, Drona's son, king Jayadratha, the two princes from Avanti, viz., Vinda and Anuvinda and Shalya, checked that assault (of the Pandava troops).

source: यो विश्वसिति मित्रेषु न विश्वसिति शत्रुषु। अर्थयुक्तिमविज्ञाय यः प्रीतौ कुरुते मनः॥ मित्रे वा यदि वा शत्रौ तस्यापि चलिता मतिः।
target: He, who blindly places confidence in friends and always treats enemies mistrustfully without paying any heed to considerations of policy, finds his life unsafe. He, who, neglecting all considerations of policy, seeks either friends or foes, is regarded as a person whose understanding has been unhinged.

source: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा साधुकारो महानभूत्। ऋषीणामुग्रतपसां यमुनातीरवासिनाम्॥
target: Hearing his words, the sages of fierce austerities inhabiting the banks of the Yamunā, broke out into a peal of plandits.

source: तस्मिंस्तथा वर्तमाने विद्रवे भृशदारुणे। युयुत्सुः शोकसम्मूढः प्राप्तकालमचिन्तयत्॥
target: During that general flight accompanied with fear, Yuyutsu, beside himself with grief, thought upon what he should do under the present circumstances.

source: अलिग्रहणो नित्यः क्षेत्रज्ञे निर्गुणात्मकः। तस्मादलिङ्गः क्षेत्रज्ञः केवलं ज्ञानलक्षणः॥
target: The Kshetrajna which is eternal and is shorn of qualities about its essence, is incapable of being seized by symbols. Hence, the characteristic of the Kshetrajna, which is without symbols, is purely knowledge.

source: अरिष्टानि प्रवक्ष्यामि विहितानि मनीषिभिः। संवत्सरवियोगस्य सम्भवन्ति शरीरिणः॥
target: I shall now tell you the presaging marks, as laid down by the wise, of those who have but one year to live.

source: एतद् बुद्ध्वा भवेद् बुद्धः किमन्यद् बुद्धलक्षणम्। विज्ञायैतद् विमुच्यन्ते कृतकृत्या मनीषिणः॥ न भवति विदुषां महद्भयं यदविदुषा समुहद्भयं परत्र। न हि गतिरधिकास्ति कस्यचिद् भवति हि या विदुषः सनातनी॥
target: By gaining such knowledge one really becomes learned. What else is the mark of a person of knowledge? Having gained such knowledge, the wise men consider themselves successful and become liberated. Those things which produce fear to men shorn of knowledge do not do so to those who are gifted with knowledge. There is no end higher than the eternal end which is acquired by a learned person.

source: तिष्ठेल्लोको विना सूर्यं सस्यं वा सलिलं विना ॥ न तु रामं विना देहे तिष्ठेत्तु मम जीवितम्।
target: The world may exist without the Sun; and corn without water; but this life does not exist in this body without Räma.

source: आगता हि महावीर्या हरयः कामरूपिणः। कोटी: शतसहस्राणि नानाजगनिवासिनः॥
target: And monkeys by hundreds and thousands and koțis, inhabiting various mountains, possessed of exceeding prowess, have already arrived (here). to

source: श्रेणयस्त्वां महाराज पश्यन्त्वग्र्याश्च सर्वशः। प्रतपन्तमिवादित्यं राज्यस्थितमरिंदमम्॥
target: Let the principal orders, O monarch, behold you, represser of foes, established in the kingdom, like the powerful sun himself.

source: तस्य कृद्धस्य नेत्राभ्यां प्रापतनशुबिन्दवः। दीपाभ्यामिव दीप्ताभ्यां साचिषः स्नेहबिन्दवः॥
target: And from the eyes of that infuriated one fell drops of tears as drop from a flaming lamp drops of burning oil.

source: विषण्णवदना ह्येते त्यक्तप्रहरणा दिशः। पलायन्तेऽत्र हरयस्त्रासादुत्फुल्ललोचनाः ॥
target: These monkeys with sad faces, leaving their arms behind them are flying in all directions, their eyes distended in affright.

source: अस्मान्न त्वं सदा भक्तानिच्छस्यमितविक्रम। पाण्डवान् सततं प्रीडास्यस्माकं विप्रिये रतान्॥
target: you of prowess infinite, although we are ever devoted to you, you do not wish us well; but you are ever satisfied with the Pandavas who are intent on injuring ourselves.

source: उवाचेदं मानुषा ये च दिव्याः प्रजापतेर्ये च लोका महान्तः। तांश्चेल्लभेयं संविदं तेन कृत्वा तथापि नेच्छेयमिति प्रतीतः॥
target: And he also observed that he did not wish to attain the worldly and the heavenly regions, and all the highest regions of Prajapati, and that if he were so minded, he would accept the terms of Indra.

source: भैक्ष्यवर्यासु निरताः कृशा गुरुकुलाश्रयाः। निर्धना ये तु तान् नमस्यामि यादव।॥
target: I bow to them, O, Yadava, who live upon elemosynary alms, who are emaciated for want of adequate food and drink, who have lived in the houses of their preceptors, who are averse to and destitute of all enjoyments and who are poor in Earthly possessions.

source: ततः क्रुद्धो महाबाहुर्वार्यमाणः परैयुधि। शिरांसि रथिनां पार्थः कायेभ्योऽपाहरच्छरैः। :॥
target: Then excited to the highest pitch of anger by his enemies, the mighty-armed Partha endued with great prowess, began to rob, with his arrows, the heads of car-warriors, from their trunks.

source: अहोरात्राणि गच्छन्ति सर्वेषां प्राणिनामिह। आयूंषि क्षपयन्त्याशु ग्रीष्मे जलमिवांशवः॥
target: In this world, days and nights pass away with creatures, and speedily impair their lives, even as in summer the rays (of the sun) (dry up) the waters.

source: एते देया व्युष्टिमन्तो लघूपायाश्च भारत। अजुगुप्सांश्च विज्ञाय ब्राह्मणान् वृत्तिकर्शितान्॥
target: Such gifts yield prosperity and affluence to the giver, and are considered as pure, O Bharata. Those Brahmanas who are not censurable for anything they do, and who have no means of support assigned to them, should be found out.

source: तस्माद्वर्णा ऋजवो ज्ञातिवर्णाः संसृज्यन्ते तस्य विकार एव। एकं साम यजुरेकमृगेका विप्रश्चैको निश्चये तेषु सृष्टः॥
target: Therefore, all the four castes are holy. All the castes are allied to one another by blood through the intermediate classes. They have all originated from Brahmanas. In ascertaining (the priority of origin) it will be seen that amongst all the cases the Brahmana was created first. Originally Saman was one; Yajus was one, and Rich was one.

source: क्व च यक्षार्जवं युद्धं क्व च मायाबलाश्रयम्। रक्षसां पुरुषव्याघ्र तेन तेऽभ्यधिका युधि॥
target: Where is the candid-coursing fight of the Yakşas and where the fight of the Rākşas by help of the power of illusion; and therefore in that battle the advantage was on the side of the Raksasas.

source: ततः पर्यपतन्नुग्रा निवातकवचा मयि। तानहं विवरं दृष्ट्वा प्राहिण्वं यमसादनम्॥
target: Then the furious Nivatakavachas flew towards me. Seizing this opportunity, I began to send them to the abode of Yama.

source: मनसश्च गुणश्चिन्ता प्रज्ञया स तु गृह्यते। हृदिस्थश्चेतनो धातुर्मनोज्ञाने विधीयते॥
target: The quality of the mind is thought. That is seized by the understanding. The upholder of consciousness, living in the heart, has been appointed in apprehending the mind.

source: तथा तु पतिते राजन् मयि रामो मुदा युतः। उदक्रोशन्महानादं सह तैरनुयायिभिः॥
target: Myself having fallen down, Rama, being pleased, gave forth a loud shout along with his followers.

source: समुत्पतितमेघस्य वीचिमालाकुलस्य च। विशेषो न द्वयोरासीत्सागरस्याम्बरस्य च॥
target: They sky enveloped with clouds and the ocean overflowing with surges presented no contrast whatsoever.

source: इत्युक्तवा वचनं राजञ्जयं प्राप्य वृकोदरः। पुनराह महाराज स्मयंस्तौ केशवार्जुनौ॥ असृग्दिग्धो विस्त्रवल्लोहितास्यः क्रुद्धोऽत्यर्थ भीमसेनस्तरस्वी। दुःशासने यद् रणे संश्रुतं मे तद् वै सत्यं कृतमोह वीरौ॥
target: Thus speaking, O monarch, the shorttempered Bhimasena, who was all bleeding and was very red in the face and highly wrathful Vrikodara, after gaining victory, addressed both Keshava and Arjuna, spoke these words-"You witness, O you brave warriors, that in battle I have this day redeemed by pledge regarding Dushasana,

source: प्रायोपविष्टं जानीध्वमथ मां गुरुघातिनम्॥ जातिष्वन्यास्वपि यथा न भवेयं कुलान्तकृत्।
target: Know me who am the destroyer of my preceptor as one who has sat down here observing the Praya vow. A destroyer of my family, I must do so in order that I may not be born again in any of other orders of being.

source: वासुदेवो रथात् तूर्णमवतीर्य महाद्युतिः। मोचयामास तुरगान् विनुन्नान् कङ्कपत्रिभिः॥
target: The highly effulgent son of Vasudeva descending down quickly from the chariot unharnessed the horses lacerated with arrows furnished with wings of the Kanka feathers.

source: अमर्षवशमापन्नो मा कुरूंस्तात जीघनः। एषा हि पृथिवी कृत्स्ना मा गमत् त्वत्कृते वधम्॥
target: Being subject to the influence of wrath, do not, my dear son, slay the Kurus; let not this entire earth be massacred on account of your doings.

source: शतं क्रतूनामाहृत्य देवराट् त्रिदिवं गतः। तपांस्युग्राणि चास्थाय दिवं प्राप्ता महर्षयः॥
target: Having acquired the appellation of Satakratu, the sovereign of the celestials has gone to heaven; and, having performed rigid austerities, the Maharșis have attained the celestial regions.'

source: राघवोऽपि प्रियभ्रात्रे लक्ष्मणाय यशस्विने। ऋषिभ्यो लक्ष्मणेनोक्तमरण्ये वसता प्रभो॥
target: Rama of Raghu's race gave it to his dear and illustrious brother Lakshmana. While living in the forest, Lakshmana imparted it to the Rishis.

source: विलासिनीभिरत्यर्थं नृत्यन्तीभिः समन्ततः। वायुनाधूयमानाभिः पताकाभिरलंकृतम्॥
target: And beautiful with coquettish damsels dancing around and ornamented with flags fluttered by the wind.

source: तत्र चानीयमाने तु विप्रे तस्मिन् महात्मनि । ववर्ष सहसा देवो जगत् प्रह्लादयंस्तदा॥
target: When that great-souled Vipra had been brought over, the god, Indra, suddenly poured forth plenteous showers, enlivening the spirits of men.

source: दृष्ट्वा तु मुख्यावथ युध्यमानौ दिद्दक्षवः शूरवरावरिघ्नौ॥ कर्ण च पार्थ च विलोकयन्तः खस्था महीस्थाश्च जनावतस्थुः।
target: All the gods in heaven and persons of the earth, checking the animals they were riding upon, waited calmly to see the issue of the fight between those great heroes, Karna and Partha, who were the choicest of warriors and scorchers of enemies.

source: शृण्वतां पार्थिवेन्द्राणामन्येषां चैव सर्वशः। वासुदेवमभिप्रेक्ष्य धर्मराजं च पाण्डवम्॥
target: And in the hearing of those chief among the rulers of the earth, and all others who were there and with his eyes on Vasudeva and on the virtuous king the son of Pandu,

source: वाग्भिश्च भगवान् येन देवसेनाग्रगः प्रभुः। स्तुतः प्रीतमनाश्चासीच्छापाञ्चैनममुञ्चत॥ ध्रुवस्यौत्तानपादस्य ब्रह्मर्षीणां तथैव च। मध्यं ज्वलति यो नित्यमुदीचीमाश्रितो दिशम्॥
target: He prayed to the glorious and powerful Indra who was pleased with him and freed him from a curse. Remaining on the northern side of the sky, he sheds his lustre from a position in the midst of the seven twiceborn Rishis, and Dhruva the son of Uttanpada.

source: भीमसेनं पुरस्कृत्य दुर्योधनमुपाद्रवन्। नानाविधानि शस्त्राणि विसृजन्तो जये धृताः॥
target: Placing Bhimasena at their head, are rushing at Duryodhana, hurling diverse kinds of weapons, determined to secure success,

source: तस्येमानात्मजान् देहं भार्यां च सुमहात्मनः। स्वराष्ट्रं गृह्य गच्छामो धर्म एष हि नः स्मृतः॥
target: It is now our duty to go to his kingdom with these his sons, his body (unburnt portion) and his wife.

source: रथैरनेकसाहस्रैः समन्तात् पर्यवारयत्। ततः प्रववृते युद्धमर्जुनस्य परैः सह॥
target: Surrounded them on all sides with many thousand chariots. Then ensured a fierce battle between Arjuna and his opponents.

source: तच्चाप्यपहरिष्यामि सव्यसाचिन्युपागते। यच्च ते मानसं वीर तीर्थयात्रामिमां प्रति। स महर्षिर्लोमशस्ते कथयिष्यत्यसंशयम्॥
target: Will be dispelled when Savyasachi (Arjuna) would come here from heaven. O Hero and as regards your desire to go to visit the Tirthas, the great Rishi Lomasha will no doubt speak to you.

source: ततोऽन्तरिक्षे साक्षेपा विवादा भरतर्षभ। मिथो भेदाश्च भूतानामासन् कर्णार्जुनान्तरे॥
target: O most powerful of the Bharata race, the inhabitants of the skies different in opinion and angry disputes were going on amongst them as to whether Karna or Arjuna would be victorious.

source: इदं राज्यमहं चैव भरतश्च सलक्ष्मणः। आयत्तास्त्वं हि नो राजन्गतिश्च पुरुषर्षभ।९।।
target: O king, this kingdom, myself, Bharat and Lakşmaņa are all at your disposal.

source: अपध्याता च विप्रेण न्यपतद् धरणीतले। बलाकां पतितां दृष्ट्वा गतसत्त्वामचेतनाम्॥
target: Having been injured by the Brahmana, the crane fell down upon the ground; and as she fell, the Brahmana, seeing her insensible and lifeless,

source: तामस्य विशिखैस्तूर्णं पातयामास भारत। रथादनवरूढस्य तदद्भूतमिवाभवत्॥
target: But, O descendant of Bharata, before he could come down from his car, Drona cut down his mace into may fragments. It was a wonderful feat.

source: शब्दः श्रोत्रं तथा स्वानि त्रयमाकाशयोनिजम्। वायोः स्पर्शस्तथा चेष्टा त्वक् चैव त्रितयं स्मृतम्॥
target: Sound, the organ of hearing, and all holes,-these three, originate from Space Touch, action, and skin are the three-fold attributes of the Wind.

source: अदातृभ्यो हरेद् वित्तं विख्याप्य नृपतिः सदा। तथैवाचरतो धर्मो नृपते: स्यादथाखिलः॥
target: The king should, always, publicly take away the wealth of a person who does not perform charities. By acting in this wise the King acquires great merit.

source: पितुस्त्वमेव मे गत्वा शीघ्रमाचक्ष्व राघव॥ न त्वामनुदहेत् क्रुद्धो वनमग्निरिवैधितः।
target: Do you, O descendant of Raghu, yourself going to my father, speedily inform of him this that has occurred. But take care that like a fire waxing furious consuming a woods, he in his ire do not burn you.

source: भवत्या गूढमन्त्रत्वात् पीडितोऽस्मीत्युवाच ताम्॥ शशाप च महातेजाः सर्वलोकेषु योषितः। न गुह्यं धारयिष्यन्तीत्येवं दुःखसमन्वितः॥
target: 'For you having concealed your counsels, this great calamity has befallen me.' The highly energetic and the righteous king then, in sorrow, cursed all the women of the world, saying,-'Henceforth no woman shall succeed in keeping a secret."

source: सर्वाः सेना निवेश्यन्तां वेलायां हरिपुङ्गव। संप्राप्तो मन्त्रकालो नः सागरस्येह लङ्घने॥
target: O foremost of monkeys, do you encamp your host on the bring of the ocean. Now has arrived the hour for counsel, when we should devise some plan for crossing over the main.

source: तमुवाच भृगुश्रेष्ठः सरोषः प्रदहन्निवा भूमौ निपतितं दीनं वेपमानं कृताञ्जलिम्॥ यस्मान्मिथ्योपचरितो ह्यस्त्रलोभादिह त्वया। तस्मादेतन ते मूढ ब्रह्मास्त्रं प्रतिभास्यति॥
target: Unto the cheerless and trembling Karna, that foremost one of Bhrigu's race, smiling though angry, said to the cheerless and trembling Karna who was lying on Earth with joined hands, since you have from avarice of weapons, behaved here falsely, therefore, O wretch, this Brahma weapon shall not remain in your remembrance.

source: एवं सर्वेषु कार्येषु विमृश्य पुरुषस्ततः। चिरेण निश्चयं कृत्वा चिरं न परितप्यते॥
target: In all deeds a man should, in this wise, think for a long time and then settle what he should do. By acting thus one is sure to avoid grief for a long time.

source: ते पृष्टास्तु वदेयुर्यच्छ्रेयो नः समनन्तरम्॥ तदस्माभिः पुनः कार्यमिति मे नैष्ठिकी मतिः।
target: Asked by us, they will advice us regarding our good. We should do what they say, this is my resolution.

source: यत्नाच्चोपचरेदेनमग्निवद् देववत् त्विह। अनृतेनोपचीर्णो हि हन्यादेव न संशयः॥
target: In this world a king should be carefully served like the fire-god or any other deity; one that plays false to the king is killed by him; this admits of no doubt.

source: नाना चित्राः कथाश्चान्या विश्वामित्रसहायने। जानक्याश्च विवाहं च धनुषश्च विभेदनम्॥ रामरामविवादं च गुणान् दाशरथेस्तथा। तथाभिषेकं रामस्य कैकेय्या दुष्टभावताम्॥ विघातं चाभिषेकय रामस्य च विवासनम्। राज्ञः शोकं विलापं च परलोकस्य चाश्रयम् ॥ प्रकृतीनां विषादं च प्रकृतीनां विसर्जनम्। निषादाधिपसंवादं सूतोपावर्तनं तथा॥
target: And the wonderful converse he had with Visvāmitra; wedding of Janaka's daughter; and breaking the bow; the hostilities of Rāma with Rāma (Paraśurāma); and the noble qualities of Dasaratha's son: and Rama's installation; and the enmity of Kaikeyī; and the obstacle in the way of the installation; and the exile of Rāma; and the kings grief, lamentations, and departure for the other regions; and the grief of the subjects, and their dismissal (by Rāma to Ayodhyā); and the tidings of the lord of Nişādas, and the charioteer's return.

source: एते ते शैलराजस्य सुते लोकनमस्कृते। गङ्गा च सरितां श्रेष्ठा उमादेवी च राघव॥
target: And these, O Rāghava, are the daughters of that king of mountains, worshipped of all, viz, Gangā, the foremost of streams, and the divine Uma.

source: भीष्म उवाच ह्रीनिषेवास्तथा दान्ताः सत्यार्जवसमन्विताः। शक्ताः कथयितुं सम्यक् ते तव स्युः सभासदः॥
target: Bhishma said Such persons as are endued with modesty, self-control, truth, sincerity, and courage to say the proper thing, should be your law-makers.

source: यदर्थं मां प्राहिणोत् त्वत्सकाशं बृहस्पतिं परिदातुं मरुत्ते। अयं गुरुर्याजयतां नृप त्वां मर्यं सन्तममरं त्वां करोतु॥
target: And the object for which he has sent me to you is to present Brihaspati to Marutta; O prince, let this priest perform your sacrifice, and make you who are only a mortal, attain immortality.

source: अथ मौर्वीस्वनं कृत्वा भगवान्भूतभावनः। मालिनं प्रति बाणौघान्ससर्जासिगदाधरः॥
target: Then that creator of all beings, the reverend Gadādhara,* twanging his bow-string, showered volleys of shafts on Máli. *Lit. the holder of the mace, a name of Visnu.

source: ततः सरथनागाश्वा: समकम्पन्त सुंजयाः। मृत्योरास्यमनुप्राप्तं मेनिरे च युधिष्ठिरम्॥
target: Then the Srinjayas with their cars, elephants and steeds, began to quake (with inside the jaws of Death.

source: तांस्तु भल्लैर्महावेगैर्दशभिर्दश भारतान्॥ रुक्माङ्गदान रुक्मपुङ्खैः पार्थो निन्ये यमक्षयम्।
target: O Bharata, Vrikodara, of the line of Pritha, then with ten gold-winged and flat edged shafts, sent those ten princes of the line of Bharata, whose wrists were adorned with gold bracelets, very quickly to the region of Pluto.

source: अवर्षति च पर्जन्ये सर्वभूतानि भूतकृत्। वसिष्ठो जीवयामास प्रजापतिरिव प्रजाः॥
target: Once when the clouds ceased to pour, Vashishtha, resembling Brahman himself, kept alive all creatures like Prajapati (by his power and kindness).

source: उपधार्य मतं तेषां बुधानां धर्मदर्शिनाम्। नियच्छ परया बुद्ध्या चित्तमुत्पथगामि वै॥
target: Do you act according to the instructions received from those wise men whose eyes are set upon virtue. With understanding purified by such instructions and made superior, do you then control your heart which is ever ready to deviate from the right course.

source: तक्षकः संहतविषो लोके यास्यति हास्यताम्। विचिन्त्यैवं कृता तेन ध्रुवं तुष्टिर्द्विजस्य वै॥
target: "All the world will laugh at me saying, Takshaka had no poison any longer.” Certainly having thought so, he gratified the Brahmana.

source: रहस्यमद्भुतं चैव ज्ञानं विज्ञानमारोग्यं रूपं सम्पत् तथैव च। सौभाग्यं चैव तपसा प्राप्यते भरतर्षभ।॥
target: By penances one acquires knowledge, science, health and freedom from disease, beauty of person, prosperity and blessedness, O chief of Bharata's race.

source: स भीमसेने निष्क्रान्ते मृगयार्थमरिन्दम। घटोत्कचं सानुचरं दृष्ट्वा विप्रद्रुतं दिशः॥
target: When that chastiser of foes, Bhimasena, went out hunting and when he (Jatasura) saw that Ghatotkacha and his followers were scattered in all directions,

source: व्याधिमिच्छामि ते ज्ञातुं प्रतिकुर्यां हि तत्र वै। एवमुक्तः स पुत्रेण शान्तनुः प्रत्यभाषत॥
target: I wish to know the disease from which you suffer, so that I may try to get a remedy." Having been thus addressed by his son, Shantanu replied,

source: रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा हर्षपौरुषवर्धनम्। सुग्रीवः पूजयांचक्रे राघवं प्रशशंस च॥
target: Hearing Rāma's words capable of enhancing joy and manliness, Sugrīva highly honoured the former and extolled him, saying.

source: अपि वर्णावकृष्टस्तु नारी वा धर्मकाङ्क्षिणी। तावण्येतेन मार्गेण गच्छेतां परमां गतिम्॥
target: By following the path indicated above, even a person of an inferior caste, or a woman, will surely acquire the highest end.

source: तत्राश्रमपदं रम्यं मृगद्विजनिषेवितम्। तत्राश्रमपदे रम्ये बकं पश्यति देवराट्॥
target: It was a charming hermitage frequented by beasts and birds. The king of the celestials saw in that charming hermitage Baka.

source: एष्टव्या बहवः पुत्रा यद्येकोऽपि गयां व्रजेत्। यजेत वाश्वमेधेन नीलं वा वृषमुत्सृजेत्॥
target: One should desire for many sons, so that one may go to Gaya or perform Ashvamedha or offer a Nila bull.

source: हूयमाने भृशं दीप्तं विधिवद्वसुरेतसि। न स्म स प्राप तद्वन्हौ तक्षको भयपीडितः॥
target: For Takshaka, though benumbed with fear, did not at once fall into the fire, although libations were poured into the blazing sacrificial fire in his name and in the proper form.

source: तथा भीमो गजानीकं गदया समकालयत्॥ गदया वध्यमानास्ते मार्गणैश्च समन्ततः।
target: So Bhima belaboured the elephants division with his mace. smitten by that mace, as also by means of arrows on all sides,

source: निर्द्वन्द्वां निर्नमस्कारा निराशीर्बधना बुधाः। विमुक्ताः सर्वपापेभ्यश्चरन्ति शुचयोऽमला:॥
target: They are freed from the influence of all pairs of opposites. They never offer their salutation to anything or to any creature. They are above all the fetters of want. Wisdom is theirs. They are purged of every sin. Pure and stainless they live rove about.

source: यस्य भृत्याश्च दासाश्च मृष्टान्यन्नानि भुञ्जते। कथं स भोक्ष्यते रामो वने मूलफलान्ययम्॥
target: How shall that Rāma live upon fruits and roots, whose servants and attendants fare on well cooked rice?

source: सहदेवस्तौ राजन् नाराचेन तवात्मजम्। विद्ध्वा विव्याध सप्तत्या सारथिं च त्रिभिः शरै॥
target: Then, O monarch, Shahadeva, after having first pierced your son, again struck him with seventy shafts, as well as his charioteer with threc others.

source: अथेमं दर्शनोपायं सम्यग् यो वेत्ति मानवः। सम्यक् स्वधर्मं कृत्वेह परत्र सुखमश्नुते॥
target: That man who is well conversant with the means of acquiring Liberation and who duly satisfies the duties of his order, certainly acquires great happiness in the next world.

source: ततोऽर्जुनो भीष्ममपास्य युद्धे विद्ध्वास्य यन्तारमरिष्टधन्वा। न्मेधं विदार्येव सहस्ररश्मिः॥
target: Arjuna with his mighty bow left Bhishma on battle-field, shot hard his charioteer with acute arrows and thus, came out safely from the circle of chariots. He graced like sun god shining after the clouds shattered.

source: पतिहि देवता नार्याः पतिर्बन्धुः पतिर्गुरुः॥ प्राणैरपि प्रियं तस्माद्भर्तुः कार्य विशेषतः।
target: Husband is a woman's god-her friend and spiritual guide. It is proper therefore to wok out husband's well-being even at the sacrifice of life.

source: दृश्यन्ते शैलशृङ्गेषु पार्थ किम्पुरुषैः सह। गीतानां समतालानां तथा साम्नां च निःस्वनः॥
target: And accompanied by the Kimpurushas, O Partha, are seen on the summits of the mountain. Songs exactly keeping time and also the chanting of the Samaveda,

source: उच्चैःश्रवाः सोऽश्वराजो यन्मिथ्या न कृतो मम। विनतार्थाय पणिते दासभावाय पुत्रकाः॥ जनमेजयस्य वो यज्ञे धक्ष्यत्यनिलसारथिः। तत्र पञ्चत्वमापन्नाः प्रेतलोकं गमिष्यथ॥
target: Addressing her sons she said, “As you have refused to to change the colour of Uchchaishrava, the king of horses, thus making me a slave to Vinata according to the wager, the god of fire will consume you all in the sacrifice of Janamejaya. Thus being killed, you will go to the land of the dead.

source: अभिवाद्य तथैवाहं रथमारुह्य भारत। युयुत्सुर्जामदग्न्यस्य प्रमुखे वीतभी: स्थितः॥
target: Having bowed down to him I got on it again and desirous of fight stood before Jamadgna, past the reach of fear.

source: तस्यास्तदद्भुतप्रख्यं श्रुत्वा हर्षमुपागतः। स वै कामी सह तया रेमे चन्द्रमसः सुतः॥
target: Hearing those wondrous words, the son of moon, possessed by lust, began to live with her.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच गच्छन् स तीर्थानि महानुभावः पुण्यानि रम्याणि ददर्श राजा। सर्वाणि विप्रैरुपशोभितानि क्वचित् क्वचिद् भारत सागरस्य॥
target: Vaishampayana said : That magnanimous king then went to many sacred places and to various spots on the seashore, all adorned with the presence of Brahmanas. (He went to many) charming Tirthas and saw them.

source: कृतं हनूमता कार्यं सुमहद्भुवि दुर्लभम्। मनसाऽपि यदन्येन न शक्यं धरणीतले॥
target: By Hanumān has been performed a very great deed, rare on earth, and one incapable of being even conceived by any other in the world.

source: एकीभूतास्ततः सर्वे कालपर्यायचोदिताः। भोजान्धका महाराज शैनेयं पर्यवारयन्॥
target: At that time, however, O king, the Bhojas and Andhakas moved by the perverseness of the hour that had come upon them, all became as one man and surrounded the son of Shini.

source: शास्त्राल्लोकाच्च यो बुद्धः सर्वं पश्यति मानवः। असारमिव मानुष्यं सर्वथा मुक्त एव सः॥
target: That man who, enlightened by the scriptures and the experience of the world sees every human concern in this world to be unreal, becomes liberated.

source: श्रुत्वा तु स दशग्रीवस्तं शापं रोमहर्षणम्॥ नारीषु मैथुनीभावं नाकामास्वभ्यरोचयत्। तेन नीताः स्त्रियः प्रीतिमापुः सर्वाः पतिव्रताः। नलकूबरनिर्मुक्तं शापं श्रुत्वा मन:प्रियम्॥
target: Hearing of that curse capable of making the down erect, Daśagrīva abstained from entertaining lust for unwilling females. And hearing of the curse imprecated by Nalakübara all the chaste damsels, that were kept captive, attained to great delight.

source: वृणीष्व च वरं भीरु यं त्वमिच्छसि भाविनि। वृथा हि न प्रसादो मे भूतपूर्वः शुचिस्मिते॥
target: O timid girl, O beauteous maiden, ask from me any boon you desire to have. O beauty of sweet smiles, my favour (boon) has never proved fruitless."

source: ऋषयस्तं प्रशंसन्ति साधु चैतदसंशयम्। सर्वथा सर्वदा वर्णैर्यष्टव्यमिति निर्णयः॥
target: The Rishis speak highly of such a man. Forsooth they are right. This then is the conclusion that all the castes should always and by every means in their power celebrate sacrifices.

source: कृतवर्मणा नृशंसेन गौतमेन कृपेण च। अश्वत्थाम्ना च पापे हतं वः शिविरं निशि॥
target: During the night, O king, your camp has been exterminated by the cruel Kritavarman, and Kripa the son of Gotama, and the sinful Ashvatthaman.

source: सुपर्ण इति विख्यातस्तस्मादवरजस्तु यः। कालकीर्तिरिति ख्यातः पृथिव्यां सोऽभवनृपः॥
target: That Asura who was the younger brother of Mayura and who was known as Suparna, became king Kalakirti on earth.

source: अश्वत्थामोवाच यदर्जुनगुणांस्तथ्यान् कीर्तयानं नराधम। शूरं द्वेषात् सुदुर्बुद्धे त्वं भर्ल्सयसि मातुलम्॥
target: Ashvatthama said O basest of men, in spite of his speaking of the qualities that Arjuna is really endowed with, you, that understanding, have insulted my heroic maternal uncle through (sheer) malice.

source: शूराणां युध्यमानानां निजतामितरेतरम्। अभिमन्योः परेषां च नासीत् कश्चित् पराङ्मुखः॥
target: None among those heroes, viz., Abhimanyu on one side and all your warriors on the other, who were then fighting with and slaying one another, turned away from the field of battle.

source: प्रकालयेद् दिशः सर्वाः प्रतोदेनेव सारथिः। प्रत्यमित्रश्रियं दीप्तां जिघृक्षुर्भरतर्षभ।॥
target: O best of the Bharata race, he, who is desirous of securing the blazing prosperity of his enemy, should bring all directions under his subjection, as the charioteer does his steeds with his whip.

source: एवमेते महोत्पाताः प्रादुरासन् दुरासदाः। भरतानामभावाय राजन् दुर्मन्त्रिते तव॥
target: O king, thus extraordinary and fearful protents were seen and heard, indicating the destruction of the Bharata race the consequence of your evil counsels;

source: दैवमेव परं मन्ये पौरुषं च निरर्थकम्। दृष्ट्वा कुन्तीसुते शुद्धां श्रियं तामहतां तथा॥
target: Seeing the great and serene prosperity of the son of Kunti, I consider Fate to be supreme and exertion useless.

target: Yadu and other sons did not agree to take upon them his old age. Thereupon, his youngest son, the virtuous and powerful Puru said-"O king, enjoy again with a renovated body and returned youth. I shall take upon me your old age and I shall rule the kingdom at your command."

source: रविस्तु संतापयते लोकान् रश्मिभिरुल्बणैः। सर्वतस्तेज आदत्ते नित्यमक्षयमण्डलः॥ अतो मे रोचते गन्तुमादित्यं दीप्ततेजसम्।
target: The Sun warms all the worlds by means of his rays. His disc never suffers any diminution. Remaining unchanged, he drinks energy from all things. Hence, I wish to go into the Sun of blazing effulgence.

source: रुधिरं न व्यतिक्रामद् दन्तोष्ठं मेऽम्ब मा शुचः। वैवस्वतस्तु तद् वेद हस्तौ मे रुधिरोक्षितौ॥
target: The blood, however, did not, O mother, pass down my lips and teeth. Karna knew this well. My hands only were covered with Dussasana's blood.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच अन्तर्हितानि भूतानि बलवन्ति महान्ति च। अग्निना तपसा चैव शक्यं गन्तुं वृकोदर।॥
target: Yudhishthira said: O Vrikodara, there are in this place, many invisible beings who are all powerful and huge. We shall however be able to pass through them by the merit of our Agnihotra and asceticism.

source: तमापतन्तं सम्प्रेक्ष्य राजानं प्रति वेगितम्। अभ्यधावञ्जिघांसन्तस्तावका युद्धदुर्मदाः॥
target: Beholding him make towards the king with impetuosity, your warriors, all invincible in battle, rushed at him, desirous of doing away with him.

source: ग्रहस्यातिबलस्याङ्गे वरदत्तस्य धीमतः। न शस्राणि वहन्त्यङ्गे चक्रवज्रशतान्यपि॥
target: Hundreds of Chakras like you and thunderbolts like that of Shakra, could not inflict a scratch on the body of that evil planet gifted with great might, who had acquired a boon from Mahadeva.

source: प्रभावैरन्वितास्तैस्तैः पार्थिवेन्द्राः सहस्रशः। ये गताः पृथिवींत्यत्वा इति ज्ञात्वा विमुच्यते॥
target: That man who knows that thousands of kings possessed of even great power have dies, succeeds in becoming liberated.

source: मनुष्या जगति श्रेष्ठाः पक्षिणां पतगेश्वरः। सरितां सागरः श्रेष्ठो गौर्वरिष्ठा चतुष्पदाम्॥
target: Among all human wielders of bows, you are unrivaled; you are the foremost of all men. As man is the foremost of all created beings of this world, as Garuda is the chief of all winged creatures,

source: राजपिण्डभयादेते यदि हास्यन्ति जीवितम्। न हि शक्ष्यन्ति राजानं युधिष्ठिरमुदीक्षितुम्॥
target: If foe the fear of losing the maintenance they get from the king, they can think lightly of their very lives, they will yet not be able to see the king Yudhishthira with (angry) eyes.

source: प्रकृतिं चाप्यतिक्रम्य गच्छत्यात्मानमव्ययम्। परं नारायणात्मानं निर्द्वन्द्वं प्रकृतेः परम्॥
target: When the individual Soul, transcends Prakriti, it acquires Brahma that is changeless, that is highest, that is Narayana that is beyond all pairs of opposites, and that is above Nature.

source: तावन तस्य सुकृतं किंचित्कार्ये कदाचन। मन्यन्ते सन्तमात्मानमसन्तमपि विश्रुतम्॥
target: Bad people, asked by honest ones to do something for them, consider themselves as honest after doing very doing very little of that, even though they are well-known to be dishonest.

source: दण्डनीतिः स्वधर्मेण चातुर्वर्ण्य नियच्छति। प्रयुक्ता स्वामिना सम्यगधर्मेभ्यश्च यच्छति॥
target: The penal code enforced by Lord in a proper way makes the four orders lead lives in their own proper spheres and makes the king himself earn virtue, desire and salvation.

source: के तं यान्तमनुप्राप्ता के वास्यासन् पुरोगमाः। केऽतिष्ठन् के न्यवर्तन्त केऽन्ववर्तन्त संजय॥
target: When he advanced who followed him and who went in front? Who stood by his side and who advanced with him?

source: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे घोरा राक्षसी कामरूपिणी॥ सहसा पतिता भूमौ भगिनी रावणस्य सा।
target: In the interval, Ravana sister, a dreadful and grim visaged she-demon suddenly fell down on the ground.

source: द्रोणो द्रौणिः कृपः कर्णः कृतवर्मा च सौबलः। बृहद्बलो मद्रराजो भूरिभूरिश्रवाः शलः॥ पौरवो वृषसेनश्च विसृजन्तः शिताञ्छरान्। सौभद्रं शरवर्षेण महता समवाकिरन्॥
target: Drona and Drona's son, Kripa, Karna, Kritavarman and Subala's son, Brihadbala, the ruler of the Madras, Bhuri, Bhurishravas and Shala, Paurava and Vrishasena, all shooting sharp arrows, covered Subhadra's son with thick downpour of arrows.

source: दृष्ट्वा च त्वां सूर्यपथात् पतन्तं वैश्वानरार्कातिभप्रमेयम्। किं नु स्विदेतत् पततीति सर्वे वितर्कयन्तः परिमोहिताः स्मः॥
target: Seeing you fall from the region of the sun, as effulgent as the fire or the sun, all men are asking themselves, "What is this that falls?" They are deprived of their consciousness.

source: सर्वेषामिति दानानां तिलदानं विशिष्यते। अक्षयं सर्वदानानां तिलदानमिहोच्यते॥
target: The gift of sesame seeds is superior to all gifts. Amongst all gifts, the gift of sesame is considered as yielding unending merit.

source: तेजोवीर्यबलोपेता महाबलपराक्रमाः। घटोत्कचस्तु स्वं नागं चोदयामास तं तदा॥
target: And they were endued with prowess strength and might and great fleetness and courage. Then Ghatotkacha goaded his own elephants in battle,

source: अत्र सर्वे महाराज त्यक्त्वा जीवितमात्मनः॥ सैन्धवस्य रणे रक्षा विधिवत् कर्तुमर्हथ।
target: For these reasons, O mighty monarch, it behoves us all to effect the protection of the Sindhu king at the very cost of our own lives.

source: यावन्न चरते मार्गान् पृतनामभिधर्षयन्। भीमसेनो गदापाणिस्तावत् संशाम्य पाण्डवैः॥
target: Let there be peace with Pandavas so long as Bhimasena, with the mace in his hands, does not come this way vanquishing his opponents.

source: ये चान्ये पृथिवीपाला येषां नास्ति सुहृज्जनः॥ उद्दिश्योद्दिश्य तेषां च चक्रे राजौर्ध्वदेहिकम्।
target: The king performed the Shraddha rite for the good, in the next world, of every one of those kings also who had been killed in the battle without a single excepted kinsman or friend.

source: समीराणस्तांश्च निषेव्य गन्धान् सिषेव सर्वानपि योधमुख्यान्। निषेव्यमाणास्तवनिलेन योधाः परस्परांना धरणी निपेतुः॥
target: The wind used to collect those perfumes and carry it to the great warriors for their pleasure. The warriors so served by wind laid on ground by killing one another.

source: तस्मिन रथे निहते पाण्डवस्य क्षिप्रं च खड्ने विशिखैर्निकृत। स्ततो न्यनशरवषैरुपेत्य॥
target: When that chariot of Nakula the son of Pandu was destroyed and his sword was cut-off by arrows, other warriors on the part of Kauravas organised and started hitting them by volley of arrows.

source: तद्वत्से ब्रूहि वत्सं स्वं कुमारं वृद्धसंमतम्। ममाद्य त्वं सभृत्यस्य मोक्षार्थं वेदवित्तमम्॥
target: Therefore, O sister, ask your dear son, who is exceedingly learned in the Vedas and respected even by the old, to protect me and those dependent on me.

source: हित्वा प्रासादनिलयं शुभानि शयनानि च। अरण्यनित्यः सततं बभूव मृगयापरः॥
target: He left his excellent palace and its luxurious bed. He lived always in the forest, being ever engaged in hunting.

source: ब्रह्मर्षयो भवन्त्यत्र तथा देवर्षयोऽपरे। क्रव्यादाश्च तथैवान्ये गन्धर्वाश्च महाबलाः॥ उपासते महात्मानं तस्यां धनदमीश्वरम्। भगवान् भूतसङ्घश्च वृतः शतसहस्रशः॥ उमापतिः पशुपतिः शूलभृद् भगनेत्रहा। त्र्यम्बको राजशार्दूल देवी च विगतक्लमा॥ वामनैर्विकटैः कुब्जैः क्षतजाक्षमहारवैः। मेदोमांसाशनैरुप्रैरुग्रधन्वा महाबलः॥ नानाप्रहरणैस्त्रैर्वातैरिव महाजवैः। वृतः सखायमन्वास्ते सदैव धनदं नृप॥
target: Many Brahmana Rishis and many celestials Rishis always go there; many Rakshasas and Gandharvas, besides those already mentioned, wait in that assembly-hall upon the illustrious lord of wealth, O best of kings, there wait upon his friend the lord of wealth, being ever cheerful and knowing no fatigue, the illustrious (deity), the husband of Uma, the lord of all creatures, the three-eyed Col, the wielder of trident, the slayer of Asura Bhaganetra, the mighty deity of fearful bow, accompanied by his wife and surrounded by hundreds and thousands of spirits, some, some of dwarfish stature, some of fearful face, some hunch-backed, some with blood-red eyes, some of fearful yells, some feeding upon fat and flesh, some fearful to look at, and all armed with various weapons and possessed of the speed of wind.

source: यावानर्थ उदपाने सर्वतः सम्प्लुतोदके। तावान् सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानतः॥
target: The (water of the) small tank serves the same purposes as (that of) the great lake. Like the above, the Brahmana, learned in devotion, serves the same purposes as those of all the Vedas.

source: प्रमोदने श्वापदपक्षिरक्षसां जनक्षये वर्तति तत्र दारुणे। महाबलास्ते कुपिताः परस्परं निषूदयन्तः प्रविचेरुरोजसा॥
target: When that dreadful destruction of beings went on enhancing the joys of beasts and birds of prey and cannibals, mighty heroes, inflamed with wrath, coursed over the field of battle smiting one another with impetuosity.

source: तपस्वी नियताहारः शममास्थाय वाग्यतः॥ दीर्घकालं हिमवति गङ्गायाश्च दुरुत्सहाम्। मूर्धा धारां महादेवः शिरसा यामधारयत्। न तेनाप्यहमागच्छं फलेनेह पितामह॥
target: Indeed, I gave these thrice to each Brahmana obscrvant of penances, living on regulated dict, adopting tranquillity of soul, and controlling speech, I lived for a long time on the breast of Himavat by the side of that Ganga whose irresistible current was borne by Mahadeva on his head. It is not through the merit of these deeds, O grandfather, that I have acquired this region.

source: कन्योवाच अहं प्रजापतेः कन्या देवसेनेति विश्रुता। भगिनी दैत्यसेना मे सा पूर्वं केशिना हृता॥
target: The lady said : I am the daughter of Prajapati; I am called Devsena. My sister Daityasena has already been carried away by Keshin.

source: पूर्णे च दशमे मासि पुत्रोऽस्य परमाद्भतुतः। रुक्मिण्यां सम्मतो यज्ञे शूरो वंशधरः प्रभो॥
target: His wife Rukmini conceived, and on the expiration of the tenth month a son was born of her, gifted with heroism and honoured by all for his highly wonderful accomplishments.

source: संगृहीतजनोऽस्तब्धः प्रसन्नवदनः सदा। सदा भृत्यजनापेक्षी न क्रोधी सुमहामनाः॥
target: Avoiding idleness, he should always win over men by doing them good. He should always be cheerful in appearance. He should always look to the wants of his servants and never yield to anger. He should should be magnanimous.

source: सहस्रिणोऽपि जीवन्ति जीवन्ति शतिनस्तथा। धृतराष्ट्र विमुञ्चेच्छां न कथञ्चिन्न जीव्यते॥
target: Life is real to those who have thousands (of anything or everything); life is also real to those (in a small measure) who have hundreds. 0 Dhritarashtra, renounce this (excessive) desire; there is none who cannot live by some means or other.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच ततः सहैव कन्याभिद्रौपदी राजवेश्म तत्। प्रविवेश सुदेष्णायाः समीपमुपगामिनी॥
target: Then accompanied by those girls Draupadi entered the palace with a view to appear before Sudeshna.

source: द्रौपदी चान्वयाच्छ्वधू विषण्णवदना तदा। वनवासाय गच्छन्ती रुदती भद्रया सह॥
target: Then Draupadi, with a cheerless face, accompanied by Subhadra, followed her weeping mother-in-law who was proceeding on from desire of going into the forest.

source: पुत्रो भ्राता पिता चैव स्वस्रीयो मातुलस्तथा। सम्बन्धिबान्धवाश्चैव योद्ध्या वै क्षत्रजीविना॥
target: He who follows Kshatriya practices, fights with son, father, brother, sister son and maternal uncle and relatives and kinsmen.

source: वेदाध्यायी गोषु यो भक्तिमांश्च नित्यं दत्त्वा योऽभिनन्देत गाश्च। आजातितो यश्च गवां नमेत इदं फलं शक्र निबोध तस्य॥
target: Hear, O Shakra, what the merit is of that person who, duly studying the Vedas, shows respect for kine, who always becomes glad on seeing kine, and who since his birth always bows his head to kine.

source: सर्वेषां चैवसैन्यानां कर्णमेवागमन्मनः। सूतपुत्रं महेष्वासं बन्धुमात्यकिकेष्विव॥
target: As also the hearts of all the troops turned towards Karna, who was the son of the charioteer and who, again was a great bowman, even as the heart of a person always turns towards his friends, whilst he falls in some great danger.

source: प्रजज्वाल रणे पार्थो विधूम इव पावकः। तथैव शरवर्षेण भास्करो रश्मिवानिव॥
target: Partha then blazed forth in battle like fire without even one curl of smoke. He then, in consequence of his pouring arrows showers, looked like the sun scattering his myriad rays in all directions.

source: हत्वा तु तं भीमबलं विराधं राक्षसं वने। ततः सीतां परिष्वज्य समाश्वास्य च वीर्यवान्॥ अब्रवीद् भ्रातरं रामो लक्ष्मणं दीप्ततेजसम्। कष्टं वनमिदं दुर्गं न च स्मो वनगोचराः॥ अभिगच्छामहे शीघ्रं शरभङ्गं तपोधनम्। आश्रमं शरभङ्गस्य राघवोऽभिजगाम ह॥
target: Having in the forest slain the Rākṣasa Virādha possessed of tremendous strength, Rāma endued with prowess, embracing and cheering Sītā, spoke to his brother Lakşınaņa of flaming energy, saying, This dense forest is hard to live in; nor are reacquainted with the was of the wood. Therefore will we speedily repair to the ascetic Sarabhanga. Thereupon Rāghava set out for the hermitage of Sarabhanga.

source: तत् सागरमिवोधुतं रजसा संवृत्तं बलम्॥ विदार्य पाण्डवैः क्रुद्धस्त्वया गुप्तैर्हतं बिभो।
target: O puissant one, the hostile troops shrouded with dust looked like a surging sea and the infuriated Pandavas, forcing their way amongst them, threw them over-board.

source: ततः कथायां कस्यांचिद्राघवः समभाषत। काः कथा नगरे भद्र वर्तन्ते विषयेषु च॥ मामाश्रितानि कान्याहुः पौरजानपदा जनाः। किं च सीतां समाश्रित्य भरतं किं च लक्ष्मणम्॥५ किं नु शत्रुघ्नमुद्दिश्य कैकेयीं किं नु मातरम्। वक्तव्यतां च राजानो वने राज्ये व्रजन्ति च॥
target: Thereupon Räma incidentally addressed them saying, “O Bhadra, how do the inhabitants of the city and provinces talk about Sītā, Bharata, Laksmana, Satrughna and the mother Kaikeyi? The kings, when they deviate from the paths of justice, become objects of censure in the houses of men and even in the forests as well.”

source: एवमेष क्षयोः वृत्तः कुरुपाण्डवसेनयोः। घोरो विशसनो रौद्रो राजन् दुर्मन्त्रिते तव॥
target: Thus the armies of the Kurus and the Pandavas have been killed. Great and terrible has been that destruction, O king, brought on by your evil policy.

source: स त्वस्त्रतेजसी लोकांस्तापयन्ती व्यवस्थिते। महर्षी सहितौ तत्र दर्शयामासतुस्तदा॥ नारदः सर्वभूतात्मा भरतानां पितामहः। उभौ शमयितुं वीरौ भारद्वाजधनंजयौ॥
target: Seeing those two weapons consuming the three worlds, the two great Rishis, viz., Narada who is the soul of every creature, and Vyasa, the grandfather of all the Bharata princes, came there. The two Rishis tried to pacify the two heroes, Ashvatthaman and Dhananjaya.

source: बृहन्तः सुमहेष्वासः कृतास्त्रो युद्धदुर्मदः॥ दुःशासनेन विक्रम्य गमितो यमसादनम्।
target: Brihanta, that great bowman, who was well acquainted with the use of weapons and most invincible in battle, was sent to the region of Yama by Dushasana showing forth his prowess in the field.

source: ते तस्य कवचं भित्त्वा तथा बाहुं च दक्षिणम्। अध्ययुर्धरणी तीक्ष्णा वल्मीकमिव पन्नगाः॥
target: Those sharp arrows penetrating through Karna's armour and piercing his right arm, sank into the earth, like so many fierce snakes entering their holes on ant hills.

source: संजय उवाच प्राप्तोऽस्मि पाण्डवान् गत्वा तं विजानीत कौरवाः। यथावयः कुरून् सर्वान् प्रतिनन्दन्ति पाण्डवाः॥
target: Sanjaya said Having gone to the Pandavas, I am returned; know you this, O sons of Kuru. The Pandus salute all the sons of Kurus, each according to his age.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच जामदग्न्य वचः श्रुत्वा कण्वोऽपि भगवानृषिः। दुर्योधनमिदं वाक्यमब्रवीत् कुरुसंसदि॥
target: Vaishampayana said Hearing the words of the son of Jamadagni, the illustrious Rishi Kanva addressed these words to Duryodhana in the assembly of the Kurus.

source: तदेतदृषिणा प्रोक्तं विस्तरेणानुमीयते। नवजं शशिनं दृष्ट्वा वक्रतन्तुमिवाम्बरे॥

target: I will not therefore slay you today in battle, since Drona is alive. O man of greatly vicious understanding, at the expiration of this night, when the bright dawn will appear.

target: Kashyapa, Atri, Vashishtha, Bharadvaja, Gautama, Visvamitra, Jamadagni, and chaste Arundhati (the wife of Vashishtha), all had a common maidservant whose name was Ganda. A Shudra named Pashusakha married Ganda and became her husband.

source: हैहयाधिपयोधानां वेग आसीत्सुदारुणः। सनक्रीमीनमकरसमुद्रस्येव निःस्वनः॥

source: ततो ययावर्जुन एव येन निबार्य सैन्य तव मार्गणौधैः। ल्लोकं विसिस्मापयिषुर्दैवीरः॥

target: As regards my recitations, I entertained any particular desire to do. How then, O foremost of kings, should I have any knowledge of what are the fruits of those recitations?

target: Slaying her Indrajit spoke to Hanumān,“Behold I have slain (before you) with my sword Rāma's beloved. And Vaidehi being thus slain, all your labours have been rendered useless."

target: With his son sat on one seat, О lord of the world. The great Vidura sat on a holy seat covered with a white deer skin and decked with gems.

target: So do the ministers of cruel counsel meet with their end like to a chariot driven into a wild track by an unskilled charioteer.

source: सरलान् कर्णिकारांश्च खजूरांश्च सुपुष्पितान् । प्रियालान् मुचुलिन्दांश्च कुटजान् केतकानपि॥ प्रियङ्गुन् गन्धपूर्णांश्च नीपान् सप्तच्छदांस्तथा। असनान् कोविदारांश्च करवीरांश्च पुष्पितान्॥ पुष्पभारनिबद्धांश्च तथा मुकुलितानपि। पादपान् विहगाकीर्णान् पवनाधूतमस्तकान्॥ हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णा वापी: पद्मोत्पलावृताः। आक्रीडान् विविधारम्यान्विविधांश्च जलाशयान्॥ संततान् विविधैर्वृक्षैः सर्वर्तुफलपुष्पितैः। उद्यानानि च रम्याणि ददर्श कपिकुञ्जरः॥
target: That elephant of a monkey surveyed Saralas, and Karņikāras, and dates in full flower, priyalas, Muculindas, Kutajas and Ketakas, Priyangus warm with aroma, and Nipas, and Saptachchhadas; Asanas, Kovidaras, and flowering Karavīras, and trees bearing blossoms, filled with swans and Kārandavas, and covered with lotuses and lilies; and charming sporting hills* and various watery expanses; and extensive tracts covered with diverse trees bearing flowers and furies at all seasons, and gardens exceedingly beautiful to behold. *Sporting hills according to Kataka. According to others, akrira means a grove in general.

source: यावदेतान् पुनः सुभ्र क्षिपामीति जनाधिए। सा गच्छन्त्यन्तरा छायां वृक्षमाश्रित्य भामिनी॥ तस्थौ तस्या हि सन्तप्तं शिरः पादौ तथैव च। स्थिता सा तु मुहूर्तं वै भर्तुः शापभयाच्छुभा॥ ययावानयितुं भूयः सायकानसितेक्षणा। प्रत्याजगाम च शरांस्तानादाय यशस्विनी॥ सा वै खिन्ना सुचार्वङ्गी पद्भ्यां दुःखं नियच्छती। उपाजगाम भर्तारं भयाद् भर्तुः प्रवेपती॥
target: O you of beautiful eyebrows, I shall again shoot them with my bow! The lady proceeded on her errand but was compelled to sit under the shade of a tree, on account of her head and feet being scorched by the heat of the Sun. The black eyed and graceful Renuka, having rested for only a moment, feared the curse of her husband and, therefore began to collect and bring back the arrows. Taking them with her, the celebrated lady of beautiful features came back, distressed in mind and her feet smarting with pain. Trembling with fear, she approached her husband.

source: भीरू राजन्यो ब्राह्मणः सर्वभक्ष्यो वैश्योऽनीहावान् हीनवर्णोऽलसञ्च। विद्वांश्चाशीलो वृत्तहीनः कुलीन: सत्याद् विभ्रष्टो धार्मिकः स्त्री च दुष्टा॥ मूर्यो वक्ता नृपहीनं च राष्ट्रम्। एते सर्वे शोच्यतां यान्ति राजन् यश्चायुक्तः स्नेहहीनः प्रजासु॥
target: A Kshatriya shorn of courage, a Brahmana who takes every sort of food, a Vaishya shorn of exertion, a Shudra who is idle, learned person without good conduct, one of high birth but shorn of righteous conduct, a Brahmana fallen away from truth, a woman who is unchastc and wicked, a Yogin endued with attachments, one that cooks food for his own self, an ignorant person employed in making a discourse, a kingdom without a king, and king who cherishes no love for his subjects and who is shorn of Yoga,-these all, O king, are deserving of pity.
