source: एते मदान्मृत्युवशाभिपन्नाः समानीता धार्तराष्ट्रेण मूढाः। इदं पुन: कर्म पापीय एव सभामध्ये पश्य वृत्तं कुरूणाम्॥
target: The chiefs, that is to say, the fools that have been brought together by the sons of Dhritarashtra and are thus very near the kingdom of Death. Then again look at this sinful act, of the Kurus in the council hall.

source: पुत्राञ्छ्रियं च लभते यश्छत्रं सम्प्रयच्छति। न चक्षुर्व्याधिं लभते यज्ञभागमथाश्नुते॥
target: The man who makes a gift of an umbrella gets children and great prosperity. Such a person never suffers from any eyedisease. The merits also that originate from the performance of a sacrifice become his.

source: प्राप्याष्टगुणमैश्वर्यं ये न यास्यन्ति वै स्मयम्॥ येषां विस्मयते नित्यं भगवान् कर्मभिर्हरः।
target: Having got the eight sorts of divine attributes, they are never elated with pride. The divine Hara always wonders at their feats.

source: तत्र कश्चिन्मया दृष्टः सूर्योदयसमप्रभाम्। स्त्रियमादाय गच्छन् वै भिन्नाञ्जनचयोपमः॥
target: There I saw somebody resembling a mass of crushed collyrium, going away, taking a female resembling the rising sun in splendour.

source: अजोऽग्निवरुणो मेषः सूर्योऽश्व इति दर्शनम्। कुञ्जराश्च मृगा नागा महिषाश्चासुरा इति॥ कुक्कुटाश्च वराहाश्च राक्षसा भृगुनन्दन। इडा गावः पयः सोमो भूमिरित्येव च स्मृतिः॥
target: The goat is Fire, the sheep is Varuna; the horse is the Sun; elephants are Nagas; buffaloes are Asuras; cocks and boars are Rakshasas; O delighter of the Bhrigus; earth is sacrifice, kine, water, and Soma. These are the declarations of the Smritis.

source: प्रियो हि पाण्डवो नित्यं भारद्वाजस्य धीमतः। आचार्यश्च रणे नित्यं प्रियः पार्थस्य संजय॥
target: Then son of Pandu is very to the highly intelligent son of Bharadvaja; so also, O Sanjaya, the preceptor always dear to Pritha in battle.

source: तस्मात् क्षत्रिय मा मंस्था जल्पितेनैव वै द्विजम्। व एव सत्यान्नापैति स ज्ञेयो ब्राह्मणस्त्वया॥
target: Therefore, O Kshatriya, that one can know the Supreme Soul by mere reading. He, who does not fall away from truth, should be known by you as one who has attained a knowledge of the Supreme Being.

source: पञ्च नद्यो वहन्त्येता यत्र पीलुवनान्युत॥ शतर्दुश्च विपासा च तृतीयैरावती तथा। चन्द्रभागा वितस्ता च सिन्धुषष्टा बहिर्गिरेः॥ आरट्टा नाम ते देशा नष्टधर्मा न तान् व्रजेत्।'
target: There where the forests of Pilus stand and the five rivers Shatadru, Vipasha, Iravati, Chandrabhaga and Vitasta and which have the Sindhu for their sixty flow there in those region is situated the Province called the Arattas distant from Himavat. The Province is shorn of virtue and religion. No one should there.

source: उवाच मधुरं वाक्यं तपती प्रहसन्निव। उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भद्रं ते न त्वमर्हस्यरिंदम्॥ मोहं नृपतिशार्दूल गन्तुमाविष्कृतः क्षितौ। एवमुक्तोऽथ नृपतिर्वाचा मधुरया गिरा॥
target: Sweetly smiling, Tapati spoke thus in sweet words, “Rise, rise, O chastiser of foes be blessed. O best of kings, you are celebrated in the word, it does not befit you to lose your senses.” Having been thus addressed by her in these sweet words,

source: एते चेदेवमिच्छन्ति कृतकार्यो युधिष्ठिरः। अद्यैव ह्यहमेनांश्च ये चैनाननु भारत॥
target: Since they desire to act so wickedly Yudhishthira has all the greater chances of success; for I can at this very moment, capture these and those that follow them,

source: स भारः सौम्य भर्तव्यो यो नरं नावसादयेत्। तदन्नमपि भोक्तव्यं जीर्यते यदनामयम्॥
target: It is always proper to carry such a weight as does not exhaust (him who carries); it is always proper to take such a food as does not cause illness.

source: प्रभातायां तु शर्वयां पौरास्ते राघवं विना। शोकोपहतनिश्चेष्टा बभूवुर्हतचेतसः॥
target: When the night had departed an day dawned, the citizens not finding Rāghava, overwhelmed with grief and were deprived of their senses. were

source: विध्वस्तकवचौ वीरौ विप्रविद्धशरासनौ। सायकैश्छिन्नसर्वाङ्गौ शरस्तम्बमयौ क्षितौ ॥
target: Those heroes were lying on the earth, their mail torn, their bows cast off their bodies mangled all over and thickly pierce with shafts.

source: संजय उवाच समुत्तीर्ण रथानीकं पाण्डवं विहसन् रणे। विवारयिषुराचार्यः शरवर्षैरवाकिरत्॥
target: Sanjaya said The Preceptor then, desirous of checking the progress of the son of Pandu, who had now crossed the car-host, began to cover him smilingly with his arrows.

source: तं भीष्मः प्रत्युवाचेदं मद्रराजं जनाधिपः। धर्म एष परो राजन् स्वयमुक्तः स्वयम्भुवा॥
target: The king Bhishma thus replied to the king of Madra, "O king, this is a great virtue; the self created (Brahma) has himself said it.

source: कृतपूर्वं तु महान् श्रूयन्ते हि पुराणेषु प्रजा धिग्दण्डशासनाः। दान्ता धर्मप्रधानाश्च न्यायधर्मानुवृत्तिकाः॥
target: It is heard in the Puranas that formerly mankind were self-controlled, that they valued virtue greatly, that the practices they followed for livelihood were all agreeable to propriety and the injunctions laid down in the scriptures; and that the only punishment that was necessary for chastising them when they did wrong was merely the deprecation of their deeds.

source: ततो वैश्रवणो राजा राक्षसानसृजत् तदा। ते बलान्यवमृद्गन्त मुचुकुन्दस्य नैर्ऋताः॥
target: King Vaishravana created a large army of Rakshasas. These grinded the army led by Muchukunda.

source: व्यादिदेश तथा सैन्यं तस्मिंस्तमसि दारुणे॥ ततः प्रववृते युद्धं रात्रौ भरतसत्तम।
target: Then cominanded his army (to act in obedience to his orders) during that dreadfully dark night. Then, O most exalted of Bharatas, took place a battle.

source: एवमुक्तस्तु हनुमान्सीतया वाक्यकोविदः। प्रत्युवाच ततः सीतां रामपत्नीमनिन्दिताम्॥
target: Being thus addressed by Sītā, Hanumān, skilled in speech, spoke to the blameless Rama's spouse, saying.

source: ततः समुद्रतीरेण जगाम वसुधाधिपः। भ्रातृभिः सहितो वीरः कालिङ्गान् प्रति भारत॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, that ruler of earth, the hero, accompanied by his brothers then went along the shore of the ocean to the land of the Kalinga.

source: पञ्चाला: सृञ्जया मत्स्याश्चेदिकारुषकोसलाः। अन्वगच्छन् महाराज केकयाश्च महारथाः॥
target: The Panchalas, the Srinjayas, the Matsyas, the Chedis, the Kauravas, the Kosalas and those mighty car-warriors, the Keykayas followed suit, O great king.

source: अन्वीयमान्स्तैर्वाली भाजतेऽम्बरमध्यगः। अन्वीयमानो मेघौधैरम्बरस्थ इवांशुमान्॥
target: They thus following him, Vali, appeared in the sky like the sun in the midst of clouds.

source: धारयामास चात्मानं यथाशास्त्रं यथाविधि। पादप्रभृतिगात्रेषु क्रमेण क्रमयोगवित्॥
target: According to the direction of the scriptures and to the ordinances laid down, that ascetic, who knew the successive processes of Yoga, held his soul first in one place and then in another, beginning from his feet and proceeding through all the limbs.

source: आगमश्च पुराणानां महर्षीणां च सम्भवः। तीर्थवंशश्च वंशश्च नक्षत्राणां युधिष्ठिर॥ सकलं चातुराश्रम्यं चातुर्होत्रं तथैव च। चातुर्वण्र्यं तथैवात्र चातुर्विद्यं च कीर्तितम्॥
target: Thus, O Yudhishthira, the histories of the past, the origin of the great Rishis, the holy rivers, the planets and stars and asterisms, the duties of the four modes of life, the four kinds of Homa, the characteristics of the four castes and the four branches of learning were all described in that work (of Brahma).

source: राष्ट्रे तु येऽनुजीवन्ति ये तु राज्ञोऽनुजीविनः॥ अमात्यानां च सर्वेषां मध्यस्थानां च सर्वशः। ये च त्वाभिप्रशंसेयुर्निन्देयुरथवा पुनः॥ सर्वान् सुपरिणीतांस्तान् कारयेथा युधिष्ठिर।
target: Amongst the virtuous and wise, amongst those who never retreat from battle, and those who do not live in your kingdom, those who depend on you, and those who are your ministers, as well as those who do not follow party, they who praise or blame you should never be disregarded by you, O Yudhishthira!

source: पर्यस्त इव लोकोऽयं युधिष्ठिरनिवेशने। उच्चावचानुपग्राहान् राजभिः प्रापितान् बहून्॥ शत्रूणां पश्यतो दुःखान्मुमूर्षा मे व्यजायत। भृत्यास्तु ये पाण्डवानां तांस्ते वक्ष्यामि पार्थिव॥
target: And made the palace of Yudhishthira an epitom of all the world. seeing the king offer such excellent and valuable presents, I wish for death from grief. O king, I shall now tell you about the servants of the Pandavas,

source: इमा हि देवताः सर्वा ऋषयश्च परंतप। तव क्रोधान्महादेव न शान्तिमुपलेभिरे॥
target: O scorcher of enemies, there, those gods, and the Rishis, on account of your anger, O Mahadeva, have become greatly agitated.

source: पश्यन्तस्ते नरव्याघ्रा रेमिरे तत्र पाण्डवाः। मधुस्रवफलं दिव्यं ब्रह्मर्षिगणसेवितम्॥
target: Seeing it frequented by the Brahmana Rishis and abounding in fruits dropping excellent honey, those foremost of men, the Pandavas, were filled with great delight.

source: उदीर्णः सर्वतश्चक्षुरनीशः शाश्वतस्थिरः। भूशयो भूषणो भूतिर्विशोकः शोकनाशनः॥
target: He who is above all creatures. He whose vision extends in all directions. He who has no Master. He who at all times is above all changes. He who (in the form of Rama) had to lie down on the naked earth. He who adoris the Earth. He who is power incarnate. He who is above all grief. He who removes the griefs of all his worshippers as soon as they remember Him. (624-632)

source: हिमहतनलिनीव नष्टशोभा व्यसनपरम्परया निपीड्यमाना। सहचररहितेव चक्रवाकी जनकसुता कृपणां दशां प्रपन्ना ॥
target: Being harassed with continued miseries, the daughter of Janaka has lost all her beauty like to a water-lily crushed with frost, and has come by a miserable plight like to a doe separated from her mate.

source: ततो विततधन्वानं द्रोणस्तं कुरुनन्दनम्। स मुहूर्तादुवाचेदं वचनं भरतर्षभ॥
target: Yudhisthira who stood aiming at the bird, very next moment Drona said-

source: अहं नारायणो नाम प्रभवः शाश्वतोऽव्ययः। विधाता सर्वभूतानां संहर्ता च द्विजोत्तम॥
target: O foremost of Brahmana, I am Narayana, the source of all things, the eternal, the unchangeable; I am the creator of all things and also the destroyer of all.

source: सा भुर्ज भीमनिर्हादा भित्त्वा भीमस्य दक्षिणम्। साग्निज्वाला महारौद्रा पपात सहसा भुवि॥
target: And that tremendous (club) emitting flames and sending forth dreadful roars pierced suddenly the right arm of Bhima and then fell to the ground.

source: न मोक्ष्यसे रावण राघवस्य सर्वैः सहेन्द्रैरपि मूढ गुप्तः। अन्तर्हितः सूर्यपथं गतोऽपि तथैव पातालमनुप्रविष्टः।। गिरीशपादाम्बुजसंगतो वा हतोऽसि रामेण सहानुजस्त्वम्।।
target: You shall not be able to escape Rāghava, O Rāvana, O you who have lost your sense, even if you are protected by the celestials. And you shall with your brother be slain by Rāma, even if you did fly into the sky, enter into the regions under the earth, or seek shelter of Mahādeva.

source: न च तेऽयं समारम्भो मयि मोघो भविष्यति। वध्यान् विषह्यान् संग्रामे न हनिष्यामि ते सुतान्॥
target: But at the same time this appeal to me by you shall not be entirely useless. I shall not kill such of your sons as are capable of being withstood and killed by me, in the battle.

source: दैवतं विष्णुरेतेषां विष्णुरेव परायणम्। हृदि चैषां सदा विष्णुर्विष्णुरेव सदा गतिः॥
target: Vishnu is their god; and their object of worship, Vishnu, is ever in their heart; and Vishnu is ever their refuge.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच किं पार्थिवेन कर्तव्यं किं च कृत्वा सुखी भवेत्। एतदाचक्ष्व तत्त्वेन सर्वधर्मभृतां वर॥
target: Yudhishthira said What works should be done by a king, and what are those works by doing which a king may become happy? Tell me this fully, O you who are the foremost of all persons acquainted with duties.

source: धर्मशास्त्रार्थतत्त्वज्ञः सांधिविग्रहिको भवेत्। मतिमान् धृतिमान् ह्रीमान् रहस्यविनिगूहिता॥
target: The king's minister should be well-read in the scriptures and capable in directing wars and making treaties. He should also be intelligent, courageous, modest, and capable of keeping secrets.

source: तच्चास्य बलमादास्ये बलेन महता वृतः। ज्योतिषामिव सर्वेषां प्रभामुद्यन्दिवाकरः॥
target: When, surrounded by a mighty host, shall I confound his ranks, even as the Sun arising, (vanquish) the light of the stellar spheres?

source: अष्टावक्र उवाच अष्टौ शाणाः शतमानं वहन्ति तथाष्टपादः शरभः सिंहघाती। अष्टौ वसूशुश्रुम देवतासु यूपश्चाष्टास्त्रिर्विहितः सर्वयज्ञे।॥
target: Ashtavakra said: Eight are the bags that hold hundred-fold, eight is the number of the Sarava, which preys upon lions, eight are the Vasus among the celestials and eight are the angles of a Yupa (stake) in a sacrifice.

source: नाभिजज्ञे स नृपतिर्दुहित्रर्थे समागतम्। ऋतुपर्णोऽपि राजा सधीमान् सत्यपराक्रमः॥ राजानं राजपुत्रं वा न स्म पश्यति कंचन। नैव स्वयंवरकथां न च विप्रसमागमम्॥ ततो व्यगणयद् राजा मनसा कोसलाधिपः। आगतोऽस्मीत्युवाचैनं भवन्तमभिवादकः॥
target: In fact Bhima did not know that he (Rituparna) had come to win the hands of his daughter. The intelligent king Rituparna, possessed of unbaffled power, beheld that there was neither a king nor a prince; nor he saw any gathering of Brahmanas; nor he heard any talk regarding the Svayamvara. Thereupon the ruler of Koshala ineditated in his mind and after a while addressed him, saying, "I have como here to pay you homage?"

source: समेत्य च महाबाहुः शल्यः पाण्डुसेतैस्तदा। पाद्यमयं च गां चैव प्रत्यगृह्णाद् यथाविधि॥
target: And having come there, he, the long armed one accepted the customary water for washing his feet and other gifts including a cow.

source: एतच्छुत्वा महाराज वचनं मम साम्प्रतम्॥ प्रत्युद्याहि रणे पार्थ मद्रराजं महारथम्।
target: Hearing, O king, these words of mind now, proceed, O Partha, against that great carwarrior, the king of the Madras.

source: ततस्ते प्राविशन् पार्था हतत्विट्कं हतेश्वरम्। दुर्योधनस्य शिबिरं रङ्गवद्विसृते जने॥
target: The Parthas then entered the tent of Duryodhana, shorn of its splendours and bereft of its master, and looking like a pleasureground deserted by spectators.

source: तत्पूर्वमैक्ष्वाकसुतो महात्मा रामो गमिष्यन् नृपमार्तरूपम्। व्यतिष्ठत प्रेक्ष्य तदा सुमन्त्रं पितुर्महात्मा प्रतिहारणार्थम्॥
target: And with the view of meeting the aggrieved king before repairing to the forest, the magnanimous son of the Ikşvāku race, seeing Sumantra, stayed there, so that that nobleminded one might inform his father of his visit.

source: दिष्ट्यापनीतकवचो दिष्ट्यापहृतकुण्डलः। दिष्ट्या सा व्यंसिता शक्तिरमोघास्य घटोत्कचे॥
target: It is through good fortune that his armour had been taken away, that his ear-rings, had been taken away from him; by good luck it is that his infallible dart also had been baffled by Ghatotkacha.

source: पर्वतः पृथिवीं कृत्स्ना विचचार महामतिः॥ पूज्यमानो यथान्यायं तेजसा स्वेन भारत।
target: From that time the great Parvata began to wander over the Earth, respected as he deserved, O Bharata, for his own power.

source: नायकं तत्कुमारं वा यो वा स्याद् यत्र पूजितः॥ जीवग्राहं प्रगृह्णाति तस्य लोका यथा मम।
target: That warrior, who can capture alive the commander of the hostile army or his son or some other respected leader, acquires regions of felicity like mine.

source: आशंसते वै धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्रो महाराज्यमसपत्नं पृथिव्याम्। तस्मिञ्छमः केवलो नोपलभ्यो बद्धं सन्तं मन्यते लब्धमर्थम्॥
target: The son of Dhritarashtra aspires to an extensive empire in this earth without any rival. Peace with him therefore cannot be obtained. The wealth ((and kingdom) which is now at his command he regards as inalienably his and his alone.

source: भीष्म उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। निदर्शनं परं लोके सज्जनाचरिते सदा॥
target: Bhishma said Regarding it is cited the following ancient history. That history is considered as one of the greatest precedent amongst good and wisemen.

source: द्रोण उवाच करोतु स्वस्ति ते ब्रह्म ब्रह्मा चापि द्विजातयः। सरीसृपाश्च ये श्रेष्ठास्तेभ्यस्ते स्वस्ति भारत॥
target: Drona said May all the Vedas, the Brahmanas and Brahman himself and the Reptiles and other beings of superior order bless you, O Bharata!

source: असम्बाधशतद्वारैः शयनासनशोभितैः। बहुधा तु पिनद्धाङ्गैर्हिमवच्छिखरैरिव॥
target: Each of them contained one hundred doors wide enough to admit a crowd all at once; they were adorned with costly beds ornamented with various metals; they looked like the peaks of the Himalayas.

source: असूतास्ते हयास्तत्र रथमूहुरविक्लवाः॥ मण्डलान्यभिधावन्ति तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्।
target: And deprived of their driver, there the steeds, retaining their calmness, began to go in rounds and this was wonderful.

source: अतिभक्तं त्वया सार्धं राज्यं यच्चापि मे वसु। एवमुक्त्वा धनाध्यक्षो जगाम पितुरन्तिकम्॥ अभिवाद्य गुरुं प्राह रावणस्य यदीप्सितम्। एष तात दशग्रीवो दूतं प्रेषितवान्मम॥ दीयतां नगरी लङ्का पूर्वं रक्षोगणोषिता। मयात्र यदनुष्ठेयं तन्ममाचक्ष्व सुव्रत॥
target: May my kingdom and wealth never undergo division when you are present! 'Having said this, the lord of riches sought the side of his sire, and, paying him reverence, he communicated Ravana's wish to him:' My father, this Tennecked one had sent a messenger to me, saying, Give (back) the city Lankā, which had before been inhabited by hosts of Rakşasa. Now, O you of excellent vows, do you tell me what I should do.

source: शिखण्डिनं तु समरे भीष्ममृत्यु दुरासदम्॥ हार्दिक्यो वारयामास स्मयन्निव मुहुर्मुहुः।
target: The son of Hridika, smiling over and over again, resisted Shikhandin, who was the cause of death of Bhishma and most invincible in the field of battle.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच अपूर्वश्च भवेत् पात्रमथवापि चिरोषितः। दूरादभ्यागतं चापि किं पात्रं स्यात् पितामह॥
target: Yudhishthira said Which among these three persons, O grandfather should be regarded as the best for making gifts, viz., one who is a thorough stranger, or one who is living with and known to the giver for a long time, or one who comes to the giver from a long distance?

source: अङ्गदेनात्र निहतो विकटो नाम राक्षसः। विरूपाक्षश्च दुष्प्रेक्षो महापार्श्वमहोदरौ।।।।
target: The Rākşasa named Vikața was slain there by Angada-and Virūpākșa, hard to look at and Mahāpārśva and Mahodara.

source: सर्वमेव न तत्रासीद् धर्मनित्ये युधिष्ठिरे। दस्युभ्यो वञ्चकेभ्यश्च राज्ञः प्रति परस्परम्॥ राजवल्लभतश्चैव नाश्रूयत मृषा कृतम्। प्रियं कर्तुमुपस्थातुं बलिकर्म स्वकर्मजम्॥ अभिहर्तुं नृपाः षट्सु पृथग् जात्यैश्च नैगमैः। ववृधे विषयस्तत्र धर्मनित्ये युधिष्ठिरे॥
target: In consequence of Yudhishthira being ever devoted to virtue, it was never heard that thieves or cheats or royal favourites did not wrong towards one another. In consequence of Yudhishthira's devotion to virtue his tributary chiefs always waited upon him to render him good service on the six occasions (of war, treaty etc.); and the traders and merchants of different classes paid him their dues taxes liveable on their respective trades. Thus the kingdom grew in prosperity.

source: अभिपेतुर्निषादाश्च सौवीराश्च महारणे। बाह्रीका दरदाश्चैव प्रतीच्योदीच्यमालवाः॥ अभीषाहाः शूरसेनाः शिवयोऽथ वसातयः। शाल्वाः शकास्त्रिगाश्च अम्बष्ठाः केकयैः सह॥
target: Fell upon Arjuna in battle. The Nishadas, the Souviras, the Balhika's, the Daradas, the Westerners, the Northerners and the Malavas, Abhishahs, the Shurasenas, the Shibis, the Vasatis, the Shalavas, the Shakas, the Trigartas, the Ambasthas with the Kaikeyas,

source: ततः सा तीव्रशोकार्ता प्रदीप्तेव च मन्युना। इतश्चेतश्च रुदती पर्यधावत दुःखिता॥
target: Then oppressed with poignant grief and burning with anger, the miserable Damayanti began to run hither and thither bewailing.

source: तौ परिज्ञाततत्त्वार्थो मया प्रीतिसमन्वितौ॥ । पृष्ठमारोप्य तं देशं प्रापितौ पुरुषर्षभौ। निवेदितौ च तत्त्वेन सुग्रीवाय महात्मने॥
target: They were pleased by me, being informed of the real facts. And then placing those two best of men on my back I arrived at the top of the hill and communicated the truth to the high-souled Sugriva.

source: अल्पं दत्तं मयाद्येति निष्ककोटि सहस्रशः। एकाला दास्यति पुनः कोऽन्यस्तत् सम्प्रदास्यति॥
target: Having given away in the course of a single day, a Koti of Nishkas, he used to say, “I have his day given away a very small number of coins", thus thinking, he would again give away Nishkas. What other person can give away such enormous quantity of wealth?

source: ततो गच्छेतधर्मज्ञ नमस्कृत्य महागिरिम्॥ स्वर्गद्वारेण यत् तुल्यं गङ्गाद्वारं न संशयः। तत्राभिषेकं कुर्वीत कोटितीर्थे समाहितः॥
target: O virtuous one, one should then go, after bowing to the great mountain. To the source of the Ganges which is certainly like the gate of heaven. There one should with controlled soul bathe in the Tirtha called Koti.

source: सत्यत्यागात् तु मात्सर्यमहितानां च सेवया। एतत् तु क्षीयते तात साधूनामुपसेवनात्॥
target: Malice springs from the casting off of truth and indulgence in wickedness. This vice, O child, disappears when one waits upon the wise and good.

source: न गुणा विदुरात्मानं स गुणान् वेद सर्वतः। परिद्रष्टा गुणानां तं संस्रष्टा मन्यते यथा।॥
target: The qualities cannot know the Soul. The Soul, however, knows them. The ignorant regard the Soul as existing in a state of union with the qualities like qualities existing with their possessors. This, however, is not the case, for the Soul is only an idle spectator of everything.

source: आरुरोह रथं तूर्णं दुर्मुखस्य विशाम्पते। द्रोणश्च द्रुपदं भित्त्वा शरैः संनतपर्वभिः॥
target: The highly puissant Drona also penetrating Draupada with straight shafts, pierced with quickness the latter's charioteer.

source: ततस्तीरमुपागम्य भागीरथ्याः स लक्ष्मणः। उवाच मैथिली वाक्यं प्राञ्जलिर्बाष्पसंवृतः॥
target: Thereupon having reached the other side of Bhāgirathi, Lakşmaņa, with subdued voice and folded palms, said to Sītā.

source: अर्चिताश्च नरैः पौरैः पाण्डवा भरतर्षभ। जग्मुरावसथं पश्चात् पुरोचनपुरस्सराः॥
target: O best of the Bharata race, thus adored by the citizens, the Pandavas went to their house with Purochana walking at the head (of the possession).

source: अस्त्रौघान्महतो मुक्तौ द्रोणहार्दिक्यरक्षितात्। राच्मानावदृश्येतामिन्द्राग्न्योः सदृशौ रणे॥
target: Escaping from those thick down-pours of arrows, from those divisions protected by Drona and Hridika's son, Keshava and Arjuna appeared like Indra and Agni of burning radiance.

source: द्वन्द्वमेति च निर्द्वन्द्वस्तासु तास्विह योनिषु। शीर्षरोगेऽक्षिरोगे च दन्तशूले गलग्रहे॥ जलोदरे तृषारोगे ज्वरगण्डे विषूचके। श्वित्रकुष्ठेऽग्निदग्धे च सिध्मापस्मारयोरपि॥ यानि चान्यानि द्वन्द्वानि प्राकृतानि शरीरिषु। उत्पद्यन्ते विचित्राणि तान्येषोऽप्यभिमन्यते॥
target: Though above both happiness and misery, it is thus that he subjects himself to happiness and misery. It is thus also that, though above all discases, the Soul considers himself to be afflicted by headache, opthalmia, toothache, affections of the throat, abdominal dropsy, burning thirst, enlargement of glands, cholera, vitiligo, leprosy, burns, asthma, phthisis, epilepsy, and various other diseases from which embodied creatures suffer.

source: स त्वं न दुःखी दुःखस्य न सुखी सुसुखस्य च। स्मर्तुमिच्छसि कौन्तेय किमन्यद् दुःखविभ्रमात्॥ अथवा ते स्वभावोऽयं येन पार्थावकृष्यसे। दृष्ट्वा सभागतां कृष्णामेकवस्त्रां रजस्वलाम्। मिषतां पाण्डवेयानां न तस्य स्मर्तुमिच्छसि॥ प्रव्राजनं च नगरादजिनैश्च विवासनम्। महारण्यनिवासश्च न तस्य स्मर्तुमिच्छसि॥ जटासुरात् परिक्लेशश्चित्रसेनेन चाहवः। सैन्धवाच्च परिक्लेशो न तस्य स्मर्तुमिच्छसि॥
target: But you, O son of Kunti, do nether wish to recall your sorrows nor your happiness, what else do you wish to recall barring this delusion of sorrow. Or, perchance, O son of Pritha, it is your innate nature, by which you are at present overpowered. You do not wish to recall to your mind the painful spectacle of Krishna standing in the hall of assembly with only one piece of cloth to cover her body, and while she was in her menses and before all the Pandavas. And it is not proper that you should brood over your departure from the city, and your exile with the hide of the antelope for your dress, and your wanderings in the great forest, nor should you recall to your mind the affliction from Jatasura, the fight with Chitrasena, and your troubles from the Saindhavas.

source: भीष्मस्याथ वचः श्रुत्वा दाशार्हः पुष्करेक्षणः। भीष्मद्रोणमुखान् सर्वानभ्यभाषत वीर्यवान्॥
target: That heroic scion of the Dasharha race, with eyes like the petals of the lotus, hearing the words of Bhishma, said to all of them headed by Bhishma and Drona.

source: भार्याः पतिकृताँल्लोकानाप्नुवन्तीति नः श्रुतम्। त्वामहं पतिमासाद्य कां गमिष्यामि वै गतिम्॥
target: We have heard that a wife attains to those regions which are acquired by her husband. What, indeed, is the goal that I shall attain, having obtained you for my husband.

source: तं मेरुशिखराकारं दीप्तामिव शतहदाम्। गगनस्थं महीस्थास्ते ददृशुर्वानराधिपाः॥
target: The leading monkeys, stationed on earth, espied him on the welkin, resembling in size the summit of the mount Meru, and burning like lightning in the effulgence of his own person.

source: हयाश्च मे संगृहीतास्तयासन् महानद्या संयति कौरवेन्द्र। पादौ जनन्याः प्रतिगृह्य चाहं तथा पितॄणां रथमभ्यरोहम्॥
target: I also saw my heroes held by that great river, O chief among the son of Kuru. Having touched the feet of my mother and worshipping the memory of my ancestors, I ascended my chariot.

source: शुश्रू शरीरसत्कारैः सर्वैराच्छादनादिभिः। श्वशुरं देवसत्कारैर्वाचः संयमनेन च॥
target: By ministering to her physical comforts and by (covering her with) all sorts of robes, she delighted her mother-in-law. And she pleased her father-in-law by worshipping him as a god and by controlling her words.

source: तन्महोदधिवत् पूर्णं नगरं वै व्यरोचत। द्वारतोरणनिर्दूहैर्युक्तमध्चयोपमैः॥ प्रासादशतसम्बाधं महेन्द्रपुरसंनिभम्। नदीषु वनखण्डेषु वापीपल्वलसानुषु। काननेषु च रम्येषु विजहर्मुदिता जनाः॥
target: The holy city (Hastinapur) like the wide ocean, full of hundreds of palaces and mansions, possessing gates and arches and looking like dark clouds, appeared like the celestial capital of Indra. The people sported in great delight in the rivers, lakes, tanks, beautiful groves and woods.

source: सिन्धुसागरयोश्चैव संगमे तत्र पर्वतः। महान् सोमगिरि म शतशृङ्गो महाद्रुमः॥ तत्र प्रस्थेषु रम्येषु सिंहा पक्षगमाः स्थिताः। तिमिमत्स्यगजांश्चैव नीडान्यारोपयन्ति ते॥
target: There is a mighty mountain where the Sindhu falls into the sea, Somagiri by name; having an hundred summits and tall trees. In its plateaus there are certain birds (called) Sinhas. These lift up to their nests whales and elephants.

source: सा गत्वा तीनहोरात्रान् ददर्श परमाङ्गना। तापसारण्यमतुलं दिव्यकाननशोभितम्॥ वसिष्ठभृग्वत्रिसमैस्तापसैरुपशोभितम्। नियतैः संयताहारैर्दमशौचसमन्वितैः॥ अब्भक्षैर्वायुभक्षैश्च पत्राहारैस्तथैव च। जितेन्द्रियैर्महाभागैः स्वर्गमार्गदिदृक्षुभिः॥ वल्कलाजिनसंवीतैर्मुनिभिः संयतेन्द्रियैः। तापसाध्युषितं रम्यं ददर्शाश्रममण्डलम्॥ नानामृगगणैर्जुष्टं शाखामृगगणायुतम्। तापसैः समुपेतं च सा दृष्ट्वैव समाश्वसत्॥
target: That supremely beautiful damsel, after having wandered for three whole days and nights, saw an incomparable woody retreat of ascetics, furnished with beautiful gardens, inhabited by anchorites, like Vasishtha, Bhrigu and Atri, self-governed and abstemious, performing the ten prescribed purifactory rites; some living on water, some on air and some on (fallen) leaves, with passions under thorough control, of eminent parts, secking the way to Heaven, wearing barks of trees and skins of deer and with senses held in check. She saw that charming hermitage inhabited by the ascetics and abounding in various species of animals and swarming with monkeys and graced by the presence of hermits and she was comforted (with the sight).

source: जातं जातं स गर्भं तु पुनरेव जघान ह॥ अरक्षंश्च सुतान् कांश्चित् तदा क्षत्रिययोषितः।
target: As soon as Kshatriya children were born, Rama killed them. Some Kshatriya ladies, however, succeeded in hiding their children from Rama.

source: न धर्मः प्रीयते तात दानैर्दत्तैर्महाफलैः॥ न्यायलब्धैर्यथा सूक्ष्मैः श्रद्धापूतैः स तुष्यति।
target: The deity of righteousness is never pleased so much with large gifts of costly things as with gifts of even worthless things, if acquired lawfully and given away with devotion and faith.

source: नासत्यश्चैव दस्रश्च स्मृतौ द्वावश्विनावपि। मार्तण्डस्यात्मजावेतावष्टमस्य महात्मनः॥
target: Nasatya and Dashra are mentioned as the two Ashvins. These two are the sons of the illustrious Martanda, the eighth in the above.

source: वाग्यतः प्रणतो भूत्वा ववन्दे परमेश्वरम्। तमुवाच नतं मूर्धा देवानामादिरव्ययः॥
target: The first of all the gods, who is free from decay, said the following words to him whose head was still bent low in veneration.

source: तौ च श्रुत्वा मृतौ व्यक्तं पाण्डोः क्षेत्रोद्भवाः सुताः एकाह्ना ससुहृवर्गाः क्लैब्याद्धास्यन्ति जीवितम्।। २ ।
target: Then it is evident also, that hearing of the death of these latter, the other sons of Pandi, with all their allies and friends, will give up their lives in the course of a single day, out of despair.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच युधिष्ठिरस्तु तच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य दुरात्मनः। आचचक्षे ततः सर्वं गोत्रनामादि भारत॥
target: Vaishampayana said : O descendant of Bharata, having heard the words of that wretch, Yudhishthira told him his name and lineage.

source: एवं ते कृतदारा वै रेमिरे तत्र राक्षसाः॥ स्वां स्वां भार्यामुपादाय गन्धर्वा इव नन्दने। ततो मन्दोदरी पुत्रं मेघनादमजीजनत्॥ स एष इन्द्रजिन्नाम युष्माभिरभिधीयते।
target: Having thus wedded, those Rākşasas, taking each his wife, set about sporting there, like to Gandharvas sporting in Nandana. And then was born Mandodari's son-Meghanāda. Him you call Indarjit.

source: अनुयातश्च पितरमधिको वा पराक्रमे। गीतं स्तोत्रं स सौभद्रः सम्यक् तत्र भविष्यति॥
target: Equal to his father or even superior to him in prowess the son of Subhadra will be the Vedic hymn recited there.

source: आनयस्वामरश्रेष्ठ त्वरितं पुण्यवर्धन! यावदस्याः पयः पीत्वा सा सखी मम मानद॥ मानुषेषु भवत्वेका जरारोगविवर्जिता। एतन्मम महाभाग कर्तुमर्हस्यनिन्दित॥
target: O best of the celestials, O virtue increasing one, bring her soon. So that my that human friend, drinking her milk, becomes the only person on earth free from disease and decrepitude. O illustrious god, O blameless god, you should grant me my this desire.

source: सभामध्ये च यद् रूपं मायया कृतवानसि। तत् तथैव पुनः कृत्वा सार्जुनो मामभिद्रव॥

source: आरुज्य वृक्षान् निर्मूलान् गजः परिरुजनिव। निघ्नन् पद्भिः क्षिति भीम निष्टनन् परिधावसि॥

source: ततो निवर्त्य संवर्तः परिश्रान्त उपाविशत्। शीतलच्छायमासाद्य न्यग्रोधं बहुशाखिनम्॥

target: I think that the graceful Sītā adorned with ornaments slept in this bed, for here and there are scattered particles of gold.

source: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये। मत्त एवेति तान् विद्धि न त्वह तेषु ते मयि॥
target: And all existing things of Sattva, Raja and Tama Gunas (the qualities of goodness of passion and of darkness), are all from Me. I am, however, not in them; they are in Me.

source: उल्मुकं भ्रामयंस्तूर्णं पाण्डवश्चर्म चोत्तरम्। व्यपोहत शरांस्तस्य सर्वानेव धनंजयः॥
target: The Pandava Dhananjaya, who had an excellent shield, warded off all those arrows with it and with the torch in his hand.

source: प्रविशन्तं च मां तत्र न कश्चिद् दृष्टवान् नरः। ऋते तां पार्थिवसुतां भवतामेव तेजसा॥
target: When I entered, no man, through your influence, discovered me there except the daughter of the king.

source: मुमुचुः शरवृष्टिं पाण्डवस्य रथं प्रति। शरवृष्टिं ततस्तां तु शरवर्षेः समन्ततः॥ प्रतिजग्राह राजेन्द्र तोयवृष्टिमिवाचलः। तत्राद्भुतमपश्याम बीभत्सोर्हस्तलाघवम्॥
target: They also poured a shower of arrows towards the chariot of Pandu's son. Then the we son. latter received that shower of arrows, O foremost of kings, with another shower discharged by himself, like a mountain receiving a shower of rain. Then in that battle beheld the wonderful lightness of Vibhatsu's hands.

source: स्त्रियः पुंसां परिददे मनुर्जिगमिषुर्दिवम्। अबलाः स्वल्पकौपीनाः सुहृदः सत्यजिष्णवः॥
target: Manu, on the eve of his departure from this world, made over women to the care and protection of men, saying that they are weak, that they fall an easy prey to the seduction of men, disposed to accept the love which is offered them, and devoted to truth.

source: स्वानुगा इव सीदन्ति रथचक्राणि मारिष॥ चरतस्तस्य संग्रामे तस्मॅिल्लोहितकर्दमे।
target: O sire, the car-wheels of that one, who was carcering in the battle, stopped, as if with terror, while they were moving in that bloody mire.

source: ते दुर्गवासं बहुधा निरुष्य व्यतीत्य कैलासमचिन्त्यरूपम्। आसेदुरत्यर्थमनोरमं ते तमाश्रमाचयं वृषपर्वणस्तु॥
target: (Thus) resting in many inaccessible places and crossing the mountain Kailasa of incomprehensible grandeur, they at length reached the exceedingly beautiful hermitage of Vrishaparva.

source: कथमुयनेऽशक्तान् पतने च ममात्मजान्। संतप्यमाना बहुधा वाशमाना प्रधावती॥
target: She will about uttering various laminations; for my sons are incapable of flying or rising up in the air.

source: ऊषुस्ततस्तत्र महानुभावा नारायणस्थानगताः समग्रा:। कुबेरकान्तां नलिनी विशोकाः सम्पश्यमानाः सुरसिद्धजुष्टाम्॥
target: Then arriving at the place of Narayana, all those high-souled men, devoid of sorrow, began to dwell there, beholding the beloved lake of Kubera, frequented by the celestials and he Siddhas.

source: कृत्वा कर्मातिसाध्वेतदशक्यममितप्रभः। समायातः स्वमात्मानं महाभागो महाद्युति॥
target: That Supreme God of immeasurable sheen, that great refuge of all blessings, having performed a most difficult task that cannot be accomplished by others, has returned to his own pure nature.

source: रक्षसां रुवतां रावं श्रुत्वा हरिहयानुजः। तिर्यगास्थाय संक्रुद्धः पक्षीशे भगवान्हरिः॥ पराङ्मुखोऽप्युत्ससर्ज मालेश्चक्रं जिघांसया।
target: Hearing the cheers of the Raksasa, Indra's younger brother, the reverend Hari, sitting on that lord of birds, albeit moved off from the scene of conflict, waxing enraged, from a desire of slaying (Mali) hurled his disc at him.

source: ततो हर्म्यतलस्था सा महार्हशयनोचिता। प्राच्यां दिशि समुद्यन्तं ददर्शादित्यमण्डलम्॥
target: And as she was seated on a costly bed in her room she beheld the sun's disc rising in the east.

source: सा हि दुर्योधनस्यासीन्मतिः कर्णस्य चोभयोः। अर्जुनस्य वधोपाये तेन द्वैधमकल्पयत्॥
target: Even this was what both Karna and Duryodhana had decided to be the means for bringing about the death of Arjuna; and for this they had planned the double encounter.

source: हंस उवाच एतत् कार्यममराः संश्रुतं मे धृतिः शमः सत्यधर्मानुवृत्तिः। ग्रन्धि विनीय हृदयस्य सर्वं प्रियाप्रिये चात्मसमं नयीत॥
target: The mendicant Rishi said O immortals, it has been heard by me that tranquility, self-control and the observance of true religion practiced until all the knots of one's heart be loosened bring for the agreeable and disagreeable to the level of one's own self.

source: स्पर्धमानस्तु पार्थेन सूतपुत्रोऽत्यमर्षणः। दुर्योधनं समाश्रित्य सोऽवमन्यत पाण्डवान्॥
target: The son of Suta (Karna), being jealous of Partha (Arjuna), always defied him and being supported by Duryodhana disregarded the Pandavas.

source: अमोघफलसंकल्पा: सुव्रताः सत्यवादिनः । ब्रह्मभूता नराः पुण्याः पुराणाः कुरुसत्तम॥
target: O the most exalted of the Kurus, the primary men had all their desires gratified, were given to virtuous deeds and were truthful, godly and pure.

source: संजय उवाच एवं संदर्शयन् कृष्णो रणभूमिं किरीटिने। स्वैः समेतः समुदितैः पाञ्चजन्यं व्यनादयत्॥
target: Sanjaya said Krishna, thus showing the field of battle to Kiriti (i.e., Arjuna who wore a coronet) blew his conch Panchajanya before the gladdened army (of the Pandavas).

source: देवैर्हि सम्भृतो दिव्यो रथो गाण्डीवधन्वनः। न स जेयो मनुष्येण मा स्म कृदूध्वं मनो युधि॥
target: By the gobs themselves in the heavenly car of the wielder of the Gandiva bow protected; he cannot be defeated by men; do not think in mind even of a fight with him.

source: तुतोष च यथावच्च पूजां प्राप्य युधिष्ठिरात्। सोऽर्चितः पाण्डवैः सर्वैर्महर्षिर्वेदपारगः। धर्मकामार्थसंयुक्तं पप्रच्छेदं युधिष्ठिरम्॥
target: He (Narada) was gratified by receiving the worship from Yudhishthira in proper form. Having been thus worshipped by all the Pandavas, the great Rishi, learned in the Vedas, spoke to Yudhishthira the following words on Dharma, Artha and Kama.

source: यदा न भावं कुरुते सर्वभूतेषु पापकम्। कर्मणा मनसा वाचा ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा॥
target: When one does not commit sin by any creature, in deed, thought, or word, one is then said to have attained to Brahma.

source: एवमुक्ते तु वचने सूतस्तस्य महामते। निमेषान्तरमात्रेण कृतवर्माणमभ्ययात्॥
target: Having said these words ) intelligent one! He proceeded towards Kritavarman in a moment.

source: सर्वथा हि मम भ्राता सनाथो वानरेश्वर। त्वया नाथेन सुग्रीव प्रश्रितेन विशेषतः॥
target: Having in especial, you endued with humility, my brother, O monarch of monkeys, is every way strong, O Sugriva.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य वानरेन्द्रस्यधीमतः। भीमसेनस्तदा वीरः प्रोवाचामित्रकर्षणः॥
target: Vaishampayana said : O chastiser foes, having heard these words of the intelligent monkey chief, the heroic Bhima thus spoke to him.

source: एवं स तपसा राजन् धृतराष्ट्रो महामनाः। योजयामास चात्मानं तांश्चाप्यनुचरांस्तदा॥
target: Thus the great Dhritarashtra set himself to the practice of penances, and all his followers also to the same course of conduct.

source: कथं त्वद्गमनार्थं मे वाणी वितरतेऽनघ। न ह्यहं त्वामृते वीर रतिं प्राप्नोमि कर्हिचित्॥
target: O sinless one, O hero, how can I give you permission to go? Without you my heart never feels any delight.

source: समुपानय कौन्तेयं युद्धायं मम केशव। मन्त्रसंवरणं कुर्वन् नित्यमेव परंतप॥
target: Bring here the son of Kunti for me to fight, O Keshava, for ever keeping this conversation secret, О chastiser of foes.

source: एवं भ्रष्टो दुरात्मा स देवराज्यादरिंदम। दिष्ट्या वर्धामहे शक्र हतो ब्राह्मणकण्टकः॥
target: The wicked-souled one was thus turned out of the kingdom of the gods, O you subduer of foes. It is lucky, O Shakra, that we are now on the ascendant and that thorn, of the Brahmanas, has been killed.

source: हयपत्तिलताकीर्णं गाहमानो महायशाः। व्यचरत्तत्र गोविन्दो रथेनातिपताकिना॥
target: Cavalry and infantry were its creepers. And the illustrious Keshava, as he entered that forest on that car adorned with many banners and pennons, shone exceedingly resplendent.

source: मात्रा चात्र समादिष्टो निषादान्भक्षयेति ह। न च मे तृप्तिरभवद्भक्षयित्वा सहस्रशः॥
target: My mother commanded me to eat the Nishadas. I have eaten thein by thousands, but my hunger is not appeased.

source: ततो मद्राधिपं दृष्ट्वा तव पुत्राः पराङ्मुखम्। सनागपत्त्यश्वरथाः समकम्पन्त मारिष॥
target: Thereupon your sons-seeing the king of the Madras turn back from the field of battle, O Sire, began to tremble supported though they were by elephant, infantry, cavalry and cars.

source: तावन्योन्यं जिघृक्षन्तौ हरिराक्षसपार्थिवौ। प्रयत्नवन्तौ तत्कर्म ईहतुर्बलदर्पितौ॥
target: Thereupon the king of monkeys and the lord of Rākşasas, proud of strength, essayed to catch one another.

source: तं दृष्ट्वा निहतं भूमौ राक्षसेन्द्रमकम्पनम्। व्यथिता राक्षसाः सर्वे क्षितिकम्प इव दुमाः॥
target: Seeing that foremost of Rākşasas-Akampanaslain (and lying) on the ground, the Raksasa were extremely aggrieved, and (appeared)like trees in an earthquake.

source: पुनर्नरो म्रियते जायते च पुनर्नरो हीयते वर्धते च। पुनर्नरो याचति याच्यते च पुनर्नरः शोचति शोच्यते च॥
target: A man again and again both dies and is born; a man again and again withers and grows; a man again and again asks and is asked; and a man again and again laments and is lamented for.

source: ततः प्रववृते युद्धं व्यतिपक्तरथद्विपम्॥ तावकानां परेषां च निजतामितरेतरम्।
target: Then commenced the battle between your troops and the foes; all struck at one another; elephants and cars mixed up in one confusion.

source: शतं चाप्सरस: कन्या रमयन्त्यपि तं नरम्। आर्तो वा व्याधितो वापि गच्छेदनशनं तु यः॥
target: A hundred Apsaras of the most beautiful features, wait upon, and sport with him.

source: भीष्म उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। सरितां चैव संवादं सागरस्य च भारत॥
target: Bhishma said-Regarding it is cited the old story of the discourse between the Ocean and the Rivers.

source: भूस्थैः स्वःस्थैर्दिविष्ठैश्च भूतैरुच्चावचैरपि। गङ्गा विगाह्या सततमेतत् कार्यतमं सताम्॥
target: Creatures who live on Earth, in the sky or in the celestial region indeed, even beings who are very superior, should always bathe in Ganga. Indeed, this is the foremost of all duties of the righteous.

source: स सालवृक्षमासाद्य समुत्पाट्य च वानरः। तावुभौ राक्षसौ वीरौ जघान पवनात्मजः॥
target: Then getting at and uprooting a sāla tree, that monkey, the Wind-god's offspring, slew both of those heroic Rākşasas.

source: शिष्य उवाच उपाध्यायस्य मे वक्त्राद् यथा वाक्यं विनिःसृतम् नैव जातु भवेन्मिथ्या तथा जीवति सत्यवान्॥
target: The disciple of Gautama said : The words that have come out of the mouth of my preceptor can never be false. Therefore, Satyavana is (surely) alive.

source: यथा यथा हि सद्वृत्तमालम्बन्तीतरे जनाः। तथा तथा सुखं प्राप्य प्रेत्य चेह च मोदते।॥
target: Wherever persons of the lowest caste follow the conduct of the good, they succeed in acquiring happiness on account of which they are able to pass their time in happiness both in this world and the next.

source: इन्द्रियाणीह सर्वाणि स्वे स्वे स्थाने यथाविधि। अनीशत्वात् प्रलीयन्ते सर्पा हतविषा इव॥
target: On account of their inability to act without their director, the senses, during slumber, all become extinguished in their respective places like snakes shorn of poison.

source: मम चैवानुजा साध्वी ऊर्मिला शुभदर्शना। भार्यार्थे लक्ष्मणस्यापि दत्ता पित्रा मम स्वयम्॥
target: And my father bestowed on Lakşmaņa for his wife, my younger sister, the beauteous and chaste Urmila.

source: ते हयान्काञ्चनापीडान्ध्वजश्चिशीविषोपमान्। आप्लुत्य दशनैस्तीक्ष्णैर्भीमकोपा व्यदारयन्॥
target: And, fired with terrible wrath, they, bounding up, with their sharp tecih tore up steeds caparisoned in gold, and standards resembling venomous serpents. *i.e. the monkeys, as appears from the context.

source: तस्मादस्य निवृत्त्यर्थं यत्नमेवाचरेद् बुधः। उपेक्षा नात्र कर्तव्या शतशाखः प्रवर्धते॥
target: He that is wise should certainly prevent the coming of re-birth. One should not neglect it, for indifference may subject us to it repeatedly.

source: सर्वे सम्भूय सहिता ह्यस्य नागस्य बान्धवाः। भ्रातरस्तनया भार्या ययुस्तं ब्राह्मणं प्रति॥
target: All the kinsmen and relatives of the great Naga, including his brothers and children and wife, assembling together, went to the spot where the Brahmana was living.

source: ते तु वृक्षैर्महावीरा राक्षसानां चमूमुखे।॥ कदनं सुमहच्चनुर्लीलया हरिपुंगवाः। ममन्थू राक्षसान्सर्वे नानाप्रहरणैर्भृशम्॥
target: And those foremost of monkeys and redoubtable able warriors without much ado began to spread quite a carnage in the van of the Rākşasa army, and by means of various arms terribly beat the Rākşasas.

source: तमेकं रथवंशेन महता पर्यवारयन्। विकर्षन्तश्च चापानि विसृजन्तश्च सायकान्॥
target: Then with a mighty host of cars, they surrounded that single-handed hero, stretching their bows and discharging their arrows right and left.

source: उष्णमश्रु विमुञ्चन्तस्तं विहाय महीपतिम्। ययुर्नागपुरं तूर्णं सर्वमादाय तद् धनम्॥
target: They shed hot tears to leave the king. They left that forest and went to Hastinapur, taking all the wealth with them.

source: इमां च मालामाधत्स्व दिव्यां सुग्रीव काञ्चनीम्। उदारा श्रीः स्थिता ह्यस्यां सम्प्रजह्यान्मृते मयि॥
target: O Sugrīva, do you put on this celestial golden garland-herein dwelleth the bounteous Sree who shall renounce me after my death.

source: प्रवासं यदि मे याति भर्ता कार्येण केनचित्। मङ्गलैर्बहुभिर्यक्ता भवामि नियता तदा॥
target: When my husband leaves home for going to a distant place on any errand, I remained at home engaged in various kinds of auspicious deeds for blessing his enterprise.

source: ततस्तथेत्युवाचैनं रावणं ताटकासुतः। ततो रावणमारीचौ विमानमिव तं रथम्॥ आरुह्याययतुः शीघ्रं तस्मादाश्रममण्डलात्।
target: Thereupon Tārakā's son assented to Rāvana's words, and both of them ascending the chariot like to a heavenly car set out for the hermitage.

source: इत्युक्त्वा प्रययौ तत्र यतो वृत्तं नराधिप। ततः प्रभामयी देवी शरीरात् तस्य निर्ययौ॥
target: Having said these words, Power went away where good works had gone. After this, a goddess of great effulgence came out of Prahlada's person.

source: तस्य भूमौ शयानस्य पादौ प्रक्षाल्य लक्ष्मणः। सभार्यस्य ततोऽभ्येत्य तस्थौ वृक्षमुपाश्रितः॥
target: On Rāma having lain down on the ground along with his wife, Lakşmaņa washed their feet, and then remained stationed under the tree.

source: अध्यर्धकायसंपन्नमितरेणाप्रकाशता। स पुत्रः क्रोधसंरब्धः शशापैनामिति श्रुतिः॥
target: As an embryo with the upper part developed, but the lower part undeveloped. Thereupon the child grew angry and cursed its mother, saying,

source: भीष्म उवाच ततस्तेन कृतातिथ्यः सोऽतिथिः शत्रुसूदन। उवास किल तां रात्रिं सह तेन द्विजेन वै॥
target: Bhishma continued Hospitably treated by that Brahmana, the learned guest, O destroyer of enemies, passed that night in the company of his host.

source: यो गोशतं कनकशृङ्गमयं ददाति विप्राय वेदविदुषे च बहुश्रुताय। पुण्यां च भारतकथां शृणुयाच्च नित्यं तुल्यं फलं भवति तस्य च तस्य चैव।। ३९३।
target: He who gives to a Brahmana, learned in the Vedas and other sciences, one hundred cows with their horns plated with gold and he who listens, daily to the sacred histories of the Bharata, gain equal merit.

source: तत्र सर्वाणि तीर्थानि पुण्यान्यायतनानि च। अभिगम्य महाबाहुरभ्यगच्छन्महीपतिम्॥
target: O king seeing all Tirthas and other holy places, the mighty-armed hero went.

source: स्वयंप्रभाभिर्नारीभिर्विमानस्थो महीयते॥ रुद्रदेवर्षिकन्याभिः सततं चाभिपूज्यते।
target: Those ladies the daughters of the celestial Rishis and the Rudras, worship him with veneration.

source: धनंजयवियोगाच्च राज्यभ्रंशाच्च दुःखिताः। अथ भीमो महाबाहुर्युधिष्ठिरमभाषत॥
target: Thereupon the heroic Bhima, afflicted with sorrow for the separation of Dhananjaya and the loss of kingdom, addressed Yudhishthira in the following terms.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच मा भूदियं तव प्रज्ञा कथमेवं सुयोधन। यदाभिमन्युं बहवो जघ्नुर्युधि महारथाः॥
target: Yudhishthira said How is it, O Duryodhana, that you had not this knowledge when many great car-warriors, in a body, killed Abhimanyu in battle.

source: अथात्र नारायणगीतमार्छ महर्षयस्तात महानुभावाः। महार्थमत्यन्ततपःप्रयुक्तं तदुच्यमानं हि मया निबोध॥
target: Regarding it, the illustrious and great Rishis cite a verse sung by Narayana himself, highly important and endued with high ascetic merit. Hear me as I repeat it.

source: ते समासाद्य मां रौद्रा बहुधा मर्मभेदिनः। अकम्पयन् महावेगाः सर्पानलविषोपमाः॥
target: Those fierce arrows, which were like flames and poisonous serpents coming from several sides, caused me to tremble at their great force and pierced my very vitals.

source: महान्तो यत्र विविधा मणिकाञ्चपर्वताः। विमानानि च रम्याणि रत्नानि विविधानि च॥
target: Around it there were many hills and mounts of jewels and gems. Many beautiful cars and heaps of jewels also were seen there.

source: राजतं कमलाक्षस्य विद्युन्मालिन आयसम्। त्रयस्ते दैत्यराजानस्त्रील्लोकानस्त्रतेजसा॥ आक्रम्य तस्थुरूचुश्च कश्च नाम प्रजापतिः।
target: And the other made of silver had been in the possession of Kamalaksha; and the third of black iron belonged to Vidyunmalin. And those three Dailya inonarchs immediately attacked the three worlds with the aid of their prowess and continued to reside; they said also these words, who is that one called Prajapati। (or the creator).

source: अहंकारस्य च त्यागः प्रमादस्य च निग्रहः। संतोषश्चैकचर्या च कूटस्थं श्रेय उच्यते॥
target: The absence of pride, the suppression of carelessness, contentment, living by one's own self,-these form the supreme excellence.

source: बाल्यदिह त्वं त्यजसि वसु वैश्रवणो यथा) अयत्नेनैव राधेय द्रष्टास्यद्य धनजयम्॥
target: Foolishly you are giving away your wealth as if you are Vaisravana, the king of riches. Without any trouble, O son of Radha, you will see Dhananjaya today.

source: तमन्तकमिव क्रुद्धमापतन्तं यतव्रतम्। दृष्टा सम्प्राद्रवन् योधाः पाण्डवस्य ततस्ततः॥
target: Beholding that one of regulated vows rush at them like the god of Death enraged, all the warriors of the Pandavas sped on all directions.

source: सद्यो वर्धयति प्राणान् पुष्टिमय्यां दधाति च। न भक्ष्योऽभ्यधिकः कश्चिन्मांसादस्ति परंतप॥
target: Meat quickly increases strength. It ordains great development. There is no food. O scorcher of enemies, that is superior to meat.

source: देवगन्धर्वकन्याश्च नागकन्याश्च तास्ततः। परिवार्य दशग्रीवं प्रविशुस्ता गृहोत्तमम्॥
target: And encircling Rāvana those daughters of celestials Gandharvas and Nāgas, entered into an excellent abode.

source: को हि शस्त्रविदां मुख्यो महेश्वरसमो युधि। शत्रु न क्षपयेच्छक्तो यो न स्याद् गौतमीसुतः॥
target: What person is there, O son of Goutama's daughter, who though capable yet would not destroy my enemies, besides you that are the foremost of those that wield weapons and are equal to Maheshvara himself in battle.

source: शणसर्जरसंव्यक्तमानीय गृहकर्मणि। मुञ्जबल्वजवंशादि द्रव्यं सर्वं घृतोक्षितम्॥ शिल्पिभिः सुकृतं ह्याप्तैर्विनीतैर्वेश्मकर्मणि। विश्वस्तं मामयं पापो दग्धुकामः पुरोचनः॥ तथा हि वर्तते मन्दः सुयोधनवसे स्थितः। इमां तु तां महाबुद्धिर्विदुरो दृष्टवांस्तथा॥ आपदं तेन मां पार्थं स सम्बोधितवान् पुरा। ते वयं बोधितास्तेन नित्यमस्मद्धितैषिणा॥ पित्रा कनीयसा स्नेहाद् बुद्धिमन्तोऽशिवं गृहम्। अनार्यैः सुकृतं गूढैर्दुर्योधनवशानुगैः॥
target: By the help of trusted and well skilled artisans, the enemies have nicely built this house with hemp, health, straw and Purochana desires to burn me after inspiring me with confidence. The wicked man, therefore, lives here, obedient to (the instruction of) Duryodhana. The greatly intelligent Vidura, knew this danger. Therefore, O son of Pritha, he told me of it beforehand. Knowing this, that well-wiser of ours. The younger brother of our father, out of affection for us, has told us about this house, so full of danger and constructed by the wretches under Duryodhana (who is) acting secretly (from behind).

source: अहं चापि प्रतिज्ञां तां गुरोः समनुपालयन्। वनमद्यैव यास्यामि स्थिरीभव मनस्विनि॥
target: To day shall I repair to the forest for redeeming my father's vows; do you, Oh high minded one, live here in undisturbed mind.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच केन वृत्तेन वृत्तज्ञ वर्तमानो महीपतिः। सुखेनार्थान् सुखोदर्कानिह च प्रेत्य चाप्नुयात्॥
target: Yudhishthira said By following what conduct, O you who are a master of every kind of behaviour, can a king succeed in easily acquiring, both in this world and in the next, objects which yield happiness in the end?

source: ततो रेणुः समुद्भूतः सपत्रबहुलो महान्। पृथिवीं चान्तरिक्षं च द्यां चैव सहसाऽऽवृणोत्॥
target: Thereupon clouds of dust with innumerable dry leaves rose and suddenly covered the earth, the atmosphere and the sky,

source: अयं कौन्तेय कामस्ते नचिरात् समुपस्थितः। योत्स्यसे हि मया सार्धमद्य द्रक्ष्यसि मे बलम्॥
target: Your wish O son of Kunti, is about to be fulfilled. You will fight with me today and see my prowess.

source: पुत्रकामो हि पुत्रार्थं यां वृणीते विशाम्पते। क्षेत्रजं तु प्रमाणं स्यान्न वै तत्रात्मजः सुतः॥
target: When a man, desiring to have a son, marries a girl quick with child, the son born of his wife must belong to him, for it is the fruit of his own soil. The person from whose vital seed the son has sprung, can have no right to such son.

source: नारदेनाभ्यनुज्ञात: शुको द्वैपायनात्मजः। अभिवाद्य पुनर्योगमास्थायाकाशमाविशत्॥
target: Bhishma said Having received the order of Naradas, Shuka the son of the Island-born Vyasa saluted the celestial Rishi and once more set himself to Yoga and entered the element of ether.

source: नानाशस्त्रौघबहुलां शस्त्रावृष्टिं समुद्यताम्। व्यधमत् समरे राजा महाभ्राणीव मारुतः॥
target: Like the wind scattering masses of clouds, the king of the Madras, in that battle, dispersed the shower of arrows and various other weapons.

source: ब्रह्मवध्यामिमामद्य भवतः शासनाद् वयम्। ग्रहीष्यामस्त्रिलोकेश मोक्षं चिन्तयतां भवान्॥
target: We are willing, O lord of the three worlds, to take at your order this sin of Brahmancide. May you point out the means of our rescue.

source: संजय उवाच भीष्पद्रोणकृपद्रौणिकर्णर्जुनजानर्दनान्। समाप्तविद्यान् धनुषि श्रेष्ठान् यान् मन्यसे रथान्॥
target: Sanjaya said You raged Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, the son of Drona, Karna, Arjuna and Janardana to be well versed in the knowledge of weapons and also to be the foremost of all bowmen and again, the best of car-warriors.

source: ते वध्यमाना गन्धर्वाः पाण्डवेन महात्मना। भूमिष्ठमन्तरिक्षस्थाः शरवर्षैरवाकिरन्॥
target: As the Gandharvas were killed by the illustrious Pandava, they hurled a heavy shower of weapons on Arjuna who was on earth.

source: अतिप्रवृत्ते दुर्मेधे कैकेयि कुलपांसनि। वञ्चयित्वा तु राजानं न प्रमाणेऽवतिष्ठसि॥
target: O you whose desires outrun your sense of honour, O you of perverted understanding, O befouler of your line, deceiving the monarch, you stay not within the pale of the promise.

source: देवताश्च विकर्मस्थं पातयन्ति नराधमम्। व्याजेन विन्दन् वित्तं हि धर्मात् स परिहीयते॥
target: The gods will punish such men when they happen to be vile and guilty of wicked practices. The king, who replenishes his treasury by fraudulent means, certainly deviates from the path of righteousness.

source: तथैव तपसोपेताः स्वाध्यायाभ्यसने रताः। दातारो यज्ञशीलाश्च न तरन्ति जरान्तकौ॥
target: Likewise, persons endued with ascetic merit, devoted to study of the Vedas, practising charity and frequently celebrating sacrifices. cannot escape the hands of decrepitude and death.

source: स तथा शल्यमामन्त्र्य पुनरायात् स्वकं पुरम्। शल्यो जगाम कौन्तेयानाख्यातुं कर्म तस्य तत्॥
target: Vaishampayana said And having thus done honour to Shalya, he came back to his own capital while Shalya went to the sons of Kunti to tell them of that act of Duryodhana's.

source: मार्कण्डेय उवाच इत्युक्तः पितृराजस्तां भगवान् स्वचिकीर्षितम्। यथावत् सर्वमाख्यातुं तत्प्रियार्थं प्रचक्रमे॥
target: Markandeya said : Thus addressed by her, the divine lord of the Pitris, in order to please her, began faithfully to relate everything about his intentions.

source: तस्य श्रावस्तको ज्ञेयः श्रावस्ती येन निर्मिता। श्रावस्तकस्य दायादो बृहदश्वो महाबलः॥
target: From this Shravasta, the city called Shravasti was founded. The son of Shravasta was the greatly powerful Brihadashva.

source: सारथिं पञ्चभिर्बाणै राजन् विव्याध संयुगे। तं निवार्य शरैस्तूर्णं धृष्टद्युम्नो महारथः॥
target: Pierced the latter's charioteer, O foremost of the Bharatas, with five arrows. Then the mighty car-warrior Dhistadyumna checking Drona by means of his arrows.

source: याः क्रियाः प्रचरिष्यन्ति प्रवृत्तिफलसत्कृताः॥ आभिराप्यायितबला लोकान् वै धारयिष्यथा
target: Indeed, receiving strength from those rites and observances that will be in vogue in the several worlds, originating from the fruits of action, do ye continue to uphold the affairs of those worlds.

source: वासुदेव उवाच उपपन्नमिदं वाक्यं कौरवाणां धुरन्धरे। महावीर्ये महासत्त्वे स्थिरे सर्वार्थदर्शिनि॥
target: Vasudeva said Your words become you only who are the foremost of Kuru's race, who are endued with great energy, who are of great soul, and who are possessed of great patience and conversant with every subject.

source: तावन्योन्यं महाराज समासाद्य महाहवे। अन्योन्यवेगाभिहतौ निपेततुररिंदमौ॥ ततः स्वरथमारोप्य पौरवं तनयस्तव। जयत्सेनो रथेनाजावपोवाह रणाजिरात्॥
target: Then, O mighty monarch, those two subduers of foes, rushing against one another in that fierce combat, fell down, overthrown by one another's velocity. Thereupon your son Jayatsena taking up the descendant of Puru carried him away from the field of battle on his own vehicle.

source: ते गजा विशिखैस्तीक्ष्णैर्युधि गाण्डीवचोदितैः। अनेकशतसाहस्रः सर्वाङ्गेषु समर्पिताः॥
target: The elephants were pierced on every part of their bodies with the arrows of keen points shot by hundreds and thousands from the bow Gandiva.

source: संजयो मुनिकल्पस्तु जज्ञे सुतो गवल्गणात्। सूर्याच्च कुन्तिकन्याया जज्ञे कर्णो महाबलः॥
target: The Suta, Sanjaya, who was like a Rishi, was begot by Gavalgana and the greatly powerful Karna was begot by Surya of Kunti when she was a maid.

source: बाणजालावृत्ते व्योम्नि च्छादिते च दिवाकरे। न स्म सम्पतते भूम्यां किंचिदप्यन्तरिक्षगम्॥
target: When the firmament was thus closed with the net-work of arrows and the sun was covered over with them, none of the rovers of the sky descended upon the earth.

source: ततस्तं लोभयामास कामं ब्रूहीति तक्षकः। स एवमुक्तस्तं प्राह काश्यपस्तक्षकं पुनः॥
target: Thereupon Takshaka, in order to tempt him, said, “Tell me what is your desire.” and Kashyapa replied to Takshaka.

source: ते तु रामेण बाणौधैः सर्वमर्मसु ताडिताः। युद्धादपसृतास्तत्र सावशेषायुषोऽभवन् ॥
target: And, pierced in their vitals with Rama's shafts, they, having only their lives left to them, disappeared from the field.

source: अश्मपृष्ठे गयायां च निरविन्दे च पर्वते। तृतीयां क्रौञ्चपद्यां च ब्रह्महत्यां विशुध्यते॥
target: Bathing in Ashmaprishtha and Niravinda mountains and Kraunchapadi all three in Gayaone becomes purged of the sin of Brahmanicide. A bath in the first place purifies one of a single Brahmanicidele; bath in the second cleanness one of two similar offences; and a bath in the third cleanses one of three such offences.

source: प्रशाधि पृथिवीं देवीं प्रजा धर्मेण पालयन्॥ सपर्वतवनद्वीपां मा राजन् विमना भव।
target: Protecting your subjects righteously, rule over the goddess Earth with her mountains and forests and islands. Do not, O king, become disspirited.

source: देवैरपि न शक्यस्त्वं परिज्ञातुं कुतो मया। त्वयि सर्वेस्म दृश्यन्ते भावा ये जगति स्थिताः॥
target: At the universal dissolution, everything once more enters thee. Thou art incapable of being known by the celestials, how then canst thou be known by me?

source: तत्रापि राजा प्रीतात्मा यथादिष्टमथाकरोत्। ततोऽस्य भगवान् प्रीतो बभूव मुनिसत्तमः॥
target: At this deed also, king Kushika showed no mark of dissatisfaction. He did as the Rishi ordered. Seeing all this, that illustrious and best of ascetics became pleased.

source: शूद्रास्तु मन्दगा नित्यं पुरुषा धर्मशीलिनः॥ न तत्र राजा राजेन्द्र न दण्डो न च दण्डिकः।
target: The Mandagas are all brave Shudras and they are all virtuous. O king, in these countries, there is no king, no punishment, and no person who deserves to be punished.

source: यत्रैतदमृतं चापि स्थापितं कुशसंस्तरे। तद्विज्ञाय हृतं सर्पाः प्रतिमाया कृतं च तत्॥
target: They saw that the Kusha grass on which the Ambrosia had been placed was empty. It had been taken away by a counter act of deception.

source: भीष्म उवाच प्रविश्य स महारण्यं तापसानामथाश्रमम्। आससाद ततो राजा श्रान्तचोपाविशत् तदा।॥
target: Bhishma said Having entered that large forest, the king arrived at an asylum of ascetics. Worn out with toil, he sat himself down for rest.

source: शतघ्नीभिः सुघोराभिः परिघैश्च परश्वधैः। मुद्गरैर्मुसलैः प्रासैः क्षेपणीयैश्च सर्वशः॥
target: Then with terrible Shataghnis, with bludgeons, battle-axes, maces, mallets, thick short clubs, and lances, and other missiles,

source: जयन्तो हन्यमाना वा प्राप्तुमर्हाम सद्गतिम्। राक्षसे जीवमानेऽद्य रविरस्तमियाद् यदि॥
target: We should gain the blessed state, either by defeating the foe or by being killed by him. If the sun sets today and the Rakshasa remains alive.

source: शकुनिरुवाच यामेतामतुलां लक्ष्मी दृष्टवानसि पाण्डवे। तस्याः प्राप्तावुपायं मे शृणु सत्यपराक्रम॥
target: Shakuni said O hero whose prowess is truth, hear the means by which you can obtain the matchless prosperity that you have seen in the Pandava.

source: न खल्वप्यरसज्ञस्य कामः क्वचन जायते। संस्पर्शाद् दर्शनाद् वापि श्रवणाद् वापि जायते।॥
target: One who has not experienced the enjoyment of a certain object, never feels a desire for that object. Desires originate from the actual experience of the pleasures that touch, or sight, or hearing gives.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच श्रुतेन श्रोत्रियो भवति तपसा विन्दते महत्। धृत्या द्वितीयवान् भवति बुद्धिमान् वृद्धसेवया॥
target: Yudhishthira said : By the Shruti (i.e. the study of the Vedas) one becomes learned. By asceticism one attains to what is very exalted. Intelligence makes one have a second. Ministration to the old makes one wise.

source: अब्रुवश्च महाराज सर्वाः सास्राविलेक्षणाः। स्वस्रीयो वासुदेवस्य मृतो जात इति प्रभो॥
target: All of them, with eyes rendered muddy by tears, repeatedly explained, saying, Alas, the son of Vasudeva's nephew has been born dead.

source: न तु त्वं धर्ममुद्दिश्य तस्य वा प्रियकारणात्। एतद् दित्ससि कृष्णाय सत्येनात्मानमालभे॥
target: For the sake of virtue or for desire of pleasing him however you do not give all this to Krishna; and I speak truly that you do this for the gain of yourself.

target: He who is the younger brother of Indra. He who took birth as a dwarf, He who is tall. He whose acts are never futile. He who cleanses. He who is gifted with preeminent energy and strength. He who upholds His self in the same form without being ever subject to birth, growth, or death. He who sustains all creatures in creatures in their respective functions in the universe. source: त्वच्छोकविमुखो रामो देवि सत्येन ते शपे। रामे शोकाभिभूते तु लक्ष्मणः परितप्यते॥
target: My revered one, I swear to you by truth itself that Rāma neglect every business because of grief for you. And Rāma being over-whelmed with woe, Laksmana burn in grief.

source: संगच्छ शूलमादाय पाशहस्त इवान्तकः। वानरानराजपुत्रौ च भक्षयादित्यतेजसौ॥
target: Go forth, grasping your spear, like the noosehanded Destroyer himself. Do you devour up the monkeys as well as the princes possessed of the energy of the Sun himself.

source: तस्याश्वानातपत्रं च ध्वजं सूतमथो धनुः। निपात्य नकुलः संख्ये शङ्ख दध्मौ प्रतापवान्॥
target: But the mighty Nakula, cutting dowii, in the battle, Shalya's steeds, umbrella, standard, charioteer and bow, blew his conch.

source: तस्मात् संहर कल्याणि प्रजाः सर्वाश्चतुर्विधाः। धमः सनातनश्च त्वां सर्वथा पावयिष्यति॥
target: Therefore, O blessed lady, destroy these four kinds of creatures. Eternal virtue shall always be yours.

source: गच्छामुष्मिन् वनोद्देशे ब्राह्मणो मां प्रतीक्षते। अन्नार्थी तं त्वमन्नेन समांसेनोपपादय॥
target: Go at once to the forest where a Brahmana is waiting for me in the hope of getting food. Go and entertain him with food and meat.

source: ततोऽहं तस्य तद् वाक्यं श्रुत्वा वज्रमुदीरयम्। देवराजस्य दयितं भीममस्त्रं नराधिप॥
target: Then, O lord of men, hearing these words of his, I let go that favourite weapon of the king of the celestials, the terrible Vajra (thunderbolt).

source: तौ शूरौ समरे राजन् परस्परकृतागसौ। परस्परमुदीक्षेतां क्रोधादुद्दृत्य चक्षुषी॥
target: In the field of battle, O monarch, those two heroic warriors committed injuries to each other. They also looked upon each other.

source: छत्रैराभरणैर्वस्त्रैर्माल्यैश्च ससुगन्धिभिः। हारैः किरीटैर्मुकुटैरुष्णीषैः किङ्किणीगणैः॥
target: With umbrellas, with ornaments, garments and perfumeries with chains and diadems and crowns and headgears and with tinkling bells.

source: अन्यया यौवने मयों बुद्ध्या भवति मोहितः। मध्येऽन्यया जरायां तु सोऽन्यां रोचयते मतिम्॥
target: A man, in youth, had one kind of understanding. In middle age, he has not the same, and in the period of decay, a different kind of understanding prevails in him.

source: यथा दुर्योधनो वाच्यो यथा शान्तनवो नृपः। धृतराष्ट्रो यथा वाच्यो द्रोणश्च रथिनां वरः॥
target: How Duryodhana is to be addressed, how the king Shantanva, how Dhritarashtra and how Drona, the best among the charioteers, tell him what he is to say.

source: श्रूयतां विस्तरो राम सगरस्य महात्मनः। शंकरश्वशुरो नाम्ना हिमवानिति विश्रुतः॥ विन्ध्यपर्वतमासाद्य निरीक्षेते परस्परम्। तयोर्मध्ये समभवद् यज्ञः स पुरुषोत्तम ॥
target: Do you, O Rāma, hearken to the story of the high-souled Sagara's sacrifice. Sankara's fatherin-law is the far-famed Himavat. And approaching each other, the Himavat and the vindhya behold each other. And on the region lying between them took place, O foremost of men, that sacrifice of Sagara's.

source: शरभं पृष्ठसोवर्णं नकुलस्य महाध्वजम्। अपश्याम रथेऽत्युग्रं भीषयाणमवस्थितम्॥
target: For striking terror into the hearts of the enemy, we saw that tall and fierce standard of Nakula, mounted on his car, that bore the device of Sharabha having golden back.

source: भीष्म उवाच श्रेयो वै याचतः पार्थ दानमाहुरयाचते। अर्हत्तमो वै धृतिमान् कृपणादधृतात्मनः॥
target: Bhishma said It has been said, O son of Pritha, that a gift made to an unsoliciting person yields greater merit than one made to a person who begs. One endued with contentment is certainly more deserving than that person who is shorn of that virtue and is, therefore, helpless amidst the storms and buffets of the world.

source: शरैरेकायनीकुर्वन् दिशः सर्वा यतव्रतः। जघान पाण्डवरथानादिश्य भरतर्षभ॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, showering continuous arrows in all directions, that hero of rigid vows (Bhishma) struck the Pandava warriors calling each by name.

source: विधूय कलुषं सर्वं विरजाः सम्मतः सताम्। लोके महीयते सद्भिर्यां ददाति वसुन्धराम्॥
target: That king who makes a gift of earth is purged off of every sin and, therefore, is pure and liked by the righteous. In this world he is highly honoured and praised by all righteous men.

source: अथ तासां वदन्तीनां परुषं दारुणं बहु। राक्षसीनामसौम्यानां रुरोद जनकात्मजा ॥
target: Those hideous Rākşasīs thus threatening her with reproaches rude and rough, the daughter of the king Janaka began to weep.

source: मेरोः सहस्रः स हि योजनानां द्वात्रिंशतोर्ध्वं कविभिनिरुक्तः। अनिन्द्रियाश्चानशनाश्च तत्र निष्पन्दहीनाः सुसुगन्धिनस्ते॥
target: The learned say that its distance from the mountains of Meru is greater than thirty-two thousands Yojanas. The inhabitants of that realin have no senses. They live without food. Their eyes are winkless. They always send forth excellent perfumes.

source: सुखं दान्तः प्रस्वपिति सुखं च प्रतिबुध्यते। सुखं पर्येति लोकांश्च मनश्चास्य प्रसीदति॥
target: The self-controlled man sleeps in happiness and awakes in happiness, and moves through the world in happiness. His mind is always cheerful.

source: न हि भार्येति विश्वासः कार्यः पुंसा कथंचन। न हि कार्यमनुध्याति नारी पुत्रवती सती॥
target: Men should never trust women, even if they be wedded wives. When women become mothers, they do not much care to serve their husbands.

source: ऋतुकाले तु सम्प्राप्ते भर्तृव्यसनकर्शिता। अकृतार्था ह्यहं भर्ता प्रसवार्थं समागता॥
target: On my season's coming, I was united with my husband in order to get offspring; but I have not been successful.

source: चिन्त्यमानं हि न व्येति भूयश्चापि प्रवर्धते। अनिष्टसम्प्रयोगाच विप्रयोगात् प्रियस्य च॥ मानुषा मानसैर्दुःखैर्दह्यन्ते चाल्पबुद्धयः।
target: By indulging in it, one cannot lesson it. On the other hand, it increases when being indulged in. When any evil or when bereavement of some dear one, comes on, only they that are of little intelligence allow their minds to be laden with grief.

source: कृते कर्मणि राजेन्द्र पूजयेद् धनसंचयैः। दानेन च यथार्हेण सान्त्वेन विविधेन च॥
target: Whenever any of his work is done the king should reward those who have helped in its accomplishment with wealth and other becoming presents and grateful speeches.

source: स त्वं भुक्ष्व महाराज सपुत्रः ससुहृज्जनः। नावबुध्यसि यद् राजन् वार्यमाणः सुहज्जनैः॥
target: Now, O mighty monarch, do you with your sons and relatives, taste that mortal fruit, in as much as, O king, you did not seem to be awakened though always warned by your wellwishers.

source: तमब्रवीत् ततो राजा प्रीयमाणः पुनः पुनः। द्रोणकर्णादिभिः सार्धं पर्याप्तोऽहं द्विषद्वधे॥
target: As also with their flesh. O foremost of kings, it behoves you to accord me your permission.” Thereupon king Duryodhana, highly gratified, repeatedly told these words to

source: गाण्डीव प्रहितान् घोरानद्य गात्रैः स्पृशञ्छरान्॥ कर्णः स्मरतु दुष्टात्मा वचनं द्रोणभीष्मयोः।
target: Let the wicked Karna feel the pangs of those deadly shafts sped from the Gandiva and remember the words of Bhishma and Drona.

source: एवमुक्तौ महात्मानावुभौ केशवपाण्डवौ। तावबूतां तदा कृष्णौ राजानं पृथिवीपतिम्॥
target: On his so delivered statement, Sri Krishna and Arjuna reciprocated the king in following words-

source: मतङ्ग सम्प्रधायँवं यदहं त्वामचूचुदम्। वृणीष्व काममन्यं त्वं ब्राह्मण्यं हि सुदुर्लभम्॥
target: Knowing this for certain, O Matanga that I say to you do you name some other boon, for the status of a Brahmana is incapable of being acquired by you.

source: वर्मिभिः सादिभिर्यत्तैः प्रासपाणिभिरास्थितैः। चामरापीडिनः सर्वे जाम्बूनदविभूषिताः॥
target: And accompanied by many foot soldiers cased in armours, armed with nooses and prepared to fight to the best of their abilities. Decked with Chamaras and adorned with golden caparisons.

source: अवधानेन सुभगे नित्योत्थिततयैव च। भर्तारो वशगा मह्यं गुरुशुश्रूषयैव च॥
target: O blessed lady, my husband has become obedient to me for my diligence, my alacrity and for the humility with which I serve my Gurus.

source: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच ये दानशीला न प्रतिगृह्यते सदा न चाप्यर्थोश्चाददते परेभ्यः। येषामदेयमर्हते नास्ति किंचित् सर्वातिथ्या: सुप्रसादा जनाश्च॥ ये क्षन्तारो नाभिजल्पन्ति चान्यान् सत्रीभूताः सततं पुण्यशीलाः। तथाविधानामेष लोको महर्षे परं गन्ता धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र॥
target: Dhritarashtra said Those men who always make gifts without receiving any gift, who never accept any service from others, who possess nothing which they cannot give to a worthy person, who are hospitable to all creatures, who are inclined to show favour to every one, who are of for giving dispositions, who never speak ill of others, who protect all creatures by covering them with mercy, and who are always righteous in their conduct, only those men, O great Rishi, go to such regions. I shall go to a higher region. Indeed, Dhritarashtra shall not go there.

source: अयं वसिष्ठो भगवान् ब्राह्मणैः सह तिष्ठति। क्षिप्रमाज्ञाप्यतां राजन् राघवस्याभिषेचनम्॥
target: And the worshipful Vasiştha stays with the Brāhmaṇas. Do you, O king, immediately order the installation of Rāma.

source: नदद्धिश्च महानागैर्हेषमाणैश्च वाजिभिः। भेरीशङ्खनिनादैश्च स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत्॥
target: The huge elephants roaring, the horses neighing and the bugles and conchs being sounded, there arose a great tumult.

source: स्वलंकृतमिदं वेश्म स्थूणस्यामितविक्रमाः। नोपसर्पति मां चैव कस्मादद्य स मन्दधीः॥
target: This mansion of Sthuna is well-adorned, O you (followers) of immeasurable powers. Why does not this fool, however, approach me?

source: अनुजानीहि मां सौम्य पूजितोऽस्मि विभीषण। मन्युर्न खलु कर्तव्यः सखे त्वां चानुमानये॥
target: Do you regard me, O Vibhīşaņa, O gentle one, as worshipped. O friend do you be not angry-I request you.

source: अन्योन्यं क्षोभयामासुः सैन्यानि नृपसत्तम। वध्यमानानि सैन्यानि समन्तात् तैर्महारथैः॥
target: Began, O best of the Bharatas, to afflict each other and the troops. The soldiers, (thus) terribly slaughtered by those great car-warriors.

source: यथोपजीविनां धेनुर्देवादीनां धरा स्मृता। तथोपजीविनां गङ्गा सर्वप्राणभृतामिह॥
target: As the Earth and the cow are said to be the chief sustenance of the celestials, so is Ganga the chief sustenance of all living creatures.

source: अथवा नायमुन्मादो मोहोऽप्युन्मादलक्षणः। सम्बुध्ये चाहमात्मानमिमं चापि वनौकसम्॥
target: No, it is not madness-for derangement of mind is the sign of madness, I have not lost sense and I do distinctly perceive me and the monkey.

source: शिष्योपाध्यायिकावृत्तिर्यत्र स्यात् सुसमाहिता। यथावच्छास्त्रसम्पन्ना कस्तं देशं परित्यजेत्॥
target: Who, however, will leave that place where exists fully that conduct between disciples and preceptors which is consistent with what has been sanctioned by the scriptures?

source: चोदयामास तस्यार्थे सा रामं विधिचोदिता। रामस्तस्याः प्रियं कुर्वन् धनुरादाय सत्वरः॥ रक्षार्थे लक्ष्मणं न्यस्य प्रययौ मृगलिप्सया।
target: Driven by destiny, Sita sent Rama in pursuit of him. And Rana (too) with a view to please her, soon taking up his bow and instructing Lakshmana to protect her, went in pursuit of that deer.

source: ततः स शैलाभिनिपातभग्नो महोदरस्तेन महाद्विपेन। व्यामोहितो भूमितले गतासुः पपात वज्राभिहतो यथाद्रिः॥
target: Struck by that mighty enemy, Mahodara, broken down by the impetus of that rock, deprived of his senses, dropped down dead on the ground, like a cliff smite with the thunderbolt.

source: सोऽहं तत्र गमिष्यामि यत्र सैन्धवको नृपः। यियासुर्यमलोकाय मम वीर्यं प्रतीक्षते॥
target: I shall now penetrate to the spot where the king of the Sindhus remains desirous of seeing a display of my prowess and of going to the domain of Yama. are

source: विश्वामित्रस्य विपुला नदी देवर्षिसेविता। कौशिकी च शिवा पुण्या ब्रह्मर्षिसुरसेविता॥
target: Vishvamitra had a large river, named Kaushiki, that was frequented by celestial Rishis. This sacred and suspicious river was frequented by the celestials and twiceborn Rishis.

source: पूजयन्तो महाराज पाण्डवा भरतर्षभम्। प्रणम्य शिरसा चैनं भीष्मं शरणमभ्ययुः॥
target: Then, O mighty monarch, the Pandavas, saluting that foremost of the Bharatas with their bent heads, sought his protection.

source: पुत्रपौत्रवधूभृत्यैराकीर्णमपि सर्वतः। भार्याहीनं गृहस्थस्य शून्यमेव गृहं भवेत्॥
target: A house-holder's home, even if filled with sons, grandsons daughters-in-law and servants, is regarded empty if there is no housewife.

source: क्रोधमुत्पतितं हित्वा सुशीलो वीतमत्सरः। अन्नदः प्राप्नुते राजन् दिवि चेह च यत्सुखम्॥
target: That man who, shorn of irrepressible anger and becoming righteous in nature and freed from malice, makes gifts of food, is sure to acquire happiness, O king, both in this world and in the next.

source: क्रोधितस्यु रणे पार्थो नाराचं कालसम्मितम्। द्रोणपुत्राय चिक्षेप कालदण्डमिवापरम्॥
target: with anger Filled with anger Partha discharged in that battle at Drona's son a Naracha like unto the very rod of Death.

source: सेयं पन्थानमावृत्य वसत्यत्यर्धयोजने॥ अत एव च गन्तव्यं ताटकाया वनं यतः। स्वबाहुबलमाश्रित्य जहीमां दुष्टचारिणीम्॥
target: And now at the distance of over half a Yojana, she stays, obstructing the way. And since this forest belong to Tāțakā, you should repair there; and, resorting to the might of your own arms, slay this one of wicked deeds.

source: शक्र उवाच अहं वै त्वां निधास्यामि यथाशक्ति यथाबलम्। न त मेऽतिक्रमः स्याद् स्याद् वै सदा लक्ष्मि तवान्तिके॥
target: Shakra said I shall give you habitations according to their strength and power in bearing you. As regards myself, I shall always take care, O Lakshmi, that I may not offend you in any way.

source: येषां मन्युर्मनुष्याणां क्षमयाभिहतः सदा। तेषां परतरे लोकास्तस्मात् क्षान्तिः परा मता॥
target: Those persons, whose anger is overpowered by forgiveness, attain to the higher regions; therefore forgiveness is considered the highest (virtue).

source: अहमुत्सादयिष्यामि शबूंस्तव महाबलान्। यदि शक्रो यदि यमो यदि पावकमारुतौ।॥ तानहं योधयिष्यामि कुबेरवरुणावपि।
target: I shall abolish your foes endowed with redoubted might. If even Śakra himself, and Yama, and the god of Fire, and the god of Wind, and Kubera, and Varuņa-shall range themselves against me, them shall I encounter in fight.

source: इमाञ्छकुनकान् राजन् हन्ति वैतंसिको यथा। एतद् रूपमधर्मस्य भूतेषु हि विहिंसता॥ कामाल्लोभाच्चधर्मस्य प्रकृति यो न पश्यति। स बध्यः सर्वभूतानां प्रेत्य चेह च दुर्मतिः॥
target: O king, as a fowler kills the birds, so does sin kill all the creatures of the world. He who, being misled by pleasure and covetousness, does not understand the nature of virtue, deserves to be killed by all. He becomes a wretch here and hereafter (after death).

source: ततोऽर्धरात्रसमये बालका मुनिदारकाः। वाल्मीके प्रियमाचख्युः सीतायाः प्रसवं शुभम्॥ भगवरामपत्नी सा प्रसूता दारकद्वयम्। ततो रक्षां महातेजः कुरु भूतविनाशिनीम्॥
target: In the midnight the Muni boys came to Vālmīki and communicated to him this auspicious intelligence, saying. “O illustrious Sir, the beloved spouse of Rāma has given birth to two sons; do you so protect them that evil spirits not injure them."

source: सा ह्यग्रे गच्छति तयोर्दम्पत्योर्हतपुत्रयोः। कर्यन्ती तौ ततस्ते तां दृष्ट्वा संन्यपतन भुवि॥
target: She was walking in advance of the childless old pair, and was dragging them forward. Seeing her, the Pandavas feel down on the earth.

source: न प्रकाशन्त वेश्मानि धूमरुद्धानि भारत। निहारसंवृतानीव वनानि गिरयस्तथा॥
target: Covered by that smoke, the places could no longer be seen, O Bharata. These resembled forests and hills overwhelmed by a thick frost.

source: न च शक्या रणे सर्वे निहन्तुममरैरपि। य एव तेषां शेषः स्यात् स एवास्मान् न शेषयेत्॥१६
target: Even the immortals cannot slay all of them in battle; so he that will survive the rest of them is sure to extirpate us all.

source: ततः प्रव्यथिताङ्गोऽसौ पुत्रशोकसमन्वितः। निवारितं नृपं दृष्ट्वा देवापिः संश्रितो वनम्॥
target: Devapi, too who was defective of one limb, seeing, that ruler of men with his heart pained and struck with grief for son, dissuaded from carrying out his intentions, went to the woods.

source: अन्योन्यमथ रज्यन्ते ह्यन्योन्यं चार्थजीविनः। अन्योन्यमाश्रयाः सर्वे तथान्योन्यानुवर्तिनः॥
target: They are attached to one another. They depend on one another. The have one another for their support. They likewise follow one another.

source: यान् सुपर्णाश्च गृध्राश्च विकर्षन्ति यतस्ततः। तेषां तु कर्मणा लोका भविष्यन्ति युधिष्ठिर॥
target: O Yudhishthira, will they obtain blissful regions by the merit of their deeds, they whose bodies are now being torn and dragged by vultures and other birds?'

source: पूर्वमर्थं प्रतिश्रुत्य प्रतिज्ञां हातुमिच्छसि। राघवाणामयुक्तोऽयं कुलस्यास्य विपर्यय॥
target: Having promised me first, you endeavour to renounce that proinise of yours. This surely is unworthy of a descendant of Raghu, and this can bring destruction upon the dynasty.

source: चातुर्वर्ण्यस्यैष धर्मस्तवोक्तो हेतुं चानुब्रुवतो मे निबोध। स्तं त्वं राजन् राजधर्मे नियुक्ष्वा॥
target: Such are the duties of the four orders told to you. Listen to the reason of my describing them. The son of Pandu (Yudhishthira) is falling from the duties of a Kshatriya; O king, you place him in a position to discharge the duties of a king.

source: इतश्चेतश्च पाण्डूनां समाजग्मुर्महात्मनाम्। अक्षौहिण्यस्तु सप्तैता विविधध्वजसंकुलाः॥ युयुत्समानाः कुरुभिः पाण्डवान् समहर्षयन्।
target: And from several directions came for the noble minded sons of Pandu seven Akshauhini carrying flags of various sorts. All of them were desirous a fight with the sons of Kuru and so caused the sons of Pandu to rejoice.

source: प्रयातौ तत्र राजेन्द्र यत्र शल्यो व्यवस्थितः। तौ तु प्रत्युद्ययौ राजन् राक्षसेन्द्रो ह्यलम्बुषः॥
target: Came to that spot, O king of kings, where Shalya was. Against them both, O king, advanced Alambusha, the lord of the Rakshasas. wide open

source: द्रव्यवन्तश्च शूराश्च शस्त्रज्ञाः शास्त्रपारगाः। कृच्छ्रास्वापत्सु सम्मूढान् गणाः संतारयन्ति ते॥
target: Having wealth and resources, and mastcred the scriptures and all the arts and sciences, the aristocracy rescue the ignorant masses from all sorts of distress and danger,

source: श्रीकृष्ण उवाच शाल्वस्य नगरं सौभं गतोऽहं भरतर्षभ। निहन्तुं कौरवश्रेष्ठ तत्र मे शृणु कारणम्॥ महातेजा महाबाहुर्यः स राजा महायशाः। दमघोषात्मजो वीरः शिशुपालो मया हतः॥ यज्ञे ते भरतश्रेष्ठ राजसूयेऽर्हणां प्रति। स रोषवशमापन्नो नामृष्यत दुरात्मवान्॥ श्रुत्वा तं निहतं शाल्वस्तीव्ररोषसमन्वितः। उपायाद् द्वारकां शून्यामिहस्थे मयि भारत॥
target: Srikrishna said : O Bharata chief, O foremost of the Kurus, I went to destroy the city of Shalva; listen to the reasons thereof. O foremost of the Bharatas, at the sacrifice of Rajasuya, the heroic son of Damaghosha, the highly effulgent, the mightyarmed and the illustrious king Shishupala was killed by me, for he could not bear to see the first worship offered to me. O descendant of Bharata, having heard of his destruction, Shalva, stricken with dreadful anger, went to the empty Dvarka, myself living here.

source: कदूश्च विनताचैव दाक्षायण्यौ विहायसा। आलोकयन्त्यावक्षोभ्यं समुद्र निधिमम्भसाम्॥
target: Kadru and Vinata, the daughters of Daksha, saw on their way the ocean, incapable of being easily disturbed.

source: सौतिरुवाच एवमस्त्विति तं वह्निः प्रत्युवाच पितामहम्। जगाम शासनं कर्तुं देवस्य परमेष्ठिनः॥
target: Sauti said: Agni then replied to the Grandfather, "Be it so" and he went away to obey the command of the Parameshthi (Supreme Lord).

source: धार्तराष्ट्रान् दशरथान् दशैव प्रत्यवारयन्। नानारूपाणि शस्त्राणि विसृजन्तो विशाम्पते॥१९॥
target: These ten warriors opposed the ten warriors of Duryodhana's hosts, discharging 0 monarch, weapons of diverse shape.

source: एकैकेन हि बाणेन भूमौ पातितवानहम्। हयांस्तेषां गजांश्चैव सारथींचाप्यहं रणे॥
target: By one arrow did I lay each to the ground with their horses, elephants, and drivers in battle.

source: सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्नाः साधुव्रतसमन्विताः। श्रुतवर्तोपपन्नाश्च नानाश्रुतिसमन्विताः॥ वृद्धानुशासने युक्ताः सत्यव्रतपरायणाः। समयं समयज्ञास्ते पालयन्तः शुचिव्रताः॥ क्षत्रधर्मरता नित्यं केशवानुगता: सदा। प्रवीरपुरुषास्ते वै महात्मानो महाबलाः। नावसीदितुमर्हन्ति उद्वहन्तः सतां धुरम्॥
