target: Gifted with all auspicious marks, observant of religious vows, well-read in the Vedas and intent upon the performance of various religious observances, (always) engaged in carrying out the orders of elderly men, of truthful vows, acquainted with the use of time, always satisfying their condition, pure, always performing the duties of the Kshatriya order, always following Keshava, those high-souled and highly powerful heroes.

source: योऽसौ पाथे व्यतिक्रान्तो मिषतस्ते महायुते। सर्वे ह्यद्यातुरं मन्ये नेदमस्ति बलं मम॥
target: O you of burning splendour, when Pritha's son has succeeded in penetrating through you division before your very eyes. I consider all my troops to be involved in a great catastrophy Indeed, I think I have no troops.

source: न क्वचित् साधु मन्येत नेमं तथानुशोचामि जीवितक्षयमात्मनः॥ मातरं पितरं चोभावनुशोचामि मद्वधे। तदेतन्मिथुनं वृद्धं चिरकालभृतं मया॥ मयि पञ्चत्वमापन्ने कां वृत्तिं वर्तयिष्यति। वृद्धौ च मातापितरावहं चैकेषुणा हतः॥ केन स्म निहताः सर्वे सुबालेनाकृतात्मना।
target: This can never be reckoned as righteous even like to violating the chastity of a preceptor's wife. I do not so much lament my end as I lament it on account of my father and mother. To what will the old couple, who have ever been maintained by me, betake themselves when I am gone? My father and mother are old, and I their only son is slain. What boy is it of uncontrolled senses that has killed us all?

source: इन्द्रविष्णुसमावेतौ मन्दात्मा नावबुद्ध्यते। संश्रयाद् द्रोणभीष्माभ्यां कर्णस्य च विकत्थनात्॥
target: They were like Indra and Vishnu seated together. That one of foolish intellect does not understand that owing to his belief in the power of Drona and Bhishma.

source: योगसंन्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसंछिन्नसंशयम्। आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनंजय॥
target: Actions, O Dhananjaya, do not fetter him, who is self-possessed, whose doubts have been removed by knowledge and who has placed all his actions in Yoga.

source: यथा चैवोक्तवान् भीमस्त्वामुद्दिश्य सबान्धवम्। कर्ताहं कर्मणस्तस्य कुरु कार्याणि सर्वशः॥
target: I shall certainly accomplish all which Bhima has said as regards you with all your followers. If you have anything to do, do it before that day comes.

source: समयश्च हि मे वीर कश्चिद् वैकर्तनं प्रति। उत्सृजेयं यथाश्रद्धमहं वाचोऽस्य संनिधौ॥
target: But O hero, this should really be my provision towards the son of Vikartana that I will sent froth in his presence such utterances as I will desire.

source: अहंथातिः खलु कृतवीर्यदुहितरमुपयेमे भानुमती नाम। तस्यामस्य जज्ञे सार्वभौमः॥
target: Ahamyati married Bhanumati, the daughter of Kritavirya and he begot on her a son, named Sarvabhauma.

source: इदमाभरणं सौम्य धराणार्थं द्विजोत्तम। प्रतिगृह्णीष्व भद्रं ते प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
target: O foremost of twice-born ones, O gentle one, do you take this ornament; may good betide you. Do you be propitiated with me.

source: वासुदेवं त्रिभिर्विद्धवा पुनः पार्थं च पञ्चभिः। भल्लाभ्यां भृशतीक्ष्णाभ्यां तं च विव्याध पाण्डवः। स तु पार्थं त्रिभिर्विद्ध्वा सिंहनादमथानदत्॥
target: And the son of Pandu pierced him with a couple of bhallas of exceeding sharpness. He also having pressed Pritha's son with three such arrows uttered a fierce yell.

source: इति तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजा तेषां मनःप्रियम्। अजानन्निव जिज्ञासुरिदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥
target: Hearing those welcome word of theirs, the monarch, as if not knowing their mind, asked them, saying.

source: तद् राजन् जीवनमानस्त्वं प्रायश्चित्तं करिष्यसि। प्रायश्चित्तमकृत्वा तु प्रेत्य तप्तासि भारत॥
target: Therefore, O king, without laying down your life, perform those expiatory acts. If you do not perform them you may have to repent in the next world.”

source: एतद् राज्ञो दिलीपस्य राजानो नानुचक्रिरे। यस्येभा हेमसंछन्नाः पथि मत्ताः स्म शेरते॥
target: No other king could imitate the deeds of king Dilipa. The elephants of that king, intoxicated and adorned with golden trappings used to lie down on the roads.

source: प्रग्रहैश्चर्मपट्टैश्च तं बद्ध्वा पर्वतोपमम्। नाशक्नुवन् समुद्धर्तुं ततो जग्मुर्जनार्दनम्॥
target: Resembling a very hill in size, the lizard was sought to be freed by cords and leather tongs. Not succeeding in their attempts, the youths then went to Janardana.

source: मया हि राजन् सादिगीश्वरा दिशो विजित्य सर्वा भवतः कृता वशे॥ स राजसूयश्च समाप्तदक्षिणः सभा च दिव्या भवतो ममौजसा।
target: O king, it was I who had defeated all the nations and the chiefs of all the principalities in the world and brought them under your subjection. It was through my influence that your Rajasuya sacrifice had been brought to a happy close by gifts of Dakshina and by a meeting of celestials.

source: वसिष्ठ उवाच देवतातिथिपित्रर्थं याज्यार्थं च पयस्विनी॥ अदेया नन्दिनीयं वै राज्येनापि तवानघ।
target: Vasishtha said: O sinless one, this milk-giving cow is kept by me for the purposes of the celestials, the Pitris and the guests and for my scarifies. Nandini cannot he given to you) in exchange of even your kingdom.

source: द्वारं तु वितताकारं समापेदे पुनश्च सः। तद्वत्तं चेति मन्वानो द्वारस्थानादुपारमत्॥
target: Coming upon another door that was really open, the king, thinking it closed, went away from it.

source: एवमेतन्मनुष्येन्द्र शूरैः प्राज्ञैर्बहुश्रुतैः। कुलीनैः सह शक्येत कृत्स्ना जेतुं वसुन्धरा॥
target: Thus, O monarch, a king may succeed in subjugating the entire Earth if he has for his ministers men endued with courage, wisdom, great learning, and high-birth.

source: ततस्तत्प्रहतं बाणैः खरमुक्तैः सुपर्वभिः। पपात कवचं भूमौ रामस्यादित्यवर्चसम्॥
target: And riven by the shafts discharged by Khara, Rāma's mail resembling the sun fell to the ground.

source: पुत्रेषु तव वीरेषु चिक्रीडार्जुनपूर्वजः। मृगेष्विव महाराज चरन् व्याघ्रो महाबलः॥
target: Then the elder brother of Arjuna played amidst your heroic sons like, O monarch, a powerful tiger roving amidst a herd of deer.

source: प्रवृत्तमेतद् भगवन् महर्षे महाद्युतेश्चक्रमनन्तवीर्यम्। विष्णोरनन्तस्य सनातनं तत् स्थानं सर्गा यत्र सर्वे प्रवृत्ताः। स वै महात्मा पुरुषोत्तमो वै तस्मिन् जगत् सर्वमिदं प्रतिष्ठितम्॥
target: O illustrious Rishi, O holy one, I see this wheel of Time, endued with great energy, of the most effulgent and Infinite Vishnu, has been set in motion. Eternal is that station from which all sorts of creation originate. That Vishnu is the Supreme Soul. He is the foremost of Beings. In Him this entire universe lives.

source: तच्चाग्निदत्तं कृष्णस्य वज्रनाभमयोमयम्। दिवमाचक्रमे चक्रं वृष्णीनां पश्यतां तदा॥
target: Before the very eyes of the Vrishnis, the discus of Krishna, given by Agni, made of iron and having its nave composed of hardest adamant, ascended into the sky.

source: जगद् वितिमिरं चापि प्रदीप्तमकरोत् तदा॥
target: Indeed, Atri made the universe shine in light, removing all its darkness. By displaying his power, he also subjugated, the vast multitudes of those enemies of the celestials.

source: मार्कण्डेय उवाच ततो निविशमानांस्तान् सैनिकान् रावणानुगाः। अभिजग्मुर्गणानेके पिशाचक्षुद्ररक्षसाम्॥ पर्वणः पतनो जम्भः खरः क्रोधवशो हरिः। प्ररुजश्चारुजश्चैव प्रघसश्चैवमादयः॥
target: Markandeya said : Then, when those troops were in their quarters, Parvana Patana, Jambha, Khara, Krodhavasha, Hari, Praruja, Aruja, Praghasa and many other minor Rakshasas and Pishachas under the sway of Ravana entered amongst them.

source: मा विनं मा च मे पापं मा च मे परिपन्थिनः। ध्रुवो जयो मे नित्यः स्यात् परत्र च शुभा गतिः।।६२।
target: Let no calamity visit me, let no sin define me, and let there be no opponents or enemies of mine. Forsooth, I will always have victory and an auspicious end hereafter.

source: ते शरीरं विराधस्य भित्त्वा बर्हिणवाससः। निपेतुः शोणितादिग्धा धरण्यां पावकोपमाः॥
target: Thereat, resembling flames, those arrows furnished with peacocks, feathers, pierced. Viradha's body, and fell to the earth, covered with blood.

source: क्षत्रदेवब्रह्मदेवो रथस्थौ पुरुषर्षभौ। जघनं पालयन्तौ च पृष्ठतोऽनुप्रजग्मतुः॥
target: And those foremost among men, seated on their chariots, Kshatradeva and Brahmadeva, followed behind, protecting the rear.

source: अतोऽन्यथा चेत् क्रियते यद् ब्रवीमि परं हितम्। कुरवो वै विनक्षयन्ति नचिरेणैव मे मतिः॥
target: If the advice, productive of great good that I have given, is not followed, my opinion is that the Kurus will be exterminated.

source: देवानामविहिंसायां न भवेन्मानुषक्षयम्। तद् गृहाण महाराज पूजार्हो नौ मतो भवान्॥
target: Let the boon, however, be such that it may not create enmity with the gods or bring on destruction to men. Accept then, O king, a boon, for you deserved one as we think.

source: तस्यास्तद् विमलं वक्त्रमाकाशे रावणाङ्कगम्। न रराज विना रामं विनालमिव पङ्कजम्॥
target: And her blameless countenance on Rāvana's lap in the sky did not appear beauteous without Rāma, like a lotus without its stalk;

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच अनुभूय तु राज्ञस्तं राजसूयं महाक्रतुम्। युधिष्ठिरस्य नृपतेर्गान्धारीपुत्रसंयुतः॥ प्रियकृन्मतमाज्ञाय पूर्वं दुर्योधनस्य तत्। प्रज्ञाचक्षुषमासीनं शकुनिः सौबलस्तदा।॥ दुर्योधनवचः श्रुत्वा धृतराष्ट्रं जनाधिपम्। उपगम्य महाप्राज्ञं शकुनिर्वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥
target: Vaishampayana said O king, having been impressed with the great Rajasuya sacrifice of king Yudhishthira and having also learnt the intentions of Duryodhana, from what he said, and also in order to do what was pleasing to him (Duryodhana), the son of Subala, Shakuni, accompanied by Gandhari's son (Duryodhana) to the king Dhritarashtra whose knowledge was his eye, seated (on this throne). Approaching that greatly intelligent (king), Shakuni thus spoke to him.

source: यत्र यत्र च याति स्म रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः। जाम्बूनदमयं लिङ्गं तत्र तत्र स्म नीयते॥
target: Wherever Rāvana went the golden Siva Linga was brought.

source: तां चाभिजनिवान् मायां राक्षसस्य दुरात्मनः। संक्रुद्धश्च महावीर्यो राक्षसेन्द्रं नरोत्तमः॥ छादयामास समरे शरैः संनतपर्वभिः। बह्वीस्तथान्या मायाश्च प्रयुक्तास्तेन रक्षसा॥
target: And with that weapon Abhimanyu destroyed the illusion of that wicked-souled Rakshasa. Then waxing worth, that foremost of men, endued with great prowess, covered the prince of the Rakshasas in that battle with a net-work of straight-knotted shaft. Various other kinds of illusion was created by that Rakshasas;

source: देवाः सोमार्कसंस्थानि यथा सत्रादिभिर्मखैः। अमृतान्युपजीवन्ति तथा गङ्गाजलं नराः॥
target: As the celestials support themselves upon the ambrosia that is in the Sun and the Moon and that is offered in various sacrifices, so do human beings support themselves upon Gangawater.

source: वत्स रावण तुष्टोऽस्मि पुत्रस्य तव संयुगे। अहोऽस्य विक्रमौदार्य तव तुल्योऽधिकोऽपि वा।।३
target: My son, Ravana, I have been pleased with your son in the conflict. Oh! what wonderful prowess, what strength-equal or greater than your.

source: जघान चतुरश्चाश्वान् सूतं च त्वरितः शरैः। नाराचैरर्करश्म्याभैः कर्ण विव्याध चोरसि॥
target: Quickly did he then slay with his arrows Karna's four steeds and charioteer. He then pierced Karna on the breast with Narachas of the effulgence of solar rays.

source: समुपलप्स्यते। त्रितस्तेषां महाराज पुरस्ताद् याति हृष्टवत्॥ एकतश्च द्वितश्चैव पृष्टतः कालयन् पशून्।
target: Trita, O king, was cheerfully walking before them. Ekata and Dvita were in his rear, conducting the animals.

source: ततस्तु नकुलः शूरो धर्मराजे प्रपीडते। अभिदुद्राव वेगेन मातुलं मातृनन्दनः॥
target: Seeing the just king Yudhishthira greatly assailed the heroic Nakula, the son of Madri, rushed with force against his maternal uncle.

source: स समाप्यायितः शक्रो विष्णुना दैवतैः सह। ऋषिभिश्च महाभागैर्बलवान् समपद्यता॥
target: Thus favoured by Vishnu by all the celestials and by the highly-blessed Rishis Sakra (Indra) became more powerful than before.

source: प्राणानामायतत्वेन तमुदानं प्रचक्षते। तस्मात् तपो व्यवस्यन्ति मन्दतं ब्रह्मवादिनः॥
target: Hence, Prana and Apana do not desert a sleeping person. On account of its controlling all the vital airs, the controlling breath is so called Udana.

source: सूतपुत्रे हते राजन् वित्रस्ताः शस्त्रविक्षताः। अनाथा नाथमिच्छन्तो मृगाः सिहैविार्दिताः॥
target: After the destruction of the charioteer's son, the Kauravas, terrified and wounded with arrows, having no lord and seeking refuge, locked like a herd of elephants pursued by lion.

source: मया सृष्टः पुरा ब्रह्मा मां यज्ञमयजत् स्वयम्॥ ततस्तस्मिन् वरान् प्रीतो दत्त्वानसम्यनुत्तमान्।
target: In ancient times I created Brahman who himself worshipped me in sacrifices. Pleased with him on that account I granted him many excellent boons.

source: एतत् फलमहिंसाया भूयश्च कुरुपुङ्गव। न हि शक्या गुणा वक्तुमपि वर्षशतैरपि॥
target: Even these, chief of Kuru's race, are some of the merits of abstention from cruelty. Altogether, the merits of it are so many that they are incapable of being exhausted even if one were to speak for a century.

source: यदेतज्जायतेऽपत्यं स एवायमिति श्रुतिः। कथं ब्राह्मणतो जातो विशेषग्रहणं गतः॥
target: The Shrutis say that the offspring one begets is his own self. Originally sprung from Brahman, all the inhabitants of the Earth should have been Brahmanas. Sprung from Brahmanas, why have men begun to perform works distinguished from those of Brahmanas.

source: सौतिरुवाच शप्तस्तु भृगुणा वह्निः क्रुद्धो वाक्यमथाब्रवीत्। किमिदं साहसं ब्रह्मन्कृतवानसि मां प्रति॥
target: Sauti said: Thus being cursed by Bhrigu. Agni said in anger, “What do you mean, Brahmana, by this rashness that you have shown towards me.”

source: अकार्यं परमं कृत्वा मिथ्यावादी च पाण्डवः। यो ह्यसौ छानाऽऽचार्यं शस्रं संन्यासयत् तदा॥
target: As also the prevaricating sons of Pandu, who have perpetrated a sinful act. He that caused by an underhand underhand measure, the preceptor to lay aside his weapon.

source: ततः शत्रुक्ष्यं कृत्वा समुहान्तं रणे वृषः। पश्वतां धार्तराष्ट्राणां फाल्गुनेन निपातितः॥
target: Thereupon Vrisha (Karna), having brought about an immense slaughter of the opponents in battle, was himself slain by Falguna (Arjuna), whilst the sons of Dhartarashtra were observing it.

source: पुष्पसंच्छन्नशाखाग्रं पल्लवैरुपशोभितम्। अशोकं स्तबकैश्छन्नं रमणीयमपश्यत॥
target: A beautiful Ashoka tree, decked with immense foliage and its branches so covered with flowers that they can not be seen.

source: धर्मस्यो महतो राजन् बहुशाखस्य तत्त्वतः। यन्मूलं परमं तात तत् सर्वं ब्रूह्यशेषतः॥
target: Tell me, O king, fully about that which is so vast and which has so many branches.

source: ततः शङ्खांश्च भेरीश्च शतशश्चैव पुष्कलान्।॥ अवादयन्त पञ्चालाः सिंहनादांश्च नेदिरे। तेऽभ्यधावन्त संरब्धा मद्रराजं तरस्विनम्॥
target: Having made that vow, the king proceeded against the king of the Madras. The Panchalas then blew and beat numberless conchs and drums and sent up leonine roars.

source: फलमूलाशने शक्तस्त्वं तथातिथिपूजने। न त्वां शत्रसमुद्योगे योग्यं मन्ये वृकोदर॥
target: You are fit, O Vrikodara, for eating large quantities of esculent roots and for receiving and welcoming guests, O Vrikodara, I do not consider you fit for wielding weapons.”

source: इदं शतसहस्रं हि श्लोकानां पुण्यकर्मणाम्। सत्यवत्यात्मजेनेह व्याख्यातममितौजसा॥
target: This (Bharata) contains one lac sacred slokas, composed by the son of Satyavati, Vyasa of immeasurable mental power.

source: स तत्र ववृधे राजन् मत्स्यः परमसत्कृतः। पुत्रवत् स्वीकरोत् तस्मै मनुर्भावं विशेषतः॥
target: O king, thus being reared, that fish grew in size and Manu carefully tended it as if were a child of his.

source: अर्दिता वानरैभ्रष्टा लङ्कामभ्यपतन्भयात्। हताश्रयत्वात्करुणैर्वाष्पप्रस्रवणैर्मुखैः॥
target: Being assailed by the monkeys and having their countenances full of tears in consequence of their lord being slain they fled away to Lankā in fear.

source: तदेतच्छ्रोतुमिच्छामि त्वत्तः कुरुकुलोद्वह। न तृप्यामीह राजेन्द्र शृण्वन्नमृतमीदृशम्॥
target: O perpetuator of Kuru's race, I wish, therefore, to hear all this from you. Listening to your discourses which are always sweet like nectar, my curiosity, without being satiated, is always increasing.

source: नैव लोभान्न मोहाद् वा न चाज्ञानात् तमोऽस्वितः। सेतुं सत्यस्य भेत्स्यामि गुरोः सत्यप्रतिश्रवः॥
target: Having promised to my superior with an oath, shall through covetousness forgetfulness or pride rive the bridge of truth.

source: तस्यां रजन्यां व्युष्टायां राजानः सर्व एव ते। सभामाविविशुहृष्टाः सूतस्योपदिदृक्षया॥
target: That night having passed away, all the kings entered the Council Chamber with glad hearts with the desire of seeing the Suta.

source: तौ हृष्टरूपौ सम्प्रेक्ष्य कौरवेयास्तु सर्वशः। निराशाः समपद्यन्त पुत्रस्य तव जीविते॥
target: The Kaurava warriors then beholding their appearance reflect joy, became hopeless of the life of your son.

source: एवमुक्तस्तु कर्णेन धार्तराष्ट्रो विशाम्पते। पुरोहितं समानाय्य वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्॥ राजसूयं क्रतुश्रेष्ठं समाप्तवरदक्षिणम्। आहर त्वं मम कृते यथान्यायं यथाक्रमम्॥
target: O king, having been thus addressed by Karna, Dhritarashtra's son summoned the priest and spoke to him him these words, “Celebrate duly and in proper order the foremost of all sacrifices the Rajasuya abounding in large Dakshinas."

source: अभ्यस्यमाने शक्त्यस्त्रे स्कन्देनामिततेजसा। उल्काज्वाला महाराज पपात वसुधातले॥
target: While the dart was repeatedly hurled by Skanda of unfathomable energy, meteors, O king, dropped upon the Earth.

source: नेयमस्ति पुरी लङ्का न यूयं न च रावणः। यस्य त्विक्ष्वाकुवीरेण बद्धं वैरं महात्मना॥
target: Neither this city of Lanka, nor you, nor yet Rāvaņa, shall exist, having created hostility with that high-souled hero of the Ikşvāku race.

source: तं त्वां देवासुरनरास्तत्त्वेन न विदुर्भवम्। मोहिताः खल्वनेनैव हृदिस्थेनाप्रकाशिना॥
target: Although you live in the heart, yet are you concealed. Hence, stupefied by you the deities and Asuras and men cannot understand you, O Bhava, truly and in all your details.

source: तदिच्छामि त्वयाज्ञप्तं देवि किं करवाण्यहम्। रामलक्ष्मणयोः पार्श्व नयामि त्वां किमुत्तरम्॥
target: I desire to know, O worshipful dame, what behest of yours may I obey now. Shall I carry you to Rāma and Lakşmaņa on the northern shore of the Ocean?”

source: मय्येव प्रहरेहि त्वं न स्त्रियं हन्तुमर्हसि। विशेषतोऽनपकृते परेणापकृते सति॥
target: Smite me first; you should not kill woman, specially when she has been sinned against instead of sinning.

source: योऽर्थकामस्य वचनं प्रातिकूल्यान मृष्यते। शृणोति प्रतिकूलानि सर्वदा विमना इव॥ अग्राम्यचरितां वृत्तिं यो न सेवेत नित्यदा। जितानामजितानां च क्षत्रधर्मादपैति सः॥
target: That king, who does not accept the advice of a well-wisher for its being opposed to his own views, who listens with inattention to what is said to him in opposition to his views, and who does not always follow the conduct of high and noble persons conquered or unconquered, deviates from the duties of Kshatriyas.

source: तां दृष्ट्वा विदितो हृष्टः स्वागतेनार्चितस्तया। सुखासीनः सुखासीनां स्मितपूर्वं वचोऽब्रवीत्॥
target: Seeing him she recognised and being delighted worshipped him by inquiring after his welfare. Having been comfortably seated, he smilingly thus spoke to her who was also comfortably seated.

source: एवमुक्त्वा तत: साध्वी देहं त्यक्त्वा दिवं गता। ऋषिरप्यभवद् दीनस्तस्या रूपं विचिन्तयन्॥
target: Having said these words, that chaste lady left for heaven. Her husband the Rishi, became very disspiiited by thinking of her beauty.

source: स तत्र सिद्धानभिवाद्य सर्वान् प्रत्यर्चितो राजवद् देववच्च। विवेश सर्वैः सहितो द्विजावयैः कृताञ्जलिर्धर्मभृतां वरिष्ठः॥
target: Then saluting all the Siddhas and being adored by them in return like a king or a god, that foremost of the pious, accompanied by all the leading twice-born, entered (the forest).

source: नैनं छन्दांसि वृजिनात् तारयन्ति मायाविनं मायया वर्तमानम्। श्छन्दांस्येन प्रजहत्यन्तकाले॥
target: The Vedas do not rescue one who is deceitful and lives by deceit from sins. Indeed, the Vedas, when the end approaches, forsake him, as the full-fledge birds forsake their nests.

source: न पुत्रधनलाभेन न राज्येनापि विन्दति। प्रीतिं नृपतिशार्दूल याममित्राघदर्शनात्॥
target: O foremost of kings, the happiness that one drives from seeing his enemies in grief is greater than what one drives on getting a son or wealth or kingdom.

source: उपदिष्टो हि मे पित्रा योगोऽनीकविशातने। नोत्सहे हि विनिर्गन्तुमहं कस्यांचिदापदि॥
target: My father has taught me the way to penetrate this kind of array. But I do not know how to come out of the array, if per chance some danger overtake me there.

source: अहो बतायमगमः श्रीमानस्मिन् वनान्तरे। आपीडैर्बहुभिर्भाति श्रीमान् पर्वतराडिव॥
target: Oh! this charming tree in the heart of this wilderness ornamented with fruits and flowers, is shining like a glorious king of mountains.

source: स पादुके सम्प्रणम्य रामं वचनमब्रवीत्। चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि जटाचीरधरो ह्यहम्॥ फलमूलाशनो वीर भवेयं रघुनन्दन। तवागमनमाकाङ्क्षन् वसन् वै नगराद् बहिः॥ तव पादुकयोय॑स्य राज्यतन्त्रं परंतप।
target: Bharata, bowing down to the sandals, said, O hero, for, four and ten years shall I, wearing matted locks and bark, and subsisting upon fruits and roots, O scion of the Raghu race, expecting your arrival, remain outside the city, having, O subduer of foes, made over the task of government to your sandals.

source: अकृष्टपच्या पृथिवी भवन्त्योषधयस्तथा। त्वक्पत्रफलमूलानि वीर्यवन्ति भवन्ति च॥
target: The Earth yield crops without being cultivated and herbs and plants grow abundantly. Barks, leaves, fruits, and roots, become strong and profuse.

source: विसृज्य धृतराष्ट्राय राज्यं सविदुराय च। चचार पृथिवीं पाण्डुः सर्वां परपुरञ्जयः॥
target: Having made over the kingdom to Dhritarashtra and Vidura Pandu, that conqueror of the cities of his enemies, wandered over the earth.

source: क्षमावतामयं लोकः परश्चैव क्षमावताम्। इह सम्मानमृच्छन्ति परत्र च शुभां गतिम्॥
target: This world belongs to the forgiving, the other world also belongs to the forgiving, they obtain honors here and holy blessedness in the next.

source: असित उवाच येभ्यः सृजति भूतानि काले भावप्रचोदितः। महाभूतानि पञ्चेति तान्याहुर्भूतचिन्तकाः॥
target: are Those from which the Supreme Self, when the time comes, actuated by the desire of existence in various forms, creates all creatures, and said by persons conversant with objects to be the five essential principles.

source: हरितेषु सुवर्णेषु बर्हिष्केषु नवेषु च। उपोवविविशुः प्रीता विष्टेरेषु महर्षयः॥
target: Those great Rishis sat themselves down upon seats some of which were green and some were goldhued and some were made of the plumes of the peacock and some were perfectly new and fresh.

source: प्रणिधी राक्षसेन्द्रस्य रावणस्य भवेदयम्। अनुप्रविश्य सोऽस्मासु भेदं कुर्यान्न संशयः॥ अथ वा स्वयमेवैष छिद्रमासाद्य बुद्धिमान्। अनुप्रविश्य विश्वस्ते कदाचित्प्रहरेदपि ॥
target: This must be the emissary of Rāvaņa-the lord of Raksasas. Entering in our midst, he shall, in sooth, sow dissensions in our camp, or he shall slay us when we are careless, confiding in them.

source: विनिष्कान्तं तु तं तु तं दृष्ट्वा ज्वलन्तमिव तेजसा। भवो रोषसमाविष्टः शूलोद्यतकरः स्थितः॥
target: Seeing him come out of his stomach and shining bringhtly with energy, Bhava filled with anger, stood with lance uplifted in his hand.

source: इन्द्रियाणामनुत्सर्गो मृत्युनापि विशिष्यते। अत्यर्थं पुनरुत्सर्गः सादयेद् दैवतान्यपि॥
target: And has his senses under control and attaches himself to what ought to be attached to should be desired for a friend. The renouncement of the objects of the senses is worse than death difficult of practices.

source: उद्योगं वानरेन्द्राणां प्लवनं सागरस्य च। व्यर्थं वीक्ष्यानिलसुतश्चिन्तां पुनरुपागतः॥
target: Seeing that the endeavours of the monarch of monkeys, as well as the bounding over the main, had come to nought, the offspring of the Windgod was plunged in thought.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच इत्येवमुक्त्वा नृपतिं सर्वपापहरो हरः। उमापतिः पशुपतिर्यज्ञहा त्रिपुरार्दनः॥
target: Vaishampayana said : Having said this to the king, Hara, the destroyer of all sins, Uma's lord, Pashupati, the destroyer of (Daksha's) sacrifice, the slayer of Tripura.

source: ततः कृष्णश्च पार्थश्च धर्मराजे युधिष्ठिरे। सर्वमेतत् समावेद्य दर्शयामासतुर्मयम्॥
target: Then Krishna and Partha, having told every things to Dharmaraja Yudhishthira, introduced Maya to him.

source: यथैव मम पुत्राणामिदं राज्यं विधीयते। तथैव पाण्डुपुत्राणामिदं राज्यं न संशयः॥
target: As my sons are entitled to this kingdom, so certainly are the sons of Pandu entitled to it.

source: रणाद् भरतश्रेष्ठ तावकाः प्राद्रवन् दिशः। धावतश्चाप्यपश्याम श्वसमानाशराहतान्॥
target: Indeed chief of the Bharatas, your soldiers fled on all sides. Stuck with arrows, they were seen to run, breathing hard.

source: न पृच्छेद् गोत्रचरणं स्वाध्यायं देशमेव च। भिक्षितो ब्राह्मणेनेह दद्यादन्नं प्रयाचितः॥
target: Solicited by a Brahmana, one should not enquire about his family or conduct or Vedic learning. Asked for food, one should give food to him who asks.

source: धातैव खलु भूतानां सुखदुःखे प्रियाप्रिये। दधाति सर्वमीशानः पुरस्ताच्छुक्रमुच्चरन्॥
target: The Lord Ishana ordains beforehand, with reference to weal and woe, happiness and misery, of all creatures like a seed.

source: रूपं चक्षुः प्रकाशश्च दर्शने हेतवस्त्रयः। यथैवात्र तथान्येषु ज्ञानज्ञेयेषु हेतवः॥
target: The eye, form, and light, form the three requisites of the action called Seeing. The same holds good about the action of the other senses and the ideas which is their result.

source: राधेयस्य वचः श्रुत्वा राजा दुर्योधनस्ततः। भ्रातृभिः सहितो राजन् प्रायाद् द्रोणरथं प्रति॥
target: Sanjaya said O monarch, hearing the words of the son of Radha, king Duryodhana, with his brothers rushed where the car of Drona was.

source: बाणजालं दिविच्छन्नं स्वर्णजालविभूषितम्। शुशुभे भरतश्रेष्ठ वितानमिव धिष्ठितम्॥
target: The sky being covered with a net-work of golden arrows it appeared as if a canopy had been spread there.

source: स्वयंप्रभास्ते भास्वन्तो लोका: कामदुधाः परे। न तेषां स्त्रीकृतस्तापो न लोकैश्वर्यमत्सरः॥
target: They shine in their own effulgence and they bestow every object of desire. They suffer no pangs arising from women. They do not possess worldly wealth and they are free from ill.

source: भानुमन्तं महाघोषं सर्वरत्नमनोरमम्। ससर्ज यं सुतपसा भौमनो भुवनप्रभुः॥ प्रजापतिरनिर्देश्यं यस्य रूपं रवेरिव। यं स्म सोमः समारुह्य दानवानजयत् प्रभुः॥
target: Its splendour was very great and the sound of its wheels were tremendous; it delighted the heart of every creature that looked at it. It was created by Prajapati after severe ascetic mediation. It was as effulgent as the sun and its splendour was so great that none could gaze at it. It was that very chariot riding on which the lord Soma defeated the Danavas.

source: उद्देशे नष्टमार्गेऽस्मिन् राक्षसैः परिवारिते। सागरेण परिक्षिप्ते गुप्ते वसति जानकी॥
target: And Jānakī live in this secret place, girt by the ocean, guarded on all sides by the Raksasas, difficult of being got at and having all avenues to it shut up.

source: अरुन्धत्युवाच नित्यं परिभवेच्छ्वधूं भर्तुर्भवतु दुर्मनाः। एका स्वादु समाश्नातु बिसस्तैन्यं करोति या॥
target: Arundhati said Let her who has stolen the lotusstalks always humiliate her motherinlaw. Let her be always vexed with her husband. Let her eat whatever good things come to her house without giving a part to others.

source: सात्यकिस्तु रणे हित्वा गुरुपुत्रं महारथम्। द्रोणं विव्याध विंशत्या सर्वपारशवैः शरैः॥
target: Then abandoning that mighty car-warrior that son of the preceptor Drona, Satyaki, picrced Drona with twenty shafts of sharpness like that battle axe.

source: ज्येष्ठस्य पाण्डुपुत्रस्य भागो मद्राधिपो बली। तौ तु तत्राब्रुवन् केचिद् विषमौ नो मताविति॥
target: The ruler of the Madras, endued with strength, has been reserved as the share of the eldest son of Pandu, through somebody in their party said that he was of opinion that the two did match very well.

source: सर्वभूतगणाश्चैव मातरो विविधाः स्थिताः। तेऽभिवाद्य महात्मानं परिवार्य समन्ततः॥
target: All the clans of spirits and ghosts, and the celestial Mothers, stood surrounding Mahadeva and saluting him with respect.

source: कूर्मेण तु तथेत्युक्त्वा पृष्ठमस्य समर्पितम्। तं शैलं तस्य पृष्ठस्थं वज्रणेन्द्रो न्यपीडयत्॥
target: The Tortoise king having agreed, Indra pressed that mountain on its back by means of his thunderbolt.

source: सुग्रीवो हनुमांश्चैव महेन्द्रसदृशद्युती। स्नातौ दिव्यनिभैर्वस्त्रैर्जग्मतुः शुभकुण्डलौ॥
target: Sugrīva and Hanuman, graceful like Mahendra, bathed, dressed in celestial clothes and wearing excellent kundalas, proceeded (to view the city).

source: विभज्य दण्डः कर्तव्यो धर्मेण न यदृच्छया। दुष्टानां निग्रहो दण्डो हिरण्यं बाह्यतः क्रिया॥
target: Punishment should be meted out with discrimination, guided by righteousness and not by caprice. It is intended for checking the wicked. Fines and confiscation are intended for creating terror, and not for replenishing the king's treasury.

source: इतः सर्वेऽपि गच्छामः शरणं लोकसाक्षिणम्। महापुरुषमव्यक्तं स नो वक्ष्यति यद्धितम्॥
target: Let all of us, leaving this place, go that unmanifest and foremost of Beings who is the witness of the world, for seeking his protection. He will tell us what is for our behoof.

source: श्रेयो नो भीमसेनस्य क्रुद्धस्याभिमुखे स्थितम्। सुखः सांग्रामिको मृत्युः क्षत्रधर्मेण युध्यताम्॥
target: It will be to our interest if we stay before the angry Bhimasena. Death in battle, while fighting in pursuance of the Kshatriya practices, leads to happiness.

source: त्वं हि राष्ट्रस्य परमा गतिर्मत्स्यपतेः सुतः। यथा हि पाण्डुपुत्राणामर्जुनो जयतां वरः॥
target: You are the greatest support of the kingdom, the son of Matsya king, like Arjuna, the foremost of the victors amongst the sons of Pandu.

source: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये। ते ब्रह्म तद् विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्म कर्म चाखिलम्॥
target: Those, who depending on me, tries to obtain release from decay and death know Brahma, the entire Adhyatma and all actions.

source: वध्यमानं बलं दृष्ट्वा बहुशस्तैः पुरंदरः। स सैन्यनायकार्थाय चिन्तामाप भृशं तदा॥
target: Findings his armies slaughtered by them and being eager to find out a Generalissimo for the celestials army Purandara (Indra) was filled with great anxiety.

source: एवं स राजा सुमहान्हतः सबलवाहनः। शूलस्य तु बलं सौम्य अप्रमेयमनुत्तमम्॥
target: In this wise the high-souled king Māndhāta, with his huge army, was slain. O gentle hero, incomparable and great is the strength of the dart..

source: गाश्च संकीर्तयेन्नित्यं नावमन्येत तास्तथा। अनिष्टं स्वप्नमालक्ष्य गां नरः सम्प्रकीर्तयेत्॥
target: One should always recite the names of kine. One should never show any disregard for kine in any way. If evil dreams are seen men should recite the names of kine.

source: वासुकिस्तक्षश्चैव नागचैरावतस्तथा। कृष्णश्च लोहितश्चैव पद्मश्चित्रश्च वीर्यवान्॥ कम्बलाश्वतरौ नागौ धृतराष्ट्रबलाहको। मणिमान् कुण्डधारश्च कर्कोटकधनंजयौ॥ पाणिमान् कुण्डधारश्च बलवान् पृथिवीपते। प्रह्लादो मूषिकादश्च तथैव जनमेजयः॥ पताकिनो मण्डलिनः फणावन्तश्च सर्वशः। एते चान्ये च बहवः सर्पास्तस्यां युधिष्ठिर। उपासते महात्मानं वरुणं विगतक्लमाः॥ बलिर्वैरोचनो राजा नरकः पृथिवींजयः। प्रह्लादो विप्रचित्तिश्च कालखञ्जाश्च दानवाः॥
target: O Lord of the earth, Vasuki, Takshaka, the Naga, named Airavata, Krishna, Lohita, Padma, the powerful Chitra, the Nagas called Kambalas, Ashvatara, Dhritarashtra, Balahaka, Maniman, Kundadhara, Karkate, Dhananjaya, Paniman, the powerful Kundaka, Pralhada, Mushikada, Janamejaya, all having auspicious marks and Mandalas and board hoods, these and many other Nagas, O Yudhishthira, wait without any anxiety upon the illustrious Varuna. O king, the son of Virochana, Bali, the subjugator of the earth, Naraka.

source: स तस्य गन्धमाघ्राय विशल्यः समपद्यत। तदा निर्वेदनश्चैव संरुद्धप्राण एव च॥
target: And smelling the same, he got healed; he was relieved of his pain and his outgoing vitality was shut up.

source: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच अहो बत महद् दुःखं यदहं पाण्डवान् रणे। क्षेमिणश्चाव्ययांश्चैव त्वत्त: सूत शृणोमि वै॥
target: Dhritarashtra said Alas, O Suta, painful is the news that I hear from you viz., that the Pandavas are all safe and have suffered no loss in battle!

source: कालकेयैर्महाकायैः समन्तादभिरक्षितम्। समुद्यतप्रहरणैः सशृङ्गैरिव पर्वतैः॥
target: He was guarded on all sides by the huge bodied Kalkeyas with upraised weapons, looking like great mountains with towering peaks.

source: सा तत्र परमं देवी तपोऽचरद् दुश्चरम्। समा होकपदे तस्थौ दश पद्मानि पञ्च च॥
target: There the goddess performed austere penances for fifteen billions of years, standing upon one foot.

source: यक्ष उवाच कोऽतिथिः सर्वभूतानां किंस्विद् धर्मं सनातनम्। अमृतं किंस्विद् राजेन्द्र किंस्वित् सर्वमिदं जगत्॥
target: The Yaksha said: Who is the guest of all the creatures? What is the eternal religion? O king of kings, what is Amrita? And what is this entire universe?

source: ततो जघान समरे वृत्रं देवपतिः स्वयम्। तं च मन्त्रमयं बन्धं वर्म चाङ्गिरसे ददौ॥
target: Then the lord of the celestials slew Vritra in battle and gave afterwards that armour of which the joints were composed of Mantras, unto Angiras.

source: तेषां धर्मैकरक्षाणां कुलचारित्रशोभिनाम्। अद्य चारित्रशौटीर्यं त्वां प्राप्य विनिवर्तितम्॥
target: But to-day the pride of character of those whose virtue was their sole concern,* and who shone in the character of their line, has been humbled through they instrumentality. *Another interpretation is;, Whose virtue is their sole protector.

source: स तथाभिहतो भीमश्चकम्पे च मुमोह च॥ प्राप्य चेतश्च बलवान् गदामस्मै ससर्ज ह।
target: Thus struck (by Valhika) Bhima trembled and (then) fell into a swoon. Then that powerful one, recovering his senses, hurled a mace at him.

source: वसिष्ठ उवाच श्रूयतां पृथिवीपाल क्षरतीदं यथा जगत्। यन्न क्षरति पूर्वेण यावत्कालेन वाप्यथ॥
target: Hear, O king, as to how this universe is destroyed, and of That which was never destroyed and which will never be destroyed at any time.

source: श्रुत्वा तां मैथिली रामस्त्वाशशंसे च जीवितम्। जीवितान्तमनुप्राप्तः पीत्वामृतमिवातुरः॥
target: Hearing (of the news of Vaidehi) Rama regained his life like one on the verge of death regaining his being after drinking nectar.

source: व्यास उवाच अध्यात्मं यदिदं तात पुरुषस्येह पठ्यते। तत् तेऽहं वर्तयिष्यामि तस्य व्याख्यामिमां शृणु॥
target: Vyasa said That, O son, which is considered as spiritual with reference to human beings, I shall now mention to you, and listen to the explanation I give.

source: अन्यमस्मै वरं देहीत्यसकृद् भृगुनन्दन। अमृतं देयमित्येव मयोक्तः स शचीपतिः॥
target: Let some other boon be granted to Utanka! O son of Bhrigu's race, these words were repeatedly addressed to me. The husband of Sachi, however, was once more requested by me in these words, viz., even nectar should be given to Utanka!

source: सौदास उवाच प्रजानिसर्गाद् विप्रान् वै क्षत्रियाः पूजयन्ति ह। विप्रेभ्यश्चापि बहवो दोषाः प्रादुर्भवन्ति वै॥
target: Saudasa said Kshatriyas are seen to honour the Brahmanas from the very beginning of the creation. Towards the Brahmanas, however, many offences originate (on the part of the Kshatriyas).

source: एष मुख्यतमो धर्मः क्षत्रियस्येति नः श्रुतम्॥ यदाजौ निहतः शेते सद्भिः समभिपूजितः।
target: We have heard that this is the prime duty of the Kshatriyas that when slain in battle he would lie down on earth being spoken highly of by the pious.

source: छिन्नायुधं शान्तनवेन राजा शिखण्डिनं प्रेक्ष्य च जातकोपः। अजातशत्रुः समरे महात्मा शिखण्डिनं क्रुद्ध उवाच वाक्यम्॥
target: Beholding Shikhandin with his bow severed by the royal son of Shantanu, the illustrious Ajatashatru (Yudhishthira) waxing worth, angrily said these words to the foriner.

source: भगवान् पवन: स्थानाद् वृक्षानुच्चावचानपि। पर्वतानां च शिखराण्याचालयति वेगवान्॥
target: The illustrious Pavana of great speed and force unfixes the tallest and strongest trees, and even mountain summits.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच क्षत्रधर्माद्धि पापीयान्न धर्मोऽस्ति नराधिप। अपयानेन युद्धेन राजा हन्ति महाजनम्॥
target: Yudhishthira said No action O king, is more sinful than that of the Kshatriyas! While marching or in battle, the king destroys the Vaishyas.

source: चिरेणाद्य मयाऽऽहारः प्राप्तोऽयमनुजस्तव। नाहमेनं विमोक्ष्यामि न चान्यमभिकाझये।॥
target: After a long period (of abstinence) I have got this your younger brother for my food. I will not (therefore) release him. Nor do I want any other meal.

source: संक्षोभ्य सलिलं वेगाद् गदामादाय वीर्यवान्। अद्रिसारमयीं गुर्वी काञ्चनाङ्गदभूषणाम्॥
target: Agitating the waters with great force that brave warrior rose like a prince of elephants from within the lake, sighing heavily in rage and armed with his heavy and strong mace of adamant decked with gold.

source: ततोऽब्रवीत् पुनर्मृत्युर्भगवन्तं पितामहम्। न हरेयं प्रजा देव पुनश्चाहं प्रसादये॥
target: Addressing the divine Grandfather, the maiden once more said, I am unable to destroy living creatures, O god! I seek to please you.

source: स तथा प्रवदन् क्रोधात् तैश्च प्रेष्यैः प्रभाषितः। तूष्णीं जगाम ब्रह्मर्षिर्वनमेव महातपाः॥
target: Having said this in anger and having been reprimanded by the king's men, that Brahmana Rishi, that great ascetic, became silent; and he then went away to the forest.

source: गुरुवद् भूतगुरवे प्राहिणोद् दूतमञ्जसा। शीघ्रगेन रथेनाशु स दूतः प्राप्य यादवान्॥
target: son Soon sent a messenger to that lord of all beings, sending through him (the messenger) blessings and agreeable words such as the elder should send to his younger. Riding on a swift car, that messenger soon reached the Yadavas.

source: सोऽपि शङ्करमाराध्य प्राप्तवानतुलं यशः। वेदव्यासश्च योगात्मा पराशरसुतो मुनिः॥
target: The great ascetic who is Parashara's son, viz., Vyasa bent on Yoga, has become famous by worshipping Shankara.

source: अमावास्यां महाप्राज्ञो विप्रानानाय्या पूजितान्। दक्षिणावर्तिकाः सर्वा बृसीः स्वयमथाकरोत्॥
target: On the day of the New Moon he invited a number of worthy Brahmanas. Gifted with great wisdom, Nimi made them sit on seats and honoured them by going round thein.

source: तपोवनगतं विप्रमभिगम्य महामुनिम्। पप्रच्छाङ्गिरसं धीरं गौतमः संशितव्रतः॥ अस्ति मे भगवन् कश्चित्तीर्थेभ्यो धर्मसंशयः। तत् सर्वे श्रोतुमिच्छामि तन्मे शंस महामुने॥
target: Once on a time approaching the great and learned Rishi Angiras gifted with tranquillity of soul, while he was living in a forest, Gautama of rigid vows questioned him, saying O illustrious one, I have some doubts regarding the merits of sacred waters and shrines. I wish to hear you describe that subject. Do you therefore, O ascetic describe it to me.

source: तत्रारण्यकशास्त्राणि समधीत्य स धर्मवित्। अवरताः प्रव्रजित्वा गच्छत्यक्षरसात्मताम्॥
target: Having studied the Scriptures called Aranyakas, having restrained his vital fluid and having retired from all worldly affairs the pious hermit may then find himself immersed in the eternal Soul knowing no deterioration.

source: एवं न दग्धः स मया भवता च न संशयः। अन्येनाप्यषिमुख्येन न दग्धो न च पातितः॥
target: The selfborn Brahman granted him this boon, and it is therefore that neither yourself nor I have been able to consume him. Forsooth, it is for this reason that none one else amongst the foremost of Rishis has been able to consume or throw him down from his elevated position.

source: कन्यात्वे दूषिते वापि कथं शक्ष्ये द्विजोत्तम। गृहं गन्तुमृषे चाहं धीमन्न स्थातुमुत्सहे॥ एतत्संचिन्त्य भगवन्विधत्स्व यदनन्तरम्।
target: O best of Brahmanas, O Rishi, my virginity being sallied, how shall I be able to return home? I shall not then be able to bear life. O illustrious one, take all this into your (kind) consideration and do what is proper.

source: विसर्जयामास तदा कौसल्याप्रीतिवर्धनः। राघवेण कृतानुज्ञः काशेयो ह्यकुतोभयः॥ वाराणसी ययौ तूर्णं राघवेण विसर्जितः।
target: Having taken farewell from Rāma enhancing Kausalya's delight, the king of Kasi, with his followers, fearlessly and speedily proceeded to his own city Vārāṇasī.

source: त्वामाहुरेकं कवयस्त्वामाहुस्त्रिविधं पुनः। त्वया त्यक्तं जगच्चेदं सद्यो नश्येद्भुताशन॥
target: The poets sang of you as the one and then again as the three. O you consumer of offerings, bereft of you this world is at once annihilated.

source: कृत्वा तु नैर्ऋतान् दर्भान् धीरो धौम्यः पुरोहितः। सामानि गायन् याम्यानि पुरतो याति भारत॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, the learned and self controlled priest Dhaumya, holding the Kusha (grass) in his hand and pointing them towards the south west, walk before (the Pandavas) singing the Mantras of the Samaveda.

source: अथेगितं वज्रधरस्य नारदः श्रियश्च देव्या मनसा विचारयन्। श्रियै शशंसामरदृष्टपौरुषः शिवेन तत्रागमनं महर्षिभिः॥
target: Observing a sign that the holder of the thunder-bolt made and which Shree herself approved of, then the great Rishi Narada, whose prowess all the gods knew, welcomed the approach of the goddess there and announced it as highly auspicious.

source: तं चैव सर्वं सुखदुःखयोगं लोकोऽब्रवीत् तेन कृतं विधात्रा। त्रयोऽपि लोका विहितं विधानं नातिक्रमन्ते वशगा हि तस्य॥
target: And by Him is administered misery or happiness as people say. These three worlds cannot neglect His dispensations and are entirely subject to Him.

source: इत्युक्त्वा वानरो रामं विरराम हरीश्वरः॥ न तमाश्वासयद् रामो वालिनं व्यक्तदर्शनम्। साधुसम्मतया वाचा धर्मतत्त्वार्थयुक्तया ॥ न वयं भवता चिन्त्या नाप्यात्मा हरिसत्तम। वयं भवद्विशेषेण धर्मतः कृतनिश्चयाः॥
target: Having addressed Rāma thus the lord of monkeys stopped. Thereupon Rāma consoled Vāli, of clear understanding with the following moral words, acceptable to the Saints. O best of monkeys, do you not consider ourselves as well as yourself blameable. We are more conversant, than you, with the principles of religion.

source: प्रहेतिरर्धार्मिकस्तत्र तपोवनगतस्तदा। हेतिरक्रियार्थे तु परं यत्नमथाकरोत्॥
target: Praheti, who was righteous, went to the wood of asceticism. And Heti exerted himself to the utmost to get himself wived.

source: दुःखेन चाधिगच्छन्ति भोजनं द्विजसत्तम। इति लोकमनाक्रन्दं मोहशोकपरिप्लुतम्॥
target: O foremost of Brahmanas, they are enabled to eain their livelihood with (only) good deal of difficulty. Thus men are helpless, afflicted with grief and illusion and

source: तं प्रयान्तमनुप्रायात् कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः। भीमसेनार्जुनौ चोभो माद्रीपुत्रौ च पाण्डवौ।॥ चेकितानश्च विक्रान्तो धृष्टकेतुश्च चेदिपः। दुपदः काशिराजश्च शिखण्डी च महारथः॥ धृष्टद्युम्नः सपुत्रश्च विराटः केकयैः सह। संसाधनार्थ प्रययुः क्षत्रियाः क्षत्रियर्षभ॥
target: Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, Bhimasena and Arjuna and the two descendants of Pandu-the two sons of Madri followed him as he proceeded along. The powerful Chekitana and Dhrishtaketu, the lord of the Chedis, Drupada, Kashi and the great car-warrior Shikhandi and Dhrishtadyumna and Virata in company with his sons, the Kaikeya princes, all Kshatriyas followed the bull of the Kshatriya race to attain his object.

source: अथाब्रवीद् भीमसेनं सात्यकिः सत्यविक्रमः। प्रहर्षयन् यदुव्याघ्रो धृष्टद्युम्नस्य पश्यतः॥
target: That foremost of the Yadus, that irresistible hero Satyaki then thus spoke to Bhimasena in the presence of Dhrishtadyumna.

source: जनमेजय उवाच कुरूणां पाण्डवानां च भवान्प्रत्यक्षदर्शिवान्। तेषां चरितमिच्छामि कथ्यमानं त्वया द्विजः॥
target: Janamejaya said : O Brahmana, you saw with your own eyes the great deeds of the Kurus and the Pandavas. I desire to hear them narrated by you.

source: संस्कृत्य वालिनं तु विधिवत् प्लवगर्षभाः। आजग्मुरुदकं कर्तुं नदी शुभजलां शिवाम् ॥
target: Having duly cremated Vāli's body, the foremost of monkeys arrived at a river of auspicious water with a view to perform the watery ceremony.

source: संजीवयैनं दुर्धर्ष मृतं त्वमभिमन्युजम्। सदृशाक्षसुतं वीर सस्यं वर्षन्निवाम्बुदः॥
target: Do you, therefore, O irresistible one, revive this son of Abhimanyu, this child who has eyes similar to his, even as a rain-charged cloud revives the lifeless crops (on a field).

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच ततः स नृपशार्दूल पूरुं राज्येऽभिषिच्य च। ततः सुचरितं कृत्वा भृगुतुङ्गे महातपाः॥ कालेन महता पश्चात् कालधर्ममुपेयिवान्। कारयित्वा त्वनशनं सदारः स्वर्गमाप्तवान्॥
target: Vaishampayana said : That best of kings, (Yayati), having installed Puru on the throne went to the mount Bhrigu to become a great ascetic. After many years he succumbed to the inevitable influence of Time. Observing the vow of fasting, he ascended heaven with his wives.

source: इयं सा परमा काष्ठा इयं सा परमा कला। इयं सा परमा सिद्धिरियं सा परमा गतिः॥
target: You are the highest Kashtha, you are the highest Kala. You are highest Success, and you are the highest Refuge.

source: नापराधोऽस्ति सुभगे नराणां बहुभार्यता। प्रमदानां भवत्येष मा तेऽभूद् बुद्धिरीदृशी॥
target: O blessed lady, polygamy is no fault with men. Women only commit sin by taking more than one husband. Do not, therefore, cherish such thoughts (of vengeance).

source: मद्वाक्यसमकालं ते मोक्तव्योऽत्र भवेच्छरः। तिष्ठ तावन्मुहूर्तकम्॥ वितत्य कार्मुकं पुत्र
target: "You must shoot the aim as soon as I shall give order, O son, stand here for a moment with your bow and arrow."

source: पञ्चालाश्च सवार्ष्णेयाः पाण्डवाश्च विशाम्पते। रामे द्वारावतीं याते नातिप्रमनसोऽभवन्॥
target: The Panchalas, the Vrishnis and the Pandavas. O king, became rather dispirited after Rama had started for Dvaravati.

source: शिलवृत्तिस्तु यत् कृत्यं प्रातस्तत् कृतवाञ्छुचिः। कृतकृत्यमुपातिष्ठत् सिद्धं तमतिथिं तदा।॥
target: The next morning the Brahmana in the observance of the Shila vow, having finished all his morning acts and rites and purified himself duly, gladly approached his guest crowned with ascetic success.

source: सोऽभिगम्य महात्मानं भ्राता भ्रातरमग्रजम्। मूर्धा प्रणम्य चरणाविदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥
target: Coming to his illustrious eldest brother and bowing his head to his feet, he thus spoke to him.

source: एते ह्यभिमुखाः सर्वे राधेयेन युयुत्सवः। आयान्ति पाण्डवा ब्रह्मन्नाह्वयन्तः समन्ततः॥
target: O Brahmana, all the Pandavas, desiring to fight with and shouting to the son of Radha (to give battle) are coming (against him) from all sides.

source: विदर्भराण्मम पिता भर्ता राजा च नैषधः। नलो नाम महाभागस्तं मृग्याम्यपराजितम्॥
target: The sovereign of Vidharbhas is my father, the illustrious Ruler of the Nishadhas is my husband, known under the name of Nala. Even now I am wandering in quest of that unconquerable one.

source: भीष्म उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। मैत्रेयस्य च संवादं कृष्णद्वैपायनस्य च।॥
target: Bhishma said Regarding it is cited the old conversation between Maitreya and Krishna Dvaipayana.

source: बले रूपे च शौर्ये च न शमे च समोऽस्ति नौ। धर्मे तपसि दाने च शीलसत्त्वदमेषु च॥
target: There is none equal to us in strength, in appearance, in beauty, in virtue, in asceticism, in charity, in conduct, in goodness and in selfcontrol.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एवं स्तुतस्तदा तेन मन्दपालेन पावकः॥ तुतोष तस्य नृपते मुनेरमिततेजसः। उवाच चैन प्रीतात्मा किमिष्टं करवाणि ते॥
target: Vaishampayana said : O king, thus praised by Mandapala, Agni was much pleased with the immeasurably effulgent Rishi. He thus spoke to him with a delightful heart,” what good can I do to you?”

source: तस्मिन्नोरोहति क्षिप्रं स्यन्दने लोकपूजिते॥ शिरोभिरागमन् भूमि ते हया वातरंहसः।
target: Thus while he was immediately ascending that car, which was revered by all persons, those horses, that were as fleet as the wind, bowed down upon the ground with their heads.

source: प्रविश्य विचरन्तं च रथे शूरमवस्थितम्। कथं द्रोणं महेष्वासं पाण्डवाः पर्यवारयन्।॥
target: How did the Pandavas oppose that mighty bowman, the heroic Drona, who having entered it (i.e., the hostile army) was moving about (the field of battle) stationed on his car.

source: ततः पुनर्महातेजाः कुम्भयोनिमहायशाः। उवाच रामं प्रणतं पितामह इवेश्वरम्॥ श्रूयतामिति चोवाच रामं सत्यपराक्रमम्। कथाशेषं महातेजाः कथयामास स प्रभुः॥ यथाख्यानं श्रुतं चैव यथावृत्तं यथा तथा। प्रीतात्मा कथयामास राघवाय महामतिः॥ एतदर्थं महाबाहो रावणेन दुरात्मना। सुता जनकराजस्य हृता राम महामते॥
target: The highly effulgent and illustrious Agastya, spring from a vessel, again addressed the humble Rāma as the great Patriarch sprung from lotus spoke to the Great Deity. He said to Răma, having truth for his prowess:-"Do you hear." Saying this, the highly effulgent Agastya began to narrate the last portion of the story. The high-minded saint, with a delighted heart, described to Rāma all he has heard and narrated." O high-minded Rama, having long arms, it is for this reason that the vicioussouled Rāvana stole away Janaki, the daughter of king Janaka.

source: त्वं तु कामप्रधानश्च कोपनश्चानवस्थितः। राजवृत्तेषु संकीर्णः शरासनपरायणः॥
target: But you are angry and unsteady by nature, capricious, perfectly narrow-minded in the discharge of your royal duties and did use your bow and shaft: (any where and every time).

source: रसातलं प्रविष्टायां वैदेह्यां सर्ववानराः। चुक्रुशुः साधुसाध्वीति मुनयो रामसंनिधौ॥
target: Sītā having entered Rasātala, all the monkeys and Rșis repeatedly eulogised her before Rāma.

source: ब्रह्मरूपधराज्छ्रुत्वा प्रशान्तान् पाण्डुनन्दनान्। कौन्तेयान् मनुजेन्द्राणां विस्मयः समजायत॥
target: The monarchs were very much astonished to learn that the sons of Kunti, the Pandavas, had assumed the guise of the peaceful Brahmanas.

source: जयो वधो वा संग्रामे धात्राऽऽदिष्टः सनातनः। स्वधर्मः क्षत्रियस्यैष कार्पण्यं न प्रशस्यते॥
target: Victory or death has been originally fixed by the Father of the universe. The proper course of life for a Kshatriya is this (war) and it is not proper to show a humiliating spirit in this course. son

source: द्वादशेमानि वर्षाणि वस्तव्यं निर्जने वने। समाक्षध्य महारण्ये देश बहुमृगद्विमम्॥ बहुपुष्पफलं रम्यं शिवं पुण्यजनावृतम्। यत्रेमाः शरदः सर्वाः सुखं प्रतिवसेमहि॥
target: "We shall have to live in this lonely forest for twelve years; do you find out in this huge forest a spot, spot, charming, auspicious and abounding in many deer, birds, flowers and fruits and filled with pious men, where we may live happily for all these years."

source: अरोषणो यः समलोष्ठाश्मकाञ्चनः प्रहीणशोको गतसन्धिविग्रहः। निन्दाप्रशंसोपरतः प्रियाप्रिये त्यजन्नुदासीनवदेष भिक्षुकः॥
target: He who does not yield to wrath, who values equally a piece of earth with stone or gold, who is not touched by grief who is indifferent to friendship or enmity, who cares not for praise or blame and who avoids what is agreeable and disagreeable like one who has renounced the world, is a Bhikshuka.

source: आवयोर्जीवतो राजन् मयि च त्वयि च ध्रुवम्॥ संशय:सर्वभूतानां विजये नौ भविष्यति।
target: If both of us, that is, yourself and myself, be alive, then all creatures will remain in doubt as to whom the victory belongs.

source: सारोहश्चापतद् वाजी गजेनाभ्याहतो भृशम्। निर्मर्यादं महद् युद्धमवर्तत सुदारुणम्॥
target: Then there raged a fierce and dreadful fight in which nobody paid any regard to others. "Alas! Oh father" Oh son! Where are you, o friend! stay! Where do you run to!

source: विहितान्नाः प्रजास्तास्तु जग्मुः सृष्टा यथागतम्। ततो ववृधिरे राजन् प्रीतिमत्यः स्वयोनिषु॥
target: Their means of sustenance having been thus settled the newly created creatures all went away where they liked, and cheerfully multiplied their respective species.

source: त्वेष बीभत्सुरलं नृशंसं कर्तुं न पापेऽस्य मनो विशिष्टिम्॥ त्रैलोक्यहेतोर्न जहेत् स्वधर्म सर्वे न तस्मानिहता रणेऽस्मिन्। क्षिप्रं कुरून् याहि कुरुप्रवीर विजित्य गाश्च प्रतियातु पार्थः। मा ते स्वकोऽर्थो निपतेत मोहात् तत् संविदातव्यमरिष्टबन्धम्॥
target: Arjuna cannot behave cruelly as his mind never entangles in coming vice. He cannot abandon his religion even if enticed for ruling on trio-worlds. This is the reason, he did not killed us at that unconscious state. O one of pioneer warriors in Kuru race, go back to Kuru state immediately. Let Arjuna return to his destination with cows. Keep in mind your own interest and don't become cause for defeat of your own purpose. All of us should do whatever may ensure our welfare.

source: न वै राज्यं न राजाऽऽसीन्न च दण्डो न दाण्डिकः। धर्मेणैव प्रजाः सर्वा रक्षन्ति स्म परस्परम्॥
target: At first there was no sovereignty, no king, no punishment, and no punisher. All men used to protect one another piously.

source: भ्रातृनर्हसि मे वीर मोक्तुं गन्धर्वसत्तम। अनर्हधर्षणा हीमे जीवमानेषु पाण्डुषु॥
target: "O hero, O foremost of the Gandharvas, you should release my brothers. They are not to be insulted so long the Pandavas are alive."

source: इहस्थोऽहं प्रपश्यामि रावणं जानकी तथा। अस्माकमपि सौपर्णं दिव्यं चक्षुर्बलं तथा॥
target: Resting here, I see Ravana and Janaki. We have excellent Sauparana' clairvoyance. *Clairvoyance attained by success in knowledge respecting the spiritual Golden eyes. Thus far the commentator. We leave the abstruse point to the apostles of theosophy and spiritism for illucidation.

source: किमर्थे च विषादस्ते तद् ब्रूहि द्विपदां वर। न शोच्यं विदुषां श्रेष्ठ शोकः कार्यविनाशनः॥
target: Tell me, O foremost of men. the cause of this your sorrow? O foremost of the learned, sorrow should not be indulged in, inasmuch as it overthrows the ends of life.

source: पुनः पञ्चशतान् मत्स्यान् षट्सहस्रांश्च सुंजयान्। हस्तिनामयुतं हत्वा जघानाश्वायुतं पुनः॥
target: He then slew five hundred Matsyas, six thousand Srinjayas and then again ten thousand elephants and ten thousand steads.

source: आरोपितो विमानं तद्भरतः सत्यविक्रमः। राममासाद्य मुदितः पुनरेवाभ्यवादयत्॥
target: Ascending that car, Bharata, having truth for his prowess, reaching Rāma, delighted, again bowed to him.

source: स्वे स्वे किल कुले जाते पुत्रे नप्तरि वा पुनः। पितरः पितृलोकस्था: शोचन्ति च हसन्ति च॥
target: On a son or a grandson being born in their (respective) families, our ancestors in the Pitris region, either grieve or rejoice, thinking,

source: सम्भ्रान्तनरनागाश्वप्रपतद् विद्रुतं बलम्। हतविध्वस्तभूयिष्ठमावर्तत मुहुर्मुहुः॥
target: That army, which then consisted of frightened men and elephants and horse, which lost many warriors and animals, and which had been disordered and routed, began to wander and wheel about the field again and again.

source: यच्चापि वृष्णिवीरेण कृष्णेन कुरुनन्दन। पुरोक्तं तत् तथा भावा मा तेऽत्रास्तु विचारणा॥
target: That which was uttered by the Vrishni-hero on a former occasion, will, surely, happen! Do not think otherwise.

source: विनष्टचक्षुषस्तस्य बालपुत्रस्य धीमतः। सामीप्येन हृतं राज्यं छिद्रेऽस्मिन् पूर्ववैरिणा॥
target: That intellectual (monarch) who had an only infant son, having lost his eyes, a neighbouring enemy who bore him an old grudge, taking advantage of his blindness, seized his kingdom.

source: द्रोणास्त्रशरसंकृत्तं शयानं रुधिरोक्षितम्। विराटं वितुदन्त्येते गृध्रगोमायुवायसाः॥
target: Wounded with the weapons and arrows of Drona, lying down oi. earth, and bathed in blood, Virata is encompassed by the screaming vultures and yelling jackals and crows ravens.

source: वनं प्रज्वलयन् रम्यं रामाश्रमपदं च तत्। मनोहरं दर्शनीयं रूपं कृत्वा स राक्षसः॥ प्रलोभनार्थं वैदेह्या नानाधातुविचित्रितम्। विचरन् गच्छते सम्यक् शाद्वलानि समन्ततः॥
target: And in no time the Rākşasa assumed the shape of a beautiful deer. To tempt Vaidehī that ranger of the night, assuming a beautiful countenance painted with diverse metals, illumining the beautiful forest and Rāma's asylum with its beauty, and ranging at large on the green field and living on grass, began to

source: आहुः बहुपादानि जङ्गमानि द्वयानि तु। बहुपाट्यो विशिष्टानि द्विपदानि बहून्यपि॥
target: Mobile creatures, whose number is legion, are of two sorts, viz., those that are many legs and those that have two. The latter, however, are superior to the former.

source: सत्त्वं रजस्तमश्चेति देवासुरगुणान् विदुः। सत्त्वं देवगुणं विद्यादितरावासुरौ गुणौ॥
target: It should be known that the qualities of Goodness, Darkness, and Ignorance belong to the gods and the Asuras. Goodness is the quality of the gods; while the two others belong to the Asuras.

source: अतीत्यैकादशाहं तु नामकर्म तथाकरोत्। ज्येष्ठं रामं महात्मानं भरतं कैकयीसुतम्॥ सौमित्रिं लक्ष्मणमिति शत्रुघ्नमपरं तथा। वसिष्ठः परमप्रीतो नामानि कुरुते तदा॥
target: When the eleventh day had gone by, the king performed the Naming ceremony of his sons. And experiencing great delight, Vasistha conferred the names. And the high-souled eldest one was called Rāma; and Kaikeyi's son was called Bharata; and Sumitrā's son was called Laksmana, and the last was named Satrughna.

source: तव शुश्रूषया चैव गान्धार्याश्च यशस्विनी। भर्तुः सलोकतामेषा गमिष्यति वधूस्तव॥
target: Through serving you and Gandhari, this daughter-in-law of yours, possessed of great fame, will attain to residence with her husband in the other world.

source: एवं दत्त्वा वरांस्तेभ्यस्तस्मिन्यज्ञोत्सवे सुराः। निवृत्ते सह राज्ञा ते पुनः स्वभवनं गताः॥
target: Having thus conferred boons on them at that festal place, the celestials, along with the king, (on the sacrifice) having ended, went to their abode.

source: वृक्षेभ्यः पतितैः पुष्पैरवकीर्णा पृथग्विधैः। रराज वसुधा तत्र प्रमदेव विभूषिता॥
target: And strewn with several masses of blossoms loosened from the trees, the Earth appeared breateous like a damsel dight with ornaments.

source: विरथः स तु धर्मात्मा धनुष्पाणिरवस्थितः। अयोधयत् तव सुतं किरशरशतान् बहून्॥
target: Made carless, the virtuous-souled (Prativindhya) stood, bow in hand and fought with your son by discharging many hundreds of shafts.

source: सा दृष्ट्वा कर्म रामस्य कृतमन्यैः सुदुष्करम्। जगाम परमोद्विग्ना लङ्कां रावणपालिताम्॥
target: And witnessing Rāma's deeds, incapable of being performed by others, she, extremely agitated, went to Lankā, ruled by Rāvana.

source: स्थापितो ह्यस्य समयः पूर्वमेव स्वयम्भुवा। अजस्रं परियात्येष सत्येनावतपन् प्रजाः॥
target: The self-create has before this ordinated the laws which regulate the Sun's motions. Giving light and heat to all creatures, he shines continually.

source: समुद्र इव निर्वेगो भग्नद्रष्ट्र इवोरगः। उपरक्त इवादित्यः सद्यो निप्रभतां गतः॥
target: And like to a tideless ocean or a fangless snake, he instantly became shorn of his effulgence, like to the sun overwhelmed by Rahu.* *A Daitya with the tail of a dragon, whose head was served from his body by Vişnu; but being immortal, the head and tail retained their separate existence, and being transferred to the stellar sphere, became the author of eclipses.

source: यदि वधमिच्छसि रावणस्य संख्ये यदि च कृतां हि तवेच्छसि प्रतिज्ञाम्। यदि तव राजसुताभिलाष आर्य कुरु च वचो मम शीघ्रमद्य वीर॥
target: If you wish to slay Råvaņa in battle, if your desire to recover the princess, then, O noble one, O hero, today speedily set about what I say.

source: युधिष्ठिरस्तु नृपतिर्नातिप्रीतमनास्तदा। धारयामास तद् राज्यं निहतज्ञातिबान्धवः॥
target: King Yudhishthira, after the death of his uncle, became very cheerless. Deprived of his kinsmen and relatives, he somehow bore the burthen of sovereignty. JAVASIKA PARVA

source: वनं प्रविशतानेन वायुभक्षेण धीमता। अग्नयः कारयिन्वेष्टिमुत्सृष्टा इति नः श्रुतम्॥
target: We have heard that when the old king gifted with great intelligence and living on air alone entered the forest (after his return from Gangadvara), he caused his sacrificial fires to be duly ignited. Having performed is sacred rites there with, be abandoned them all.

source: मुहूर्तमिव तु ध्यात्वा धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः। उवाच मातरं दीनश्चिन्ताशोकपरायणः॥
target: Having thought for a inoment, king Yudhishthira just, dispirited and plunged in anxiety and sorrow, said to his mother, saying,

source: सुचन्द्रं चन्द्रहर्तारं तथा चन्द्रप्रमर्दनम्। क्रूरस्वभावं क्रूरायाः पुत्रपौत्रमनन्तकम्॥
target: And (she gave birth to) three others, namely Suchandra, Chandraharta and Chandrapramardana. The numberless progeny of Krura was much wicked as she herself was.

source: एषा ते हृदयं भित्त्वा शक्तिर्लोहितलक्षणा। मद्बाहुपरिघोत्सृष्टा प्राणानादाय यास्यति॥ इत्येवमुक्त्वा तां शक्तिमष्टघण्टां महास्वनाम्। मयेन मायाविहिताममोघां शत्रुघातिनीम्॥ लक्ष्मणाय समुद्दिश्य ज्वलन्तीमिव तेजसा। रावणः परमवद्धश्चिक्षपे च ननाद च॥ सा क्षिप्ता भीमवेगेन वज्राशनिसमस्वना। शक्तिरभ्यपतद्वेगाल्लक्ष्मणं रणमूर्धनि॥
target: Having said this, Rāvana waxing furiously enraged, discharged at Laksmana that dart forged by Maya with his power of illusion, furnished with eight bells, having might sounds,t Incapable of being resisted, competent to finish foes: and flaming in energy-and shouted simultaneously. And hurled with terrific force the dart sending sounds resembling that of Vajra of the thunder-bolt, vehemently alighted at Lakş maņa in that encounter.

source: भ्रातरं निहतं दृष्ट्वा भीमसेनेन संयुगे॥ रुधिरे पीयमाने च किंस्विद् दुर्योधनऽब्रवीत्।
target: Having seen that his brother was slain in battle and his blood was drunk by Bhimasena, what did Duryodhana say? w

source: नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः। मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम्॥
target: Shrouded by the delusion of My inconceivable power, I am not manifest to all. This deluded world, knows not Me who am unborn and undecaying.

source: सहस्रशो महाशब्दः शिखराणि पतन्ति च। महाभूता भूमिकम्पे चत्वारः सागराः पृथक्।
target: Thousands of sounds are heard thousands of mountain-summits are falling down. Earth trembles, and in consequence the four oceans.

source: ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा श्रुत्वा माधवमागतम्। प्रतिग्रहार्थं कृष्णस्य यमौ प्रास्थापयत् तदा॥
target: Hearing that Madhava (Krishna) had come, the king Yudhishthira sent the twins (Nakula and Sahadeva) to receive him.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच केन संकल्पितं श्राद्धं कस्मिन् काले किमात्मकम्। भृग्वगिरसिके काले मुनिना कतरेण वा॥
target: Yudhishthira said By whom was the Shraddha first conceived and at what time? What also is its substance? In the time when the world was inhabited by only the descendants of Bhrigu and Angirasa who was the Muni who established the Shraddha?

source: आददानं गजाश्वानां नृणां चायूंषि भारता क्षणेन भूयः पश्यामः सूर्ये मध्यंदिने यथा।॥
target: The next moment, O Bharata, we beheld him shining like the mid-day sun and wrenching the lives out of elephants, steeds and men.

source: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा कौसल्या हृदयङ्गमम्। शुद्धसत्त्वा मुमोचाश्रु सहसा दुःखहर्षजम्॥
target: Hearing Sītā's words which went directly to the heart, Kausalyā endued with purity of spirit, out of fullness of bliss and bale suddenly shed tears.

source: प्रियं चेद् भरतस्यैतद् रामप्रव्राजनं भवेत्। मा स्म मे भरतः कार्षीत् प्रेतकृत्यं गतायुषः॥
target: If the banishment of Rāma, be agreeable to Bharata let him not, when I am dead, perform my funeral obsequies.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच इत्यं ते निकृतिप्रज्ञा राजन् दुर्योधनादयः। हसन्तः प्रीतमनसो जग्मुः स्वं स्वं निकेतनम्॥
target: O king, thus expressing their great delight, Duryodhana and others, ever bent on mischief, cheerfully went to their respective house.

source: अथ रामोऽब्रवीत्तत्र लक्ष्मणं शुभलक्षणम्। निर्गच्छ त्वं महाबाहो सुमित्रानन्दवर्धन॥
target: Rāma said to Lakşmaņa, gifted with auspicious marks “O Saumitri having long arms, do you proceed to the city-gate to receive those who have come here for business."

source: सोऽश्वमेधशतैरिष्ट्वा राजसूयशतेन च॥ अददद् रोहितान् मत्स्यान् ब्राह्मणेभ्यो विशाम्पते। हैरण्यान् यो जनोत्सेधानायताञ्शतयोजनम्॥
target: Having accomplished a hundred horsesacrifices and a hundred Rajasuya sacrifices also. He gave away to the Brahmanas, O ruler of men, some Rohita fish made of gold that were ten yojanas in length and one yojana in breadth.

source: दुर्योधन उवाच व्यपनेष्यति ते बुद्धिं विदुरो मुक्तसंशयः। पाण्डवानां हिते युक्तो न तथा मम कौरव॥
target: Duryodhana said O descendant of Kuru, Vidura is always engaged in doing good to the Pandavas. His feelings towards me is not so.

source: वपुर्भिश्च नरेन्द्राणां चन्द्रसूर्यसमप्रभैः। विरराज तदा राजंस्तत्र तत्र रणाङ्गणम्॥
target: Then, O monarch, here and there, the field of battle appeared beautiful being strewn over with the bodies of monarchs which were effulgent like the sun or the moon.

source: प्रत्याहृतं गोधनं च विक्रमेण किरीटिना। विराटेनोत्तरा दत्ता स्नुषा यत्र किरीटिनः॥ अभिमन्युं समुद्दिश्य सौभद्रमरिघातिनम्। चतुर्थमेतद्विपुलं वैराटं पर्व वर्णितम्॥
target: The release of the king's kine by Arjuna's valour; the bestowal by Virata of his daughter to Arjuna for his acceptance of her for his son by Subhadra, Abhimanyu, the destroyer of foes. These are the contents of the extensive fourth Parva Virata.

source: बाणशब्दरवान् कृत्वा विमिश्राशङ्खनिःस्वनैः॥ अस्मांस्तु पुनरासाद्य लब्धलक्ष्यप्रहारिणः। शरासनानि धुन्वानाः सिंहनादान् प्रचुक्रुशुः॥
target: Shooting their arrows and making various other kinds of noise mingled with the blare of their conchs, those warriors of sure aim, shook bows and uttered leonine shouts.

source: सम्पाद्यमानं सम्यक् च स्यात् कर्म सफलं प्रभो। स तथा कृष्ण वर्तस्व यथा शर्म भवेत् परैः॥
target: Done in a proper way, however, our object may be successful, O lord, therefore, O Krishna, act in such a way that there may be enemy.

source: न तु पश्यामि तच्छत्रं पाण्डुरं लोकविश्रुतम्। पितुर्दिव्यं महाभाग संशयो भवतीह मे॥
target: But, you exalted one, I do not see the splendid white umbrella of our father known among men. Therefore, doubts arise in my mind.

source: देवानामीश्वरं चक्रे देवं दशशतेक्षणम्। यमं वैवस्वतं चापि पितृणामकरोत् प्रभुम्॥
target: It was then that he made the divine Indra of a thousand eyes the king of gods. Yama the son of Vivasvat was made the lord of the departed manes.

source: समाम्नायोऽसमाम्नायस्तीर्थदेवो महारथः। निर्जीवो जीवनो मन्त्रः शुभाक्षो बहुकर्कशः॥
target: You are the Veda; you are the Smritis the Itihasas, the Puranas, and other scriptures; you are the illustrious god of very sacred shrine; you are he who has the Earth for his car; you are the inert elements that form every creature; you are he who gives life into every combination of those inert elements; you are the Pranava and other sacred Mantras that put life into dead matter; you are he who casts peaceful looks; you are severely harsh.

source: शोणिताक्ता गदां बिभ्रन्मेदोमज्जाकृतच्छविः। कृताभ्यङ्गः शोणितेन रुद्रवत् प्रत्यदृश्यता॥
target: Wielding his mace bathed in blood, with his person be spattered with fat and marrow, and smeared with gore Bhima appeared beautiful like the Rudra himself.

source: श्रीमान् दधिमुखोनाम हरिवृद्धोऽतिवीर्यवान्। प्रचकर्ष महासैन्यं हरीणां भीमतेजसाम्॥
target: The highly-powerful and illustrious old monkey, Dadhimukha by name, gathered a great army of monkeys endued with terrible prowess.

source: ते तत्र नियताः कालं कंचिदूषुर्नरर्षभाः। मात्रा सहैकचक्रायां ब्राह्मणस्य निवेशने॥
target: They those best of men, with their mother lived there for some time in the house of a Brahmana, in temperance and in abstinence.

source: मार्कण्डेयस्य राजेन्द्र तीर्थमासाद्य दुर्लभम्॥ गोमतीगङ्गयोश्चैव संगमे लोकविश्रुते। अग्निष्टोममवाप्नोति कुलं चैव समुद्धरेत्॥
target: O king of kings, then going to the inaccessible Tirtha of Markandeya situated at the confluence of the Gomati and the Ganges, ever celebrated over the world, one obtains the fruits of Agnishtoma (sacrifice) and saves his race.

source: तमुद्यतगदं दृष्ट्वा कैलासमिव शृङ्गिणम्॥ भीमसेनः पुनः क्रुद्धो दुर्योधनमुवाच ह। राज्ञश्च धृतराष्ट्रस्य तथा त्वमपि चात्मनः॥ स्पर तद् दुष्कृतं कर्म यद् वृत्तं वारणावते।
target: Seeing Duryodhana also standing with uplifted mace like mount Kailasa, Bhimasena, worked up with ire, once more addressed him, saying— 'Remember that misdeed of yourself and king Dhritarashtra that occurred at Varnavata!

source: तथा धौम्येन धर्मज्ञो वाक्यैः सम्परितोषितः। शास्त्रबुद्ध्या स्वबुद्ध्या च न चचाल युधिष्ठिरः॥
target: Thus cheered by these words of Dhaumya, the virtuous Yudhishthira, relying on his own wisdom and also that gained from Shastras, regained his patience.

source: तं समीक्ष्य महातेजा महेषु तेन संधितम्। लक्ष्मणोऽप्याददे बाणमन्यद्भीमपराक्रमः॥ कुबेरेण स्वयं स्वप्ने यद्दत्तममितात्मना। दुर्जयं दुर्विषां च सेन्ट्रैरपि सुरासुरैः॥
target: Seeing that mighty shaft set by him (on the bow-string), the highly powerful Laksmana, possessed of dreadful prowess, (in his turn) took up another arrow, bestowed by Kuvera himself of imme jurable soul in a dream, unconquerable, and incapable of being borne even by the celestials and Asuras with Indra at their head.

source: सत्यं रूपं श्रुतं विद्या कौल्यं शीलं बलं धनम्। शौर्यं च चित्रभाष्यं च दशेमे स्वर्गयोनयः॥
target: Truth, beauty, learning, knowledge, good birth, good manners, strength, wealth, heroism and ability to talk on diverse topics, these ten have their origin in heaven.

source: न बलं बलिनां मध्ये बलं भवति कौरव। बलवन्तो हि ते सर्वे पाण्डवा देवविक्रमाः॥
target: Among the really strong, physical strength does not count, O son of Kuru and all the sons of Pandu, who are endued with the strength of the gods, are strong.

source: ते त तत्र चिरं कालं विलय न महारथाः॥ प्राद्रवन् रथिनां श्रेष्ठा दृष्ट्वा पाण्डुसुतान् रणे।
target: Having wept there for a long time, those great car-warriors fled away seeing the sons of Pandu.

source: यमदण्डोपमान् घोराज्वलिताशीविषोपमान्। सौभद्रः समरे क्रुद्धः प्रेषयामास सायकान्॥
target: Inflamed with rage, Subhadra's discharged in that battle fierce arrows that resembled the mace of Death, and blazing snakes of Virulent venom.

source: तन्मां दहति यत् कृष्णा सभायां कुरुसंनिधौ। धाष्ट्रैिः परिक्लिष्टा यथा न कुशलं तथा॥
target: The degree, to which this fact pains me, namely the dragging of Krishna to the Assembly-Hall in the presence of the Kurus and insulted by the sons of Dhritarashtra, is not equalled by death itself.

source: कार्या रुधिरमासांढ्या बलयो यक्षरक्षसाम्। सुरासवपुरस्कारा लाजोल्लापिकभूषिताः॥
target: The Balis that should be offered to Yakshas and Rakshasas should be rich with blood and meat, with wines and spirits accompanying, and adorned with friend paddy.

source: यो बलं धार्तराष्ट्राणां पाण्डवानां यतो भयम्॥ सोऽर्जुनेन हतः कर्णः प्रतिमानं धनुष्मताम्।
target: That Karna who had been the strength of all the Dhartarashtras and who had been the object of terror to the Pandavas and who, again, had been the type of the best of all bowmen, was slain by Arjuna.

source: प्रांशुः कनकतालाभः सिंहसंहननो युवा। असंख्येयगुणः श्रीमान् भास्करस्यात्मसम्भवः॥
target: Being born of the sun, he was tall like a golden palm; he was a youth who could slay lions. He was handsome and possessed countless accomplishments.

source: दीर्घसूत्रस्तु मन्दात्मा हीनबुद्धिरचेतनः। मरणं प्राप्तवान् मूढो यथैवोपहतेन्द्रियः॥
target: That fish, however, who had been idle. foolish, and senseless and without intelligence, and, therefore, unable to escape, met with his death.

source: सिंहनादं विनद्योच्चैयुद्धायैवावतस्थिरे। ततो भीमं पुरस्कृत्य भगदत्तमुपाद्रवन्॥
target: Uttering their war cries aloud, proceeded for battle. Then placing Bhima at their head they assailed Bhagadatta,

source: तदन्तं हि भवेद् वैरमनुमानेन माधव॥ एवं पश्यामि वार्ष्णेय चिन्तयन् प्रज्ञया स्वया। विदुरस्य च वाक्येन चेष्टया च दुरात्मनः॥ तस्माद् याहि चमू वीर यावद्धन्मि शितैः शरैः। दुर्योधनं महाबाहो वाहिनीं चास्य संयुगे॥
target: That will terminate these hostilities. Exercising my reason, O Madhava and reflecting in my own mind, O Vrishni heroe, thinking of Vidura's words and taking into account the acts of the wicked Duryodhana himself, I have arrived at this conclusion. Enter into Kuru division, O hero, for I shall kill the wicked Duryodhana and his army today with my keen arrows.

source: व्यामिश्रेणेव वाक्येन बुद्धिं मोहयसीव मे। तेदकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्नुयाम्॥
target: You confound my mind by equivocal words, (praising action once and praising knowledge next). Tell me definitely what is good for me".

source: महाबलाः महासत्त्वाः प्रज्ञागुणसमन्विताः। प्रजायन्ते च जाताश्च शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः॥ जाताः कृतयुगे राजन् धनिनः प्रियदर्शनाः। प्रजायन्ते च जाताश्च मुनयो वै तपोधनाः॥ महोत्साहा महात्मानो धार्मिका: सत्यवादिनः। प्रियदर्शना वपुष्मन्तो महावीर्या धनुर्धराः॥
target: O king, in the Krita Yuga, men are born and beget children by hundreds and thousands they possess great strength and power and wisdom, wealth and beauty. Great ascetic Rishis, capable of great deeds and possessing highsouls, virtuous, and truthful are born in that age. The Kshatriyas of that age are handsome, able bodied, greatly energetic, accomplished in archery, highly skilled in battle and very brave. O king, in the Krita Yuga, all the Kshatriya kings were lords paramount.

source: त्रिविधाः पुरुषा राजन्नुत्तमाधममध्यमाः। नियोजयेद् यथावत् तांस्त्रिविधेष्वेव कर्मसु॥
target: Men too, o king, of three denominations viz., the good, bad middling; they should therefore be employed in their respective avocations-in three sorts of work. are

source: धर्माय येऽभ्यसूयन्ति बुद्धिमोहान्विता नराः। अपथा गच्छतां तेषामनुयाताऽपि पीड्यते॥
target: Those men who are stupefied by erroneous understandings show a hatred for virtue. The man who follows those misguided persons that have taken to devious and wrong paths is afflicted equally with them.

source: तस्य द्वाराणि सर्वाणि पर्याप्तानि बृहन्ति च। सर्वतः सुविभक्तानि यन्त्रैरारक्षितानि च॥
target: The gates should all be large and sufficiently strong. Kept in proper places, those gates should be carefully guarded.

source: नैनमन्येऽवजानन्ति नात्मना परितप्यते। कृत्यशेषेण यो राजा सुखान्यनुबुभूषति॥
target: That king, who, having performed all his duties, becomes satisfied with the verdict of his own conscience, has never to incur the displeasure of others nor has he any occasion to indulge in regrets.

source: अहं निदेशं भवतो यथोक्तमनुपालयन् ॥ चतुर्दश समा वत्स्ये वने वनचरैः सह। मा विमर्शो वसुमती भरताय प्रदीयताम्॥
target: Obeying the mandate that you have issued, I will dwell in the forest for fourteen years in the company of the rangers of the woods. Do you without feeling any compunction confer the earth on Bharata.

source: भ्रातृ॑श्च सर्वान् ऋतुभिः संयोज्य बहुदक्षिणैः। सम्प्राप्तः कीतिमतुलां पाण्डवेय भविष्यसि॥
target: Making your brothers also perform great sacrifices with profuse presents, you will, O son of Pandu, acquire great fame.

source: ते पूज्यास्ते नमस्कार्या भान्यास्ते पितरो यथा। तेष्वेव यात्रा लोकानां भूतानामिव वासवे॥
target: Such individuals are worthy of adoration. The king should bow his head to such individuals. Indeed, they should be honoured, even as one honours his father and grandfather. The course of conduct followed by men, depends upon them as the existence of all creatures depends upon Vasava.

source: कथं नाम दशग्रीव साक्षाद्वैश्रवणानुज। हन्तुमिच्छसि वैदेही क्रोधाद्धर्ममपास्य च॥
target: Wherefore, O Ten-necked one, O you who are the very younger brother of Vaiśravaņa himself, Did you desire to slay Vaidehī, forsaking righteousness?

source: ततः शिलां समुक्षिप्य भीमस्य युधि तिष्ठतः। प्राहिणोद् राक्षसः क्रुद्धो भीमश्च न चचाल ह॥
target: Thereupon the angry Rakshasas hurled a stone at Bhima standing in the fight, but Bhima did not waver.

source: एष चास्रप्रतीघातं वासुदेवः प्रयुक्तवान्। अन्यथा विहितः संख्ये वधः शत्रोर्जनाधिप॥
target: The son of Vasudeva counter acted the weapon by what means you have seen. For this, O ruler of men, the extermination of the foe has not been accomplished in battle.

source: स धर्मात्मा धर्ममधीत्य पुण्यं यदिच्छया व्रजति ब्रह्मलोकम्। वित्तं चिन्वन् पालयन्नप्रमत्तः॥
target: The virtuous soul, doing virtuous deeds, roams at his will in the region of Brahma. A Vaishya should study and accumulate wealth by agriculture, keeping cattle and commerce. He should observe these duties intently.

source: गभस्तिनेमिः सत्त्वस्थः सिंहो भूतमहेश्वरः। आदिदेवो महादेवो देवेशो देवभृद्गुरुः॥
target: He who exists, in the form of the Sun, as the centre of innumerable rays of light. He who lives in all creatures. He who is endued with great prowess. He who is the Master of even Yama and others of similar power. He who is the oldest of the deities. He who exists in His own glory, renouncing all conditions. He who is the Lord of even all the deities. He who is the ruler of even him who upholds the deities (viz., Indra). (486-493)

source: विराटनगरे चापि समेताः सर्वकौरवाः। पार्थेन निर्जिता युद्धे त्वं च कर्ण सहानुजः॥
target: Again, in the city of Virata, all the assembled Kauravas as well as you, O Karna, together with your younger brother were (all) defeated by Part. a in battle.

source: शेते विनिहतो भूमौ वने सिंहशिशुर्यथा॥ जाननप्यनृतस्याथ दोषान् स द्विजसत्तमम्। अव्यक्तमब्रवीद् राजा हतः कुञ्जर इत्युत॥
target: Slain he lies prostrate on the field like a lion-calf in the woods. Cognisant of the evils of falschood that king clearly spoke these words to the foremost of Brahmanas, adding indistinctly the word elephant after them. Hearing that you have been slain and consequently afflicted with great grief.

source: अथानयन्बलाध्यक्षाश्चत्वारो रावणाज्ञया। रथानां नियुतं साग्रं नागानां नियुतत्रयम्॥ अश्वानां षष्टिकोट्यस्तु खरोष्ट्राणां तथैव च। पदातयस्त्वसंख्याता जग्मुस्ते राजशासनात्।।२८
target: Thereupon at the command of Råvaņa the commanders brought one Niyuta (a hundred thousand) cars, three Niyuta elephants, sixty million horses, asses and camels and numberless infantry.

source: एवमुक्तः स गन्धर्वैः कुन्तीपुत्रो धनंजयः। गन्धर्वान् पुनरेवेदं वचनं प्रत्यभाषत॥
target: Having been thus addressed by the Gandharvas in these words, the son of Kunti, Dhananjaya, thus replied to the Gandharvas in these words,

source: दुर्योधन ततो दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवेन भृशार्दितम्। पराक्रान्तान् पाण्डुसुतान् दृष्ट्वा चापि महारथः॥
target: Then what did that very powerful carwarrior do after seeing Duryodhana very highly oppressed by the son of Pandu and also after witnessing all the sons of Pandu to display their prowess in arms?

source: घासमुष्टिं परगवे दद्यात् संवत्सरं यः। अकृत्वा स्वयमाहारं व्रतं तत् सार्वकामिकम्॥
target: That man who, before eating himself, gives every day, for a year only a handful of grass to a cow belonging to another, is considered as practising a vow or observance which bestows the fruition of every desire.

source: वृद्धप्रज्ञः पुण्यमेव नित्यमारभते नरः। पुण्यं कुर्वन् पुण्यकीर्तिः पुण्यं स्थानं स्म गच्छति। तस्मात् पुण्यं निषेवेत पुरुषः सुसमाहितः॥
target: An old man and wise always does virtuous acts. By doing virtuous acts he gains a good reputation and goes to a holy place (hereafter). Therefore should a man intently practice virtue.

source: दस्मिन् युद्धे वासुदेवं सहायम्। स मे लब्धो दस्युवधाय कृष्णो मन्ये चैतद् विहितं दैवतैर्मे॥
target: In this war, have I preferred the help of Vasudeva to Indra with the thunderbolt in his hand. That Krishna has come over to my side for the purpose of slaying these wicked men. This I consider has been ordained by the gods.

source: पूरणार्थं समुद्रस्य पृथिवीमवतारिता। समुद्रश्च यथा पीतः कारणार्थं महात्मना।॥ वातापिश्च यथा नीतः क्षयं स ब्रह्महा प्रभो। अगस्त्येन महाराज यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि॥
target: Was brought down on earth in order to fill the ocean, how for a particular object the ocean was drunk up by the high-souled one (Agastya) and now, O great king, O lord, Vatapi, the destroyer of Brahmanas, was destroyed by Agastya, all that you asked me (to narrate).

source: तत्र ते स्तकृतास्तेन सुमहार्हपरिच्छदाः। उपास्यमानाः पुरुषैरूषुः पुरनिवासिभिः॥
target: Being served by Purochana and adored by the citizens, they (the Pandavas,) attired in costly robes, lived there.

source: युध्यमानस्य भीमस्य सूतपुत्रोऽसमायया। तस्येषुधी धनुर्ध्या च बाणैः संनतपर्वभिः॥ रश्मीन् योक्त्राणि चाश्वानां क्रुद्धः कर्णोऽच्छिनन्मृधे। तस्याश्वांश्च पुनर्हत्वा सूतं विव्याध पञ्चभिः॥
target: Inflamed with wrath, Karna, the son of Suta by virtue of the illusion of his weapons, cut-off in that combat, with his straight arrows the pairs of quivers and the bow-string and the traces of the steeds of the fighting Bhima. Thereafter slaying his antagonist's steeds, Karna pierced the latter's charioteer with five shafts.

source: देवतानां च संकल्पमनुभावं च धीमताम्। विनयं कृतविद्यानां विनाशं पापकर्मणाम्॥
target: The resolve of the gods, the intellect, of the wise, the humility of the accomplished and the destruction of wicked deeds.

source: तथा शपन्त्यां वैदेह्या प्रादुरासीत्तदद्भुतम्। भूतलादुत्थितं दिव्यं सिंहासनमनुत्तमम्॥
target: As soon as Sītā swore in this wise a wonderful incident took place. From inside the earth a celestial and excellent throne rose up.

source: तत्रोपविष्टान् ददृशुर्महासत्त्वपराक्रमान्। राजसिंहान् महाभागान् कृष्णागुरुविभूषितान्॥ महाप्रसादान् ब्रह्मण्यान् स्वराष्ट्रपरिरक्षिणः। प्रियान् सर्वस्य लोकस्य सुकृतैः कर्मभिः शुभैः॥ मञ्चेषु च पराध्र्येषु पौरजानपदा जनाः। कृष्णादर्शनसिद्ध्यर्थं सर्वतः समुपाविशन्॥
target: When those best of kings, who were adorned with the fragrant paste of Aguru, who were greatly powerful, noble minded, liberal, devoted to Brahmanas, beloved of the whole world for their good deeds and the protectors of their kingdoms, took their respective seats, the people of the city and the country who had come to see Krishna and who had already taken their seats on the excellent platforms all around saw them.

source: सोऽहं वाससहायस्ते भविष्यामि यदीच्छसि। सीतां च तात रक्षिष्ये त्वयि याते सलक्ष्मणे॥
target: If you will, I shall become your help during your abode (in the woods). And, O child, I shall protect Sītā when you shall go out along with Laksimana.

source: ते चैनं भृशसंतप्ताः शरवर्षैरवाकिरन्। स च तांश्छादयामास शरजालैः पुनः पुनः॥
target: Greatly afflicted, they also covered Karna with a down-pour of arrows. Karna also covered them repeatedly with showers of arrows.
