source: भूय एव तु लोकेऽस्मिन् सवृत्तिं कालहैतुकीम्। यया सन्तः प्रवर्तन्ते तदिच्छाम्यनुवर्तितुम्॥
target: I wish however, to once more hear of that path of righteousness which runs in this world, regulated by the virtue of Time and according to which all good men form their conduct.

source: तस्यास्तद् वचनं श्रुत्वा हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः। सीतायाः शोकतप्तायाः समीपमुपचक्रमे॥
target: Hearing those words of $ītā, racked with sorrow, Hanumān, the son of the Wind-god drew a little nearer to her.

source: संजय उवाच हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि सर्वं प्रत्यक्षदर्शिवान्। यथा स न्यपतद् द्रोणः सूदितः पाण्डुसृञ्जयै :॥
target: Sanjaya said Alas! I shall relate to you everything, as I saw with my own eyes, how Drona fell being slain by the Pandus and the Srinjayas.

source: इति नारायणः शम्भुर्भगवान् भूतभावनः। आदित्यविबुधान् सर्वानजायत यदुक्षये॥
target: The illustrious lord of the universe, Shambhu, Narayana, having thus commanded all the celestialss, had taken his birth in the race of Yadu.

source: भीष्म उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। शिलोच्छवृत्तेः संवादं सिद्धस्य च युधिष्ठिर॥
target: Bhishma said Regarding it is cited the old conversation between a Brahmana in the observance of the Shila and the Unccha vows, O Yudhishthira, and a Rishi crowned with ascetic merits.

source: ग्राह्यं दृश्यं च सत्यं वा यदिदं कर्म विद्यते। एतदेव व्यवस्यन्ति कर्म कर्मेति कर्मिणः॥

target: Many costly apparels and many valuable pearls. Thereupon the intelligent Sahadeva returned to his kingdom.

source: युध्यमानान् यथाशक्ति घटमानाञ्जयं प्रति। पाण्डवा हि जयन्त्येव जीयन्ते चैव मामकाः॥
target: Yough they are fighting to the best of their powers, and striving hard to secure victory over them, whilst they are becoming reduced in number.

source: अथापगेयं भीष्मं त्वं रामेणेच्छसि धीमता। रणे विनिर्जितं द्रष्टुं कुर्यात् तदपि भार्गवः॥
target: Or if you desire to see the blamable Bhishma vanquished in battle by the wise Rama, he, of Bhrigu's family, will do that too.

source: अङ्गुष्ठमात्रः पुरुषोऽन्तरात्मा लिङ्गस्य योगेन स याति नित्यम्। तमीशमीड्यमनुकल्पमाद्यं पश्यन्ति मूढा न विराजमानम्। योगिनस्तं प्रपश्यन्ति भगवन्तं सनातनम्॥
target: The being who is the inner soul is of the size of the thumb, by being joined with the human body ever moves. Fools alone do not perceive Him manifest within everything, who is the Lord, Who is worthy of being worshipped, Who is capable of anything and the Prime Being. The ascetics perceive that Lord who is Eternal.

source: यथा च सर्वथाऽऽपत्सु वार्ष्णेयः पाति पाण्डवम्। तथा मद्रेश्वराद्य त्वं राधेयं प्रतिपालय॥
target: Even as that descendant of the Vrishni race protects the son of Pandu all means in all his difficulties, so, O chief of the Madras, do you support today the son of Radha.

source: पुराहं राजशार्दूल तीर्थान्यनुचरन् प्रभो। समासादितवान् दिव्यं नरनारायणाश्रमम्॥
target: Formerly, O foremost of Kings, while sojourning among sacred places, I arrived O lord, at the beautiful hermitage of Nara and Narayana.

source: लीनं तु तस्य गात्रेषु मार्जारस्य च मूषिकम्। दृष्ट्वा तौ नकुलोलूको निराशौ प्रत्यपद्यताम्॥
target: Seeing him thus enclosed within the body of the cat, the mongoose and the owl both gave up hopes of catching their prey.

source: ततः खङ्गं समुद्यम्य त्रिशिरा राक्षसोत्त निचखान तदा खङ्गं वानरेन्द्रस्य वक्षसि ॥
target: Then upraising his sword, that foremost of Raksasas-Trisiras-brought it down on the breast of the monkey-chief.

source: स्वयं ब्रह्मत्वमकरोत् तस्य सत्यवतीसुतः। धनंजयानामृषभः सुसामा सामगोऽभवत्॥
target: The son of Satyavati (Vyasa) himself became the Brahma in that sacrifice, the best of the Dhananjaya race, Susama, became the chaunter of the Sama Veda.

source: आवाभ्यां सहितः शत्रूश्वो निहन्ता समागमे। विक्रम्य रथिनां श्रेष्ठ पञ्चालान् सपदानुगान्॥
target: United with ourselves, you will kill the enemy, viz., the Panchalas will all their followers, tomorrow in battle, displaying your prowess, O best of car-warriors.

source: इत्युक्तो रथमास्थाय तथेति प्राह भारत। शल्येऽभ्युपगते कर्णः सारथिं सुमनाऽब्रवीत्॥ त्वं सूत स्यादनं मह्यं कल्पयेत्यसकृत् त्वरन्।
target: Thus addressed he expressed his consent and got upon the chariot, O Bharata. When Shalya went there, Karna, in good spirits, addressed his driver saying, O charioteer, quickly equip this car for me.

source: ततो विव्याध गात्रेषु सर्वेषु समितिंजयः। राघवस्तु सुसंकुद्धो रावणं बहुभिः शरैः॥
target: Then Rāghava-victor fight-waxing wondrous wroth, with countless shafts pierced Ravaņa all over his person.

source: सुकुमारी सुखार्हा च राजपुत्री पुरंदर। सास्माभिः सह गच्छेत तद् भवाननुमन्यताम्॥
target: The delicate princess (Draupadi) deserving of every comfort, O Purandara, should go with us! You should permit this.'

source: तत्राग्निकल्पा होतार आसन् सत्रे महात्मनः। मूलाहारा: फलाहारा: साश्मकुट्टा मरीचिपाः॥
target: In that sacrifice of the great Rishi many Hotris were engaged who resembled blazing fires in the splendour of their bodies. Among them were men who lived upon roots or fruits, or who used two pieces of stone only for husking their corn, or who were supported by only the rays (of the moon).

source: शब्दरूपरसस्पर्शेर्गन्धैश्च विविधैरपि। मज्जमांसमहापङ्के निरालम्बे समन्ततः॥
target: Plunged in a slough by the objects of senses, viz., sound, form, taste, touch and scent, man remains there without anything to save him from there.

source: यद्यस्य कृतमस्माभिर्बुध्यसे किंचिदप्रियम्। तद्बुद्ध्या सम्प्रधाशु क्षिप्रमेवाभिधीयताम्॥
target: Considering aright, did you speedily inform me if I have performed any improper act towards Rāma.

source: अथचीकादयोऽभ्येत्य पितरो राममब्रुवन्। राम राम महाभाग प्रीताः स्म तव भार्गव॥
target: Thereupon Richika and others of his ancestors appeared and said, "Rama, O blessed Rama, O son of Bhrigu, we are pleased

source: ततो मुहूर्तात् कर्णस्य बाणेनैकेन वीर्यवान्॥ सध्वजं कार्मुकं वीरश्छित्त्वा भूमावपातयत्।
target: Then that valiant hero in a moment cutting off with a single shaft Karna's bow and standard, felled them to the ground.

source: तस्य भित्त्वा तनुत्राणं कायमभ्यगमच्छरः। ततः स तमसाऽऽविष्टो न स्म किंचित् प्रजज्ञिवान्॥
target: Boring through his coat of mail, that arrow penetrated into his body and he was deprived of the power of perception and consciousness.

source: तथैव पाण्डवं सैन्यं शरै राजन् समन्ततः॥ रणेऽहन्यत पुत्रैस्ते शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः।
target: Similarly, the Pandava army, O king, were killed in hundreds and thousands in that battle by your sons on every side with their arrows.

source: ये तु तुष्टाः श्रुतिपरा महात्मानो महाबलाः। धर्म्य पन्थानमारूढास्तानुपास्स्व च पृच्छ च॥
target: They, however, who are contented, devoted to the scriptures, gifted with high souls, and possessed of great might, follow the path of virtue. Do you wait upon them with respect and seek instruction from them.

source: हतवीरतमा ह्येषा धार्तराष्ट्री महाचमूः। फल्गुशेषा महाबाहो तृणैस्तुल्या मता मम॥
target: Indeed, the best of the heroes amongst the vast army of Dhritarashtra were all slain before, O mighty armed one, only the feeble ones are alive, who are in my opinion as worthless as the straw. But in the whole force one mighty bowman, namely, the son of Suta, is shining brilliantly.

source: बन्धनो बन्धकर्ता च सुबन्धनविमोचनः। सयज्ञारिः सकामारिर्महादंष्ट्रो महायुधः॥
target: You are the fetters of the world which bind Individual soul, you are the creator of those fetters; you are the tearer of such fetters; you are he who lives with even the Daityas; you live with those who are the enemies of all acts; you have huge teeth and powerful weapons.

source: साकाशजलपाताला सपर्वतमहावनाम्॥ प्राप्नोत्वमितवीर्यश्रीरद्य पार्थो वसुन्धराम्।
target: Let the Pritha's son of illimitable valour and fortune obtain today the entire Earth with the mountains and forests and water (on it), the firmament (above it) and the nether regions (below it).

source: नैव स्थापयितुं शक्या शूरैरपि महाचमूः। सत्कृत्य महतीं सेनां चतुरङ्गां महीपतिः।
target: O king, when an army is routed, even brave leaders at the head of large divisions of the army consisting of four kinds of troops can not rally them.

source: स्वागतं वा नरव्याघ्रौ दिष्ट्या पश्यामि वामहम्। दिष्ट्या चेमौ निकृत्तौ मे युवाभ्यां बाहुबन्धनौ॥
target: O two best of men, you are welcome! By my good luck it is that I do behold you. By my good fortune you have dissevered my shoulders today.

source: निकृत्य रथिनां चाजौ रथेषाश्च युगानि च॥ जघान रथिनश्चापि बलवान् रिपुमर्दनः।
target: That mighty chastiser of foes, cut off the shafts and yokes of those warriors on their cars, and he then killed them.

source: विवस्त्रायुधदेहासून कृत्वा शत्रून् सहस्रशः॥ युक्त्वा स्वर्गयशोभ्यां च स्वेभ्यो मुदमुदावहत्।
target: Sundering the armour, weapons and bodies of thousands of his enemies, killing them by thousands and sending them to heaven to earn fame Karna gave great delight to his friends.

source: अहिंसकानि भूतानि दण्डेन विनिहन्ति यः। आत्मनः सुखमन्विच्छन् स प्रेत्य न सुखी भवेत्॥
target: He who, for his own happiness, kills other innocent creatures with the rod of punishment never acquires happiness in the next world.

source: कच्चित्ते सफला वेदाः कच्चित्ते सफलाः क्रियाः। कच्चित्ते सफला दाराः कच्चित्ते सफलं श्रुतम्॥
target: And do you observe the Vedas? And do you perceive the fruit of your acts? And have your wives borne children? And has your knowledge of scripture borne fruit?

source: यथाग्निरिन्धनं प्राप्य ज्वलेद् दीप्तार्चिरुल्बणम्। तथा जवाल पुत्रस्ते पाण्डुसेनां विनिर्दहन्॥
target: Just as fire fed with fuel fiercely blazes forth with terrible flames, so did your son consume the troops of the Pandavas.

source: स कम्पयन्निव महीं बलेन चतुरङ्गिणा। युयुधे पाण्डवश्रेष्ठः कर्णेनामित्रघातिना॥
target: Making the earth tremble by his troops of four kinds, that best of the Pandavas fought (a battle) with that slayer of foes Karna.

source: सोऽहं तासां विशेषार्थं स्त्रियमेकां विनिर्ममे। यद्यत्प्रजानां प्रत्यङ्गं विशिष्टं तत्तदुद्धृतम्॥ ततो मया रूपगुणैरहल्या स्त्री विनिर्मिता। हलं नामेह वैरूप्यं हल्यं तत्प्रभवं भवेत्॥ यस्य च विद्यते हल्यं तेनाहल्येति विश्रुता। अहल्येत्येव च मया तस्या नाम प्रकीर्तितम्॥
target: And I created a female distinct from them. Collecting all those limbs that were most excellent among the created, I made a female under the name of Ahalyä. Hal means uglinessone born from Hal is called Halya. That female was known as Ahalyā because she had nothing blameable in her, I gave her that name.

source: नैनानभ्युदियात् सूर्यो न चाप्यासन् प्रगेशयाः। रात्रौ दधि च सक्तूंश्च नित्यमेव व्यवर्जयन्॥

source: क्षत्रधर्मं पुरस्कृत्य गतः शूरः सतां गतिम्। यां गतिं प्राप्नुयामेह ये चान्ये शस्त्रजीविनः॥

target: At that foremost of car-warriors, the son of Drona, as a cloud (sends down) showers of rain. (But) the son of Drona allayed that down pour of arrows by means of his (own) shafts, before they could reach him.

source: अद्यः वः सरथान् साश्वानशस्त्रो विरथोऽपि सन्। नक्षत्राणीव सर्वाणि सविता रात्रिसंक्षये॥
target: Rising I shall fight all of you in battle Like the year that one by one meets with all the seasons, I shall meet with all of you in fight.

target: Is Vaidehī, dearer to me than my life still living? Shall this exile of mine be of no avail?

target: Bring me also beautiful bows of great toughness and bow-strings of finest make, capable of throwing (arrows at great distances) and some large quivers well-stuffed with shafts and several cuirasses (to cover my person).

source: इन्द्रमस्यां तु वेलायामभितुष्टाव मातलिः। सोऽजयद् दानवान् सर्वांस्तथा त्वां बोधयाम्यहम्॥
target: The charioteer Mätali used to hymn Indra at this season, and (encouraged by that eulogy) he conquered the Dänavas. Even so do I hymn you.

source: बाला विहीनाः पित्रा ते त्वयैव परिवर्धिताः। तान् पालय यथान्यायं पुत्रांश्च भरतर्षभ।॥
target: As boys they lost their father and were raced and brought up by you; protect them in a way that would be in accordance with justice as you would do your sons, O best of the Bharata race.

source: क्षन्तव्यं पुत्रधर्मो हि हतो हन्ति न संशयः। यदि राजा न संरक्षेत्पीडा नः परमा भवेत्॥
target: O son, if you destroy Dharma, (piety), Dharma will certainly destroy you. If the king. does not protect us, we meet with many afflictions. was

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच सर्वेषामेव वर्णानां म्लेच्छानां च पितामह। उपवासे मतिरियं कारणं च न विद्यते॥
target: Yudhishthira said O grandfather, all the orders of men, including the very Mlechchhas, are naturally disposed to observe fasts. We, however, do not know the reason thereof.

source: भीमसेनार्जुनौ चापि श्रुत्वा क्रोशगतं रिपुम्। स्वयमश्वांस्तुदन्तौ तौ जवेनैवाभ्यधावताम्॥
target: Hearing that the enemy has gone only two miles Bhima and Arjuna spurred their horses to greatest speed in pursuit of him.

source: ऋषीणां ब्रह्मवादानां स्वर्गस्य गमनं प्रति। सुयुद्धेन ततः प्राणानुत्स्रष्टमुपचक्रमे॥
target: Coincide to this a memory to take a departure in the abode of Brahma as stated by Rishis, well-known to Brahman, decided to abandon leave their lives through fighting in the battle field with chivalry.

source: पाञ्चजन्यस्य निर्घोषं विस्फूर्जितमिवाशनेः। निशम्य सर्वसैन्यानि समहृष्यन्त सर्वशः॥
target: All the soldiers of the army became cheerful in every way at hearing the sound of the Panchajanya conch which was similar to the roaring of thunder.

source: मोदापुरं वामदेवं सुदामानं सुसंकुलम्। उलूकानुत्तरांश्चैव तांश्च राज्ञः समानयत्॥
target: He then subjugated Modapura, Vamadeva, Sudamana, Susankula, the northern Ulukas and the kings and the people of those countries.

source: स मया समनुप्राप्तो नास्मि शोच्यः कथंचन। कृतं भवद्भिः सदृशमनुरूपमिवात्मनः॥ यतितं विजये नित्यं दैवं तु दुरतिक्रमम्। एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं वाष्पव्याकुललोचनः॥
target: I have obtained him! No one should grieve for me. You have done what persons like you should do. You have always tried for my success. Destiny, however, is incapable of being defeated.'-Having said all this the king, with eyes bathed in tears, became silent, O king, agitated as he was with pain.

source: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु काष्ठभूतं महामुनिम्। विघ्नैर्बहुभिराधूतं क्रोधो नान्तरमाविशत्॥
target: When the thousand years had been complete, many an impediment tried the mighty Muni staying like the trunk of a tree, yet could not anger enter his heart.

source: स्प्रष्टुं राजसहस्राणि तेजसाप्रतिमानि वै। समरे नाभ्यवर्तन्त वेलामिव महार्णवः॥ सोऽयं राज्ञो विराटस्य कन्यानां नर्तको युवा। आस्ते वेषप्रतिच्छन्नः कन्यानां परिचारकः॥
target: That youthful one, whom myriads of kings of matchless prowess could not overcome in fight, even as the great ocean cannot overleap its banks, is now the dancing master of the daughters of king Virata and passes his days in disguise as one in the capacity of a servant to them.

source: न च क्षरति तेभ्यश्च यशैश्चैवाप्नुते महत्। सुवर्णमक्षयं दत्त्वा लोकांश्चाप्नोति पुष्कलान्॥
target: He has never to fall down from the regions which he acquires, and the glory he attains to, becomes very great. Indeed, by making gifts of gold one acquires numberless regions of a happiness all of which he enjoys for good.

source: भवनं वारुणं पश्य यदेतत् सर्वकाञ्चनम्। यत् प्राप्य सुरतां प्राप्ताः सुराः सुरपतेः सखे॥
target: Behold this mansion of Varuna which is inade entirely of gold and attaining to which the gods have obtained their god-ship ( you friend of the lord of the gods.

source: अपोवाहाथ शीघ्रं स शैनेयाद् युद्धशालिनः॥ सात्यकिस्तु रणे राजस्तावकानामनीकिनीम्। अभिदुद्राव वेगेन ततोऽनीकमभज्यत॥
target: Then that hero, expert in fighting, soon took away Sini's grandson. Then O king, Satyaki, with great force, advanced against your army at which they were all routed.

source: यत्र ते पुरुषव्याघ्राः शूरा विगतमन्यवः। पाण्डवा धार्तराष्ट्राश्च स्वानि स्थानानि भेजिरे॥
target: Indeed, he reached that place where those foremost of men, those heroes, viz., the Pandavas and the Dhartarashtras, freed from (human) wrath, were enjoying each his respective position.

source: ततो वैरविनिर्बन्धः कृतो राहुमुखेन वै। शाश्वतश्चन्द्रसूर्याभ्यां ग्रसत्यद्यापि चैव तौ॥
target: From that day a great enmity was created between the head of Rahu and Chandra and Surya. To this day it swallows Chandra and Surya (causing eclipses.)

source: दिव्यगर्भोपमैः पुत्रैयूंढोरस्कैर्महारथैः। अन्वितो राजशार्दूल पाण्डवा मुदमाप्नुवन्॥
target: O best of kings, having obtained sons, all of whom were celestials, all of whom possessed broad chests and all whom became great warriors, the Pandavas became exceedingly happy.

source: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु अयोध्याधिपतिर्महान्। अम्बरीष इति ख्यातो यष्टुं समुपचक्रमे॥
target: And it came to pass that at this time that mighty lord of Ayodhyā, Ambarışa, prepared for celebrating a sacrifice.

source: समासादयितुं शतो न च मां धर्षयिष्यति। धृष्टद्युम्नश्च समरे द्रोणं क्रुद्धं परंतपः॥ वारयिष्यति विक्रम्य वेलेव मकरालयम्। यत्र स्थास्यति संग्रामे पार्षतः परवीरहा॥
target: Will be able to defeat or afflict us. Dhrishtadyumna also that scorcher of foes, putting forth all his prowess in battle will hold the enraged Drona in check like the banks resisting the mighty main. In battle, where that slayer of foes viz., the son of Prisata will present him.

source: प्रीतस्तस्मै नरपतिरप्रमेयपराक्रमः। ततश्चकारावभृथं विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा॥
target: The king of immeasurable kindness was thus much pleased and he concluded the sacrifice according to the rites of the ordinance.

source: असितं चार्तिमन्तं च सुनीथं चापि यः स्मरेत्। दिवा वा यदि वा रात्रौ नास्य सर्पभयं भवेत्॥
target: Those that will recall to their minds, Asita, Artiman and Sunitha, in the day or in the night, will have no fear from snakes.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच कथं वै ज्ञातयो ब्रह्मन् कारणं चात्र किं मुने। कथं समुद्रः पूर्णश्च भगीरथप्रतिश्रयात्॥
target: Yudhishthira said : O Brahmana, O Rishi, why and how did the relations (of Bhagiratha) become the cause (of refilling the ocean)? How was the ocean refilled by the interference of Bhagiratha?

source: प्रत्यक्षं ह्येतयोर्मूलं कृतान्तैतिह्ययोरपि। प्रत्यक्षेणागमो भिन्नः कृतान्तो वा न किञ्चन॥
target: Direct evidence is the basis of both inference and the scriptures. The scriptures can be contradicted by direct evidence. As to inference its evidence is not much.

source: अनेकवर्षसाहस्रो वृद्धस्त्वमसि पार्थिव। स रामं युवराजानमभिषिञ्चस्व पार्थिवम्॥
target: O king, being many thousand years old, you have become aged. Do you then install Rāma as the heir-apparent to the throne.

source: विद्राव्य शतशो गुल्मान् धार्तराष्ट्रस्य सैनिकान्। पर्यक्रामत् समन्ताच्च पार्थेन सह केशवः॥
target: Routing hundreds of groups of soldiers of the son of Dhritarashtra Keshava wandered about in company with the son of Pritha.

source: सुहृदस्त्वद्धिते युक्तान् भीष्मद्रोणमुखान् परैः। निहतान् युधि संस्मृत्य कचिन्न कुरुषे व्यथाम्॥
target: Remembering that your friends, Bhishma, Drona and others, who were ever occupied in contributing to your welfare, were slain by the enemies in battle, do you not feel pain?

source: कथं चाप्युशना प्राप शुक्रत्वममरद्युतिः। ऋद्धिं च स कथं प्राप्तः सर्वमेतद् वदस्व मे॥
target: Endued with the effulgence of an immortal, why did Ushanas obtain the name of Shukra? How also did he acquire such superior excellence? Tell me all about these things.

source: यं देवं विदुषो गान्ति तस्य कर्माणि सैन्धव। यामाहुरजितं कृष्णं शङ्खचक्रगदाधरम्॥
target: These are his achievement, O Saindhava, whom the wise thus describe. They call him the unconquerable Krishna, with conch, discus and club in his hands.

source: केषांचिदिषुभिर्बाहूंश्चिच्छेदाथ स राक्षसः॥ वानराणां सुसंरब्धः पार्श्व केषांचिदाक्षिपत्।
target: He cut off, with his arrows, the arms of some and some were deprived of their sides.

source: प्रयाताः शिबिरायैव निशाकाले परंतप। दुर्योधनस्तु नृपतिर्दीनो भ्रातृवधेन च॥
target: Then those repressors of their foes retired to their camps at the advent of night. King Duryodhana, on the other hand, distressed in consequence of the slaughter of his brothers. some

source: तस्य वीरस्य विक्रान्तैः सहस्रशतदक्षिणैः। अश्वमैधशतैरीजे धृतराष्ट्रो महामखैः॥
target: Dhritarashtra performed with the wealth acquired by that hero five great sacrifices, in which offerings were made to the Brahmanas by hundreds and thousands and in which so much wealth was spent as would have been sufficient for one hundred Horse sacrifices.

source: जगाम सर्वतीर्थानि पृथिव्यां चेति नः श्रुतम्। स गत्वा सरितः सर्वाः समुद्रांश्च महातपाः॥
target: Feeling great pain and with putrid matter flowing from his thigh, he travelled to all the tirthas of the earth, one after another, as heard by us.

source: दृढाहतः पत्रिभिरुग्रवेगैः पार्थेन कर्णो विविधैः शिताः। बभौ गिरिगैरिकधातुरक्तः क्षरन् प्रपातैरिव रक्तमम्भः॥
target: Thus wounded by Partha with many keen and powerful arrows Karna looked like a red chalk mountain with streams of red water pouring down.

source: विद्रवन्ति च सैन्यानि त्वदीयानि दिशो दश। लब्धलक्ष्या हि कौरव्या विधमन्ति चमू तव। दहत्येष च वः सैन्यं द्रोणः प्रहरतां वरः॥
target: Your own troops also are flying away in all the ten directions of compass; the Kaurava warriors, having reached their aim, are now killing your troops. Yonder indeed does Drona, that foremost of smiters, consume our ranks.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच तयोः संवदतोरेवं पार्थमाङ्गेययोस्तदा। आजगाम विशुद्धद्वात्मा नाकपृष्ठाद् बृहस्पतिः॥
target: Vaishampayana said While the son of Pritha and the son of Ganga were thus conversing with each other, there came at the spot from the sky the illustrious Brihaspati of purified soul.

source: नाभीतो यजते राजन् नाभीतो दातुमिच्छति। नाभीतः पुरुषः कश्चित् समये स्थातुमिच्छति॥
target: He that is without any fear, O king, never celebrates a sacrifice. He that is without fear never gives away. The man that is without any fear never desires to satisfy and engagement or contract.

source: भीष्म उवाच गविजातः प्रतापवान्। नहुषस्य वचः श्रुत्वा उवाच हर्षयन् सर्वानमात्यान् पार्थिवं च तम्॥
target: Bhishma said Hearing these words of Nahusha, the ascetic born of a cow and gifted with great energy spoke thus, gladdening the monarch with all his counsellors:

source: प्राणो जिह्वा मनः सत्त्वं सद्भावो रजसा सह। भावैरेतैर्विमुक्तस्य निर्द्वन्द्वस्य निराशिषः॥ समस्य सर्वभूतेषु निर्ममस्य जितात्मनः। समन्तात् परिमुक्तस्य न भयं विद्यते क्वचित्॥
target: The vital air, the tongue, the mind, the quality of goodness, along with the quality of passion, are all existent. Of him who is freed from these existent objects, who is above all pairs of opposites, who does not cherish any expectation, who is alike to all creatures, who is freed from the idea of mineness, who has governed his self, and who is released from all his surroundings, no fear cxists from any source.

source: सशैलसागरानूपं वीर्यवानवलोकयन्। नानापुष्पफलैर्वृक्षैरनुकीर्णं सहस्रशः॥ शीतमङ्गलतोयाभिः पद्मिनीभिः समन्ततः। विशालैराश्रमपदैर्वेदिमद्भिरलंकृतम्। सालैस्तालैस्तमालैश्च तरुभिश्च सुपुष्पितैः॥ अत्यन्तनियताहारैः शोभितं परमर्षिभिः। नागैः सुपर्णैर्गन्धर्वैः किंनरैश्च सहस्रशः॥ जितकामैश्च सिद्धैश्च चारणैश्चोपशोभितम्। आजैवैखानसैषैिर्वालखिल्यैर्मरीचिपैः॥
target: And that one possessed of prowess beheld the shore of the sea, containing crag, scattered with trees bearing fruits and flowers of various kinds by thousands, bordered all around with pools furnished with cool and delightful waters, ornamented with spacious asylums having daises, graced with woods of plantain, beauteous with coconuts, and blossoming Sāla and palmyra, and tamāla, trees, grateful with supreme saints rigidly restraining their fear, and with serpents and fowls of fair feathers and Gandharvas and Kinnaras by thousands; and pleasant with Siddhas and Caraņas, that have controlled their lust; with those descendants of Brahma-the Vaikhanas, the Māsas, the Vālakhilyas, and the Marīcipas;

source: सर्टिप्रासासिनखराः समुद्गरपरश्वधाः। विच्छिन्ना बाहवः पेतुर्नृणां भल्लैः किरीटिना॥
target: Severed by Kiritin with his board-headed arrows, the arms of men, having swords, lances and rapiers for their nail and grasping bludgeons, mallets and battle-axes, fell down.

source: न हि मे मोक्ष्यते जीवन मूढः सैन्धवको नृपः। पातालतलसंस्थोऽपि यदि शक्रोऽस्य सारथिः॥
target: I shall not let along the stupid king of Sindhu even if he finds shelter in the nether world or is supported by Indra himself.

source: सूर्य उवाच यदि तात ददास्येते वलिाणे कुण्डले शुभे। त्वमप्येनमथो ब्रूया विजयार्थं महाबलम्॥ नियमेन प्रदद्यां ते कुण्डले वै शतक्रतो।
target: Surya said: O highly-powerful son, if you bestow your beautiful car-rings to the wielder of the sorrow thunderbolt, you should, in order to secure victory, say to him, “O lord of hundred sacrifices, I can only part with my ear-rings under a condition."

source: स्वर्गं हि गत्वा सशरीर एव को मानुषः पुनरागन्तुमिच्छेत्। अन्यत्र कालोपहताननेकान् समीक्षमाणस्तु कुरून् मुमूर्षुन्॥
target: What man is there who having gone to heaven in his own human body ever wishes to come back? Because he sees the Kurus at the point of death by Time, he has returned.

source: भ्रक्षेपालापमाधुपैः कान्त्या सौम्यतया पे च। शशिनं वक्त्रचन्द्रेण साऽऽह्वयन्तीव गच्छति॥
target: With her beauty, grace and the charm of the motions of her eye-brows, with her soft accents and moon-like face, she walked on defying the moon.
